name: Das kleine DDR-Quiz
description:
Objective: Know correct answers on questions out of the former GDR
- acting by turn -
A small trivia game about GDR; with 100 questions and answers. The game itself is like a notebook (with spiral binding). Each page contains 2 questions and 4 answers, the back side contains the correct answers with additional information.
Questions like: What is a 'Gummifuffziger'? How many disticts did GDR possess?

name: Gear Jammers
description:
You're about to embark on the greatest adventure of your life. You will have the chance to become one of six of the most unbelievable characters you will ever meet. You become the owner of a highly technical fleet of trucks, with a dealer network worldwide. Now you will find out if you have what it takes to be a real..."Gear Jammer". A gear jammer is a trucker/owner that is prepared to take the chance....challenge and risk to become the most successful on the board game of...Gear Jammers!

Objective: To see who can run the most successful trucking business...based on a combination of companies owned, trucks on the road and cash on hand. To do this, you will want to buy all the trucks you can buy, invest in companies that are going places, and hope you won't get stuck with too many accidents, losses or heavy costs.
What makes Gear Jammers really fun are all the chances you take in hopes of collecting some profits. You may run into a truck stop that means you miss a couple of turns! We say "Go for the profits anyway!". If you own a fleet of trucks (and the value cards in your favour) you could be the ultimate winner of the game. But don't count on a thing until the timer goes off. Just when you think you've got the game in the bag, your old trucking buddy may land on a "Price and Profit!" card - and turn the whole game around.

Start your engines....roll out your trucks and begin driving on the highway to success....if you dare!

name: Welt der Berliner
description:
Objective: score most winning points knowing correct answers about Berlin.

With this quiz game the players will learn (with 220 questions) some detailed information about the city of Berlin.
2 different playing versions:
Version 1: active player draws a card and reads the question & 4 possible answers (of which 1, 2 or 3 may be right); now each player may invest gradually chips to be placed betting on different answers; correct answer(s) is(are) printed on the back of the card;
Version 2: find out the proper sequence of three answers regarding posted question

name: Flipkick
description:
"The New Game of Table Football".

Fairly basic game of finger-flicking dexterity. The box illustrates it rather well.

The board is anything you can find to act as a board, maybe an old blanket. The wire supports fasten the goals and the blanket to the table. Up to 4 can play. With your finger, you literally flick the ball, hopefully goalwards. There are no player figures so I expect the game got quite frenetic, especially with four players.

The most goals wins.

name: Tau
description:
The board is wooden (made of exotic hardwood), into which there are 21 half-inch diameter holes. Basically the positional shape of the holes is a five times five grid with corners removed:


5 ooo
4ooooo
3ooooo
2ooooo
1 ooo
ABCDE


The dark player has seven dark shafted game pieces to control. The light player has seven light shafted game pieces to control. Each game piece is formed as a stick which will fit nicely into any of the holes. Each piece has coloured caps at the end in six combinations:

1.) yellow / orange
2.) orange / red
3.) red / purple
4.) purple / blue
5.) blue / green
6.) green / yellow

Game rules give the hint that these form a circle of colours. This information might help and can be used to find logical game strategies here.

The seventh piece being special is

7.) white / black

Colour white is used being a 'wild' (joker). It can be used as a legal replacement for any colour mentioned before.
Black is basically a blocker not representing any colour.

Players take alternating turns. When a game piece is placed in a hole one of the coloured end caps is obviously not visible anymore. Placing a game piece the non visible colour must be announced loudly and clearly enough to the opponent while setting the piece.

On his first turn a player must place one of his pieces into any free hole. After the first turn a turn consists of one of the following actions:

1.) Play another own offboard piece into another free hole, or
2.) Turn any one of your already played pieces upside down in the same hole (announcing the non visible colour towards the opponent clearly and loudly), or
3.) Move any one of your played pieces to another hole (but not turning it upside down)

The object is to get three of the same colour in a row (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally) and the first player to do so wins. Since each player's set contains only two caps of each colour (as listed above), at least one of the three-in-a-row might has to be an opponent's piece.

The 'wild' game piece can only be played as soon as all other six pieces are already set before. This way you can build and win creating a three-in-a-row using own and/or opponent's white game piece as well. The black colour can not be used in a three-in-a-row constellation since it is used as a blocking piece only.

In general each player can only move game pieces with a shaft of own colour. But any game piece can be used to form the three-in-a-row to win.

Initially you draw by lot who goes first. In consecutive rounds the previous loser takes the first turn.

You might find similarities in game play like in Quarto (published in 1991, using opponent's pieces as well to form the winning row) and Memory (published in 1959, remembering the hidden colours is definitively helpful).

In contrast to Tau the newer Calypso does not include the aspect of a Memory game any longer. The colour which is not visible in Tau (and has to be announced each time) is still visible in Calypso due to the other construction of the game pieces.

name: Isle of Eldermoor Chess
description:
Isle of Eldermoor Chess is a large board chess variant.

It is played on a larger 10X10 board to allow more pieces, and then borrowed the idea of the Citadel corner from Omega Chess, an idea quickly expanded to an area of seven additional squares on each corner, leaving the board with a more castle-like appearance.

The game also uses the 'river' idea in the centre from Xiangqi, as well as an inner King's sanctum area,

The first goal of Isle of Eldermoor was to toss out the traditional Western Chess game. There are great variants such as Omega Chess, Opulent Chess, and Grand Chess which take the traditional game and add to it with a few new pieces. It's been done.

So only the King was transfered to Eldermoor.

The rest of the army array reflects more of a fantasy Medieval army, so Paladins, Cavaliers, Yeomen, Soldiers, Archers etc are used.

As an ode to long nights of Dungeons & Dragons over the years a fantasy element with Wizards, Griffins and Dragons are also part of the game

With an all new piece array, I needed different movement patterns, well different from Western Chess at least. There are so many variant pieces almost every conceivable movement pattern has been done before in one variant or another.

The resulting movements draw on Western Chess, Xiangqi, Shogi and related variants.

The game has three win conditions;

The game is won by checkmating the opposition king.

or

If a player loses both Wizards the morale of their army is broken and they lose the game.

or

You win by occupying both opponent's wizard towers, and holding them for one full turn.

name: Nathan lettres
description:
Each player draws 10 letters from the bag, then take turns trying to form the longest word.
Each letter has its own value showed on the chip. Once a new word is formed, the player adds the points for letters of that word. Words must be interrelated.
The round ends when a player has placed all of its 10 letters. The scores are counted and the first player to reach the score of 100 points (several rounds) wins the game.

name: Massive Multiplayer Captain's Mistress
description:
This games takes a regular game of Captain's Mistress (this is sold under the brand name Connect Four) and turns it into a party game using a framework suitable for most other abstract strategy games. In the game, a player's team selects where they go during that team's turn. When it is not the team's turn, the player has an opportunity to leave their team.

This game was discussed as a variant in this thread on BGG, but has been spun off as its own entry due to additional development and changes on how the game is run. The discussion can be found here.

name: Richesses de l'Oise
description:
Similar to Richesses de France.
Oise is a department in the north of France.

The goal of the game is to complete a circuit in the department faster than your opponents by traveling from city to city. This is done either by foot, bicycle, or car. Money can be earned (to buy a bicycle or car) or lost during the game.

In his turn, the player moves one space or two space with bicycle or 4 spaces with his car following different routes. Its purpose is to visit every city in any order.
Every time you stop on a region that is not named, draw a card. That brings You some good or bad news.

Player who visits all regions on game board and returns to the space he started first is the winner.

name: All Your Mechs Are Belong To Us
description:
AYM (as it is abbreviated) is a tactical boardgame where players take the role of a mech pilot. Players custom design their mechs by use of a series of transparency overlays, giving them a final visual representation of the mech they designed. Players' mechs then enter a map via dropship, where they will need to complete the objectives of that scenario. These scenarios include search and destroy, retrieve resources, etc. At the end of each scenario, players gain money and experience in which they can upgrade their mechs in preparation for future scenarios.

AYM is played as a tactical board game with some basic RPG elements. Mechs are represented by game pieces on a physical grid map of the scenario.

name: Tiercé Color
description:
To object of the game is to get 3 of Your 4 pawns to the end in the order that appears on one of your cards.

Each player will try to move the pawns in the order of the "trifecta color" of his choice.
In his turn player rolls three dice and advance three of four pieces, each being moved in the number of spaces shown by one of the three dice.

If the first pawn arrivs in Finish a die is removed.
If the second pawn arrives next to it a second die is removed.
If the third pawn arrives next to them the game is over.
If The finishing order of the pawns gives the so called "trifecta color" showed on card the player wins the game.

name: Toufruit
description:
Toufruit, published in 1990, is the precursor of Halli Galli.

The cards and the rules are identical but there is no bell in this game. Players try to shout "Toufruit" first instead of ringing the bell.

In his turn player places one card face up in front of him from his face-down deck. And if there are total of five of one kind of fruit on the table the player who shouts "Toufruit" first gets all played cards. When you run out of cards, you're out.
Game ends if there are 2 players left. Who has most cards is the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Verkehrsmittel der Neuzeit
description:
Objective: Be the first ending the round trip in Friedrichshafen
- moving by turns -
roll the die, move your meeple & and follow instructions (glued on cover inside) ending on a marked (red) space

remarks: published beginning/mid 1910's
cute meeples (pewter figures) - see pictures

name: Euro Austria Börse Quiz
description: There are 100 cards each with 5 questions and 3 answers in each card. The goal is to learn of financial transactions, stock exchange and other technical terms. Correct answers are marked according to budget in the index, an incorrect answer will forfeit the round budget. At the end of game player with the highest number of exchange points wins the game.

name: Spanish-American War
description:
Relive the war the destroyed an empire and herald the rise of a new empire in the Spanish American War! Play the Cuban theater, or the Pacific theater! Or combine them!

Players choose which theater they want to take operations on per turn and take as many actions as they want. But the American has to worry about the Spanish player's mines that he is allowed to place concealed on the sea zone. With these advantages... Can the Spanish Player change history or will the superior American troops win again?

name: 1-2-X Das Bundesliga Quiz König Fußball
description: Football enthusiasts can test their football knowledge around the Austrian football events. It addresses questions about the entire Austrian Bundesliga. The aim of the game is to answer questions in 5 areas of knowledges from the beginning to the presence of the Austrian football properly. Who was the first after completion of the two halves of play by reaching the goal-box wins the game.

name: MASK: Die Jagd nach den Sonnensteinen
description:
An old roll-and-move boardgame loosely based on the popular M.A.S.K. cartoon series and toy franchise of the 1980s.

Every one of the (up to 4) players takes control of one MASK character and must try to move him on a mini-course (16 spaces) back to the starting point. Movement is determined by rolling a D3, and a special Sunstone-Die determines how many of such stones a player might receive. Once a player gets more than 3 Sunstones at any point, he has to return them all to the box.

Note: the Sunstone-Die also determines how many spaces the 'Miles Mayhem' character (a villain) moves. Once the villain lands on the same space as a character, the player has to move his character back to the last space with a vehicle.

If, at any time, a player rolls the same number as his Sunstones, he cannot advance, but has to go back instead.

Contents:

deck of cards
2 white 6-sided dice
4 miniature cars (red, green, yellow, and blue)
game board
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: War at Japan sea
description:
War at Japan Sea is a strategic wargame for Russo-Japanese war. This game issued with Japanese self-published magazine SLGamer Volume 5.

Players control either Japanese Navy or Russian Navy. Players manage fleet movement and battle, to control of seas. The basic system of this game is reference from War at Sea (Second Edition).
The fall of Port Arthur fortress is a big event in the game. Russian Pacific fleet will be wiped out by fall of the fortress. Russian player can be delay the fall of the fortress by the control of the sea areas.

Winner will determine by victory points. Victory points can be earned from control of seas, and also earned from surviving warships at the end of the game.

name: Charmed: La Prophétie
description:
The ancient prophecies announce the arrival of a child with amazing powers. The Haliwell sisters will need to eliminate the demons and prevent corruption of the chiled calledWyatt.

In her turn player rolls the dice and makes action accoridng to the squares she landed. There are different types of actions: Power, Demons, Allies, Places and Prophecies.

The game ends:
If demons reach the end of the Corruption track - the players lose the game.
The letters drawn by landing the Propecy squares form the word GIDEON - the players lose the game.
All demons are eliminated - the players win the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Shrek Le Jeu
description:
Shrek and Donkey crosses the country to free Princess Fiona captured by the Dragon.

The game takes place in two phases.
In first phase players walk around the board to recover the weapons needed to face the dragon and to free the princess.
In second phase they recover 6 objects (flowers, poems, balloons, etc..) to protect Fiona before reaching the top of the tower by Lord Farquaad.

In his turn, the active player may:
1) move, rolling a die with six faces.

2) get a random event. Some of these events apply immediately, as the "angry farmers" or "guards", others may be kept by the player and be used later as "My turn" which allows you to replay a turn or "The onion is good" which wastes a turn the player of your choice.

3) roll a six sided figure, and advance in the number of spaces indicated. The player can move his figure in any direction and by taking any path. If it encounters an event-driven model (brigand, custody, etc..) It solves the encounter, usually on a combat die roll.

4) if the figure reaches a square, the player can perform a search to find items still available.
Depending on the phase in which the player is, he will seek weapons to face the dragon or gifts to seduce the beautiful.

When a player wishes, he can go on the square with dragon to confront it. It will then launch a die which he will add his bonus weapons. If he gets at least 7, the princess is saved. Then begins the second phase. In each round, Lord Farquaad will rise a box in his lap (there are 12 laps).
The first player who gets the 6 gift before the evil Lord marries the nice Princess is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Charmed: le jeu de cartes à jouer et à collectionner
description:
Charmed CCG is on based on the television series Charmed.
One player is good side as Leo, Chris and all the other heroes of the series. Second player is bad side playing the demons.

In this game You must complete missions. To do this, you use your characters. Bonus cards allow you to strengthen the power of your characters. You have also Event cards that allow you to counter the moves of your opponent!
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Little Bag Games: Air Combat
description:
Game is played by pulling chips from a bag. Each player has a Search bag and a Dogfight bag. Players start by using their Search bag to find opponents aircraft. Player to find the other players aircraft gets to draw from their Dogfight bag and will either lose sight of the enemy or shoot one of opponents planes down.
Very easy.
Comes with 44 chips and 4 bags. 12 of the chips are tokens to keep track of your aircraft. These tokens are being produced now and will be shipped free of charge if you order before they are complete. These are not required for game play but does add a little to the game.

name: Ladder Logic
description: Ladder Logic is a puzzle and voting game where players compete to turn on the switches that will activate their gear network in an effort to get the clock tower working once again. Players manage workers on a shared main board that influence their actions on their player boards where they maintain a network of gears.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Voting, Worker Placement

name: Le Livre de la jungle: Histoire à jouer
description:
Similar to Chutes and Ladders.

Players roll the dice, place as many tiles on the board starting with the first tile numbered 1 and move his game piece accordingly telling the jungle story showed on the tiles.

Player who place the last tile and reach to end of the story first is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling, Tile Placement

name: Le Livre de la Jungle: à la recherche de Mowgli
description:
Character from the children novel Mowgli.

Mowgli, Shanti and Ranjan is threatened by Shere Khan (the man-eating tiger) and hide themselves in the ruins deep in the jungle.

Players are Bagheera, Baloo and baby elephant and they search for them rolling the dice and following the footprints of Mowgli. Who first discovered the hiding place wins the game.

name: Chouette Carre Magic
description:
At start each player in turn places 7 game pieces of his color on the game board. Then, the game continues by sliding each turn a gamepiece in a free adjacent position.
The first who close a square with four of his game pieces wins.

name: Arm Chair Quarterback: A Game of Skill
description:
This game was manufactured by Novelty Manufacturing Co. out of Richmond, CA in 1955. Arm chair quarterback is a game that consists of a game board, first down/yardage marker, 11 red defensive pawns, 1 tan offensive pawn, and a huddleboard with two metal stands.

The object of the gameplay: The huddleboard is placed in the middle of the board allowing the offensive and defensive teams to call their play. The offense has 9 spots/plays to place their pawn. The defense has 11 pawns with 16 spots to try and stop the play of the offense. When the huddleboard is removed each team can see the result of the play. At each spot on the board a result of the play is posted as whether its a gain, loss, turnover, TD, or incomplete. After each play, you record the information on the yardage/down marker. Like football, the offensive player must make 10 yards in 4 downs to continue or the the board is turned around to switch positions. The game can be played for 30 or 60 minutes depending on your preference. Note: All plays are based on national averages. There is no advantage to either team. It all depends on how good you are at playing QUARTERBACK!

name: Teachatot
description:
Teachatot is designed to help children learn simple spelling and arithmetic. Select a picture card and asking the child, whose turn it is, to find and identify the letters making up the word for the picture. Similarly, you could select a number and the child must find the numbers needed to make that total. Get the most right after an equal number of turns, and you win

All the 144 pieces interlock with each other to provide lots of word combinations and arithmetic sums.

The game was first produced in Britain in the 1950's but sank without trace. However, it has now resurfaced in Australia/New Zealand, and has been available there for some time.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number, Word Game

name: NamNam
description:
Players draw cards where (German) first names have been creatively transformed into some weird word conglomeration.

Actual examples from the German game: Weichangst for Hartmut, Hirschweitkaffee for Renate (Reh-nah-Tee)

An English example off the top of my head (so non-German speakers get the idea): Buddhaout for Christin

The goal is to correctly decipher as many of the first names behind them as possible. Turns are timed with a sand timer.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: A Las Barricadas
description:
Descriptions from Kickstarter:

A Las Barricadas is a boardgame about conflict between two opposing social forces, namely that of the state and of anti-authoritarian demonstrators. It is a two-player game with each player representing one of these social forces, the theatre of this conflict being that of the street demonstration. It is being developed and designed by the Black Flag Games collective, committed to the idea that games and interactive media can have an impact in the struggle for a free and cooperative world. We are also committed to the ideals of free culture and aim to deliver professional play experiences that enrich a participatory entertainment culture.

'A Las Barricadas' is a two-player, asymmetric boardgame. This means it is a contest between two players whose ability to affect the game is different. Play takes place on a board which represents a real city or historic location, and small chips are placed on building squares (buildings can be occupied, blockaded or vandalized). The Radical player chooses randomly from a small deck of objective cards and both players choose their tactics for the game. Victory is achieved by the Radical player if they complete their objectives in an allotted number of rounds. The Police player only gets a small piece of flavor text as a hint to the objectives of the radical player, and their objective is to keep the radical player from gaining victory points and completing their goals. Many of the objectives relate to acquiring Strike chips (by causing economic loss through blockades, pickets, occupations etc.) or by gaining Media chips (representing media coverage).

name: Bird Cage
description:
The game of Bird Cage is a connection game in which players attempt to connect their sides of a square by establishing an unbroken connection in a rectangular (but staggered) grid.

The game's original incarnation was as a machine built by the game's designer, noted engineer Claude Shannon. The machine would choose its' move by measuring electrical resistance between its' sides of the square and would reportedly win "almost always" when making the first move.

The game was later re-discovered independently by mathematician David Gale, who got it published under the name of Bridg-It.

Bird Cage has since been defined as an abstract game called the Shannon Switching Game, playable on any finite graph. In the abstract game, two players, Short and Cut, will either attempt to connect two predetermined points on the graph (short) by claiming edges, or remove graph edges (Cut) such that the two points cannot be linked.

name: The A.N.Z. Mobile Bank Game
description:
Australian promotional game, published by a bank.

The game is a simple roll-and-move game. Obey instructions when you land on a coloured square (Green is good but red is bad).

First player to get from Home to the Bank, wins.

name: Ma Boîte à réactions: Monsieur Madame
description:
A game of reaction. Players turn the cards on the board, if they recognize a character from the card, all players must make the appropriate response: laughter, falling, tickle etc.

Whenever you're the first to give the right answer, you will receive a rubber stamp on your scoresheet. 10 shots and You win the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Real-time

name: Electrolette
description:
A battery operated British game of chance, no skill required at all.

The board has a wheel with nine different coloured horses with jockeys on board. Players are invited to place their bets. You could play for real money or buttons. When all the bets are placed, you flick a switch and the wheel will spin. As each horse goes past a connection, their colour light flashes on, so with a fast spinning wheel, the lights all flash, adding to the excitement. When the wheel stops, there will be one light on and that is the race winner. Winning punters collect their bets and another race can start.

The winner is the one player who has the most money when the game ends.

name: Huckleberry Hound Roll-A-Ball
description:
Action game. The board is three dimensional and involves chutes to take a ball from one chute to another. A ball is dropped in the top and will work itself down to the bottom where, hopefully, it will score points depending in which hole it eventually settles.

It seems to me that there is very little skill in this. You cannot decide to throw it down the chutes with gusto, nor can you try to make it a very gentle roll. The different direction chutes take out any influence a player might have, and the end result is purely a matter of chance. Children will enjoy it though, at least until the novelty wears off.

The winner is the player with the most points at the end of the game.

The box has this slogan....
'Roll - a - ball
Down - a - hill
Try your luck
Test your skill'
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Top of the Drunks
description:
A game that combines a drinking game with top trumps. After winning a hand (as in top trumps) the winner also has to take a drink.

Players pit their selected characters against each other on qualities such as 'Favourite tipple' and 'Special skills' to determine points scored, with losers downing their respective drinks and a special forfeit forcing them to drink the 'Dirty Pint' (when players draw a hand all the drinks are poured into one glass, the 'Dirty Pint').

33 playing cards feature a charismatic illustration of a variety of parodies of notoriously drinkers, such as the WAG, Abby Goodnight, and Prime Minister, Wineston Burphill.

name: Cinco
description:
The board is comprised of 25 posts arranged in a 5x5 array. Players take turns placing one ball of their color on any post on the board. The winner is the first to get five balls of their color in a straight line - this can be accomplished vertically (on the same post), horizontally or diagonally.

From the instruction book -
Cinco: The newly designed game employing 25 pegs for 109 possible win positions. This fascinating game of strategy gives endless hours of pleasure and excitement.

Similar to:

Score Four

name: The Game of Telepathy
description:
Looks like it might be an abstract game but turns out to be only luck-based.

The object of the game is to travel from your outer star to the inner one. To do this a player must try to communicate with the other players telepathically. This is attempted by another player drawing a card from the deck and you have to identify it by only the power of the mind. Five such attempts (i.e. guesses) are allowed and the fewer used mean that you move further along the board in your journey to the centre.

name: Battlefield Auerstadt 1806
description:
Battlefield Auerstadt 1806 is cardgame for battle of Auerstadt in Napoleonic wars. This game issued with self-published version Game Journal magazine volume 42.

The game use three types of cards, unit , commander and action card. The unit card represent divisions of French and Prussian army. The commander card represent French commander Davout and Prussian commander Duke of Brunswick.　The action card represent various military actions and terrain.

In each turn, players can perform one free action and can also play action card for perform additional actions.

Winner determine by advantage number or elimination of opponent. The advantage represent control of battlefield and can improve by die roll test in each turn.

name: Aus Dem Traum
description:
Aus Dem Traum (From the Dream in German) is an operational wargame on battle of the Bulge during World War 2.

Players control either the German Army or Allied Army, and manage movement and combat. The game sequence is a standard movement, combat and secondary movement. However, several actions like movement more than one hex, secondary movement or combined attack spend operational points. A few Operational points are given each turn.

The winner is determined by control of cities and the crossing of the Meuse river by German units.

Game Scale:

1 division, brigade, regiment per unit
9 km per hex
1 day per game turn.

name: Dr. Seuss Fish-A-Ma-Jigger Game
description: Players take one of 4 included pieces (Foo, Whom, Wumbus and the Grinch) and using a spinner move them according to the color that they spin. Once on a space they take the included fishing pole and try to catch what look like whales from the fishing pond to help move them along. First player to cross the finish line wins.

name: Playful Malice
description:
From the box: "Playful Malice is a conversational frolic for adult adults - a game in which players compare views of one another's quirks. The purpose of the game is to have fun - and, incidentally, to see who wins the most chips."

On a round, one person is called the "Target". The Target takes one of the 64 cards from the deck and reads it aloud. He reads the statements one at a time, giving players time to rate each item on their score pads from 0 to 5. The Target also rates his own personality.

Now the Target will guesses aloud how each player rated him, and depending if he is near or far from the ratings he will receive chips. The player with the most chips is the winner.

name: Buffy: Action Quizz
description:
Buffy Trivia Game is the test of your knowledge of Buffy the Vampire Slayer!

In their continuing struggle against the forces of evil, Buffy and her friends must defeat a selection of vampires and demons particularly formidable. Boxes 'quiz' brighten the path to test the knowledge of the players on the main characters and key events in the series. Each correct answer and defeated demon can accumulate points throughout the game. Issues affect all the episodes of the first 5 seasons.

The winner of the game is the first player or team to reach the finish and successfully face the last vampire.
categories: Card Game, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Les Royaumes Combattants
description:
6th century BC, China does not yet have a name and seven kingdoms are fighting the mandate of heaven: the right to rule over the rising empire.

The game turn consists of nine phases. Those are moving priors, development, production, policy, recruitment, commercial, Science, movement (and battles), counts during the player move his game-pieces, take actions according the cards or draw tiles.

During the counts, player must feed itself and pay the balance of forces. Each province not be able to eat or pay will receive a token of revolt. After 2 tokens of revolt, player loses that province.
Also players earn civilization points during this phase.
1 point per province owned
1 point per occupied capital
1 point per level of development in most developed
1 point for general
3 points per wall funded
-1 Point for each pair of tokens of revolt

The game ends after one player has accumulated at least 50 points. Whoever has the most points wins.

name: Yellowstone Teton Wit
description: One of a series of Wit trivia games, Yellowstone Wit has 105 cards with questions about Yellowstone. On the back of each card is a photo of something found in Yellowstone (Lower Falls, Old Faithful, brown bear, Mammoth Hot Springs, big horn sheep, Morning Glory Pool, elk, Castle Geyser, bison, a meadow, geyser, stagecoach and hotel, swan and mud pot) and a point value from 1-10 or 15. On the front of each card is a trivia question and answer. In turn, each player is asked a question. If he gets the question right, they keep the card. If he gets it wrong, all other players in turn (except the question reader) are given a chance. If all fail, the card is placed in the so-called "stumper" pile. After all cards have been asked, the stumper pile is revisited. Then, all players add up their points and he with the highest points wins.

name: Une partie de pêche
description:
Who will be the best fisherman?

Fish or worms? In his turn, players tries catch some fish with a fishing rod. You may get fish but You may get worms.
They roll dice and the color determine the fish: goldfish, yellow, blue, green or purple fish? To win the fishing contest, you must be the first to catch 5 fish.

name: Barrier
description:
Barrier is similar to Ludo/Pachisi. It is a roll and move game in which you try to get all your counters round the board before your opponents, however you can also use your counters to form barriers (by stacking multiple counters on top of each other). Forming a barrier blocks your opponents from moving past until they roll an exact number (which reduces your barrier by 1). The downside of this is that your barrier counters can not move, but can be disbanded at any time.

The game is played in teams of 2, and your roll can count for either you or your partner. Partners must be formed form opposite colours (i.e. red & yellow, blue & green, orange & purple). Both partners can contribute to a single barrier or create separate barriers. Landing on an opponents counter sends it back to the start.

The strategy of the game revolves around 6 key points:
1) Where to build barriers for the best effect
2) When to build barriers
3) When to break barriers
4) The order of colours in the barrier
5) When not to 'knock off' your opponents counters
6) How to keep counters moving

The rules also allow for the length of the game to be altered. Each counter each person has equates to 30 minutes game play - meaning a game where each person has 4 counters lasts 2 hours, a 6 counter game will last 3 hours. It is not recommended to play with less than 4 counters each, due to the need to create barriers.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Dragodor
description:
The king's castle was attacked. The Dragodor Princess takes her prisoner.
Players roll the dice on their turn and move to king's castle.
Who will be the first to overcome all obstacles and reach to castle to beat the Dragodor is the winner

name: Bandits of the Crab Nebula
description:
Bandits of the Crab Nebula is a game set in a chaotic universes where cunning rogues search for contraband to sell, all while avoiding the wrath of the Space Cops. Players pick from one of ten different ships, all with their own unique ability, and try and avoid asteroid belts, mine fields, and even police barricades.

Players control their ships speed, manage what is in their various hulls, install upgrades to better their chances of winning, and even play special cards to sabotage others. But they must also be careful to not be too greedy, because hidden in the deck where they find their items and cargo are special events that rarely end up good for anyone. These events can be as simple as one player discarding one piece of cargo, and as complex enough to warp everyone to a new location, have two players swap minds, or even put a ship swallowing black hole into play.

The aforementioned Space Cops are also a hassle, but also what sets the game apart from its peers. Players must manage how much cargo they are carrying and where they store it, because they might end up being accosted by the Space Cops when passing through a Police Barricade or when a rival player blows the whistle on them. If a Space Cop searches the Players ship and finds contraband, they must then deal with the consequences!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: McMurtle Turtle
description: This is a simple dexterity game where players flip a wooden ball at the McMurtle Turtle target. If a player flips him over with a good shot, that player advances his/her colored wooden peg one space along the start/finish track. A spin at the beginning of the turn determines how many shots at the target each player gets. No two players can occupy the same space along the movement track at the same time, and special star spaces along the way advance a player's peg ahead to the first open space. The first player to reach FINISH wins.

name: Enter In
description:
Religious Charades in a way although you don't have to mime. Must be played in teams of at least two people.

In a turn, a player draws a card and tries to get his team-mates to name a Biblical character from his clues. The first team to get a pre-agreed number of characters correctly, wins.

The rulebook promises a Family Devotions variant but the rules were missing from my set so I do not know this variant at all.

name: Soap Quiz: Emmerdale
description:
Small quiz game that tests your knowledge of Britain's second longest soap, Emmerdale. No board, just 54 question cards, with six questions per card.

In your turn, roll the die and the player on your left reads out the question to you that relates to the number thrown. There are six categories on each card. If you get the question right, you keep the card and you roll the die and you are asked the question indicated on the next card, and you keep going until you get an answer wrong. If you are wrong, the card goes back to the bottom of the stack and the turn passes to the player on your left.

The player with the most cards when the deck runs out, wins.

A solitaire game is also suggested. Turn over the cards one at a time. Roll the die and answer the question indicated. If you are right, place the card on your left and call cards won, the Winning pile. If you are wrong, place it on your right and call those the Duffer's pile. Keep going until all 54 cards are exhausted. Collect 28 or more cards in your Winning pile and you have won. If you have more than 27 cards in your Duffer's pile, you lose.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Hermann Köhl's Flug Nach Amerika
description:
Hermann Köhl (1888 - 1938) was the first aviator to fly across the Atlantic from east to west, i.e. from Europe to North America (accomplished in 1927). This game celebrates that feat. The track is 50 spaces long, tracing Köhl's route, from Germany to North America and back home again.

The game is not very novel in the game-play. Roll a die and move along the track. Obey instructions when you land on a special square. Very nice illustrations illuminate these special points along the track.

First to get to the end, wins.

name: Contre-attack
description:
There are 3x3 grid game board and 2 types of game-pieces red cylinders and yellow cubes. Players draws a cards where are tasks how do position the game-pieces.

At the beginning of each round the board is empty.
Each player draws a card of his objective and in his turn player places or swaps the game-pieces.

The goal of the game, is to achieve the placement showed on the card, either during installation or by swapping two pieces later stage. The player gets a card as a point.

At the end of the game if the deck is exhausted, the player with the most cards is the winner.

name: Le Monde de Nemo
description:
Nemo is captured by a diver. His friends decide to go on a long journey in search of him.

In this cooperation game children search together Nemo.
In his turn, player spins the wheel and move the game-piece
building a puzzle path.

The game ends when Nemo is found (the players have won) or when the puzzle is completed Darla (then the players have lost).
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle

name: Le Monde de Nemo: La Grande Evasion
description:
Object of the game is to escape from the aquarium first.

In his turn player draws a card and play a card.
There are usual cards to move his fish to the next available slot
or special cards to exchange his hand, force opponent to discard one card etc.

First fish who has completed his journey to ocean is the winner
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Racing

name: Rover Rummy
description:
Rover Rummy consists of a deck of 51 cards, divided into dog "parts" - fronts, rears, bodies, heads, legs and tails. Each set of parts (except the tail) is divided into colors which denote the correctness of the body parts. Green being poor, then Yellow (fair), then Red (good), with Blue being the best (excellent). Each player is dealt 6 cards per hand. Play progresses by a simple "draw and discard" method.

The object of the game is to win the required amount of points to obtain a Championship on your "dog". A Championship is obtained by accumulating 15 "points" (based on the combined values of the colored body parts forming one "dog") over the span of several hands, and 2 major wins ( A major = a hand of 3, 4 or 5 points). The rules of winning a Championship in this game are the same pointwise, as winning a real Championship. The first player to lay down a complete "dog" wins a hand. The hand is counted by adding up the point value of each of the body parts, or in the case of a complete "red" or "blue" dog, the point value assigned to that dog.

name: Firestone "Coast to Coast" Game
description:
Promotional Canadian game, issued by the tyre supplier.

The board is a track, taking you from Halifax to Vancouver. As usual in these sort of games, if you land on a space with instructions, then you must follow those instructions, be they good or bad.

When you get to one space from winning, you must stop there. You cannot get to Home without rolling a double on the dice. This probably means that you will be there for a few turns which helps others to catch up and make the end of the game a little more exciting. First to Home (Vancouver), wins.

name: Fantail Hockey on Grass
description:
Didactic board game played on a board with the features and markings of hockey on grass, with two smart charts for each team,one dice, 8 sided role and only one piece to move on the board.This feature makes the game very agile and entertaining.
Each team, consisting of one or two people, must follow in the smart chart the current situation of the game according to what the 8-sided dice throw and go placing the piece on the board in the place that corresponds with a indicating the smart chart in use.
The objetc of the game is to lead the team through the smart charts and score a goal.

name: Die Reise nach dem Silbersee
description:
Objective: be the first entering field 80
- moving by turn -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; stepping on a marked space follow instructions.
remarks:
published during 1920's
equipped with pewter figures ~ 2 inch tall
categories: American West, Book, Children's Game, Dice, Racing
publishers: A. Anton & Co., Leipzig, Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: Wartiles
description:
Wartiles is a fantasy tile laying game, taking inspiration mainly from Warhammer Fantasy Battle and other fantasy wargames.

Each player start with an army general and must defeat its opponent's general. To do so, each player has access to army tiles that are layed on the board. In some way, it might look as dominoes.

Terrains and powerful spells come in play to add some twists.



=====================================================Wartiles est un jeu de combat fantasy dans lequel les unités du jeu sont représentées par des tuiles. Ce jeu tire son inspiration principalement de Warhammer Fantasy Battle mais aussi de plusieurs autres jeux dans le même style.

Chaque joueur commence avec une tuile général et le but du jeu est de réussir à vaincre le général des autres adversaires.Des tuiles représentant des unités sont placées sur le plateau et le tout pourrait s'apparenter à une partie de domino, spécialement dans l'apparence et la manière de placer les tuiles en jeu.

Des terrains et de puissants sorts viennent pimenter la partie.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: La Terre des Dieux
description:
Priest of Apollo, Athena, Demeter, Poseidon or Zeus, 3-5 players try to make their worship the one who will dominate the whole of Greece. As you gather up YOur followers, build monumental temples, free the cities of mythological monsters, use your political weapons for your own benefit.

The game consists three phases:

Action Phase
Agora Phase
Stage season


In his turn in first phase player places his followers to build temples, gather resources and hunt monsters to get more followers.

Also it is possible to convert opponents' cities, or even paralyze them by sending Your monsters to attack them.

In Agora Phase player deifies his heroes, who offer more improved actions for the action phase

Finally the season phase is a phase of replacement.

Player must meet at least 10 worshipers ( or have Three shrines before the end of the game to be the winner of the game.

name: Valkyrie
description:
Valkyrie is a game of checkers with 2 boards. One is Midgard (Earth), the other Asgard (heaven). When the game starts, each player has three gods and a Valkyrie on first board 9 troops (human or monsters) on the second board.

Player wins the battle if he eliminate 3 opponent's gods or has last man standing on the second board.

In his turn player has 2 actions/movements according to the following rules:

troops move one square in the 8 directions
the gods move one square orthogonally and never back
the Valkyries move freely on the set except the last line.


If the move ends on square with an opponent the battle begins.

The value of a pawn in combat is equal to the value of the piece (5 for the gods, 1 to 3 for the troops).

The Valkyries may move a troop from one world to another if it stands one of the adjacent square.

name: Graf Zeppelin
description:
German game celebrating Germany's fame, as they were once the leading airship manufacturer in the world.

The game is a simple roll and move game, taking your Zeppelin across Europe and visiting the major cities. Obey instructions if you land on special spaces. First to the end of the track, wins.

Undoubtedly seen as an educational game, teaching children about their neighbouring countries as well as their aeronautical history.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: Three Little Pigs: The Game
description:
Take on the role of one of the Three Little Pigs as you try to build a house strong enough before the Big Bad Wolf arrives to blow it down and eat you. Move around the board collecting straw, sticks, and/or bricks and then bring them back to your building site to build your house before the big bad wolf arrives. Will you risk travelling further to get to the brick pile, or build a house of straw quickly and then sit back and relax counting on luck to save you when the big bad wolf comes calling.

Watch out, your brother pigs can steal what you’ve collected before you get it back to your house or speed up the wolf’s approach. The pigs whose houses still stand at the end of the game are the winners.

Extra points are awarded for being lazy, but they only matter if your house can survive the coming wolf.

Do you want to take your chances by building a house of straw?

Do you have the time to gather the bricks for your house before the wolf arrives?

Are your brother pigs going to steal your bricks before you can get them back to your house?

Move fast and be smart or it won't matter how much hair you have on your chinny chin chin.

name: Ski Race / Go For Goal
description:
Two games in one box, the only link being that they are both designed to help 7 to 11 year-olds with their maths.

Ski Race is a dice game with four special dice that have very unusual number spreads on them. Children are encouraged to do simple maths with the numbers rolled and thus advance in the Ski Race.

Go For Goal is a football related game for 2 players only. Each player has a hand of cards and must use them (with some simple mathematics) to move the ball around the pich.

The publisher is a major name when it comes to publishing books for budding Hi-Tech students.

name: B4U: Hipster Battle Game
description:
"B4U: Hipster Battle Game" is a simple 3-5 player card game where you try to play a card that has the highest "Irony" value out of your hand, or "Six Pack" as I like to refer to it. It's not as easy as all that though, because someone could play an event card that will completely throw the rules of that round a curve, making it anyone's game! This is a quick, and easy to learn and had a little snark to it as well. All you need to know how to do to play B4U is some simple math, and that's it.

How to play?

Gameplay is easy. As a round begins, you place two card facedown on the table. One in front of you, and one to your right. The card in front of you (which can either be a Irony card, or an Event card) will always come into play each round, but the one on the right (always an Irony card) may or may not.

After all necessary cards are placed into play, the card in front of everyone is turned over and exposed. In the simplest version of a round, the card played with the highest Irony value wins that round. If someone has played an Event card in the front position, then the round gets skewed in some fashion (explained on the card). Such things that could happen are the player with the lowest value wins, or you use the Irony value of both cards, etc.

When an event card is played, that is when the card to your right will be turned over. Some event cards also require you to play a third card onto the table.

After a winner for the round is determined, the round is over, and everyone puts any non-displayed cards back into their Six Pack, and draw back up to 6 cards if the Six Pack is not complete.

First player to win 7 rounds is the winner!

The Object of the game is to achieve an alignment of three pieces of Your color before opponent by making simultaneous displacements.

The pawns are placed on the central board and each player chooses number of movements and destination with his dice on his board. The results are revealed simultaneously.
- If a piece lands on a space occupied, it is placed on top.
- A stack of n pieces can move from 1 to n squares.

A player wins if he makes a row of 3 pawns or if he removes his opponent's pawns

name: Shabadabada: Edition occitane
description:
Shabadabada promotional version made in Occitan.

Two teams compete using predetermined words.

As soon as a player sings part of a song which contains the current word, the other team must find another song containing the word. As soon as a team fails, the other one wins the card.

name: Astronomie: Lernspiel für Jung und Alt
description: This is a small trivia game belonging to the series Wissen-Spielen-Lernen. It contains 98 cards, with questions about the universe. When you answer the questions you can get plus or minus points.

name: Roadrunner Park
description:
"A family game for all ages compliments of Roadrunner Pharmacy. Weave your way through Roadrunner Pak to reach the vacation that is waiting to start,"

Six colored pawns representing dogs and cats move around a path on the board using a spinner to determine how many squares to move. Not unlike Candyland - for pets.

name: Familie Seebrück 2
description:
Familie Seebrück 2 is an expanison for Familie Seebrück.

6 years after the family lost their brewery (story of the base game), they meet again. Each player gets the role of one of the family members.
They want to celebrate the 18. birthday of Vanessas, but she has been abducted.
Than, they find a dead body. Jochen, the lover of the brewers ex-wive has been killed.
It´s the task of the players to find the murder.
All players should act out their role to solve the mystery, because one of the guests is the murderer.

name: Cockpit of Europe (Miniatures Wargames)
description:
"Being a game of genteel warfare for two players desirous of campaigning in the manner of the 18th century."

Cockpit of Europe was published as an article in issue No. 49 of Miniature Wargames magazine in May of 1987. Despite its source this is not a set of miniatures rules, but a paper-and-pencil game of conducting campaigns and sieges in the late 17th and early 18th centuries. It allows two players without a referee to re-create the "limited" or "scientfic" wars of the period dominated by methodical sieges and maneuvering armies against the enemy's line of communication instead of pitched battles. While not detailed, it is rich in historical flavor, not in the minutiae of weapons and tactics but the general's big picture of moving armies within the constraints of supply and time.

Games consiste of several campaign seasons of twenty weeks. Armies must return to winter quarters each year, so only fortresses captured will be retained from season to season. Collecting intelligence is key, or you won't know if your siege train can reach the enemy and create a practicable breach before their supplies run out, or winter sends you home.

This is the warfare of Marlborough and Vauban!

name: All Star Wrestling Power Slam VCR Wrestling Game
description:
Players watch clips of wrestling matches from the old AWA league attempting to play a card that matches the move about to happen (there's a 3 second delay to allow players to choose which card to play)

A correct answer will allow that player to move his marker 2 spaces to the 'pin' space on the game board. If the card played has 'go for the pin', then if that player gets the next 2 card plays correct, they win. Game can also end when someone moves their marker to the pawn space

name: Martial Art Love Affair High School
description:
User summary

A small-press amateur Japanese game; "Martial Art Love Affair High School" is a humouristic card game where the goal is to collect a certain combination of cards, that together form a four-panel cartoon. One card at a time is put out, and players select if they want it or not. If several players want the card, they have to fight for it; fights being decided by dice rolling and some tactical card position choices.
When one player has completed hit set, the round ends and points are calculated. Game plays for five rounds.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Master Trader
description:
In Master Trader players produce one or more unique resources and these are traded for the other players' in order to form a set according to a specific privilege a player has and this combination gives them a specific reward in the shape of gold coins, advanced resources or Victory Points (VP).

The goal of the game is a race to become the first player with a specific amount of VP.

There are many unique privileges arranged in three levels:
In Level 1, players trade 3 different basic resources for 1 gold coin.
In Level 2, players trade 2 different basic resources for 1 advanced resource.
In Level 3, players trade specific combinations of advanced resources and/or gold coins for VP and/or gold coins.

All privileges must be purchased with gold coins.

The game plays over an unlimited amount of rounds, each round consisting of 3 phases. Phases 1 (Free Trade) and 2 (Resource Conversion) are concurrent (no player turns). Phase 3 (Buy Privilege) occurs in a particular order that gives preference to the weaker players at the time.

The entire game is based on a closed economy with limited resources.

name: Les Blondes: Le Jeu
description:
Each card has a picture of the TV series The Blondes.

Each player has a hair color chosen at the beginning of the game and they sit around the table in that order from the darkest to the lightest hair color (Brown, Chestnut, Auburn, Red, Blonde who must wear the included blonde wig). The goal of the game is collect the most points. The one that has the least points at the end of the game is the Blonde.

The cards are numbered from 1 to 10.
On their turn a player may either:
a) play a (better) card or combination (pair, 3/4/5 of a kind) than the previous player
b) pass
When all players have passed, one who has played the highest card or combination opens the next turn by playing new card or combination of their choice.
The player who got rid of all his cards first wins the round and becomes a Brown for the next round pushing the others one rank down.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dri-Dra-Drachenburg
description:
Two little dragons are frolicking through the wizard Charlie's castle. They need to hide well, however, because every now and then the wizard will try to catch them.

"Dri-Dra-Dragon Castle" is a simple game for small children. The castle consists of a series of rooms. The dragons start in the first room, and whoever reaches the last room first wins. Each turn players draw a token from the bag that either allows them to advance their own dragon and hiding it in the next room, or to peek through the door of the wizard's study, trying to spot and catch the other player's dragon.

name: Spoker
description:
Mix of Poker and Scrabble.
Player have card-tiles instead of letters with fifth additional suit and they place them on the gameboard scoring points with poker combinations. Of course there are bonus squares on the board what increase Your points.

name: Cirkle Cards
description:
Unusual shaped cards see Ergomia at www.ergomia.com
There are 5 colors and 5 symbols (Cirkle System) on the cards and the rulebook includes both new and also many known game adaptions like UNO, poker etc.

e.g. version "Flower"
Object of the game is to form flower with the cards scoring the most points.
Player plays the card in front of him but to play the card next to another card it must have the same color or same symbol. If the flower forms rounds the last card must be placed in the middle of the flower and should be in the common shape or color on each side.

name: Toss 'N' Roll Spooky Dice Math
description:
Toss 'N' Roll Spooky Dice Math is a small-box game with a double-sided board and three glow-in-the dark orange dice. The 16-page instruction manual includes directions for six simple math games, including Spider's Web, Big Numbers, Match Points, On the House, Shout Out and Prime Time.

Spider's Web:
The dice are rolled onto a bull's eye board divided into eight pie sections labelled one through eight. Depending on where the die landed, it is multiplied, added or subtracted from the number of the pie piece in which it landed. No points are scored for dice which land in the exact center or off the board completely. The winner is the first to reach a score of 300.

Big Numbers:
Using the same board as Spider's Web, players roll the three dice onto the board, then scramble to be the first to find the largest three-digit number possible, using either the face value of the dice or the number slices into which they landed. This game teaches place value and the winner is the first to reach 2,000.

Match Points:
Each player rolls one die onto the spider web board, making a fraction with the smaller of the die or number slice value (on which the die landed) being the numerator. When a player has collected enough fractions to be one or greater, he scores a point and starts over collecting fractions. The first player to collect five whole numbers wins.

On the House:
Using the game board with six numbered houses, each player rolls one die onto the game board. If the die matches any digit in the house square on which it landed, the player scores. Scoring involves adding each of the digits of the three-digit number on the board together, then multiplying by the die value. The winner is the first player to reach 250 points.

Shout Out:
A designated shooter rolls two dice off the board and one die onto the haunted house board. Depending on which of the six house squares the die lands, all players race to perform the required math operations on the three dice first. The first player to be the first ten times wins.

Prime Time:
Each player rolls the three dice onto the haunted house board, then looks for prime numbers amongst the sum of the die and door number, the dice themselves and the door numbers themselves. Any missed primes may be stolen by other players. The first player to reach 100 points is the winner.

name: Le Répok
description:
The object of the game is to collect game pieces of his oppoenents.

In his turn player plays a card on the table to form vertical or horizontal combinations. He must places his game piece on it. To take away the opponent's pieces, you have to put a stronger combination.

Player with the most opponents's game pieces at the end of the game is the winner

name: Pokerbordspel
description:
The object of the game is to score the most points by playing poker combinations on the table.

In his turn player places a card-tile on the table adjacent to any other tile. Player scores a points for all combinations the tile forms.

If the tile-deck is exhausted the player with the most points is the winner.

name: Heraclitus: The Meta Game
description:
The origins of this game came about due to discussions involved with games evolving over time and being robust enough to handle the change. Other concepts were also added to shape it, such as handling draws and the use of the pie rule to handle uneven game conditions. The game was built around these concepts.

The name of the game comes from the philosopher Heraclitus who said a person never jumps into the same river twice. The game involves the changing of game conditions from round to round, and a testing of the player's skill to be able to evaluate and manipulate such game conditions to their advantage.

The base game takes place on half a checkerboard, and each player has 12 pieces each. In the basic game, if no rules changes are applied, players end up dropping a piece on the board from the reserve, sliding one of their pieces on the board, or swapping one of their pieces with an opponent's piece on the board. Players capture enemy pieces by jumping. In the normal game, players win the game by capturing at least 6 enemy pieces.

This is Game #29 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series.

name: Auto Game:  Dis moi, ce que je vois
description:
Each player tries to win cards being the first to see or guess the objects from the cards other players draw.

Player drive with car and see different things from the window. He draws a card from the deck and says something like that: "I see, I see ... what you do not see - and it's blue!" Other players must guess quickly what it is. First player who guess wins that card.

If the deck is exhausted the player with the most cards is the winner.

name: Auto Game: Déclic et des plaques
description:
Players try to make sentences or words with numbers and letters of a license plate from the cards.

The card is drawn face-up and the first player who make a sentence or a combination of words from one of the plates represented, says it aloud and wins the card.

If the deck is exhausted the player with the most cards wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Déplikid
description:
Children version of the game Deplimo.
Players build their words with six sections - each section with 4 to 6 letters.
In his turn player draws a letter from bag. The number of letters is defined by rolling of dice (1 to 6)

Game ends if first player fills all of his sections with letters.
Player with the most letters at the end of the game is the winner.

name: M.E.K.
description:
M.E.K. aka Mäng Eesti Koolidele (The game for Estonian Schools) is a Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition like boardgame produced by small student company.

Players move on the board answering the questions of 6 categories: History, Biology, Estonian, English, Mathematic, School. In his turn player rolls the die and moves his pawn accordingly, draws a card from correct deck and answers the question. Player who has answered correctly questions from each category may start to move in the middle of the board. If he answers the last question correctly he wins the game
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Trivia

name: Baa!
description:
From the website

Farm. Fences. Folds. Friends. Fun!
Baa! is very cute triangle-tile-based board game which is originally designed, illustrated, manufactured and published by Joshua Chao on June 15th, 2011.
Players explore the farm and place their fences on it to create folds as the game progresses. The more sheep a player can have, the more score a player can get. But not so easy...

Gameplay in short:
On a player's turn he places a triangular tile (farm) from his hand connected to tiles already on the table first to create a landscape. After that he places a fence on the connecting side of to farms to hurd sheep optionally. Fences cannot be placed next to trees. Taking a new farm from the stack ends his turn and the next player is on.
If an area is completely surrounded with fences regardsless of colour (a fold) after playing a fence scoring is forced. A fold must contain at least one sheep and a shed and cannot cannot contain empty spaces. Sheep are owned by the player with the most fences alongside the fold (draws are possible). Whites get you 3 points, grays 2 and blacks 1. Sheep next to a fruit bush earn you 1 bonus point.
Game ends when a player has used all his fences or when the stack of farms is depleted. Player with the most point in total wins. Draws are decided by the amount of fences left in a player's hand.

name: Tidley Quoits
description:
Tidleywinks variation. Instead of flicking counters, you flip rings with the intention of making a ring land over one of the spikes on the board. You still use a big counter to do the flicking. The box illustrates the game very well.

Each successful flick scores points. When you stop the game, the player with the most points, wins.

name: That Sports Game
description:
THAT SPORTS GAME is a newly produced classical board game that uses dice for player movement, a card game within the game to compete for amateur sports. The sports are the sports in the list of sports approved by the Olympics for athletic competition at the quadriennial games.

That being said, there is NO TRIVIA, and no knowledge of sports required. The only requirement is a love of board games, and an understanding of how board games function.

That Sports Game game play involves everyone at the table, whenever a sports event space is encountered by landing on it. The SPORTS EVENT card is drawn, every player must 'pay' to enter the sport, and then using the GET SET deck, that includes 5 cards per person at the outset, each player 'bids' for the event by using their skill, experience, and training against each other competitor. The winner of the Sports event keeps the SPORTS EVENT CARD, as well as takes the honorarium designated on the card, plus the cash of all the other competitors in the event. The aim is to get enough sports event cards to qualify for a coach (if you don't get a coach by other means) and a sponsor, so that you can move up to national and global competition.

When landing on other spaces like HOST CITY, a Host City Card is
drawn, and specs followed. Drug testing may be required, taxes, fund raising and Bonus spaces also are part of the mix. Scoring as per the score card, determines the winner in most games if timed.

We enjoy playing 1:23 (that is one hour and twenty three minutes) and then compute the winner. You might be surprised to find yourself an athletic champion!

For lots of information, look to our website: www.thatsportsgame.com

name: Par It
description:
From the rules booklet

"Golf the Year Round- Rain or Shine

Par-It is a game, played with cards, which is fully as intriguing as regulation outdoor golf."

You have 12 sets of cards, representing golf clubs - each with different results on them - hook, slice, sand trap, 4 putt on the green, etc. You draw a card from the appropriate stack based on the yardage remaining to the hole and keep track of your score on the score card. Each card drawn represents 1 stroke, added to the number of putts on the green. They suggest you can even use score cards from your favorite course.

Each copy of the game has a random card affixed to the lid - so some might say No. 3 Iron Mid Mashie while another might say No. 8 Iron Niblic. All the same game - Par It

name: Le Son du Nénuphar
description:
A game to work on innovative sounds and the meanings of words.

The object of the game is to create as many words as possible by combining the vowels listed on the board and consonants, diphthongs from the cards.

In each direction a word count for a different word and therefore scores You more points. Everyone plays at the same time to monitor the words found by the player

Contents:

game board,
an hourglass,
66 cards representing consonants, diphthongs, etc.

name: Les visages de Casimir
description:
Each player starts the game by picking a word that represents a character of Casimir.
The game board is divided into boxes, each box contains a letter.
In his turn player rolls two dice to move on the board.
You must gain the letters of your word from first to last.
The first player who completes his word is the winnner.

name: Mots croisés rallye
description:
The game takes place in 8 rounds. 7 rounds lasts 30 seconds. 8th round lasts 60 seconds.

Each player receives some hidden letters to use.
Player must use 5 letters to form words like crossword in front of him during the round.
If the round ends players give the letters they didn't use to his neighbors and draw 2 more letters for next round.

After 8 rounds the player with the most letters used is the winner

name: Vevisee
description:
A pachisi variant. Each player has four named pieces, the Horse, Rider, Child and Dog. As usual in pachisi the object is to get all four pieces around the circular track and "home" to the center.

A unique feature of the game is that on a turn each player rolls two dice and moves any two pieces. There are "obstacles" on the course, and the Horse and Rider must cross each obstacle on the same turn, as must the Child and Dog. If a player's Horse and Rider, or Child and Dog, occupy the same space then they form a "block" which opposing pieces may not pass.

name: Play Tennis
description:
A game in the little known third series of games from Melins/Scandecor. Like the bigger plastic boxed games (Play Ecology and others) the game box is hard plastic in excellent quality.

The game tries to simulate real tennis as closely as possible, although with directions quantified to three (forward, left diagonal and right diagonal) and with 4x4 spaces on each side as possible places for the ball to land. For every turn, you can move both your pieces (up to two steps), and one of them must land at the ball. You then select a position on the other side, along the lines from the ball, in which you strike the ball.

The goal of the game is to win a tennis "game", following tennis rules, and there are markers for 0-15-30-40-advantage on the side of the board, but no marker for number of games, since you are only expected to play one.

Alas, the game has no random elements whatsoever which makes it fairly easy to see through, and once you understand the tactics, a single ball takes forever. This was most likely one reason why the game was short lived and is pretty unknown today.

name: Clacto Fishing, game with magnetic balls
description: Clacto Fish is leterally a fishing game. Players use a magnetic fishing rod to remove magnetic balls from the gameboard. The objective is to remove the balls in such a way that the position of the remining balls is undisturbed. The winner is the player to collect most balls.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Army of the Goblinoids
description:
From publisher blurb:

Contains stats for both standard OGL play and Feast of Crows unit conversions.

The orcs, goblins and bugbears of the land have a just reputation as ravagers, destroyers. Mindless barbarian forces intent on nothing more than rape, burn and pillage. They breed fast, live for war - even amongst themselves - and exist in a brutal hierarchy of strength, bowing their heads only to those breeds and powers that prove stronger and more ruthless than they are.

The goblinoids represent chaos and animal instinct, they exist at the fringes of the civilised world in the wild places and in the caverns underground, they inhabit ruins and the dark areas of the map. They are fear of the savage and dangerous side of nature they are beasts that walk like men and use their own tools against them.

Goblinoids are not the most intelligent or tactically minded of creatures, their options mostly being limited to attacking endlessly, relying on their great weight of numbers to succeed where others would fail. Their personal physical prowess and low animal cunning still makes them dangerous though and many a well thought out and clever trap has failed to take into account goblinoid tenacity and savagery.

They are the engines and footsoldiers of chaos and evil, bringing war and strife to every land and every people endlessly. Occasionally a great host will arise, lead by an effective leader and then the lands of the man-like races should tremble and fear what is coming.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Army of Civilisation
description:
From publisher blurb:

Army of Civilisation also contains conversions of all the spells you could need to sway your battles.

Humankind has not the industriousness of dwarves, the savagery of orcs nor the arcane knowledge and eternity of the elvenkind. Men have no one thing that makes them shine above the other demihuman races, they are not beautiful, they are not giants, their senses are dulled compared to their companion humanoids, their minds weaker, they lifespan fleeting.

But what humans do have are towns, villages, cities, kingdoms and empires. Man builds communities; he transmits knowledge from one generation to the next. He creates gods, he creates traditions, he creates history and, so short lived, he strives to leave his mark upon the world before he passes beyond it through deeds and accomplishments.

Man creates civilisation in all its trappings, the inheritors of the land. Man's armies are organised, powerful, working together. Man is the jack-of-all-trades of the races, master of none, but able to work together to create accomplishments that no other race can. Where they are one dimensional, focussed, exaggerations of some aspect of the spirit of man only he is whole, one, able to bring every part of himself to bear in peace of conflict.

Man's armies are innovative, adaptable, disciplined. Working together in faith they can stand against a much greater force and destroy it, simply by holding steadfast. Their adaptable, flexible nature gives them a depth to their force that no other race, no matter how ancient or savage, can hope to destroy.

Man has spirit.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Army of the Barbarians
description:
From publisher blurb:

Contains statistics for a barbarian army for both normal play and converted for Feast of Crows.

Bonus rules for heroes-as-units and fractional casualties.

Beyond the walls of civilisation lie the untamed lands. Most of the world is untamed, wilderness, walked by fell beasts and savage races to whom fighting, survival is their only way of life. To survive out here, without the comforts of the hearth fire or the aid of trade and civilisation, to live requires you to become part beast yourself.

The barbarian tribes survive by becoming the savage, by becoming the beast. Human ingenuity and flexibility combined with the very traits that make the lands so hard to live in, in the first place. They are one with the harsh land they inhabit be it plains, mountains, deserts or blasted wilderness. Supplementing their armies with wild horseflesh and the great beasts that civilisation looks upon in awe.

And when stirred? These barbarians can be the greatest allies or the greatest enemies to civilised man. They can tear down his walls or unite with him against his enemies. They rebuff civilisation itself but to some the brotherhood of man overcomes any cultural difference that they might feel.

Blood is life, blood is sacrifice, blood is all. The barbarians embrace the beast and fight!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Army of the Elves
description:
From publisher blurb:

Contains rules for both regular OGL play and Feast of Crows.
Contains army lists for both 'light' and dark elves.

Elves are inscrutable, graceful, long lived and knowledgable. Good or evil, light or dark, they bear themselves aloof from the other races and are regarded as untrustworthy, or even downright evil, by many of them.

Elven craft is amongst the finest known, their weapons and armour renown for its accuracy, strength and the delicacy of the artisan's work. No bow is more accurate, no armour lighter, no blade so keen. Their goods are prized, valued, fought for by those of lesser ability.
