Their magical knowledge is considerable, honed and fashioned over the long centuries to give them resistance to many magics along with a powerful talent, most especially for enchantments. These enchantments and martial prowess with bows and other stand-off weapons allow the elves to protect their communities, even though they are smaller than those of many other races.

When war comes the elven host will often resemble a silvery pool, light glinting from their mithral weapons and armour and a high keening cry coming from their number as they close to the attack. Arrows flying with uncommon accuracy to strike their enemies down.

There is a dark-half though, an outcast race of elves who call the tunnels and the dark home, the ways of evil. Their grace is decadent, their weapons crafted with subtle evil and the silken tones of their voice come from the spinnerets of spiders, not the joy of ancient tales.

Poison and treachery lurk in the dark but are no less elven than any other?
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Army of the Dwarves
description:
From publisher blurb:

Contains stats for both standard OGL play and Feast of Crows unit conversions. Army of the Dwarves also contains expanded siege rules.

Master craftsmen and builders, delvers into the earth, smiths of unsurpassed quality and fighters of a steadfast and strong-willed temperament the dwarves are accomplished at war but rarely muster above the surface save in times of great peril for all the lands.

Most of the dwarves' battles, most of the dwarves' lives, are spent deep beneath the surface of the world, delving their homes, building their fortresses living and dying without sight of the sun. They are one with the rock, stoic, unswerving and patient.

The greater number of the dwarves' wars are conducted in the caverns and keeps below the surface and fought against one terrible enemy only, the endless march of the goblinoids. The bitter feuds between the dwarves and the goblinoids are legendary and their battles and skirmishes in the dark heart of the world all but unceasing.

Dwarves are not the speediest of combatants but they do have a mastery of crafting and technology that others lack and they have specialist tactics and methods suited to their underground battles. Neither is magic their greatest strength, though they have their faith. Dwarven battles are about taking and holding ground while making a slow, implacable advance. Steady and even progress towards a goal or the bitter holding of ground, denying even an inch to the enemy no matter how fierce the battle.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Errors in English Card Game
description:
A deck of cards which can be used either as normal playing cards or as flashcards with two words (like "SHALL / WILL" or "ROBBERY / THEFT") on the face and an explanation of the difference in correct usage of the two words on the back.

Instructions are included for a simple card game in which players race to play all cards from their hand, but can only play a card once they have described the point of English usage explained on it.

name: The Deflation Game
description:
A Monopoly-inspired game in which players roll and move round a track buying and selling assets; as in Monopoly, the object is to be the last player not bankrupt, or to be the richest player after a designated period of time.

Players can purchase two kinds of assets, tangible and financial. Whenever a player lands on a "Price Change" space, every player's tangible assets become either more or less valuable: usually less, because deflation occurs on a roll of 1 through 4, inflation only on 5 or 6.

Financial assets are not affected by inflation and deflation, and thus holding them is more advantageous.

A player may also land on a "Sound Advice from Shilling & Co." square, in which case he or she may take one of five special actions, such as selling an asset of his/her choice at market value.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Occaboton Clinic
description:
As doctors in a world famous clinic, players have fun trying to help patients recover from a variety of health problems.

Each player chooses a token and places it on the start square. Players move around the board by rolling dice. Landing on certain squared allows players to pick a new patient card, roll for a patient, or answer a true/false question. Patient cards describe a patient and the patient's health problem. Rolling the dice determine if the patient improves and the player gains points, or gets worse and the player looses points. Players also gain points by answering the true/false questions correctly. The player with the most points at the end of 30 minutes is the winner.

Occabaton Clinic is a teaching game designed for grades 5-12 to prevent young people from starting tobacco. (Occabaton is "no tobacco" spelled backwards.) The students are not told the focus on of the game is anti-tobacco; the game is designed for them to discover on their own that tobacco use is dangerous. After the game is over, students are led in discussion and exercises.

name: Execution Tennis
description:
Simulates the game of tennis through the use of a tennis court layout on a board and the use of various strokes, court position, target area and the probability (spinner) of the success of each shot. Scorecard allows for traditional, VASSS - "no ad" and NTL ping pong style scoring.

Rules are included for an alternative forecourt tennis game using dice.

name: Gettysburg: America at War
description:
“Gettysburg: America at War” takes place in a time of swords, horsemen, and muskets. In our game, we attempt to simulate the feeling of being the commander of a Corps commander in the Civil War, notably it’s most well known and well studied battle, the Battle of Gettysburg. The desire to simulate a realistic battle has to be weighed against the constraints of time, attention, and ease of play. As such, we’ve streamlined the game a good deal since its initial play testing, and hope that you’ll find this version of the game easy to learn and play, taking no more than a few short minutes to get your first game underway. We have also attempted to order the scenarios not only by chronological order, but by complexity. This was done so that you can learn the finer points of strategy as you go along, without feeling bogged down trying to command half the Army of the Potomac.
Each chit in the game represents roughly one battalion of soldiers, or a single battery of guns. Although historically many of the battalions came from all over the country, and had a variety of names, to keep the game simple, we have avoided putting unit names on the chits, and simply created names for the OOB for each mission. Commander’s names have been kept though, and are generally correct in terms of participation in the events they are represented in.
Players take the role of either a Confederate or Union officer commanding his soldiers, alternating between players. The game is divided into a variety of scenarios to represent individual portions of the battle, and one large "Campaign" scenario. To win the player must complete the objectives stated on the scenario orders, which generally align to the historical goals of the respective commanders. Players move the chits around the map, having to take into account terrain, roads, and overall tactical situation.

name: Travel Pack: Road Signs and Spylo
description:
A game to play whilst travelling on a long car journey. It includes cards for two games but they are merely the same game with an emphasis on two aspects of the journey.

The first is called Road Signs and the cards feature illustrations of road signs at the time. The other is called Spylo and the cards feature landmarks or non-sign related subjects to look out for.

The winner is the one who spots the most.

name: Crown Chess
description:
Review by John Humphries in Games and Puzzles #30:

Crown Chess is an unfortunate choice of name for this interesting and original game, as it bears no resemblance to chess. Perhaps Crown Prince may be a more apt name.

The game is played on a large, circular, wooden board on which are printed five concentric rings which are radially divided into eight sections, giving forty spaces or panels in total. The outermost ring or band is gold in colour, the remainder being black or white, in a pattern such that each adjacent pair of sections are of a similar colour and each panel is surrounded on three sides by panels of like colour.

Four sets of playing pieces are supplied. Each set consists of a Prince, two Barons (elephants) and two Viscounts (horses). The pieces are well moulded from resin, each set being in a distinguishing pastel colour. In addition there is a Crown, resembling an up-turned vase. The rules are simple and easy to follow.

The Crown is worn by one of the Princes, who is thus elevated to King. The object of the game is to promote your Prince and then manouevre him to the gold (outer) band. All pieces may be moved in or out one panel, the Prince can be moved an unlimited number of panels in a clockwise or anti-clockwise direction, the Baron only clockwise and the Viscount only anti-clockwise. No diagonal moves are permitted and the only piece allowed to move onto a panel already occupied is the King, and this only to capture. The King is the only piece able to capture other pieces. The Crown is gained by moving a piece onto a panel of the same colour and adjacent to the King, who is then demoted and the new Prince is crowned.

Although not a difficult game to play, Crown Chess does require thought and planning. However, it is rather difficult to formulate strategy because the situation changes so rapidly with four players. The Hints on Play provided advice that the main objective should not be to take the Crown, which should only be done to prevent another player from winning, to prevent possible capture of your pieces or to win the game. As pieces cannot jump over one another, there is a certain amount of aimless movement. and blocks can occur. Princes may not be captured, thus there is no way of forcing them to move. One of the best winning strategies seems to be to move one's Prince onto a panel adjacent to a Gold, keep it protected and wait for other players to blunder, then take the Crown at the opportune moment and make the winning move.

The game does have many unique concepts and apart from the box is extremely well presented. It is also most decorative though probably beyond the means of most games players (this game cost 18 pounds at the time of release).

name: Bonomino
description:
Funny domino-game with parts of different characters on the tiles. Players must get rid of their tiles first by placing them on the table that the parts - hairstyle, head, body, legs, feet - fits together correctly.

Player who gets rid of his tiles first is the winner.

name: Léonardino
description:
The object of the game is to get rid of his cards first by placing these on the table and helping Leonardo to mix colors correctly.

Each player draws 4 tiles with brushes and 8 cards.
In his turn player may play a color-card if he can paint with that color. eg. Player has card with blue and yellow. He can play this card if he can place on the table tile with blue and yellow or tile with green (which is mixture of this 2)

Player who plays his last card is the winner.

name: Magic Artifact
description:
Fantastic and addictive game with your family and friends. 2-4 players. Team mode for 4 players.
90 cards including 60 normal artifacts and 30 power artifacts. 10+ highly playable expanding rules.

Get most magic points to become the winner!

Brief rule:

There are 3 phases in a player’s turn: the beginning phase, the operation phase and the ending phase.
1) The beginning phase: The active player can draw 1 card from top of the library...
2) The operation phase: The active player can place 1 normal artifact. He can also play at most 3 power artifacts...
3) The ending phase: If the active player doesn’t play any card, he can draw 2 cards. If he has more than 6 cards in hand, he should choose to discard extra cards.

https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/magic-artifact

name: Sorcery the Congregation
description: Sorcery the Congregation is a deck building game with elements of direct conflict, player interaction, and chaotic 2-4 player action. Each player will start with a 12 card deck that contains 9 Essence, 3 Lackeys and 20 life force. The goal of the game is to acquire stronger cards from the center and conjure minions or cast spells to slow and injure your opponent. It is a game of with a parody feel to classic games such as Magic the Gathering and other deck building games.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Los Angeles Rams Football
description: Both the Offensive coach and the Defensive Coach have 8 cards in their hands. The cards show the offensive plays; Fullback thru line, Halfback Off Tackle, Halfback Around end, Long Pass, Jump pass, Flat Pass etc. The Offensive player selects his play call while the defensive player puts the cards in order depending on which play he thinks the Offensive player will call. The order that the cards are placed in determines how successful the offensive play is. If the defense matches the offense then the defense has guessed the right play and the gain will be minimal. If the offensive play was Halfback around end and the defensive player had that card 4th in order the gain might be 7 yards. If the defense had the card 3rd in order the gain might be reduced to 4 yards. So the closer to the actual play call the defense is, the lower the gain potential. There is also a clock that the players move. Run plays take 30 secs while pass plays take 15 secs.
publishers: Schmidt Game Company, Zondine Game Co.

name: SV Werder Bremen Quiz
description:
The combination of card and dice game includes 288 questions in six levels of difficulty around the German national football team.

Roll "one" and answer the simple question, where correct answer gives You one chip.
Roll "six" and answer difficult question, where correct
answer will be rewarded with six chips.

If the deck is exhausted the player with the most chips is the winner.

Contents:

48 cards
1 dice
150 chips

name: MD
description:
MD is a promotional game by the German paper factory of the same name. It shows the production steps of high quality paper.
The game essentially uses a roll and move mechanism. Additionally, there are certain fields on which the players can pick up "forward" and "backward" cards. These can be used to either cancel bad event field effects, to double a die roll, or to set back opponents. The goal of the game is to get to the final storage fields for the completed product.

name: Two-In-One Halfpenny Fun Games
description:
From the box: Two games in one! Our specially designed double-sided board offers two favorite games - Steeplechase on one side and Ladders & Slides on the other.

Steeplechase is a game where the players roll two dice and move their markers (horses) the number of spaces shown on the dice. There are special squares that either help you or hinder your progress. The first "horse" to reach the finish line wins the game.

Ladders & Slides is basically the same as Chutes & Ladders, Snakes & Ladders, Knights & Dragons, etc. Roll one die and move forward the number shown. If you land on a square with the botton of a ladder, you automatically move to the square at the top of the ladder. If you land on a square with the top of a slide, your mover is sent to the square at the bottom of the slide. The first player to reach square 100 by an exact number wins the game.

name: System: The Customisable Hacker Game
description:
System is a Player Versus Player card game on which Player's take on the role of hackers and try to take control over their Opponent's System Cards via damaging them by battling on the plains of cyberspace with the use of Virus cards while defending from their opponent's attacks with their own anti-Virus cards.

A Player starts with a Memory value of 0. During the start of a Player's turn they may play (upload) Anti-Virus Cards that increase a Player's Memory value while on the field and or Virus cards that decrease a Player's Memory value while active on the field. If anytime during the game, a player's Memory value is below 0, then they must send their active Virus cards from their field to the discard pile until their Memory value is restored to at least 0, if not higher.

In addition to Anti-Virus and Virus Cards, Players may also use "Input" costs which have a Memory Cost and can be activated at anytime except the Upload Phase by returning Anti-Virus cards that have an equal or higher memory value than the costs of the input card back to the owner's hand.

To reduce your opponent's System Points, you declare which Virus Cards you choose to attack with and then the defending player may block with an Anti-Virus card (An Anti-Virus card may block any number of Virus Cards but if it's Memory Value is equal to or less than the total sum of the Virus Card's Memory Value, it is destroyed)

If a Virus card attacks succesfully, you inflict 1 Critical Damage to your Opponent's System (ie you reduce their System Points by 1.) When an Opponent's System is reduced to 0, you win the game.

Start-Up
Both Players draw 5 cards. Player who goes first may not attack.

Phases

Draw – Turn Player draws 1 card
Upload – Turn Player uploads Anti-Virus or Virus Cards. No Input Cards may be activated.
System – Turn Player selects which Virus cards to attack with.
End – Some effects may happen here.


Zones

Deck - Directory
Discard – Recycle Bin
Field - Desktop
Hand - Hand
Removed From Play – Archive


Other Terminology

Card Collective (on table) - Program
Card Collective (off table) - File
Counter - Cancel
Destroy - Terminate
Discard - Delete
Effect - Process
Player - Host
Return - Buffer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Star Confrontations: Matrix Legion
description:
From the Introduction:

The Matrix Legion army book requires the Star Confrontation rules book in order to play. The Matrix Legion is a robot army that uses self repair to keep their army on the move no matter what damage their forces receive. Matrix robots use advanced stealth and teleportation technologies to dominate the battlefield.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Star Confrontations: Coalition Forces
description:
From the Introduction:

The Coalition Forces army book requires the Star Confrontation rules bookin order to play. This army book introduces the the Coalition Forces, which is a mass tropp army supported by APCs and heavy tanks.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Confrontations: Star Elf Guardians
description:
From the Introduction:

The Star Elf Guardian army book requires the Star Confrontation rules book in order to play. Star Elves are master snipers that use crossfire to tear enemy forces apart. Star Elf worlds have limited population so drones make up most of their military forces. These fearless robot warriors are tough as nails and each provides a special ability to their squad, making Drone Squads one of the most versatile and durable squads in the game.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Tomot Original
description:
At start each player receives seven cards.
There are 2 letters on the cards, one black and another purple.

The goal is to find a word during 3 minutes with 3 or 5 black letters but using a purple letter in the middle of your word
to socre 2 points.

At the end of the lap, put your cards face down on the table except the card with used purple letter what You put on top of the deck face-up.

The cards are given to neighbors who have 90 seconds to find in the word of his opponent's word of 3 or 5 letters.
Each player announces the words they found.
If you can not find a word or Your word is smaller than word of Your opponent, his score is doubled.

With several rounds the player with the highest score wins.

name: Tomot Thèmes
description:
The game consists of 30 theme cards for the Tomot Original.

Each player receives seven cards of the original game and a theme card is drawn face-up on the table.
There are several themes like: Geography, Sports, Games etc.

In his turn player must give a word beginning with a letter from his card and related to the face-up theme-card. An answer can be given only once throughout that round.

The round ends when one player has given answer for each card from his hand. Then he scores a point.

A player must take an additional card, if He does not have words or he is too slow.

After several rounds the player with the most points wins.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Rotascript
description:
Copied from a review by John le Neve Johnson in Games and Puzzles #12:

The equipment for the game comprises a plastic bowl in the lid of the box and another one fixed in the bottom half; a gross of small cards in six colours with letters on both front and back; and a six-sided top with a differently-coloured spot on each side.

The cards are shuffled and dropped in the bowl in the lid of the box. The top is spun in the other bowl and the idea is to grab the cards one at a time and build up words while the top is still spinning. Letters that are unused must be returned before another one is taken. The grabbing must stop immediately the top falls over.

One point is scored for every card used in a word which is the same colour as the spot on the top side of the dice when it falls. If the word starts with a white card the score is doubled.

Each round consists of two spins of the top; then the words are broken up and the cards returned to the bowl for the start of a new round.

The winner is either the first player to score a set number of points or the high¬est number of points in a set time.

name: Tomot Pictures
description:
Adds 30 Picture-cards for the Tomot Original
Each card has a picture and word describing that picture with 5 letters but only the middle letter is shown.

The game is played only with black letters from the original game.
At the beginning of the round, each player receives 5 ​​picture cards and the top card from the original deck is drawn face-up.

Players must be the quickest to find the word from his pictures
that contains this letter and to score point. The picture card is discarded.
If a player makes a mistake he draws an additional card.
The round ends when a player has no more cards in hand.
Player with the most points is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Tomot Histoires
description:
Adds 30 blank cards to Tomot Original.

Players receives 7 original cards with letters and 3 blank cards.
First player forms a word to start telling a story.
Eg. plays cards "R","A" and "T" and says: Once upon a time (a) RAT..."
In next turns player forms a word and continue a stroy.
Player must always has 7 orignal Tomot cards in hand and 3 blank cards what replaces any letter.

Winner of the round is the player who is the last in game.
Player is eliminated if he:

He has no word to continue the story,
He makes a mistake in grammar, spelling etc.
He doesn't remember the story to continue
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game

name: Hamburger SV Quiz
description:
The combination of card and dice game includes 288 questions in six levels of difficulty around the German national football team.

Roll "one" and answer the simple question, where correct answer gives You one chip.
Roll "six" and answer difficult question, where correct
answer will be rewarded with six chips.

If the deck is exhausted the player with the most chips is the winner.

Contents:

48 cards
1 dice
150 chips

name: Hamburger SV Quiz Set 3
description:
Adds 32 new cards with 152 questions for Hamburger SV Quiz.

Roll "one" and answer the simple question, where correct answer gives You one chip.
Roll "six" and answer difficult question, where correct
answer will be rewarded with six chips.

If the deck is exhausted the player with the most chips is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports, Trivia

name: Fibonacci 21
description: Fibonacci 21 is a deck of 89 cards numbered 2, 3, 5, 8, 13, or 21. Several rummy-style games and a solitaire game can be played with the deck. The idea in each game is to form sets of cards based on the Fibonacci sequence and then to meld those cards onto the table. The winner is the first player to go out after acquiring the correct number of sets.

name: FC Schalke 04 Quiz
description:
The combination of card and dice game includes 288 questions in six levels of difficulty around the German national football team.

Roll "one" and answer the simple question, where correct answer gives You one chip.
Roll "six" and answer difficult question, where correct
answer will be rewarded with six chips.

If the deck is exhausted the player with the most chips is the winner.

Contents:

48 cards
1 dice
150 chips

name: SkyWar Dragon
description:
A Strategic Game of Aerial Dragon Combat
Blood poured from a ragged wound in his neck and his wings were frozen and sluggish from Syrinaxx’s icy breath, but Ulmasaur drove himself onward. The frost dragon’s wingbeats thrummed behind him, relentlessly matching each maneuver as they banked around a mountain. But Syrinaxx had grown overconfident and Ulmasaur climbed, twisted and flipped in an unexpected wing over to arrive directly behind the white dragon and a vicious bite delivers a final mortal wound.

A vile smirk splits his maw as the white dragon plummets into the mist below, but victory is short lived, as the full bulk of the gigantic Lavendros collides mid-air with the black scaled Ulmasaur as they lock claws and tumble earthward - wings, gore and fangs in a deadly embrace. The wind screams as they bite and rend one another, but as the ground rushes at them there is no hope for Ulmasaur, who takes the full brunt of the crash beneath the bulk of Lavendros. The big dragon sniffs the corpse below him once before bellowing a victorious roar and taking wing, he is battered and broken but the skies are his and his alone.

Overview of Play
In SkyWar Dragon, Each player controls a mighty dragon embroiled in a battle for supremacy in the skies. Players will play Flight Cards to maneuver on the board and gain position over their opponents so that they may then play damaging Attack Cards. Flight Cards modify your Evasion and Combat, so careful section of the right card at the right time is essential to victory.

name: Borussia Mönchengladbach Quiz
description:
The combination of card and dice game includes 288 questions in six levels of difficulty around the German national football team.

Roll "one" and answer the simple question, where correct answer gives You one chip.
Roll "six" and answer difficult question, where correct
answer will be rewarded with six chips.

If the deck is exhausted the player with the most chips is the winner.

Contents:

48 cards
1 dice
150 chips

Adds 32 cards with 152 new questions for SV Werder Bremen Quiz.

The combination of card and dice game includes 288 questions in six levels of difficulty around the German national football team.

Roll "one" and answer the simple question, where correct answer gives You one chip.
Roll "six" and answer difficult question, where correct
answer will be rewarded with six chips.

If the deck is exhausted the player with the most chips is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports, Trivia

Roll "one" and answer the simple question, where correct answer gives You one chip.
Roll "six" and answer difficult question, where correct
answer will be rewarded with six chips.

Contents:

48 cards

description:

The combination of card and dice game includes 288 questions in six levels of difficulty around the German national football team.

Roll "one" and answer the simple question, where correct answer gives You one chip.

Contents:

48 cards
1 dice
150 chips

name: Tomot Poker
description:
Adds 52 cards with poker chips to the Tomot Original.

Each player gers 250 credit and 4 Original cards with letters and one letter is drawn face-up on the table, which will remain in this position throughout the race.

The goal is the same as traditional poker: having the best combination: pair, 3/4/5 of a kind, word with 3,4 or 5 letters,
3 or 4 letters in alphapetical order or TOMOT/Super TOMOT
word with 3/5 letters with black letter in the middle.
Players bid with their credit.

At the end of the game the player with the most money wins.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game

name: Marble Fun
description:
A traditional target game. The target is a wall with five arches. The arches are worth points if you can roll one of your marbles into the opening. The scores 'on the doors' seems arbitrary; they are, from left to right, 7, 8, 5, 10, 3 .
Above each arch is an animal;
An elephant, a lion, a sea lion, a tiger, and an ape. The illustrations, that give the game some character, are by English illustrator, Kenneth Townsend (1931 - 1999).

The first player to reach a pre-agreed total, wins.

name: Safety Net
description:
Full name - "Safety Net: A Technological Security Simulation"

Safety Net is an educational simulation in the form of a single-player card game pitting the player, armed with one deck of cards, against the opposing deck itself. Created as a graduate project for an intelligence analysis program, Safety Net is designed to simulate various online defenses, threats and responses for an individual in an environment with sensitive information. Each card also includes flavor text describing the relevant threat or defensive option. This offers a great way to quickly introduce someone to the basic ups and downs of online security in a sensitive-information-based environment.

The player begins with 10 Security Points (SP) and attempts to use the Defense Deck to build multi-layered defenses across various electronic fronts (email, social media, and mobile devices), while each turn the 'Hacker' deck generates attempts to penetrate or disrupt the player's security, reducing the SP total. If at any point, the SP value reaches zero, the player loses the game. The player wins by successfully fending off the hacker's attacks and surviving ten rounds of the game with SP remaining.

name: Admiral
description:
To start, the players place two of their galleons in their main harbours and one in each of their smaller ports on the opposite side of the board. The admiral sails in one of the ships in the main harbour. The object of the game is to sink the enemy ship carrying the hostile admiral. One very interesting feature is that the ships in the smaller havens cannot be moved until they are released by the other ships in their navy.

On his turn, a player has three options. He may move one galleon one or two spaces in any direction; he may engage in battle with an enemy ship standing on an adjacent space, or he may move his admiral from one of his ships to an adjacent one. You release a ship simply by moving one of your galleons to the space immediately in front of the harbour in which it rests. Once having left port, no ship may return there during the game. This ensures that all ships are kept on active service and there is no running for cover. Battles are resolved by the roll of dice, one die for each friendly ship (up to a maximum of three) adjacent to the victim. Each 5 or 6 thrown results in a hit. A hit on a galleon in full sail means that the tile must be turned to reveal the damaged vessel. A hit on a damaged ship results in the sinking of that ship.

Obviously the main tactic is to release all of your ships as quickly as possible, and try to attack on a 2 — 1 basis. Due to the choice of options, a player must move his ship next to the enemy on one turn and wait until the next before firing his guns. This means that the enemy can either turn tail, or attack and hope to get in the first blow but at the same time remaining on station to accept an attack on the following turn.

name: Old Lady in a Shoe
description:
Copied from a review by John le Neve Johnson in Games and Puzzles #13:

Old Lady in a Shoe is a well-presented, strongly-boxed game for very young children, the winning of which depends almost entirely on chance.

It consists of a plastic boot on top of which is placed a plastic roof with a chimney; three square cards — one marked Swimming pool, another Play¬ground and the third equipped with a spinner and divided into eight segments, two of which are marked Swimming pool, two Playground and the other four with a picture of the boot house; and 16 play children in four differently coloured sets.

The object of the game is that each player should collect his four play children either on the Playground or in the Swimming pool.

Each player spins the spinner in turn and moves one of his play children as directed — either down the chimney or to the Playground or the Swimming pool. One of three things can happen to a play child dropped down the chimney — it can come out on one side of the boot into the Playground, on the other side into the Swimmjng pool or it can remain inside the boot.

A child who spins Playground or Swimming pool can use his turn to move a play child from one play area to another. The winner is the player to get most play children on to one area.

name: Wordpower
description:
Word-Mastermind variant, which I believe was published before its more famous compatriot.

One player thinks of a five letter word. The decoder must try to find it in as few guesses as possible. The mechanic for the decoder is that he or she must think of a five letter word themselves, show it to the problem setter, who then allocates different coloured pegs signifying right letter/wrong spot or right letter/right spot.

Points are rewarded for the length of guesses needed to discover the word. I guess the one who is first to a pre-set agreed total, wins.

name: L'écologie sur un plateau magnétique
description:
Four gameboards together in one book with magnetic pawns. All four games have an environmental friendly theme.
Playing and learning at the same time.

The first game is for 1 or 2 players and the goal is to be the first to complete a family of polluters. The game board is full of what not to do.

The second game is for 1 to 4 players. It is like a game of goose, but the theme is safe our planet and learns us how.

The third game is again for 1 to 4 players and takes the players on vacation. It teaches how to have a good time on holiday and still respect nature.

The last game board is for 1 to 4 players and has endangered species as theme. Players move horizontally and vertically over the board and try to reach the end stone.

name: Les Pirates sur un plateau magnétique
description:
Four game boards together in one book. All with a pirate theme. With each game you discover more about the pirate life.

The book is magnetique and the pawns are magnets representing pirates. Spin the wheel inside the book and try to be the best pirate!
The first plateau "Galleon Pirate" will get you familiar with the names of all parts of a ship. On the second "A collision" you get to know the regions flagship piracy seventeenth century. The third" At your orders captain!"you discover the daily life of a pirate apprentice under the command of a ship captain very authoritarian. And the fourth "Under the Black Flag" is a board game to continue the life of a pirate.

A book of games! Very practical, very handy that you can take anywhere and particularly on the road!

name: Princesses sur un plateau magnétique
description:
Four games together in one book with magnetic pawns and a spinning wheel. All games have a princess theme.

Games to learn the different dresses of a princes and their queens through the ages, know "skirts baskets", "closed body", "candlesticks" and many other clothing, discover a masquerade costumes and step into the shoes of Marie Antoinette.

The first plate "The Elegant" will get you familiar with the differences dress of princes and princesses through 6 different epochs.
The second "Frou Frou" will identify the clothes strewn of 4 different princesses to learn the layers of clothes and shoes at the time of Marie Antoinette.
The third is "Masquerade" at the court of King Louis XV. It will expose the guests dressed as Columbine, Harlequin, Pierrot. Who will get to the buffet first where her prince awaits.
On the fourth plateau "Long live the queen!" Marie Antoinette is going to marry Louis XVI. Preparations for a royal wedding on a game board.

name: Les chevaliers sur un plateau magnétique
description:
Four games together in one magnetique book with magnets as pawns and a spinning wheel as die.

You dream of tournaments and attack castles? Play with this book and delve into the world of proud medieval knights!
In the first game you will discover all about the equipment of the knight who is preparing to battle: the various parts that make up his armor, his weapons, the horse's harness.
The second game takes you to storm a fortress to rescue his lord and discover the architecture of a castle.
In the third and fourth game you'll find yourself immersed in the thick of the fight, and to awaken the slumbering knight in you, you must be brave and respect the honor code of chivalry.

name: En voyage sur un plateau magnétique
description:
Four games together in one book with magnetique pawns and a spinning wheel as die.
Easy to take along on vacation, at home or while driving, to pass the time while you're doing the riveting world tour.

In one game you discover the world and it's different continents.
In another game you learn the various ways of travelling: By car, train, boat and air plane.
The third game is a race. Who will get to the finish first?
And in the last game you discover what it needs to be a true globetrotter.

name: Cleon
description:
Object of the game is to be the first to get rid of your cards by dressing Cleon, the chameleon

The game consists 48 cards which can be either a head or body, or tail for 16 different chameleons. Each creature will be 2 colors (unique combination), but each of these colors will be found on other chameleons, in different combinations.

Early in the game, the dealer prepares a single chameleon, with elements of the same color, it raises the center of the table. The cards are then shuffled and the dealer deals eight cards to each participant.

In turn, the active player will try play one of his cards to replace a body part of the chameleon in the middle of the table.
- this card must be the same body part as the removed card.
- this card must have a color in common with one of the neighboring cards.

If the active player can't play, he draws one card and passes.

Player who gets rid of his cards first is the winner.

name: Race of the Turtles and Hares
description:
For two players

Object: to get all checkers from one aide of the board in the illustrated squares to the opposite side.

Place 22 red and 22 black checkers on the squares with illustrations on them. Players shake the dice and moves either one or two men diagonally across the board toward the other side. If 1 man is moved add the pips of the dice roll together and move that many squares. If 2 men are moved then move each checker the number of squares showing on each die. Players may jump their own or their opponents men.

Player first reaching the opposite side with all his men wins the game.
Rules from National Games Archives.

name: Das bunte Blumenspiel
description:
A colour recognition and memory game for children.

Game components: 25 cardboard tiles, 4 wooden pawns, 1 colour die

The game is divided into two parts. In the first part, players create the path towards the bee hive by throwing the die and adding a tile with a flower in the matching colour. Once all the tiles have been added, the second part of the game starts. Players now try to get their wooden bee pawn back to the bee hive. The die now dictates which flower is to be visited next. The active player has to memorise the colour sequence up to that particular flower and has to name it with closed eyes. They get to move their pawn up to the last correctly remembered flower. The player whose bee reaches the hive first wins the game.

name: Das WM Quiz 2002
description:
Simple trivia game with questions on the Soccer World Cup 2002.

Components: board, 55 cards with 6 questions per card, 1 die, 6 pawns

How it is played: The die decides which question (number 1-6) on the current card the active player has to answer. 4 possible answers are provided. If the active player chooses the correct answer, he/she moves his/her pawn one space forward. If the answer is wrong, the pawn is moved one space back. 3 times per game each player may use a joker, which means that the player who reads the question reduces the answer options to two. The player who is first to reach the ninth and final space on the board wins the game.

name: Das Deutschland Quiz
description:
Trivia game "60 years German Federal Republic", covering the years 1949-2009.

Components: 110 cards, 36 betting chips, 4 emergency chips, 6 pawns, one number die, 1 board.

Aim of the game: Being the first to reach the final space on the board.

How it is played: Each player gets a pawn and 6 betting chips. Each round, the active player throws the die, draws a question card and reads the question and possible answers corresponding to the roll of the die. The other players choose one of their betting chips (with values 1-3 on the back) and place it on the answer fields (A, B or C). After the active player has read the correct answer, a player who has put his/her chip on the wrong answer loses that chip. Players who bet on the correct answer move their pawn the number of spaces corresponding the value on the chip they bet. Their chips are returned for further use. Then it is the next players turn to read a question.
If nobody chose the correct answer, the active player gets to move his/her pawn according to the number of players in the game. If a player has lost all their betting chips, he/she gets an emergency chip (value 1). Players can earn back chips if they land on a city space (or they may chose to move 1-3 spaces instead: 1 space if he/she is in the lead, 3 if he/she is currently in last position, 2 spaces in all other cases).
The game ends when a player reaches the final space.

name: The Game of Parlor Tennis
description:
This dice game required each player in turn to roll the dice in order to determine if your shot cleared the net and either produced a winner or the ability for your opponent to return the shot


The game came with a fame board, 2 wooden dice and 3 wooden pegs used to show present location of the ball.

name: Yo! Monster Allergy
description:
Yo! Monster Allergy is a card game where players try to outbid each other with the cards they have in their hands.
Players take turns choosing cards from their hand. They play these cards in front of the player to their left and says a number and a color. This player can either accept these cards and play new cards in front of the player that is clockwise next to him, with the only restriction that the number must be higher. Or he can say 'YO!'. When a player shouts YO!, you look at the cards, if the player lied and played a number less than the number he called, the player loses some points. If a player has zero points he is eliminated from the game.

The surviving player wins the game.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ortho
description:
Ortho is a game intended to sensitize players to correct writing. It aims to do this by making spelling entertaining and the more they play the more they learn.

Each player takes a token. Then each player takes a card that has 25 words that are arranged in 3 columns labeled Beginner, Intermediate and Expert. Each player takes turns reading a word for another player to spell. If the word is spelled correctly the player moves a space on the board. The winner is the player who reaches the finish line first.

name: Froggammon
description:
Froggammon is based on the game backgammon and is designed for younger players.

The board consists of modular lily tiles. In the middle there is a large central tile connecting four paths of six lily leaves. Each of the paths is closed by a larger starting area where a player places six pieces of his colour.

The aim of the game is to hop through the water lilies and get all of your frogs to you opponents’ lily pads. On one leaf there can be multiple pawns of the same player. Another player can only put his pawn on a leaf when there is only one pawn of an opponent. In that case the pawn of the opponent has to start over from his starting tile.

The game is stored in a handy storage case with a handle.

name: Dark Eon Assassin
description:
Dark Eon Assassin is an exciting solo science-fiction boardgame, designed to challenge players of all ages as they infiltrate the Tyrant of Acheron’s palace, avoiding the traps and guards he has prepared, in an effort to rid the galaxy of his maniacal atrocities. You will have a range of high technology equipment and weapons to aid you, but the odds are stacked against easy success…

The board forms your inventory and view of the Tyrant's palace, allowing you to quietly stalk its halls and corridors as you track down your prey. While the palace is explored via two decks of cards and will be different in every game, you will be making important choices all the time that will affect your chances of success.

First, you will need to choose which school of assassins you will be trained by; the school of Dark Eon prizes stealth and deception above all else, while the school of Torsten Rex focuses on ranged weapons and one shot-one kill. Finally, the school of Magna Kurr practices ancient Jovian martial arts and can deal punishing blows with almost any part of their bodies.

You will also need to choose from a highly advanced but very limited range of equipment, including Stealth Suits, Ionised Rail Rifles, Psionic Shields, and many others. Finally, you must pit your wits against the defences of the Tyrant's palace, including avoiding or nullifying traps, evading guards, and defeating the mighty Warmaster Battle Engine as you close in on the Tyrant himself!

name: Alice: Adventures in Wonderland
description:
In the game there are 8 Player Characters that form the Player Character Deck. Each turn 2 random characters are discarded and then the players secretly choose the Player Character they will play in the current turn.

Each Player Character has 2 unique abilities. The first ability may be used on any turn, however the second ability may only be used in Chapters that the Player Character appears in the book.

Secondly, we have the Story Decks which are composed of: Characters, Quotations, and Objects from the book. There are Story Decks for all 12 chapters of the book. Each card may be played for its cost in the Chapter it appears in. Character and Object cards have a Story Point value that adds to a Player's score. Quotation cards are used to complete a Chapter, which is accomplished by playing 3 cards in the appropriate Chapter, but have no Story Point value. Completed Chapters double the points scored while incomplete Chapters score only the card's combined Story Point value.

You may have noticed that I mentioned the cost of playing a card. In Alice: Adventures in Wonderland the currency we use is Tarts. One of the actions a player may take on their turn is taking Tarts. The Tarts are used to play Story cards. Player's must carefully balance the number of Tarts they have in their possession, because at the end of the game any Tarts they have will count against their final score. They lose 1 Story Point for every Tart they did not return to the tray.

The game board we use in the game is called the Storyboard. Alice travels along a pathway from one chapter to the next, spending only a few turns in most chapters. When Alice moves into a new chapter, cards that players may have in their hands from a previous chapter may no longer be played.

Along the perimeter of the Storyboard is a Story Point Tracker. At the end of each Chapter, players score the cards they played (doubled if they played 3 cards) and all cards from the Chapter (in their hands, played in front of them, or remaining in the chapter's Story Deck) are removed from the game. There is also a Tart Tracker that represents the current number of Tarts each player has in their possession.

In the game, Alice is not a Player Character. She is not even a character in the Story Deck. In the game she is represented by a token that moves along a pathway through each chapter. She is a basically a timer. When the Alice token reaches the final space, the game is over.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Unlucky Sevens
description:
Unlucky Sevens is an extremely simple and portable game Vegas-style dice game that can be played in a very short amount of time, or over a series of rounds for a longer experience. It can be played stand-alone or as a betting or challenge game for points, rewards, or even drinks. It is simple enough for kids, but with the utility to entertain adults as well.

Players take turns rolling a pair of dice, after each roll taking a Point card corresponding to the roll made. (Even if another player has that card).

When each one of the cards finally belongs to a player, the game ends immediately and players total up their score. But beware, the 7 is Unlucky, and whoever is stuck with it will suffer a negative point penalty!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Set Collection
publishers: G. U. Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Gladius
description:
GLADIUS

Gladius is a 2-4 player card game illustrated by Gonzo Bríos.

In GLADIUS the players take on the role of a lanista. Your goal is to select the best gladiators in your ludus and organize the best fights in the amphitheater. The player that organizes the best fights wins the game.

The players use cards from your hand to steal cards from the board of equal or lesser value. With those cards players create fights between distinct gladiators and place in front of them. The score of the fight is determined by the difference between the values ​​of the gladiators. The player with the highest score in his fights wins the game.

The game components are:
A deck of 52 cards, 48 gladiators cards and 4 christians cards.



=======================GLADIUS

Gladius es un juego de cartas para 2-4 jugadores ilustrado por Gonzo Bríos.

En GLADIUS adoptas el rol de un lanista. Tu objetivo es seleccionar los mejores gladiadores de tu ludus y organizar los mejores combates en el anfiteatro. Aquel lanista que organice los mejores combates ganará el favor del César.

En GLADIUS los jugadores organizan combates utilizando cartas de su mano para robar cartas de la mesa de igual o menor valor. Con esas cartas robadas forman combates de gladiadores distintos que colocan frente a ellos. La puntuación de los combates está determinada por la diferencia entre los valores de los gladiadores que luchan. El jugador que obtenga la mayor puntuación en sus combates gana el juego.

Los componentes del juego son:
Un mazo de 52 cartas, 48 cartas de gladiadores y 4 cartas de cristianos.

name: Manicomios de Arkham
description:
Arkham Madhouse is a card-game for 2-4 players illustrated by Pedro Belushi.

The Arkham asylums have opened their doors and their residents have escaped. They roam the city like lost souls. Your job is to bring them to the place from which they never should have left. Drive your ambulance through the streets of Arkham and find those crazy men.

And if you think this is a lame excuse to honor H. P. Lovecraft... Cthulhu will drive you mad!

On the table there is a map of Arkham formed by ten cards. The players move on the map of Arkham using the action cards. Players collect mad men cards when his pawn stays on a map card that matches the color of mad men card. Mad men cards have different values. At the end of the game the player that gets the highest score using these mad men cards is the winner.


Los manicomios de Arkham han abierto sus puertas y los residentes han escapado. Vagan por la ciudad como almas en pena. Tu trabajo es lograr que vuelvan al lugar del que nunca deberían haber salido. Conduce tu ambulancia por las calles de Akham y devuelve a los perturbados a su manicomio. Y si crees que esto es una burda excusa para homenajear a H. P. Lovecraft, que Cthulhu te arrebate la cordura para siempre.

Sobre la mesa se forma un mapa de Arkham con diez cartas. Los jugadores recorren Arkham moviendo su peón utilizando las cartas de acción. Los jugadores recogen cartas de locos cuando coincide el color de la carta de loco y de la carta de mapa sobre la que está su peón. Las cartas de loco tienen distinta puntuación. Al final del juego aquel que obtenga la máxima puntuación con las cartas de loco es el ganador.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Horror, Novel-based, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Lisa und Rex
description:
This is a simple game designed to teach children the difference between right and left.

The game is played by rolling a die and moving one of two pieces on a board, trying to collect stamps from a stamp pad on a sheet.

There are two shared pieces: Lisa the cat, who always travels to the left (clockwise); and Rex the dog, who always travels to the right (counter-clockwise). There are corresponding stamps for each animal.

There is a circular track on the board with three types of space: dog, cat, and "restless bear." Players roll a die that moves either Lisa or Rex 1 to 3 spaces, being sure to announce which direction they are going ("Lisa is moving to the left.").

If the moving animal lands on its own type of space, the player collects a stamp of that animal on their sheet. Four stamps of any one animal (either Lisa or Rex) wins.

If the animal lands on the opposite animal space, nothing happens.

If the animal lands on a restless bear space, the player may still collect a stamp, but only if they do something with the correct side of the body. For example, if Lisa lands on a bear space, a player might say "Lisa is waving her left paw."

If a player lands on the other animal, they get a stamp from both; if this is on a restless bear space, however, they must first do something with both sides of their body.

name: Das 70er Jahre Quiz
description:
Those were the days! You may well remember clogs or tight hot pants. Then you come up with a playful journey through the decade. You can expect statements about events, Zeitgeist, TV, Celebrities and Stars. For each statement, you get 3 answers. Use your memory and remember the headlines at the time or just type. Become an expert 70s?

Player with the most correct answers wins the game.

name: 80er Jahre Quiz
description:
Quiz of the Decade series from Noris publisher attributes the players in the 80s. Each participant tries to get through right answer as many questions of quiz cards. Who has the most cards at the end in his possession wins the game.

The quiz cards are shuffled and placed in a pile in the middle of the table. There are six categories: 1) History & Politics, 2) literature and film, 3) Sports & Games, 4) Technology & Cars, 5) music and 6) Misc.
The active player rolls the dice and one player takes the bottom card from the pile and reads the corresponding question. Now the player must choose one of four answer choices, because only one of the answers is correct.

name: 60er Jahre Quiz
description:
Quiz of the Decade series from Noris publisher attributes the players in the 60s. Each participant tries to get through right answer as many questions of quiz cards. Who has the most cards at the end in his possession wins the game.

The quiz cards are shuffled and placed in a pile in the middle of the table. There are six categories: 1) History & Politics, 2) literature and film, 3) Sports & Games, 4) Technology & Cars, 5) music and 6) Misc.
The active player rolls the dice and one player takes the bottom card from the pile and reads the corresponding question. Now the player must choose one of four answer choices, because only one of the answers is correct.

description:

The active player rolls the dice and one player takes the bottom card from the pile and reads the corresponding question. Now the player must choose one of four answer choices, because only one of the answers is correct.

description:

name: Fantail Golf
description:
Fantail Golf is a didactic board game,very fun and to play with the family, where participants play simulating the path of the Golf field with 9 or 18 holes. Each participant has his personal card, hole by hole, and enter your information in the General Board Positions.
Golfers in turn, first, throw the four-sided dice to know under what weather conditions play a certain number of holes. These weather conditions that are four: optimal, good, changing and adverse, have influence on the chances of holing the hole in fewer strokes. Then, each golfer rolls the twelve-sided dice to play the hole to be played. According to the number thrown every golfer will place your piece on the Golf field (board) into the fairway, rough, hazard, bunker or the green. These possibilities as well as the tees and the holes are indicated on the Golf field.
The object of the game is to finish the number of holes agreed with the least amount of strokes taken.

name: Das Blondinen-Quiz
description:
The goal of the game is to get the most points by answering questions about blondes

The active player rolls the dice and takes a card from the deck, asking question according die-roll. He can try to explain with words (he can't use words from the answer), or by drawing gestures for other players to get close to the answer.

Player who finds the correct answer, scores 2 points and moves accordingly on the game board. The active player scores 1 point.

The game ends if somebody reaches to finish on the game board.
He is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Trivia

name: Motor Race
description: Motor Race game from Wolverine Supply dated 1910. Players spin a spinner and go around the track. Penalties are listed on spaces on the board. There is even a space for Tire Trouble with its own spinner to tell how many turns you lose while your tires are being fixed. You must finish the game by exact count in order to win.

name: Marbles? USE'em or LOSE'em!
description:
Marbles? merges the exciting aspects of a party game with one-on-one challenges both observed and judged by all other players, the Peanut Gallery. Many of the challenges are reminiscent of familiar games. Others are very unique and designed specifically for the roles of Challenger, Opponent and Peanut Gallery. Marble-like gems are the currency. Players must use their intellectual marbles to win challenges and also strategically pose challenges that are to their greatest advantage. Highly dimensional, there are multiple perspectives of strategy.

Players take turns being the Challenger and can select any player not previously an Opponent in the same round. "Teaser" cards indicate Opponent availability. Opponent cards change the dynamics of the challenge. Peanut Gallery cards permit side wagers, further expanding the dimensions of how the game is played.

All challenges are performed in (2) minutes or less. Challenger cards detail a wide variety of tasks across (7) categories:
1) Consensus - The Peanut Gallery is polled to derive a count that the opponent must accurately predict. Some are factual events like visiting an ATM within the last 24 hours while others are preferences such as: Cat or Dog, Chocolate or Vanilla, Paper or Plastic…
2) Dice - Challenger cards in this category require a specified outcome from the roll of dice. Luck over skill, the tasks vary as defined for each challenge.
3) Domino – To win, the Opponent must also hold a Challenger card in this category having a Domino number that matches one of the two numbers presented by the Challenger.
4) Performance – Opponent must skillfully complete the challenge. Examples include telling a joke that invokes laughter and an impersonation in which the Peanut Gallery must correctly guess.
5) Physical – Another skill category, the Opponent must successfully complete a task involving an activity like Origami (paper folding) or Roshambo (Rock-Paper-Scissors). When the results are subjective, the Peanut Gallery judges the task.
6) Playing Cards – A single hand of a common card game is played, such as Blackjack or Draw Poker. Every Challenger card in this category fully defines the task and specifies the requirements necessary to win.
7) Starter – Cards in this category quickly establish the winner, simply with who holds the highest number.

The objective is simple. Take turns matching a Challenger card in hand with an opponent anticipated least likely to successfully complete the task. Opponents set the wager, either (1) or (2) marbles, upon the Challenger announcing the category. Should the Opponent fail the task, the Challenger wins the wager. Otherwise, the Opponent collects the wager. Number of players determines the number of rounds. At game end after the final showdown (in case of a tie, if necessary), the player with the most marbles reigns supreme.

Not at all the game of marbles everyone played as a child, this version is all grown up but still retains the youthful retro spirit.
"Wanna play Marbles?"

180 Marbles? Cards, 4 Color-Coded Types, 7 Challenger Categories

name: Spar: The Card Game
description:
The game has been updated to version 3! It's a complete revamp and change from version 2 for faster and more strategic gameplay.

A fast paced card game featuring two opponents slugging it out in each other's faces. Very easy to learn, but the strategy lies in reading your opponent and strategizing your own moves. Do you go all out and attack heavily from the start? Or do you lean back and wait for your opponent to strike first?

How to Play
1. Players are dealt 9 cards
2. Players take turns playing a valid card from their hand. A valid card is one that is equal to or higher than the current card in play. If there isn't a card in play, the player may play any card.
3. After the player plays a valid card it is the next player's turn.

How to Win
Discard your entire hand first to win.

Passing / Drawing a Card
If a player is not able to play a card, they must draw a card. The player's turn is now over. A player may also choose to draw a card even if they have a valid card to play.

Block
A player can BLOCK once per game. A BLOCK causes both players to draw a card. The player's turn is now over.

Shadow Fist / Playing Pairs
A player may start to play pairs if the pair they wish to play is the same as the current card in play. Subsequent plays must be pairs until a player passes, blocks, or wins.

The 1 Card
The 1 card may be played after the 10 card.

name: Laikz Biznesam
description:
Business hours in English allows the player to get into the business manager role, reflecting the business processes.

The object of the game is to be the first player to get the most traditional customer base, or the highest market share.

In his turn player can generete experience of his company by searching customers or buy and sale products.
When they have loyal customer, when products are offered for sale, they can make even the highest prices.
Two players can at any time join forces in order to reduce market competition and displace opponents. In this case, players combine business with all their resources: both players money, privileges, raw materials and traditional customer base, but the experience can not be combined.

name: Los Charros Contrabandistas, Juego de Dados
description:
This was a really old 'Roll and Move' boardgame, the estimated date of publication is somewhere between 1890 and 1913.

The original print is kept at the Library of Congress Prints and Photographs Division Washington, D.C.

name: Perfect Word: A Word Dice Game
description:
Unlike other word games, the objective of Perfect Word is to derive the single word that best matches (4) types of criteria. Roll (12) dice, draw one Perfect Word card and start the 2-minute timer. Use as many point letters as possible, including non-point letters as needed. Perfect Word cards permit one helpful exception, such as unlimited license to use the letter "P".

Word games are more fun when there is a challenging twist. The longest words are not necessarily the Perfect Word. One point is deducted for every syllable. If the required letters are available, "squirreled" is a Perfect Word. It contains (10) letters but only has (1) syllable.

name: Mini-Wissens-Quiz für Kinder
description:
In his turn player rolls dice and a card is drawn where the question is asked according to dice-roll. If the answer is correct the player advances his pawn one step further.
there are also some colored barriers on the game board what need only the correct answers otherwise the pawns moves back one step.

The player who finishes first on the board is the winner.

name: Aita Aidata
description:
Help to help in English.
Players are volunteers who try to help and support people who need clothes, food, medicine, work or money.
In his turn player roll the dice and move up to 4 volunteers of his team on the game board to search sponsors and needed resources. If then player is able to support one or more people/organizations he scores a point for every such act.

Player who have the most points by supporting at the end of the game is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Armis
description:
Armis is a two player high-strategy board game, your objective is to capture the opponent's flag. Success is achieved by planning, implementing, and assessing various strategies and tactics given specific rules, resources, and environments.

Armis rules are detailed in the Player’s Handbook; the game has three environments: land, air, and sea; and the 17 resources are: Flag, President, Vice President, Army, Aircraft Carrier, Submarine, Jet, Helicopter, Marines, Coast Guard, Reserve, Diplomat, Religion, Child, Mover, Media, and Nuke.

Given the above, players instinctively and continuously formulate offensive and defensive situations until a winner emerges.

Armis is great exercise for the mind, and the brain.

name: Das Quiz des Jahres 2003
description:
Trivia game about events of this year. Several variants can be played.
There are 5 questions on the card. In his turn player rolls the dice and choose aks the question or if "6" is rolled he chooses question randomly. Who answers correctly gets the card.

Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Das verzauberte Märchenbuch
description:
The player must find the missing pages of the storybook in the enchanted forest again.
In his turn player rolls and moves and looks at the plate next to the target field. If it shows desired fairy tale, You get the card and a new card is revealed. If all the fairy tales have found, the player with the most cards wins.

name: Spotto
description:
Promotional game from BP, so naturally it is a game to play in a car. Each player gets a sheet of things to look out for and the one who has seen the most during the journey, wins.

On the reverse of the player sheets there are some picture puzzles, a maze and, bizarrely, a guide to giving mouth-to-mouth resuscitation.

name: Game of Naval War
description:
Two opposing fleets of 5 ships each, one fleet being blue and the other red vie to see which fleet can capture all the ships of the other.
A die roll determines which fleet begins in Cadiz and which fleet begins in the Tortugas.
Players use a spinner to determine how far to move. That movement can be in any direction over GOLD roads or over the roads of his/her color. The winner is the player having any ships left, after all of the ships of the enemy have been captured.
Gold roads can be used by any player. Red cannot use Blue roads and vice versa. Any ship that arrives at the enemy headquarters captures all of the ships there. If there are no ships there the player gets back one of his own ships or the first ship subsequently captured afterwards. That ship begins again in his home area. To capture a ship it must be landed on by exact count. There are mines that might be landed on. These destroy ships which are permanently removed from the game

From NY Historical Museum:
"The Game of Naval War" paper covered cardboard box top with a chromolithographed image of a naval battle with a gun deck in the foreground with crew members dying and ships in the background sinking and burning and two American ships coming to the rescue; cover inscribed, "THE/ GAME/ OF/ NAVAL WAR/ COPYRIGHT 1898/ McLOUGHLIN BROS/ NEW YORK/ COPYRIGHT 1898 BY F. D. MAHER."

Overall: 13 x 21 1/2 in. ( 33 x 54.6 cm )

name: Game of Discovering the North Pole
description:
This McLoughlin Brothers game comes from 1909.

The Object of the game is to see which player can first reach the North Pole and get home safely.

Each player using his/her colored marker must use that colored space indicator and must obey any directions on places he lands on.

Eventually players will reach a gold spot where all colored roads meet, this does not have to be by exact count. Once reaching that space players may use squares for the remainder of their attempt once again following any directions with an objective of landing on the square marked "North Pole"

Once there, any route can be used to return. If you land on another player piece that piece must be moved back 3 spaces or if that space is occupied to the next available vacant space.

name: Deception
description: A card game played with a standard 52-card deck and a mat that outline potential card plays. Players take turns placing cards out on the display mat, scoring melds of 3 cards as they do. On a single card play, it's possible to play two melds, with face cards acting as multipliers.

name: Happy Party Game: Boat Race
description:
Unusual word game. Each guest is given a sheet of twelve statements about words. Half will get an Oxford sheet, the other half a Cambridge sheet.

The Oxford sheet answers are all words using the letters in the word 'Oxford'. The Cambridge sheet answers are all words using the letters in the word 'Cambridge'.

After time runs out, the guest with the most right answers, wins.

name: Travelling To?
description: Party game. 16 cards are placed around the room where they can all be seen by the guests. Each card has a rhyming clue to a place. Guests taking part write down their answers and the one with the most correct when the host calls "Time", wins.

name: Pot-in-Egg
description:
"A Rollicking Game of Skill" proclaims the box. And it must have been very skilful, perhaps too skilful.

The game includes 6 wooden egg cups which are placed in the centre of the table. The players have a catapult device with which they lob the egg shaped pieces into an egg cup. At least, that is what they intend to do but it must have been devilishly difficult. The most successful player wins, but I suspect the only player to get it right wins automatically.

name: Apparatus
description:
World-renowned genius (and eccentric) inventor Klaus von Essen has completed his latest creation, the "Apparatus". The world wants to know what it does. His peers want to know how it works. His wife wants to know what it did with him.

In Apparatus, players race to recruit Researcher teams to invent the Contraptions that will help fund the recreation of the Apparatus. Of course building the first Apparatus is important, but not as important as exploiting it for financial gain. As the research teams are recruited, each Contraption is endowed with ever-increasing grants, and a player wins only if he collects the most Electros (the currency in the game)!

In the first part of the game, players use grants that provide income every turn to recruit Researchers of various Professions. Some of these Researchers are in high demand and a bidding war between players can break out. As the player's spend their Electros on Researchers, various Contraptions that comprise The Apparatus will gain value in the second part of the game. Once all the Researchers are acquired by the players, the game moves on to the second phase.

In the second phase of the game, players use recruited Researchers to compete to be the first ones to discover the various Contraptions that will help fund the creation of the Apparatus. Each Contraption requires certain types of teams of Researchers. Players compare values of the various teams to determine the winner and second place teams. The winner has a choice of gaining Electros, which is used to determine who wins, or gaining research notes, which determines who builds the Apparatus first. As the Contraptions are decided, the required teams become more and more difficult to build.

The game ends with the building of the Apparatus, which has a large reward for the first place team. Players then count up their Electros, and the player with the most wins the game!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Das Pferde Quiz
description:
There are questions about horses, the breeds, husbandry and care, training of horse and rider about the equestrian sport. Question and 3 answer choices on each card.
Answer correctly and move Your pawn on the game board.
Who finishes first is the winner.

name: Das Katzen Quiz
description:
There are questions about cats, the breeds, husbandry and care, cat diseases etc. Question and 3 answer choices on each card.
Answer correctly and move Your pawn on the game board.
Who finishes first is the winner.

name: Das DDR Quiz
description:
62 multiple questions about the categories of art and media, Peaceful Revolution, everyday life and leisure, politics, history etc. about former East-Germany

In player's turn his left neighbor reads aloud a question.
If the answer is correct he receives one point and answers another question. Otherwise, the next player has a turn. The winner is whoever has accumulated the most points at the end of the game.

description: Simple trivia game with questions related to the German city of Braunschweig. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each. Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

description:

One by one, in a clockwise direction the players draws a card and represent the animal on the card. All other players try to guess which animal is meant.

Whoever scores the biggest amount of points by both acting and guessing animals, wins the game
