name: Das Bayern Quiz
description:
Trivia card game about German region of Bavaria. There are questions about culture and media, politics and current affairs, business and science, history, life and leisure, and geography.

In player' turn his left neighbor reads aloud a question.
If he answer correclty he receives one point and must answer another question. Otherwise, the next player has a turn. The winner is whoever has accumulated the most points at the end.

name: Das Deutschland Quiz
description:
Trivia game about Germany. Questions about culture, economics, history and politics.

In player's turn his left neighbor reads aloud a question.
If he answer correctly he receives one point and must answer another question. Otherwise, the next player has a turn. The winner is whoever has accumulated the most points at the end.

name: Das Heimat Quiz
description:
Trivia game about Germany.

In player's turn his left neighbor reads aloud a question.
If he answer corretly he receives one point and must answer another question. Otherwise, the next player has a turn. The winner is whoever has accumulated the most points at the end.

name: Das Europa Quiz
description:
Trivia game about Europe. 62 multiple questions about geography, politics, culture, history, institutions, and records.

In player's turn his left neighbor reads aloud a question.
If he answer corretly he receives one point and must answer another question. Otherwise, the next player has a turn. The winner is whoever has accumulated the most points at the end.

name: Imps Vs Puppies: Crate of Carnage Edition
description:
This set collects the base, as well as the first two expansions to Imps Vs Puppies.

The main version of Imps Vs Puppies is a simple trick taking game in which each player sends an Imp from their team to smash a crate. If the Imp is sent face up, they all have unique abilities which will alter the course of the round but if an Imp is sent face down, the only thing that matters is the strength. The winner of the round smashes the crate which may contain a puppy but on occassion, it could be a bomb or even a Ninja Kitten. The general strategy is to put as many cards as possible in your score pile.

With the first expansion, Hissy Fits, more advanced Imps were added to the game as well as Imp drafts and even team play. The second expansion added more Imps as well as Hidden Agendas, new cards you can attach to Imps when playing them face down.

The second expansion, Hidden Agendas, launched with this set.

name: Career Challenge
description:
Career Challenge® is a board game specifically designed to help students explore careers that may be good matches for their talents, interests, and work preferences. Players learn important facts about many careers and are encouraged to explore careers about which they previously had no knowledge or interest. The play of the game is a lot like a quiz show. Players answer questions to progress, and they receive checks as rewards. There are four decks of cards that the players use to learn about careers. The game comes with two sets of cards in each color. One set is designed for third and fourth graders, and the more difficult cards are designed for fifth and sixth graders. The four kinds of cards are as follows: 1. The Education and Skills cards help players learn about the importance of formal education and specific skills for various careers. 2. The What’s It Like? cards teach players about what it’s like to work in various careers. 3. The Good Career cards challenge players to match careers with interests and talents. 4. When a player picks a Guess My Career card, the player tries to get other players to guess the career by verbal descriptions and/or acting out the career.

Players also learn the importance of a college education for entering many careers, as well as beginning to think about job preferences, such as whether they want to work mainly on their own or with others. During the post-game discussion, players begin to focus on major industry groups and even individual careers.

name: Pop-Over Soldiers
description: Target game that uses a gun made of cast-metal. The targets are Scottish soldiers in their kilts. Most successful hits wins when the game ends.

name: Funny Family
description:
A card-laying game with verbs based on the well-known Mau-Mau game. A card can be played when it shows either the same person with another activity as on the face-up card or another person with the same activity.

The first player who can put all their cards down wins the game.

name: Virxle Crackdown
description:
Dastardly Virxles have invaded the mainframe and are running amuck. You, as a system administrator, must load your program into a detonation node and set off chain reactions, scoring points for how many you get. The chaining system can lead to massive scores and ultimate victory.

At the beginning of the game, players select which Virxle (color) they are going after and set up an initial board. Then, on their turn, they can play a card (Special Program or Circuit Card), load a program (placing a token on a detonation node), or run a program (setting off the program and scoring Virxles in your path). Circuit Cards contain Virxles and detonation points, which players put down, building the board as they play. When running a program, the detonation node has a set distance (in one of the cardinal directions) the explosion travels. If it can reach another detonation point, a chain begins and can continue for up to 9 detonations points. Bonus points are scored for longer chains.

More advanced rules variants introduce Virxles the player must avoid as they become negative points.

name: Limbo: the health care game
description:
An educational game designed to demonstrate how health care costs work in the U.S. health care system.

Players roll and move around a circular track, paying and receiving money as directed on the squares they land on, or on "Cost" cards drawn when they land on a "Cost" square.
Each player has a varying Salary, which determines how much money they receive when they land on Collect Your Income squares; and a varying Insurance Status (Uninsured, Underinsured or Insured), which affects how much they have to pay on "Cost" squares.

When a player runs out of money they are in "Limbo" and take no further part in the game. The last player surviving outside "Limbo" is the winner.

name: Synthesis
description:
A deck of cards each of which bears either three English prefixes (such as "CON- PRE- EX-"), three English suffixes, or one English root word to which prefixes and suffixes can be added. There are also five special "prize" cards which bear one suffix each ("-ANT", "-IBLE", "-EE", "-OR" and "-FUL").

Rules for five different games to be played with the cards ("Mode I" through "Mode V") are included.

In "Mode I", the game described at greatest length, each player begins with four cards in hand, and four cards begin face up on the table. Players on their turns must combine one card from hand with one or more face-up cards from the table, to form a word. They may also steal a word from a previous player if they can add a card to make a new word. If they cannot do either of those, they must instead contribute a card from their hand to the table.
Players score points for making words of four syllables or more, for making words using "prize" cards, or for using the last card from the table.

name: FUBAR: Assault on Penzar Island
description:
Three years in the making, FUBAR: Assault on Penzar Island is an amalgamation of strategy game fused with contemporary popular cultural myths and a whole lot of chaos thrown into the mix. Up to six different factions face off to control the last remaining land mass on Earth in the very distant (or not so distant) future.

The scenario and subsequent conflict begins with an alien abduction through the fabric of time and space which is unexpectedly thwarted by a glitch, landing the warring factions on a remote island in the middle of nowhere. The factions begin in their respective base hub on the outskirts of the island. Quickly, they must build their ranks and establish their perimeters to begin the conquest of their adversaries. Their goal is to acquire the Mojos of their opponents and secure more territories on the island. Factions not only have their own set of specific cards to aid them in their conquest, they also have a random faction force that enables them to have a unique edge over their foes. To complicate matters and add an element familiar to any survivalist, there is a good chance that chaos will enter the fray. From radiation leaks, mad cow outbreaks, and teleportation malfunctions to volcano eruptions or the periodic tsunami, the unpredictable chaos events (a dreaded favorite) will force players to adjust their strategies as the game progresses.

The victory goes to the first player that successfully absconds with an enemy’s Mojo and safely returns it to their own hub…. but the game could go on as there are chaos events that could shift the game objective at any time. In addition, there are 4 other game variations with different objectives that players can choose from to make for a variety of gaming experiences with the same set. There is a planned expansion/variation called Covert Ops being developed as well.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Footchess
description:
Footchess is a board game that simulates a soccer match. In order to win it you will need vision, strategy and some luck.

10 players divided in two teams move around a chess-like board, looking for open passing lines and a chance to score goals.

Each player starts is turn by rolling the dice in order to know is action points. Then he can spend his actions points passing the ball, moving players, intercepting the ball from the opponent or shooting the ball on goal. When the player uses all his action points the turn is over and the player picks a card from the deck. Some cards improve player skills, others are not so good and players can even be injured or kicked out of the game.
The game ends when all 40 cards have been picked.
In case of a draw the game continues until one of the teams score the winning goal.

name: The 50's: A Game for Your Generation
description:
The 50's
a game of your generation

This is a Monopoly clone from Late from the Sky, a publisher that specializes in themed Monopoly games. In The 50's game, Blocks of Time and Decades replace houses and hotels, Big Fun! and Contingency replace Chance and Community Chest cards, and all the properties and spaces on the board are 1950's themed. The tokens are a guitar, a 50's car, a jukebox, a male figure modeled on Elvis Presley, a shoe (blue suede?) and a pair of cat-eye glasses. As in all versions of monopoly, the last player left in the game wins.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Méli Mélo des Animaux
description:
42 cards represents one third of an animal: head, body or
legs - 14 animals in total.

In his turn player plays sets of animals with the symbol at the top of the card or invent imaginary creatures.

The winner is the one who put together the most animals.

Rules to the Dagobert Edition in French, English and German. Rules to the France Cartes edition in English, French and Spanish.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor

name: French Toast And Friends Fun Food Matching Game
description:
Can you help French Toast make the most pairs in this whimsical matching game for preschool-aged children? Featuring fun food and characters from the French Toast and Friends world!

Players match the most pairs by flipping over tile cards to win. If you don't make a match, tell everyone which turned tile card is your favorite, and why. Once all the tile cards have been matched, the player with the most matches wins.

Includes rules for the bonus Friends vs. Food Game. Players flip the cards over one at a time. Friends beats food! If you flip a friend tile card and you opponent flips a food, take both tile cards. Player with the most tile cards at the end wins!

Components:
50 Matching tile cards
2 Bonus sticker sheets

name: The Game of Travelling
description:
This is a spin and move game by J. W. Spear & Sons.
Each player has a piece that is used to make your way around the board. The inside box cover which has the rules for the game calls the game "A trip on the continent". By rolling dice players land on different spaces that cause either good or bad things to happen. Spot 13 says " after hurrying to the wrong station you lose a turn". Spot 25 says "sees the sights and lose a turn". #40 says "on the right road, advance to space 46". Many other things can happen while on your trip.

The object is to get to the finish line (#75) first.

The game was manufactured at the SPEAR WORKS in Bavaria

name: Austin in-a-box
description: This is a Monopoly clone from Late from the Sky, a publisher that specializes in themed Monopoly games. All the deeds, spaces on the board and cards feature locations and landmarks from Austin.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Buffalo-opoly
description: This is a Monopoly clone from Late from the Sky, a publisher that specializes in themed Monopoly games. All the deeds, spaces on the board and cards feature locations and landmarks from Buffalo.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Patent Pending
description: Patent Pending is card game for three to five players that simulates patent prosecution (i.e., the process by which one obtains a patent). On a player’s turn, the player plays one of their cards as a pending patent application that will be worth points if the application survives examination and issues as a patent. The remaining players act as the patent office by (a) playing a card from their hand as prior art against the pending patent application, (b) playing a card as an event to influence the play flow, or (c) passing. If the pending application survives the examination by the opposing players, then the patent application issues to the activate player. If the patent application is rejected, all the cards played are discarded. At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins.

name: Rise of Rebels
description:
Rise of Rebels is a 2 player territory control wargame. Players deploy units, research tech and battle for control cities in an effort to achieve their secret objectives. Each round players choose three action cards which constrains the actions they may take during the round.

When a player has acquired the requisite number of Victory Points by claiming successfully completed objective cards they win.

Included with the game is the Rise of Rebels: Legacy variant. The Legacy variant takes two players through a campaign that details the story of the rival factions represented in the game (the rival Rebel organizations) as they battle for control of the space station. This variant involves making permanent modifications to the game bard and faction components based on the outcome of each battle.
categories: Print & Play, Science Fiction, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Caza-Tesoros
description:
Treasure-Hunters

On this occasion I propose to players searching for sunken treasure, in what once were large ships at some point in history, and for some reason or another, suffered from the punishment of the sea, until the scourge of pirates, buccaneers and privateers but today, we rescued who were sleeping sleep for centuries.

For this game we put ourselves in the skin of modern rescuers sunken treasure, and by a simple board that will help us through all the seas and oceans, trying to salvage the wreck treasures included.

To move around the board, we will have several boats that will be used to navigate until you get to the coordinates indicated and initiate searches galleons, wrecks, ships and all kinds of boats that sailed these waters for centuries.

If we can find the part, the spoils can be of incalculable amount and report if found some interesting benefits.

In terms of mechanical and manufacturing included two forms of the game printed on one side is the most expensive and luxurious yet what material is concerned, and the other which I find very interesting and can serve to make the game a minimum cost.

This can be manufactured in a single letter large amount of material needed and sheets of different colors and Parcheesi board game have almost ready to play.

When treasure hunting system also devote special care to prove a simple, effective but not without emotion that surrounds so that any discovery.

name: CIA: Cyber Ops
description:
Cia: Cyber Ops is a collectible card game played between two or more players each of whom are computer programmers trying to program their three Computers before their opponents. Using cards like Operations, Programs, Viruses, Firewalls, and Special Agents each player tries to program their Computers, thwart their opponent’s attempts to do the same and protect against devastating and underhanded attacks.

CIA: Cyber Ops is marketed primarily towards Christian home school students in Michigan as a way of providing an alternative to Magic: The Gathering, while encouraging academic development in math skills.

The game can be purchased in main sets and boosters. The game is currently in it's fourth series of main sets.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Educational, Math

name: Dogfight: Free Trial Version
description:
From the game description:

Take to the Skies!

Fly a patrol over the trenches and tangle with enemy planes in this set collection card game! Conserve your ammo as you jockey for position, attempting to line up the perfect shot. Choose from 24 different historic aircraft, each with different performance attributes which suffer as the plane takes damage. You may wind up an ace, or go down in flames!





Dogfight is a World War I aerial combat flavored set collection card game in which players strive to collect then play sets of cards to line up a chance to damage their opponents.

The game features set collection, card drafting, and variable player powers.

Throughout the game, players manage their altitude and speed while trying to collect the cards necessary to attack each other.

Damage is recorded, not as hit points, but as degradation to the plane's unique performance attributes. Such damage could eventually cause the plane to be forced down, start on fire, go into an uncontrolled spin, or break up in midair. It is also possible to hit the opposing pilot with a machine gun bullet, killing him instantly.

It's dangerous up there, and Dogfight is not for the faint of heart!
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, World War I
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Sudoku Taisen: Ice Age
description:
Ice Age is a Sudoku of people interaction and strategy.

Ice Age is a 30 minute one to four player Sudoku game. The goal of the game is to complete a 4x5 Sudoku puzzle or a 5x5 puzzle in a single player game. In each round, players roll four dice simultaneously, and begin with the starting player, each player takes one action per turn to place, remove, or replace a number base on the number rolled. Player may also use other's dice, except number 6, the joker. When all dice are used or players passed, a round ends.

When a row of 1 to 5 is completed, player receives victor point based on the time of completion. When a player finishes the puzzle or 7th round ends, game ends, and the player with highest score wins the game.

name: Challenge of Monthu
description:
An abstract strategy game for 2 players. It is played using a wooden board, marked into 64 squares, and 12 'ancient' looking coins, 6 silver and 6 gold. Five of each set of coins show a Wheel on one side and a Foot on the other, and the sixth coin has a Flag on both sides. There is also a small metal die.

Each player begins the game with his 6 pieces positioned on opposite corners of the board. On the throw of the die a player may move up to 3 pieces corresponding to the number shown. A Flag, a Wheel and a Foot move differently on the board. If a Foot stops on the centre square it is turned over to become a Wheel. Specific movement rules come into play when a confrontation occurs. For example, a Foot piece must be removed from the game if it is confronted by two opposing Foot pieces.

The game may be won in 3 ways:
a) by surrounding your opponent's Flag with any 3 pieces;
b) by removing all of your opponent's pieces from the game; or
c) by capturing your opponent's undefended Flag with your Foot.

The components are good quality - 'ancient' playing pieces, a burgundy and gold wooden board, a velvet draw-string bag for the coins.

Designed and produced in Australia. This is obviously a quality, small production but unfortunately the rules aren't available anywhere on the internet and the publisher's website no longer exists.

name: Goofy Finds His Marbles
description: This is a very simple game for kids 4 to 8. You simply spin the spinner and move your marble from the start line to the finish. If your spin causes you to land on another players marble you simply stop one space short of where your opponents marble is.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Octopunk
description:
Octopunk is a tile placement exploration game set in the near future, transgenic octopi have been tasked with building a human habitat on Europa's deep ocean floor. Players pick one of five different uplifted octopi and search 36 exploration tiles looking for the resources to build the dome while dodging the very dangerous dragon jellyfish. the humans will arrive in only four years and if the mission is not complete everyone loses. The Game consists of twenty five eight sided Ocean Floor zones in the spaces between the octagonal zones square exploration tiles are placed face down, they may contain either resources or hazards for the players to discover.
If the players have completed building the human habitat and surrounded it with four defense turrets (before the humans arrive) then points are scored by resources collected, structures built, and hazards defeated.
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Dogs of War: Legends of the Crushed Planes
description:
Dogs of War is a wargame using 22mm miniatures to form together into squads that take to the battlefield and wage war on each other. The game has a rich history and setting with unique races and models. During each round of play, a player can move his or her squads, strike and shoot at enemy squads and even cast magic designed to help you and hinder allies. Various scenarios exist in the game that will define goals for the game, time limits and other details. There is even, in development, a campaign set of rules that will be designed directly into the core set of rules. Each race has it's own set of special rules and squad lists with attributed points values to make the game a "fair fight."

Play as one of several races for dominion and survival in the crushed planes. Play as the Ng'Awuthii, otherwise known as the Ng to foreign races, an advanced race of humanoids who possess technology far surpassing the technology of all other races combined. Or play as the talwart Tuskers, tribes of wise and savage nobility who use their heavy weaponry, tough skin and rending tusks to demolish their foes. Play as these, or several other races including the beautiful Eduran people who wield powerful magic and fight with inhuman grace, or the infamous Nameless, insect kin who travel above-ground in a pupal state which appear kin to dwarves of mythology or even the Kingdoms of Man.

name: Star Confrontations: Republic Army
description:
From the Introduction:

The Republic Army army book requires the Star Confrontation rulebook in order to play. This army book expands the base game by adding one additional army for players to select and use in play. Each army has its own special abilities that will make every game unique.

The Republic Army have highly skilled soldiers commanded by psionic soldiers known as Masters. When these forces work together they become a deadly fighting force that is near impossible to stop!
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Kansas City in-a-box
description:
This is a Monopoly clone from Late from the Sky, a publisher that specializes in themed Monopoly games. All the deeds, spaces on the board and cards feature locations and landmarks from Kansas City.

Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. When a player collects all the properties in one color group, the properties can be improved by first building skylines, and then upgrading to keys to the city. When players land on a space owned by another player they must pay rent. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

description:

description:

Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Playtime Game
description: From the rules: This is a most interesting and instructive game. As many children can play as there are individual playing cards. Give each player a card and place all the filler pieces in the center of the table face down. The object of the game is to complete cards correctly. Players draw from the face down fillers and try to complete a figure. If he/she does so the player draws another filler card and tries to add it properly. He continues to pick fillers until he draws a filler card that does not belong on his card. When that happens he/she returns the filler card face down into the center. After having mixed it with the rest of the remaining filler cards play continues in turn until someone completes their card and wins the game,

name: Knock Knock Who's There?
description:
Contents:
104 cards (4 sets of 26 cards)
rules

Includes rules for three separate games.

Game #1: The "Grab it quick" game
The Knock Knock cards are shuffled and placed in a draw pile, while the Who's There cards are placed face up on the table. A player says "Knock Knock", the other players respond, "Who's there?" and then all players race to find the correct card from those face up on the table. The person who grabs it first keeps both cards, and the person with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

Game #2: Advanced grab it
Same as Game #1, except the Who's There cards are placed face down, adding a memory element.

Game #3: The "Remember Where" game
Instead of a draw pile, each player is dealt 4 Knock Knock cards, and on their turn must match a Knock Knock card to the Who's There cards which are face down on the table. If a player makes a match, they keep the cards and get a second turn. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

name: Game of Fire Department
description: Game consist of 4 pieces representing fire department apparatus and a spining dial. The movment of the various pieces of apparatur to the location of the fire is beset with many obstacles such as traffic jams, open drawbridges over which they must pass, railroad crossing with gates down, detours, engine and tire troubles and collisions which must be overcome. The oject of the game is to see which player best moves his piece of apparatus to the location of the fire, go into action, limber up his piece, put out the fire and then return to his fire house returning to their station by exact count on the spinner,

name: Der Wilde Wissens-Trumpf
description:
Mix between Trivia game and Top Trumps

The 32 trump cards are mixed. Each player receives 16 cards in front of them. The target goal is set in the middle of the table.
The first player draws his top card and choose one of the four category, reads it and its value. The enemy reads value of same category. The higher value wins. The losing player ask the question from the card. Winner of the duel can answer the question and wins if he answer correctly. Otherwise he loses to opponent.
Some cards are with word "target goal", then the duel winner may shoot the goal.
After 16 duels the player who now has fewer cards takes "the end of the game" card and puts it behind his stack of cards.
Duels continues until this card.
The winner is the player who has more trump cards in his hand.

name: Paperclip Railways: Boardgame Guru
description:
Promo station card for Paperclip Railways. The base game has three 'placeholder' station cards that can be cashed in for a promo of choice 'from the box'.

This Promo card was given to customers of Boardgameguru, a UK board game store
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building, Trains
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Il Gioco Maxi dell'Italia
description:
Players first assemble the large jigsaw puzzle game board then roll and move to take a tour of Italy.

Each turn, players roll a die and advance along a marked route from the starting point at Rome. Landing on a red spot ends the turn; landing on a green spot allows the player to advance two extra cities; landing on a yellow spot causes a player to go back one city.

The winner is the first player to complete the entire tour route and return to Rome by exact die roll.

name: French Bulldog opoly
description:
This is a Monopoly clone from Late from the Sky, a publisher that specializes in themed Monopoly games. All the deeds, spaces on the board and cards feature the French Bulldog.

Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. When a player collects all the properties in one color group, the properties can be improved by building. When players land on a space owned by another player they must pay rent. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Jack Russell-opoly
description:
This is a Monopoly clone from Late from the Sky, a publisher that specializes in themed Monopoly games. All the deeds, spaces on the board and cards feature the Jack Russell terrier dog.

Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. When a player collects all the properties in one color group, the properties can be improved by building. When players land on a space owned by another player they must pay rent. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Snowman opoly
description:
This is a Monopoly clone from Late from the Sky, a publisher that specializes in themed Monopoly games. All the deeds, spaces on the board and cards feature snowman humor or helpful hits for building snow creations.

Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. When a player collects all the properties in one color group, the properties can be improved by building. When players land on a space owned by another player they must pay rent. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Noun Bite
description:
It is a new card game that 2 or more people compete to spell most number of words using the most number of cards. It is unique that anyone can capture ('Bite') others' words by creating new ones from the spelled ones at any time, which makes the game fast pace and fun.

The person who has the most vocabulary may not necessarily win because smart use of special cards can turn the tide very quickly.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game

name: Monogamy: An Intimate Kit of Sensual Essentials
description: Expansion for Monogamy including 25 additional game cards and various accessories including a bullet, ties, spanker, feather.

name: Alchemist's Quest
description: Alchemist's Quest is a game about alchemists (players) competing to create compounds that will help them achieve one or all of the three great goals in life: Health, Wealth, and Power. Each player takes turn gathering elements (Rolling Dice) to create higher and higher order compounds (Buying table cards). Some of the cards have effects such as making a player an Apprentice (Giving the player an extra die to roll). Gathering elements is not without risk, however, as rolling the element death can cause negative consequences (such as losing a turn).

name: Yiora
description:
You are an Overlord ruling over a small army of devotees. Your destiny is upon you - can you capture your opponent's Throne for yourself, or even better, capture the opposing Overlord? Each player gets nine pieces - Mages, Soldiers, and an Overlord - with which they must destroy or be destroyed!

Players' armies are set up on opposite sides of the circular board, pieces in position to defend the Overlord and the Throne space it sits on. To win the game, you must maneuver your pieces to the other side of the board and either capture your opposing Overlord, or move your Overlord into their throne.

The circular battlefield makes for unusual strategies and challenges even the most experienced strategy gamer!

name: Condors of Sow
description:
It is the year 2592. After countless years of war and struggle, the Defense of United Colonies (DUC) has triumphed against the Galactic Ordered Terrorists (GOT). Humanity now has high hopes for this new Era, as everywhere people attempt to rebuild the devastated worlds of the UC.
But its hopes were dashed to pieces as a new enemy, the Horde, rose through the depths of the planet, Telocto, ravishing its colonists, and breaching evacuation ships, got to new planets. In a matter of a few months, over half of the UC’s planets were infected. The only known way to defeat them is to glass infected planets, destroying any life support that planet has. On the planet known as Sow, a force of seasoned, grizzled veterans, known as the Condors, attempt one last stand, before they are exterminated.

Condors of Sow is a cooperative game for 1-4 players, as they attempt to complete each mission. Using a token and a pencil for each player you will have three actions on your turn: move, attack, pick up an item, revive player, reload, or overkill move.

After players move, The Horde move, by having players mark one dot at the end of a predetermined number lines closest to them.

All this game needs is a player sheet, a map, and a pencil and token per player.

Players have the use of multiple weapons and tactics. You must use cover, or you will die. Fight hard Condors! Humanity’s last hope is you.
categories: Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: All the Answers
description:
The trivia game with all the answers.

All the Answers is an interactive race through 4 challenging trivia categories: Who, What, Where, and Whatever. Be three first to capture all 4 category cards and return to the centre and you're the winner. A unique blend of party game and trivia game, everyone has an opportunity to answer all the questions in
All the Answers.

What makes this trivia game unique is that it asks questions with multiple answers and you have to provide as many of them as you can, your opponents can try if you don't say all of them. It is best with 4-6 players.

name: Rebel Yell!
description:
This is an umpired miniatures wargame with true fog of war and hidden troop values. All combat systems are integrated in the game and have been computer tested. The game may be played at the divisional, corps, or army level depending on how many troops you might have and how much time you have to conclude the battle. Balanced armies may be attained by using the Historical Correction Table, thus offering the chance of a one-sided game.

There are interesting command, morale and terrain effects for each game. Artillery is well catered and very realistic results should be obtained.

Appendices include campaign suggestions.

Detailed, but very fast playing. All you need are the troops, the rules and one kind friend to act as the umpire.

name: Bivary
description:
In his turn player rolls 2 big dice (d32): first dice with letters, second dice with topics. Player tries to form a word in rolled topic what start with letter from the other dice. Then He may advence his game-piece as many squares forward as many letters is in his word. There are many bonus squares with special action on the track when landed (another turn etc.)

Player who finishes first on the track is the winner.

name: Population: 4
description:
POPULATION: 4 is a fast paced Survival-Horror Board RPG with an unique premise: Get it, play it, write your survival story and have it published on the game's site.

THE GAME
The game can be played up to 5 players (1 Zombie Controller and 4 Survivors, that's where "Population: 4" comes from), where the survivors are to get the neccesary items to escape the city while the zombies lurk the districts of the city searching for food. Cooperativism between survivors is essential to escape, although every player is free to choose if they are to cooperate, ignore or betray everybody else.

CITY, GUNS AND SURVIVORS
The city has several locations where different items can be found (eg. You won't find ammunition at the Train Station), so the search strategy must be smart and coordinated. There is a wide variety of guns, just to mention some the classic Crowbar and Chainsaw, to the imperative Shotgun and Sniper Rifle.
Survivors come in 8 classes: Soldier, Policeman (Riot), Fireman, Medic, Athlete, Explorer, Scavenger and Child). The way you use every class' talent and overcome it's weaknesses have real weight on the strategy development and use of items.

STORY AND STRESS
Each match carries an excellent and different story, it is highly recommended for those who get the game to write their stories and send them through the game's website to have them published. The interaction between players is unique and spectacular. The stress, strategy and decisions to make are realistic

name: The Cat's Pajamas Card Game
description:
Be the first player to get rid of all your cards by making pairs to win! To play, you must first learn to speak 'cat'! "Meow" means "No!" and "Meow, Meow" means "Yes!" If a player uses a language other than cat, you must ignore them. You can only speak cat while responding to questions in this game!

Or play the optional rules for a matching game by matching the most pairs by flipping over cards to win.

Contents include:
50 Cat's Pajama's jumbo color and shape cards
2 sticker sheets
Easy to follow rules

name: 5, 2, 3: Gackerei
description:
The object of the game is to roll numbers 1-5 in sets of three to get right colored hen.

In his turn player rolls the 4 dice up to 3 times and may choose or reroll some of the dice. Player must collect three of a kind. The Hen shown on the dice count as a joker and can replace any number. If player succeed to roll f.e. 3 x three he gets a white hen.
Player who collet all 5 hens first is the winner.

There are some other game variant as well in this game to learn numbers and colors.

name: 6 jours de Paris
description:
Cycling through the Paris. Game is similar to Game of Goose.
Players roll the dice, advance their pawns and who finishes first is the winner.
Of course there are some special squares on the track.

name: Over the Top: The Dogs of War
description:
A battle game of feints and bluffs where players vie for control of No Man's Land.

Game play is comprised of selecting from a limited pool of resources, and committing them to action. Players face off knowing only how much has been committed, but not what specifically is sitting before them. When the wave is revealed, they battle and ground is gained or lost.

Currently this game is in production and testing is available on Vassal
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Dr. Playwell's Controlling Your Anger Card Game
description:
From the publisher's website:
Help kids take control of their anger before it takes control of them. This game teaches children how to recognize and change the things that make them angry, how to compromise in situations where there is a conflict, how to talk about their feelings rather than act on them, and how to self-monitor their emotions. The bonus activities in this game help children learn positive ways to handle frustration in their day-to-day lives.

Appropriate responses to the question or activity on the back of the card allow the player to collect cards, and the first player to collect two from each "suit" wins.

This card game is also part of the Dr. Playwell's Amazing Card Games Collection.

name: Jeu du Robert
description:
Word game in grid as Scrabble and other similar games.
In his turn player roll the dice and advance his pawn around the board and places the letters to same row or column he stand and scoring points by forming words.

Player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

name: Kangaroos & Koalas: The Aussie game of ups and downs
description:
There are 4 games and a double-sided playing board. The main game, Kangaroos and Koalas, is a Snakes and Ladders type of roll and move game, where the aim of the game is to reward positive character traits displayed by the kangaroos and to penalise negative character traits displayed by the koalas by moving playing pieces to higher or lower squares. For example, landing on 'Caution' moves a player up to Safety' and landing on 'Selfish' moves a player back to 'Lonely'.

The second game, 'Where's Kolo?' is a search and find game, involving luck as well as colour, number and picture recognition. Players race around the board, trying to find Kolo Koala underneath special gumnut tokens. Finding a "Here's Kolo" token allows a player to collect a piece of a jigsaw puzzle. The first to complete their puzzle is the winner.

Rules for two other games, using the same components, are included in the box.

Components: 1 double-sided game board, 1 die, 6 playing pieces, tokens, 4 jigsaws

name: Fuel: Fast Action Dice
description:
Players identified by a color, place two marker chips on the board. Similar to Craps, there are several types of options with various odds. In addition to single roll options, one section has two levels. Upon successfully winning Level 1, Level 2 (the second marker chip, if placed in Level 2) is activated and increases the potential for an exponentially high payoff on the next dice roll.

Although calibrated for casino-style wagering, the premiere edition is configured for the accumulation of points. All options on the board state the point values. Everyone plays concurrently and independently, utilizing the same dice rolls. Each player lists the points acquired and after (30) minutes of play, the scores are totaled. The player with the highest score wins the game. In the event of a tie, play continues one dice roll at a time until the tie is broken.

Level 1 is the spark that can ignite Level 2 to Fuel an exponential payoff.

name: Lotto spielen mit dem kleinen Bär
description:
The Lotto game has four busy picture boards and the object is for each player to be the first to collect all six picture cards that correspond to his picture board.

To play:
1. Each player takes one of the four picture boards. The 24 cards are shuffled and placed on the table face-down.
2. The first player takes one of the cards, flip it and tries to find the same picture on his board. If he has found the picture, he place the card on one of the six squares around his picture board.
3. If the player don´t find the same picture on his Board, he place the card face-down again.
4. The game continues until one player has filled all six squares on his picture board.

name: Plains Wars
description:
Campaigns and Skirmish Scenarios

Tactical Supplement for WarPaint or any western wargame

Contents:
1. Campaigning the Plains Wars (Operations)
2. Plains Wars Scenarios (Skirmishes)
3. Warfare on the Plains (Tactics)

Softcover, 28 pp
categories: American Indian Wars, American West, Miniatures, Wargame

name: This is your city: Bendigo game
description:
Board game played on map of Bendigo to promote the region and businesses within Bendigo. The gameboard is a full colour representation of Bendigo and the players compete with each other to race to targeted destinations on the gameboard.

Officialy sponsored by The Bendigo Development Committee.

name: The Great Mouse Hunt
description:
From the Publisher's Website:

We printed this home-made board game on the back cover of our seventh issue, playable with pennies and a die, for those long train journeys.

What could be more enticing to a mouse than a cup of tea? And what could be more enticing to a cat than a mouse?

In our custom-made board game, you get to be a cat stalking the kitchen for prey, or a mouse, desperate to be the first to make a cuppa tea for yourself and your mouse-spouse.


User Summary:

This roll-and-move board game was printed in issue 7 (Sep/Oct 2011) of oh comely, a British lifestyle magazine. It was also released on their website in a complete electronic format that can be printed for play. The core game is designed for three to five players, although included are variant rules for two players.


One player takes on the role of the cat and aims to capture mice by landing on them and then bringing them back to its owner's pillow. Capturing three mice will win the game for the cat.



Other players are the mice and win by making two cups of tea. Each cup of tea requires three ingredients (one milk, one tea, one sugar). Ingredients are randomly determined and rewarded at the end of each round, given to whichever mice have claimed certain territories on the board. Mouse players can trade ingredients.


As an optional rules, two spaces on the board offer chance cards to players that land on them. There are separate cat and mouse chance cards that provide competitive advantages of various types.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Väike numbrikohver
description:
2 decks of smaller-size and 1 deck of larger size cards with numbers 1-20 with 15 different games. Some games are old classic like memory etc. Some are new games.

f.e. Tell a number:
Both smaller cards with numbers 1-12 are used.
Each player gets 6 cards in hand.
In his turn player tell a number from 1 to 24 and all players try to find 2 cards with sum of that number. Who finds places this cards in front of him and draws 2 cards.
Each number may be used only once during the game.
Game ends if all cards are used and player who has the most cards is the winner.

name: PARticipation
description: PARticipation is a golf game. Players spin a spinner in order to determine their shots, which are kept track of on molded plastic three-dimensional terrain. Putting is done with a life-sized putter and golf-ball included with the game, with the idea being that the players will set up their own "greens" a la miniature golf with varying levels of difficulty.

name: The Game of Catching Mice
description:
for 2 players

Each player having 6 different colored counters each for mice and an indicator.
The object is to win mice (counters) by stopping a players men on the letters M,I,C, and E.

Players spin the indicator and place their mouse on the start places in order. Using either end of the arrow obtained from the spinner result. If the player hits upon an "M" he takes one of his mice and outs it on the blue track opposite the "M". The players having obtained an M then try to get the I,C, and E, The MIC & E may be separated by many spaces but must follow in order. In the case that a player does not obtain the next needed letter he must move forward the number of spaces shown on either end of the arrow. If a piece falls opposite an opposing mouse, the mouse is returned to the center of the board to be used again. If a player obtains a letter and there are only mice of an opposite color in the center he takes one of them and exchanges it for one of his own color, No two men or mice may occupy the same space. The player having the most mice home at the end wins the game

name: Basketball Team card game
description:
Basketball Team Card Game

Enjoy the dynamic, the humor and the assistance and betrayal of a game played by brave young men.

Play against a friends by yourself or like a team.

As a player you can play action cards to make action:
Throw Shooting, Rebounding, Fouls, Foul Drawing, Blocking Shots, Stealing the Ball, Assists, Defense and others.

ACTION CARDS that keep the game moving fast while at the same time allowing everything that takes place in a real game to occur.
Try the game and claim some fame.

Basketball Team Card Game... are you man or are you meat?

Each game begins with draft and then the season begins.
Each game turn represents individual player attack.
Players play actions cards and earn victory points based on their actions and teams' actions.

The point of the game is to get the most victory points.

The Game of Professional Basketball.

name: KOR
description:
Roll the Haul before you Lose it All!!!

Buckle up. Keep On Rolling (KOR) is the bold press your luck dice game geared to get your wheels spinning AND have you screaming for the air brakes at the same time! Every player is in the drivers seat on their turn and rolls the jumbo dice to log 25, 50 or 100 miles at a time. Each roll (haul) must obey the rules of the open road. How many times does a player roll the dice on their turn? As many times as possible and they Keep On Rolling until no miles have been rolled or they run into a dead end, Players can roll their turn to a slow and steady STOP or lose everything they have rolled by hitting a DEAD END! Roll a U-TURN and you pass the dice to any player, who then is U-TURNED and rolling against their score! The first player to log 6,000 miles wins!

name: Klexx Party Junior
description:
Who wants a birthday party of Klexx the dog needs luck and tactical skills.

Players roll the dice and move on the inner round with many obstacles to grab the four different pieces of his color. Player may use his magic bone to get in right square faster.

Player who gets his 4 puzzle pieces first is the winner.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Party Game, Puzzle, Racing
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Blue Jays Suck-Ball
description:
Two players go head-to-head in the World Series of Baseball!

Using a standard deck of playing cards divided into reds and blacks, each player takes control of a team and attempts to out-pitch and out-score the other player by turning over cards representing their Defense or Offense. In what plays a little like War (injected with hardcore baseball strategy), highest card wins and determines whether the batter gets a hit or is out. Complete with rules for bunting, sac flys, stealing and more, you'll be a Major League coach in no time!

Meticulously crafted by a baseball fanatic and his brother while watching their Major League home team lose miserably, this game will leave you cheering, yelling, and having a Grand Slam of a time. You'll never have to make it out to the ballgame again!

Check out the Files section for the full rules.

name: Invasive Species
description:
You and your fellow scientists have been sent to Earth.
Your mission: Conquest
Your weapon: An organism Earthlings call a "plant". Your "plant" has been created to combine with other plant species on Earth and spread across the planet, changing the biosphere to support your own race.

Each player builds a nursery of 15 cards and, starting with the Alien Seedling - Code Name: Noraby, match numbered points along the sides and corners of the cards. However, each plant the seedling takes over may radically change the game.

And there are other things in the garden of Earth. Animals, insects, poisons, tools, and people that may hinder the spread of your plants, or unwittingly help.

The scientist with the most points and the end is the winner and shall be proclaimed Overseer of the new Earth.

Set number one will be "American Wildflowers". Later expansions will cover Mold, Fungus, Diatoms, Roses, Trees, etc.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Environmental, Science Fiction

name: Genius Triangle
description:
Like Score Four bit the base is triangle instead of square.

In his turn player places marble on one of the pins.
The winner is the player who first places four marbles in a row on the pins, vertically, horizontally or diagonally.

name: Multimatch II
description:
The divisions on the Multimatch I tiles are turned from diagonal to vertical/horizontal to get this other set of 24 unique 3-color squares. Here the color-matching gets trickier because each edge has two segments to be matched up.

Players take turns placing tiles on the 5x5 gameboard. Edges must match and the first piece placed on a border of the board determines the color of that border. Last player wins.

name: Hillbilly Hell
description:
You and your friends thought it would be fun to go on a little backwoods camping trip. You’d heard the rumors about missing campers, but thought it was just stories to frighten tourists. Then, when you found the hidden side trail, you just couldn’t resist a good hike. Now, you’re running for your lives and you know the stories are true.
You can hear some of your friends screaming in the distance, but you have no idea where you are. You just want to find your way out, to escape this place. But those screams, how can you leave your friends behind? Suddenly, you notice the woods around you have gone quiet. Something’s not right.
As you realize you’re not alone, you also remember something one of your friends said- “There’s a reason it’s the road less traveled!”.

Hillbilly Hell is a semi-cooperative game of Horror, Survival, Rescue, and Escape for 1-3 Players. In Hillbilly Hell, you play as a group of lost Hikers that have stumbled into the path of a family of inbred cannibal rednecks. Players must look for a way out while helping one another (if they choose to) survive being hunted for sport, food, or worse. The player whose Hikers can survive or escape, and gain the most Survival Points along the way, wins.

name: From Start to Finish
description:
This 2 player children's game consists of a board, a rabbit and a die. Both players use the rabbit, which starts the game in a field in the middle of the board. One player's goal is to move the rabbit to a carrot patch, the other's goal is to move the rabbit to a lettuce patch.

Each player moves the rabbit toward their goal in turn using the number rolled on the die. There are two types of special squares. Landing on a plank gives that player an extra turn. Landing on a fence causes that player to lose a turn.

First player to reach their goal wins.

name: Game of Troublesome Pigs
description: After raiding the garden, those troublesome pigs flee the angry farmer and his trusty dog as the farmer waves his fist and swings his hickory stick. A simple roll and move game over a pretty complex game board. Game is Circa 1900-1910 and features some of Milton Bradley's finest early chromatography/lithography.

name: In The Soup
description: A Tiddly Winks type game. The game comes with 4 miniature salt cellars, 4 small counters of differing colors and 1 large snapping piece. The object is to try and not knock over any of the Salt Cellar pieces while landing on the same color area as the area that you started in. A counter must be clearly on the same and outside of the soup dish. Any piece resting on the same color scores 15 points and counters resting on a different color scores 5 points. Each salt cellar still standing scores 5 points. Minuses for any counter IN THE SOUP (minus 10 points), every salt cellar down but not in the soup (minus 5 points) and for every salt cellar down resting clearly over the line separating the soup from the edge of the Soup Dish (minus 5 points). Game is played in turns to a score of 100. First to that score wins.

name: Mice of Valor
description:
Mice of Valor is a strategy game about clans of mice contending to retrieve the most cheese. Players take turns moving their mice around the board to uncover tokens. This can be done by moving onto one, or by sniffing out the area before moving ahead. However...

It's not so easy as it sounds! The humans have placed deadly traps and poison everywhere, and two hungry cats prowl the area. While poison can simply be avoided, to score cheese from traps and escape the cats' clutches will require skillful use of slide cards. Don't forget about rival clans either - they'll resort to thievery if they have to!
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Phase Order

name: Big Happy Vacation
description:
"A Game Of Family Discovery"

This is a board game designed to help family members get to know each other in new and different ways.

Players move around the board and respond to provocative or silly questions depending on the color-coded shape of the space where they land. There are two decks of cards, one for adults and one for children. The questions are structured to provide an open environment for discussion without confrontation. Some cards prompt a player to create a story, which the other contestants judge for creativity and originality.

The first player to reach the end of the vacation pathway with all six "Lucky Symbols" is declared the winner. That family member gets a free wish, like a special dinner of their choice.

Includes a colorful board, six pewter tokens, one die, two decks of cards in a "suitcase" card holder, the rules, and a large cloth carrying bag. There is no outer box.

Designed for kids age 5-12 to play with parents or grandparents.

name: Pollen8
description:
Pollen8 is a simple abstract strategy game in which two players try to capture the opponent's piece. Both players have 19 pieces, divided into two types: the pollen (4 pieces) and pollinators ( 2 ants, 3 lady bugs, and 10 bees). All pieces are red on one side and black on the other. The players start by placing first the pollen pieces on the center of the board with their own color face up. After which, the players can choose to place two bees with piece from previous turn in between them or place a lady bug to flip a row or play the ant to push a row. Each piece must link to another piece at all time. At least 4 pieces are needed to capture an opponent's piece. Each captured piece is removed from the board and has a point. A pollen, a bee, a lady and an ant has 1, 2, 3 and 4 points respectively. The game ends with the first player to get 8 points.

The lady bug and ant are useful for capturing pieces. When played at early stage of the game may result into earning points but at the same time presents difficultly to get additional points at the end part of the game. This also draws your opponent to try to capture your high scoring piece to score big against you. When they are played near the end of the game, it may be also too late to catch up and score ahead. Think ahead and plan you moves, knowing when to use the lady bug and the ant is the key for winning this game.

name: All About Greeley
description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the gameboard from a "Residence Square" to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

The game board is map of Greeley, Colorado depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. The locations are real businesses in Greeley, and this game was made as a promotional item for the area. The game also came with coupons for businesses advertised.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Minute's the Limit
description:
"The educational word game. Fun for everyone from eight to eighty. As seen on T.V."

Minute's the Limit is a word game played over several rounds. In this game, players must write down, under each of five "subject titles", either a place, name, subject or thing that commences with a particular letter of the alphabet. Both subject titles and letters are selected by chance, thus allowing many possible answers. However, each round is timed -- adding further tension and competition to the game.

Each word written down that is deemed acceptable scores points for the player. Each unacceptable word causes the player to lose points. The player with the greatest number of points at the end of the game is the winner.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Word Game

name: Bad Moon
description:
The year: 1815 AD; the location: Maine, New England.

The village of Cape Grimson has turned into a battleground for ancient vampire houses and savage clans of werewolves. The stench of blood fills the night when the children of the darkness prepare their teeth for the taste of the enemy. Now, it's your time to become the lord of the damned and conquer the night once and for all.

Bad Moon is a fast-paced card-drafting strategy game about the war between vampires, werewolves and other sinister creatures of the night. Players collect victory points by guiding the factions in the war and balancing the battles by secretly playing different factions during the game. The strong factions don't always prevail, mind you; it's all about intrigue and planning the future of the war.

Each round represents one month consisting of four moon phases. Moon phases determine possible movements in the map for different locations. Players play one of their hand cards in order to conduct actions on the map. At the start of each new month new cards are drafted giving the players a chance to change the way of the war.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Ron LeGrand's Quick Turn Real Estate Game
description:
This is a board game that highlights and helps teach the principles of Ron LeGrand's Quick Turn Real Estate method.

Each player starts with a different amount of cash and credit. Players roll the dice and move around the board landing on different card spots. The spots are Marketing, Market, Ronism, Business Tools, School of Hard Knocks. Some card spots are beneficial and some are detrimental.

The goal is to have the most after tax income after 60 or 90 minutes.

name: Map Caps
description: This educational milkcap game comes with milkcaps for each of the 50 states, marked on one side with various information about the state. Players take turns trying to flip as many milkcaps as possible. An opponent takes any flipped milkcaps and asks the player a trivia question from the front; if the player gets the question right he gets to keep the milkcap. Players continue taking turns until the milkcaps have been awarded, at which point the player with the most milkcaps wins.

name: Job Creator(?)
description:
Job Creator(?) is an economic strategy game. Players are members of the "1%" in a small town. They own means of production and shops in the town, employ the citizens and produce and sell goods back to the population. In the beginning of the game, a small percentage of the town is employed, however the population has all of the money they need to buy goods and keep the economy moving. As play progresses, franchises (and later Big Boxes) move into the town, both of these change the purchasing dynamic of the town and makes doing business much harder.

The game combines "rondel" and "worker placement" gaming, along with economic strategy. Victory is determined by Victory Points, which are primarily earned by paying workers (although there are other ways to gain and lose points).

name: Remember the Maine, and to Hell with Spain
description:
Being a wargame guide to the Spanish American War 1898

Campaign Booklet 9

85 pages

From the Table of Contents:

CHAPTER ONE Background to the War
CHAPTER TWO The Cuban Army
CHAPTER THREE The Spanish Army
CHAPTER FOUR The Outbreak of the War
CHAPTER FIVE The Prewar Regular Army
CHAPTER SIX The Volunteer Army
CHAPTER SEVEN The Invasion of Cuba
CHAPTER EIGHT El Caney, San Juan, and the Fall of Santiago de Cuba
CHAPTER NINE The Puerto Rico Campaign
CHAPTER TEN Postrcipt and Prelude
APPENDIX A The Uniforms of the Spanish Army
APPENDIX B The Uniforms of the American Army
APPENDIX C Rule Modifications for the JOHNNY REB
BIBLIOGRAPHY

Overall the booklet provides the historical background, framework, and suggested rules (Johnny Reb) for the miniature gamer to simulate battles of the war.

The booklet uses modified Johnny Reb rules (based on the GDW 2nd edition) based upon the author's experience in gaming the period.

name: Naipedrez
description:
Naipedrez is a simple card game P&P for the whole family, the game is to assemble a line of figures like the famous game of chess.
This turn-based players play their cards and try to create their lines, but will not be so easy that event cards that can modify the lines of any player.

Figures of the game are available in different colors and line shapes can be formed with any color, but the nuts would that be could get all the figures of the same color.

To play using two types of decks, the first will consist of chess figures in various colors, forming the main deck, second deck are event cards, introducing frame shots in the game.

The object is to form a line with the figures of chess, the pawns figures standing in front of any shape of the line to protect them from possible events that may occur and will be determined by the second deck events.

The first player to complete the line shapes with a single color wins the game or when all players have completed their line, with different colors the game is terminated, in which case the winner is, the more figures that have to a same color.

The first deck is composed of five different colors, which make up the main deck of 50 cards.

The second is made up of different events taking his goal in open play, giving some plot twists to the game.

The entire game is included in three A4 pages type, making a total of 75 letters, and was designed for printing on adhesive sheets to stick on cards 60x40 small format.

components:
50 Cards figures
25 Cards of events
01 Manual
mechanics: Line Drawing, Open Drafting, Variable Phase Order

name: Champy
description:
Series beginning with the game systems DDU Champy.

This is a great simple game to play with small children or not so small, it is also ideal for playing in meetings with many people, or alone, the spectrum is all that can cover a large board game.

The system is based on nine dice with possibility to expand as much as you wish, the players throw the dice and go as they progress along the way, the remaining dice are collected for re-launch and go to form the new route.

In this way a player or more throwing the dice and set a course ...

now with a standard six-sided as the first player throws and the result will be the amount of movement points to move the player dice up the way ...

the events that occur at each of the players will be represented by the different shapes that make up the dice of the route ...

once the players move through the tour the last player to collect the remaining dice to be placed back on the tour again, so is unlimited, no end and the system is very simple to understand for adults as for children.

components:
A4 includes 9 dice to cut and play
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order

name: Dézégo
description:
A dice game with no chance.
The dice are used as pawns in Dézégo that never move but turned 90 degrees. Thus, the "1" can become a "2", "3", "4" or a "5", but not a "6" as this would require two rotations.

The goal is to display six dice of the same value in his camp. In turn, players return one of their dice. If the value is identical to that found its twin opposite, the opponent is now required to turn it from thence, and not another. Which can thwart his plans.

name: RoXzai
description:
A dexterity-stacking type in the reigns of Jenga.

Players draw a rock (a real stoney rock from Tenessee) from the bag and tries to stack in on top of the other rocks. Points are awarded if you are the last player to successfully stack a rock before everyone passes or the tower collapses. If the tower collapses the player who made the tower collapse gets negative points.

The game comes in a cloth bag.

name: Käfer, Wanzen und Schmetterlinge
description:
A pattern recognition game for children.

Components:
- one board (in two parts)
- one Charlie card
- four Lola cards
- 16 strawberry milkshake chips
- three dice (+ 18 stickers to be put on the dice)

The board shows a 10x10 grid with insect symbols (4 different symbols). The dice show the same symbols. The active player rolls all three dice and puts them on the Charlie card in a sequence of their choice. Now all players simultaneously try to find the same sequence of symbols on the board - from left to right, right to left, top to bottom or bottom to top. As soon as a player spots this combination of symbols, they say "Stop!" and put their Lola card on the board so that it points out the sequence the players were looking for. If it is correct, the successful player gains a milkshake chip. The first player to gain 5 milkshake chips wins the game.

name: Rocketship Dynasties
description:
Rocketship Dynasties puts you in control of a dynasty of decadent hedonists. Played on a board made of hex-tiles, players must settle, develop and defend colonies while breeding children and researching new technology, all in the pursuit of victory points. The first player to acquire 15 wins. Each dynasty has it's own special abilities, the mastery of which is the key to victory.

The tone of the game is irreverent and strange. The family members which can be acquired are largely portrayed as inept hedonists, while the technologies have a retro flavor to them.

Battles are fought by rolling dice, with special abilities granted by certain technologies and occasionally even family members. The game can be played totally peacefully, and combat is usually a risk to both sides.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Biopunk Urbwar
description:
URBWAR!

The companion boardgame to Machine: Overdrive takes you to the burned out streets of Terra Corporation Los Angeles. Deserted from years of Ratta gang fighting Oceanic and Terra go head to head with Hovertanks, Ronin, Netrunners and a host of other units. Oceanic is storming U.N. City from the ocean and Terra is gonna' put up a fight.

This game will be supplemented by Infantry: Netwar which brings elite Netrunners into the mission fighting for digital control of a prototype SunCor shuttle floating over the city.

Urbwar includes, dice, cards, units, a great easy to use board, and a clear rulebook.

This is the first Furry Cyberpunk boardgame.

name: Quiz Panel
description: This game from Cadaco Ellis capitalizes on the 1950's TV quiz show craze. There are 200 total questions in eight different series (25 questions each). In the standard game each player is given a quiz series sheet and quizzes (from their own sheet) the player on the right. The answering player silently places a peg in the yes or no holes on the board. The quizzing player then uses the code given on his/her series sheet for that question to turn the dial on the board and show the hidden answer. Players receive one point per correct answer. The player with the highest number of correct answers/points at the end of the game wins. In the party version all players work off the same quiz series sheet.

name: The Game of Hitch Hiker
description: Players try to complete a travel route across the board using a spinner and action cards. The first to reach their destination wins. On each turn the spinner directs player movement. Spaces on the board can direct you to jump to other locations or to draw cards which can slow you down (take a slow vehicle) or speed you up (take a fast vehicle). They can also (as in Monopoly) send you to jail or to the Hitch Hiker hospital. As is often the case in the 1930's, the Hitch Hiker theme is pasted on.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zond
description:
ZOND, named for the Soviet manned lunar orbital program, is an easy to play game of worker/resource management and action selection, featuring an idealized view of the Space Race, beginning in 1957 and ending in 1987, by which time the Soviets had confidently predicted that they would be launching a manned mission to Mars. Players may represent the American, Chinese, European, Soviet, or Zambian (!) Space Programs.

Player interaction is based upon strategic action selection and the use of an Espionage Deck, reflecting various game altering events, conditions, and missions that may be used to assist or slow the progress of the various space programs represented in the game.

This is a tongue in cheek game, based upon idealized history, and while many of the events and actions are based upon historical fact, it should not be misconstrued as a straight laced simulation.

name: United Challenge
description:
United Challenge is a board game which is described on the box as "The official Manchester United trivia game for the whole family".

The game is similar in many respects to Trivial Pursuit. Players are required to collect scoring pieces (in various colours) to place in their playing "football". The pieces are acquired by correctly answering trivia questions about Manchester United Football Club.

Players circulate around the board by throwing a die and moving accordingly. The location of their "football" will determine which question they are asked. The first player to fill their football with scoring pieces is the winner.

name: Challengia
description:
Challengia is a fun party game. During the game players have to do several engaging challenges. It's important that all players have to perform the tasks and not someone alone (looser or winner etc). Challenges are mainly fun and also good-willing like: text someone what you have in your pockets, for the next round pretend that you are in love with the player on your left etc.

There are 175 challenges in one game set. All together there are 525 challenges. Every game is a bit different challenge set.

Challengia is set-based game similar to poker. In the beginning dealer deals every player some amount of challenges. The more tasks are dealt, the longer can game last. During the game players have to get the strongest set to win a round. Whoever wins a round, can read her challenge and every player has to perform that task. That's right - winner, looser and everybody else has to do the task. Whoever gets rid of her challenge cards first wins the game.

name: Porky Pig's Donut Factory
description:
This is a game for young children featuring images of classic cartoon charatcers like Porky Pig, Bugs Bunny, and Daffy Duck.

The object of the game is to become the first player with zero donut holes. Players use a whimsical spinner to move a token along the pathway made of donuts. A player might gain or lose a donut hole, depending on the type of space where the token lands.

There are a number of options and the players do have decisions to make during a session. A player may move in either direction. Certain spaces give the player a choice between spinning again for a free move or setting a donut hole "trap" on the board for another player.

The player with zero donut holes who crosses the finish line first is declared the winner.

Designed for 2, 3, or 4 children ages 6 through 10 years old.

Includes a colorful board, spinner, 4 cardboard Porky Pig tokens with plastic bases, and 22 donut hole markers.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Strawberry Shortcake Rescues Fig Boot
description:
Strawberry Shortcake and friends rescue the friendly Figboot

The Lend a Hand and Help a Friend Game

This is a spin and move game. The object is to rescue Fig Boot by being the first player to uncover the word "Fig Boot" and Fig Boot's picture. Landing on the Purple Pieman's spaces will trap your pawn until another player lends a hand.

The winner is the one who has played all his or her "Lend A Hand" chip.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Victory
description:
Victory is an abstract combat dexterity game for two players. The game mixes skill and a little luck to create an abstract battlefield the players overlook and attempt to control

Each player will set their army of meeples up on their side of the table or floor. Then the players will take turns drawing cards and sliding their glass bead shooters, attempting to knockdown their opponent's army first.

No game is never the same twice and the Action cards randomize abilities and opportunities available.

Victory is awarded to the last (meeple) man standing...and the player who owns it.

name: Underdog's Save Sweet Polly Game
description:
Object is to save Sweet Polly by moving into the blockhouse on Barsinister Island where Simon Barsinister has hidden her.

Each player has a designated start space on the board. On each turn, the player spins the spinner and moves their Underdog piece forward or backward along the path (one or the other per turn). When landing on a "Turn Blockhouse" space, the blockhouse in the middle of the board is moved one turn. There are four paths leading to the blockhouse but only one side has a yellow door that allows entrance. This door moves when the blockhouse turns.

First player to get into the yellow door and enter the blockhouse saves Sweet Polly and wins the game. Exact number not required.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ben 10 Die Schlacht gegen Vilgax
description:
In this action-puzzle shooting game, one player is Ben and other player his enemy - evil Vilgax.

Each player gets 3 identical figures and Omnitrix for his half of the board.
Both players shoot at the same time and try to remove the units of the opponent off the board first using the special guns.
