categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Starmania Das Spiel
description:
With this game You can become the next star of the year. All you need is a CD with your favorite songs and up to 5 friends. In five rounds You try to use Your star talent.

In his turn player rolls and moves and depending on the field, there are different actions: for example on Star Mania to carrying out the specified action with a song on the CD like Singing Duet, describing a song, singing with no sound etc.
Then there is a voting.
Player with the most votes as points at the end of the game is the winner.

CD and CD player are NOT included in the package.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: The Heart of Sut
description:
How The Game Works
The Heart of Sut is set in a Steampunk Universe. Each player is given a secret objective. The game continues until one or more of the players have achieved their objective. Taking it in turns each player draws the next card on their adventure. If the group fails to meet the challenge laid down in front of them they must retrace the steps and take another route. Along the way they can collect some strange and exotic equipment. Can they find the Airship to help them in their travels or find uptodate victorian clockwork technology? Only the cards will tell.

Characters
Each player is given a Character that must complete an objective. The objectives are not publically known and are as follows.

Cultist - One of the other players must be killed.
Greed - Must collect 40 000GP
Horder - Must get a unique set of items
Journalist - Must collect five items from different sets.
Hunter - Must collect a trophy from each different species of creature
Adventurer - The group must find the artifact (get to the end of the roads) with no other clear winner


Start of Game
Each player is dealt four cards off the equipment deck. They may spend up to 4000GP on the equipment they have drawn and must discard the rest. Each player signifies what they have equipped by placing it on the table in front of them. Equipment usual increases the attack strength of the character. The player with the highest attack strength is given the title of Watchman and goes first.

Taking a turn
The Watchman turns over the first road card. The road cards contain one day event and one night event. Every player is expected to take part in the day event first then the watchman completes the night event alone. When both events have been completed the Watchman announce the player to their right is the new Watchman. All characters are now allowed to reequip, trade between themselves and use items. When this is finished the game continues.

If both road events are completed succesfully the card is placed down in the middle of the table to signify they are on their journey. If they fail the road card is discarded.

Events
Day Event: This can be anything from a Shop to a toll bridge to a raid by Monsters.
Night Event: This can be a travelling sales man, a theif or a night raid by Monsters.

Monsters
There are seven different species of Monster. These are broken down into three different classes. To defeat a monster you must have an attack value greater then the monster's. If you defeat the monster you get his body as a trophy and one random equipment as loot. If you cannot defeat him alone someone else can help you but all loot is discarded. If you are unable to defeat a monster you loose a peice of equipped equipment. If you have no equipment left you die and are out of the game (Causing the Cultist to win). No one can fight more then one monster a turn. There are no limits to the number of trophies a player can carry.

Equipment
Equipment falls in to five types Hat, Coat, Weapon, Gadget and One Shot. An equipment set is made up of a specified Hat, Coat, Weapon and Gadget. Hat, Coats and Weapons increase the characters attack value. Gadgets are usually useable by the whole group once one person has it equipped. No one can fight more then one monster a round with the exception of One Shots. One Shots can be used once and then must be discarded. One Shots can be played on the monster or the character fighting the monster by anyone. The player can have at most four equipment cards in his hand unless he has a gadget that allows him to have more.

Money
Every Monster Trophy and Equipment card has an amount of GP in the bottom right corner of the card. When the characters are at a shop then can discard either equipment or monster trophies for cards off the equipment draw pile at the apropriate cost. No change is given.
mechanics: Area Movement, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Rosette
description:
Each player gets a secret colour. The players alternately place any of the rhombic tiles.
The game ends when all tiles are played and a large decagon is formed.

The winner is the player with the most tiles inbetween the lines of his colour.

name: Kinder-Quibble
description:
Children version of Quibble Das schnelle Kreuzwortspiel with picture tiles added.

A crossword puzzle game for children, in three difficulty levels, the most recent set of words to get a little knowledge of the pictures and reading the letters.

Object is to gain winning points placing the words into the crossword board.

name: Essex County On Board
description:
Essex County On Board is a version of Monopoly. All the spaces, deeds, and cards are based on locations in Essex County, Ontario on them.

Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. When a player collects all the properties in one color group, the properties can be improved by building. When players land on a space owned by another player they must pay rent. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Heavy Gear Blitz! Shields of Freedom
description:
From the publisher:

In the vast Badlands of Terra Nova, people are caught between two superpowers bent on dominating the planet. Peace River, Port Arthur and various smaller settlements are fighting for freedom, survival, and sometimes even money. Brought together by a common need, the peoples of the Badlands stand wary, ready to defend themselves and fight for what little they have. But it remains to be seen if these Badlanders will remain free or if the superpowers will crush these people between them in the madness of war . . .

Shields of Freedom contains everything you need to know about the forces of the Badlands including:


Overviews of the major Badlands Factions of Peace river and Port Arthur.
Backgrounds on all the major war machines.
In-depth field guides for the Peace River Defense Force, Port Arthur Korps, and Leagueless Badlanders.
New squads, including many new, never-seen-before vehicles for the PRDF, the Hovertanks used by the Port Arthur Korps and the patchwork groups used by desperate Badlanders.
20+ Datacards covering all major Badlands-use designs for easy Reference.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Duplicate Golf Game
description: Game includes folded lithographed to represent the fairway and rough of a golf course. Disk with spinner is used to advance the ball around the course. Movable pieces represent the putting greens, cart paths, bunkers and hazards. Design holes based on your own design, or on a real course. Then choose your club and play the shots trying to beat par.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sound It!
description:
"At home or on the go, SOUND IT! is non-stop fun and entertainment for all ages, engaging the imagination through making and guessing silly sounds. SOUND IT! card game has 96 fun-filled cards...and unlimited possibilities!

FUN & CHALLENGING – but simple to learn – each deck of 96 SOUND IT! cards offers two great ways to play: On one side of each card, guess the picture based on hearing the silly sounds other players make. On the other side, hear the special clue and be the first to make the correct sound."

Source: The Publisher Website.

name: Pathological
description: Pathological gets your friends and family laughing with hilarious explanations to get you out of sticky situations! You start by drawing a situation where you wouldn't necessarily want to tell the truth, and then you wager how many words of different points you think you can fit into your tall tale, and then you weave a story using the words you've drawn to explain your way out of the situation. You get to keep the points you've drawn if more people think your lie is a good one than don't. It's great for parties and family game nights where everyone wants to have some good light-hearted fun!

name: SV Werder Bremen
description:
Objective: Be the first acquiring 4 cupcards

A quizgame about the German soccer team SV Werder Bremen.

You have to answer questions out of the 4 Masterball places to get cupcards; there are different actions reaching different places on the board by changing your direction. Type of cards:
master-cards, action-cards, cup-cards.
Places to meet: penalty, gallery, substitutes' bench, offside, hospital, autographing session...
'Roll, move and answer questions game'

name: Giants and Dim Sum Chefs
description:
On the eve of a competition between all the world's dim sum chefs, the chefs themselves have gone missing! When you wake up – you being one of those top dim sum chefs – you find yourself trapped in a cage with the other chefs. A giant in front of you says, "Feed me!" This is your chance to get out. You need to make dim sum to fight for your survival

In Giants and Dim Sum Chefs, you use cards to make dim sum, with each player having a card placed in front of them each round – but repeats are not allowed, so you'll need to use strategy to interfere with opponents. Use all the cards in your hand, and you win your freedom!

name: Follow the Arrow
description:
Basically a Chinese checkers type game, played on a 5x6 rectangle, where you and an opponent move your 5 men across the board into your opponent's starting position. The catch is that each space on board has arrows which indicate the allowed moves out of that square.

Board box top probably looks like label on board back.

name: Eine Reise durch Sachsen
description:
Objective: be the first to travel to arrival point
learn more about folks and country
- simple 'Roll and Move' game, moving by turn -

rolling the die each player starts in Dresden
you can't kick opponents ==> your can't move if you would meet another meeple
follow instructions of field you land on - description/characterization of the place you reached is told
to all participants
remarks:
GDR product, very similar to ==>
Eine Reise durch Sachsen - und Sudetengau
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: Lust auf Liebe
description:
Erotic Partner-Game for one or two couples!

Bring new fresh in your relationship and get to know your partner better!

There must be intimate questions answered in detail, hot action is taken and secret desires are revealed.
Whoever arrives first thing in the middle of the board wins.

- 2 Heartstones
- 8 Cardsets
- 1 Game Board
- 1 Rule Book

name: BrainBox: World – 20 More
description:
Due to such high demand for ‘BrainBox The World’ we have added another game and another 20 cards to the amazing BrainBox. This fabulous game includes twenty new countries. Did you know the capital of Mauritius is Port Louis or that .bb is the internet domain for Barbados?

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

Made from a minimum of 70% recycled material and designed in the UK, the BrainBox range is fabulous fun. Find out who the BrainBox is in your family – it may not be who you think it is!

Players 1 or more,
Ages 8 to 88,
Contains 20 illustrated cards.

name: BrainBox: Reminisce
description:
Can you remember when… Bob the Builder was the Christmas number 1; The Queen of England had her 50th Jubilee; or when the Twin Towers were attacked in New York City? BrainBox Reminisce is the complete guide to the past twenty years with each card showing the “best bits” of each year stretching over the last two decades (1990-2010).

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner. This simple concept can be played by all ages and in large groups as well as a 1 person game.

Made from a minimum of 70% recycled material and designed in the UK, the BrainBox range is fabulous fun. Find out who the BrainBox is in your family – it may not be who you think it is!

name: BrainBox: Kings & Queens
description:
Did you know that George V was the first monarch to make a Christmas day broadcast? And that Richard I only spent 6 months of his 10 year reign in England? Developed in conjunction with Historic Royal Palaces, BrainBox Kings and Queens of England recalls all the monarchs of England since the Battle of Hastings spread over 55 beautifully-illustrated cards stuffed full of fun facts.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner. This simple concept can be played by all ages and in large groups as well as a 1 person game.

Made from a minimum of 70% recycled material and designed in the UK, the BrainBox range is fabulous fun. Find out who the BrainBox is in your family – it may not be who you think it is!

name: BrainBox: Awful Ancients
description:
This is the second of our Horrible Histories BrainBoxes. Find out how truly awful our ancestors were.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner. This simple concept can be played by all ages and in large groups as well as a 1 person game.

name: BrainBox: Horrible Science Blood & Guts
description:
This is the first of our Horrible Science BrainBoxes. Find out all about our horrible bodies.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

Made from a minimum of 70% recycled material, the BrainBox range is fabulous fun. Find out who the BrainBox is in your family – it may not be who you think it is!

Ages 8 - 108,
Contains 54 cards, 1 rules card, 1 sand timer and 1 die,
Players 1 or more,

name: BrainBox: Australia
description:
Did you know that Australia gave the world latex gloves, refrigerators and the world’s first feature film? Do you also know that this country is the only one to cover an entire continent? BrainBox has gone down under for this version of BrainBox Australia. 53 playing cards illustrate the history, sport, people, inventions and wildlife of one of the world’s most fascinating countries.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

This simple concept can be played by all ages and in large groups as well as a 1 person game. Made from a minimum of 70% recycled material and designed in the UK, the BrainBox range is fabulous fun. Find out who the BrainBox is in your family – it may not be who you think it is!

Players 1 or more,
Ages 8 to 88,
Contains 53 illustrated cards, 1 rules card, 1 timer and 1 eight-sided die,

name: BrainBox: Travel
description:
Did you know that the Leaning Tower of Pisa took 200 years to complete? Or that the nickname of Florida is the “Sunshine State”? BrainBox Travel contains 35 beautifully-illustrated cards showing the very best this world has to offer in a handy magnetically locked travel box.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

Designed to take away on holiday this fabulous game is made from a minimum of 70% recycled material and is fabulous fun. Find out who the BrainBox is in your family – it may not be who you think it is!

name: Brainbox: On The Go Devon
description:
Do you know which famous art? Or where the oldest commercial bakery in the world is? BrainBox Devon On The Go contains 55 beautifully-illustrated cards showing the very best Devon has to offer, and then some!

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner. This simple concept can be played by all ages and in large groups as well as a 1 person game.

Made from a minimum of 70% recycled material, the BrainBox range is fabulous fun. Find out who the BrainBox is in your family – it may not be who you think it is!

name: Fantail Handball
description:
Fantail Handball is another board game of the Line Fantail dedicated to sports. It is a didactic and very entertaining board game where two teams develop Handball in a board game by using (2) smart charts each. Because it has a single disc on the board which is used as a ball, the Fantail Handball is a game very agile. In the smart carts are designed rules and tactics of Handball. Through the launch of a role given to 8 faces in smart charts are being obtained different game variations, which can lead to the movement of the ball among players in attack, cause the exclusion of a player, cause a foul, result in passive play or score a goal.
The symbols printed on the smart charts are in direct relation to the symbols printed on the game board.

name: Scarnie
description:
This is sort of an odd entry which fits with this odd game. In part this entry is to document that Scarnie was not a predecessor of Scarney. John Scarne used his name in many games in many variations. It makes trying to reconstruct his contributions to board games even more frustrating. Having never seen the game itself, I'll attempt to describe it from the rules. Unfortunately there doesn't seem to be quite enough information to entirely reconstruct this game.

To make matters a bit more confusing in his book The odds against me Scarne has a 1929 picture of him playing a game named Scarney with Jimmy Braddock. The picture shows a game which fits this Scarnie game for which the rules are available (see weblinks). Being a good promoter Scarne didn't show him opposing the water boy at the boxing camp, but the champ himself!

Equipment

Scarnie is played on a board with four stations. Each station has the numbers 1 to 7 arranged in a semi-circle arranged in front of the player. There is common "pool" area in the center of the table.

There are 28 men which we will say are black discs. There is a number on one side of the disc, with each disc having one of the numbers between 1 and 28. 20 numbers are say red, and eight are say green. (Sorry but rules don't specify color/number association!!).

Play

The men are place numbers down in the pool area, and then each player fills his stations consecutively (thereby selecting seven pawns total for the station) and keeping the numbers hidden from the other players. The dealer calls "play" and the men are turned over to reveal the numbers.

The rules mention "Double", "Triple" , and "Draw" positions which I cannot explain. The available rules do describe other aspects of play. The gist is however that the pawns are eliminated from the board, and the last pawn left on the board scores points for that player.

name: Fantail Volleyball
description:
Fantail Volleyball is another board game of the line Fantail dedicated to sports. It is a board game didactic and very entertaining, where two teams develop Volleyball in a board game by using (2) smart charts each. On the game board there is only a piece to be moved by each team in turn, which makes the game very agile. In the smart charts are designed rules and tactics of Volleyball. Smart charts begin with a decision, the player can choose float or power stroke. Then the dice 12-sided role, according to the number thrown, will derive on smart charts in different variants, which can result on hitting the ball by the forwards, or produce the opposing team simple, double or triple block, or the recovery or loss of the ball, or the obtaining or loss of the point at stake.
The symbology printed on the game board is in direct relation to the symboligy printed on smart charts.

name: Som' Beans
description: Som' Beans is a fun, fast card game for 2 to 4 players with a simple object: End the game with the most beans. What is involved in the game are a bag with 100 beans and a deck of 54 cards. Each player is dealt 6 cards and one player grabs out a handful of beans from the bag. From there players take beans from the pile, put them back, or take from other players. Once the last bean is taken by exact count, a player pulls out some more beans and the next round begins. When the bag is empty and the last bean is taken, count up. The most beans wins. Games take approximately 15 minutes.

name: Fantail Basketball
description:
Fantail Line presents "Fantail Basketball"
Fantail Basketball is a board game agile and very fun where two teams try to put the ball into the hole by means of single, double or triple throws, and thus achieve higher score than your opponent.
Smart Cards printed on both sides, (6) per team, are designed so that the rules and tactics of basketball can be developed on the game board.
The symbols printed on the game board is directly related to the symbols printed on smart charts.
A 10-sided roll dice cast by the team that has possession of the ball determines the way forward on the smart chart in use.
In the smart chart of start o restart the game has some decisions that the team in possession of the ball to take.
In other smart charts are designed situations related to the game of basketball itself, such as: passes between players, faults, recovery and loss of the ball, rebounds, throws and conversions.

name: Fantail Football
description:
Fantail Football is a board game designed under the Fantail Game.
Fantail Football is a board game very agile and very entertaining where two teams try to score a goal and another and another and thus win the match.
Smart Charts printed on both sides, (4) per team, are designed so that the rules and characteristics Football can be developed on the game board.
The symbology printed on the game board is directly related to the symbolism printed on smart charts.
A 12-sided roll dice cast for the team that has possession of the ball determines the way forward on the smart chart in use.
In the smart charts are designed situations related with Football, such as: passes between players, fouls, off-sides, recovery and lost of the ball, free kicks, corners, centers to the goalposts and the desired goal.

name: Sport und Technik
description:
Objective: be the first to pass the finish line (100)
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll and Move' game
if you land on an marked area follow instructions printed on cover inside
remarks:
published early 50's

name: Im schönen Schwarzwald
description:
Objective: be the first ending on space 43
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game - roll the die, move & follow instructions printed on cover inside

remarks:
belongs to series: "Scholz' künstlerische Spiele";
game should be published early 1920's
numbering (on box and rules) differs: 652 vs 472
meeples: pewter figures
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: Age of Ravens
description:
User Summary: Prototype 15mm fantasy rules based on the Brother Against Brother and Ge Koku Jo system.

Subtitle: Fantasy Miniatures Rules System

From the introduction:
Battlecry: Age of Ravens (AOR) is a set of 15mm Fantasy Miniatures rules. Designed to cover large-scale battles, AOR is fast and flexible. Players control many strategic decisions, but some random elements such as turn sequence, movement and morale undercut this control in battle. The careful general will take these risks into account.

Age of Ravens is set in the world of Lowell. Here, after the fall of a great evil known as the Thonak, peoples and cultures struggle to reclaim what was lost. The races and history reflect this setting, but AOR can easily be adapted to a variety of other worlds.

name: Found in the Garden
description:
A party game where guests are each given a card with 18 pictures on it. The pictures are visual cryptic clues to something found in a garden. For example, picture number 10 is a pair of lips and the answer is Tulips (Two Lips - geddit?). There are 18 such clues to solve and the first to hand in a completely correct card, wins.

This is one of the publisher's range entitled Can You Solve?

name: Cryptograms
description:
Party game. Each participating guest gets a card with 18 cryptic clues to words. First to get them all right, wins. Or the one with the most answers when 'Time' is called, wins.

Part of the publisher's Can You Solve? party game range.

name: Blind Peg
description:
Up to four players each have a wooden board with 10 holes for pegs. They blindly draw colored pegs out of the can which is also used to store the game. If the peg is their color, them they get to score it, otherwise the peg is discarded and it is the next players turn. Two specially colored pegs. A silver peg forces a player to remove one of his pegs and return it to the can. A gold peg gives the player three more draws in the same turn.

The game was packaged in a round can about 3.5 inches in diameter and 4.75 inches tall.

name: Edgewise
description:
Edgewise is a speed matching tile game where you race to play your 12 player chips first by matching the edges to the starter chip of each round or any player chips already played. There are twelve rounds that change with each starter chip. A point is scored for each chip played along with bonus points. The most points at the end of all the rounds wins the game. The game can be customized to however many rounds you want to play. If your time is limited, you can play 2-3 different rounds in under 20 minutes. You can also have multiple games going at the same time since Edgewise has 12 starter chips that determine each round.

Contents: 84 hexagon-shaped game pieces
Game Pieces: 72 Player Tiles (12-Black, 12-Turquoise, 12-Pink, 12-Green, 12-Orange, 12-Purple), 12 Starter Tiles (1-"Basic" round, 1-"Follow the Leader" round, 1-"Teams" round, 1-"Longest Chain" round, 1-"No Reds" round, 1-"Opposites Attract" round, 1-"Stack 'Em" round, 1-"Capture" round, 1-"Dead End" round, 1-"Freeze Tag" round, 1-"Rotate" round, 1-"Share the Love" round)

name: The Speed-Boat Race
description: A simple roll and move game. Players start in Southampton and then follow the track around the British Isles, ending up back at Southampton. Certain spaces give help or hindrance along the way. First to get back there, wins.

name: Toby
description:
Objective: Be the first turning back to your starting point & collecting all 3 wooden chips, placed at 3 different corners.

- Place your meeple onto appropriate (coloured) corner of the board & 3 of your chips into all other corners.
- Roll the die by turns: move according the number into direction free of choice; ending on an arrow move into that direction next turn; ending on an image you are going to be teleported to the appropriate second image; passing a corner collect your wooden chip.

remarks:
very cute wooden meeples - produced in the Erz Mountains; one of the reasons why this game is rather difficult to get

name: Luftibus auf Reisen
description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line (field 90)
simple 'Roll and Move' game - use only one die between 1-14 and above 72, otherwise 2 dice
remarks:
very cute drawings
very nice coloured pewter figures
should had been published between 1910-15

name: American Boys
description: A Fox and Geese type game played on an irregular network of positions. The one red scout is trying to reach the bottom of the board and get back home. The six blue scouts are trying to block him so that he cannot move.

name: The Ebb and Flow of Battle: Module 3 – The Peninsular Campaign
description:
Grand tactical warfare rules focusing on 1809-1811 featuring the defense of Portugal and the securing of a base for operation with the capture of the fortress of Cuidad Rodrigo and Badajoz.

Dice are not used with these rules

name: Tricorne
description:
Tricorne is a set of rules for warfare in the 18th century. They cover the period of transition from the pike and shot armed regiments to the mass armies of the Revolutionary Wars.

Ground Scale:
20/25mm miniatures - 1 inch = 10 yards
15/18mm miniatures - 1 cm = 10 yards

name: Alles verdreht
description:
Objective: be the first covering all 10 numbers of your playing segment

acting by turns -
each player gets 10 (coloured) chips
player with red starts turning the spinner
- if a number within his own (coloured) segment is shown by the arrow => cover that number with a chip
- if a number within another coloured segment is shown by the arrow => correspondent player puts a chip on this number
- if an already covered number is shown by the arrow => correspondent player puts a chip on the following number (+1)
- if a 'zero' is shown => each player has to remove 1 chip

name: Ballistrikks
description:
This game simulates players trying to hit a target at the far end of a playing field using stones or similar projectiles. The target is either suspended in the air or on the ground, which will be agreed upon by the players. A graph paper or grid paper (10x10 or 20x20) represents the playing field. The movement of the projectiles per turn is determined by a standard die roll. Each player has four projectiles to throw. If the projectile hits the target or misses it, it is discarded from the game.

Each move starts with a dice roll. The player moves his projectile according to the dice roll. For each dice roll, the user can choose to move a projectile which is already airborne or introduce a new projectile into the playing field. For the initial moves the projectile has to travel towards the sky (top of the graph paper) in a diagonal manner (towards top right). After the projectile is airborne, the player can choose whether the projectile has to fall down in this turn. If he chooses so, then the projectile will have to move horizontally for this turn and the next turn onwards the projectile moves towards bottom right(ground) diagonally. The projectile always move to the right and cannot go back. (Should obey laws of gravity and projectile motion). The target is always placed at the second half of the paper, towards the right edge.

If the projectile hits the target the player is awarded 5 points. If the projectile hits another players projectile (lands in the same square) in the second half (right half) of the graph sheet, then 1 point is awarded and the opponent projectile is removed. The player can hit another player's projectile only in the second half of the field.Game continues till all projectiles are removed from the graph paper. The player with most points wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 19th Hole Golf
description: Snow on the ground? No problem you can still play golf using a real score card with the game Rough Water. Swings are dealt from a card deck and you score for the hole is recorded just like on a real golf course.

name: MIMIC
description:
Mimic (Memory Interfaced Micro Integrated Computer) is an electronic game similar to Simon. Colored LEDs light up in an ever increasing pattern, and the object is to "mimic" what has been shown each turn (and heard with beeps for each of the four colored buttons).
There are 3 play modes (1, 2, 3 -- not sure what these do) and 4 levels of difficulty (novice, amateur, junior, and pro) that can be set with two switches.

name: Mickey Mouse Electric Treasure Hunt Game
description:
The game is made by Tudor, the company who brought you the vibrating Electric Football game. Teamed up with Disney, this much simpler (and as a result, more fun for kids) game uses that same clever technology. Happily, all you have to do to play is put your ship in one of the tracks and let it go. You can adjust the knob on the board to control the speed (amount of vibration), but you don’t have to fiddle with anything else to play! Just flip the switch and you’re off to search for treasure!

Players choose from one of four 1.5-inch long ships made of tin and plastic, which are piloted by either Mickey, Donald, Goofy, or Pluto. Each character has a differently colored background on their game piece. There are four Ports to choose from as a starting point for each player.

The goal is to sail for the Treasure Chests at the top, worth from $200 to $500! Many sailors will be side tracked along the way into one of the many Coves where lesser treasure of $100 can still be found. But watch out! Captain Hook is on the prowl as his ship starts out from Pirate’s Cove from the top of the board and if you are intercepted by his ship, you’re sunk!

Some of the lesser treasure coves along the routes include names like Smugger's Cove, Doubloon Cove, Neverland Cove, Skeleton Cove, Shark Cove, and several others. The Treasure Chests at the top include Captain Kidd's Treasure, Captain Morgan's Treasure, Captain Hook's Treasure, and Long John Silver's Treasure.

-- description provided by Jason Monroe (belial1134) via the Unidentified Games page
categories: Children's Game, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Pirates

name: Pawn Mob
description:
This is a two player abstract strategy game played on a chessboard (simulates a brawl between two mobs in an enclosed area). This is played with eight pawns per side. Pawns start from the opposite extreme ranks. White moves first. Movements are as per pawn movement in chess. But opponent's pawns are not captured when they come in diagonally to each other. Instead they are pushed one square backward orthogonally. If there is no space to move orthogonally (square occupied by another pawn or there is no space in the board) then the attacked pawn is captured. One point is awarded per captured pawn and for each pawn which reach the opposite ranks. Game ends when no more pawns can be moved for either side. Player with most points wins.

Game rules will be uploaded soon.

name: Blitz Bolide
description:
BLITZ BOLIDE is a racing car game based on Formula 1 race.
THE PURPOSE OF BLITZ BOLIDE IS TO PLAY WITH 1/64 MINIATURE AND HAVE GREAT FUN IN DOING THAT. At this scale, a car has 7,5 cm or 3 inches length.
Blitz Bolide is played on tracks which are made of spaces. The average length of a lap is between 40 spaces (fast tracks) and 60 spaces (long tracks).

HOW TO PLAY : a car has four levels of gear : low, intermediate, high, and extreme.
Each turn, his driver can increase or decrease this gear by 1 level.
After that, he rolls 2 dice : according to the results of the dice, and according to the gear, the car is moved by a certain number of spaces.
Move bonuses (in terms of spaces) are given by tyres, fuel gauge, suspension, etc...
Once moved, a car can engage another car in order to gain its position.

There are two important difficulties in the game :
a) How to manage the Damage Points (DP) ?
Each car begins the race with 8 DPs. DPs are lost during brutal brakings, during engagement, when the car is going out of track, at extreme gear, etc...
A car is eliminated if it goes under 0 DP.
The higher the speed, the faster you lose DPs. But you cannot win if your speed is too low...Here Pit Stop strategy is very important for purpose of managing DPs.
b) How to take the corners ?
Each corner has an optimal gear. If its gear exceeds the optimal gear while taking a corner, a car can goes out of track (losing speed and possibly DPs).
However, a driver has 3 choices when his car is about to take a bend : short, medium, or long trajectory. With a short trajectory, you go faster, but it's risky. With a long trajectory, you take the corner more easily, but you become an easy target if engaged by opponents...
Here, tyre strategy, set-up (aero grip, suspension, etc..), are very important things for purpose of taking a corner.

Basic rules cover : hard or soft tyres, fuel gauge, pit stop, optimal gear in bend, fast bend, etc...
Advanced rules cover :advanced set-up (pit stop efficiency, bolide's toughness, etc...) defective gearbox, rain tyres, meteo.
Expert rules cover : aero grip, suspension, oversteering, understeering, engine power, qualification lap, Events card.

For the moment, there are 8 tracks : Monaco, Canada, Belgium, Japan, Italy, Catalunya, Singapore, China.

name: BASSMASTER Fishing Trivia Game
description:
This is a fishing trivia game with a wide variety of questions in two booklets... it isn't just about bass fishing.

Player move along the pathway as they answer questions in the following categories:

Fishin' Lore -- History & Tall Tales
Fishin' Gear -- Rods & Reels, Lures, Boats, etc.
Fishin' Holes -- Geography
Fishteristics -- Fish Characteristics
Fishpourri -- Everything Else

The first player to reach the finish line and answer the bonus question is declared the winner.

Includes a colorful board, two question booklets, tokens, die, and a storage insert.

name: Oldies Game
description:
The goal of "Oldies Game" is for each player to move his or her tokens to the finish line as quickly as possible. The first player to do so, wins. The winner, thereby, proves that he or she is not "old", but is still "young".

By rolling dice, players move around the game board into different colour-coded areas. Each area provides various obstacles to overcome (as explained on the game board) and assignments to complete (as explained on cards drawn in play). These obstacles and assignments can involve both physical stamina and brain power. In some cases, players "duel" directly with their opponents in order to progress on the game board.

name: Las guerras modernas
description:
It's a game similar to chess and checkers, the background is the first world war, german versus french.
Each side has four different units: infantry (one move to front or side) , cavalry (one diagonal move, like checkers game), cannons (like towers in chess) and planes/zeppelins (like queens in chess).
There is a special unit, the standar-bearer, if you capture the enemy standar-bearer with one infantry or cavalry unit, your unit change to a cannon unit.
The board is divided by a river in the middle, the infantry and cavalry units cannot retreat until overpass the river.
The objetive to win is eliminate all the enemy units.

name: Fantail Baseball
description:
Fantail Line presents "Fantail Baseball"
Fantail Baseball is a board game agile and very fun where two teams try to get more runs that your opponent and so win the match.
Smart Charts printed on both sides, (4) per team, are designed so that the rules and tactics of baseball can be developed on the game board.
The symbols printed on the game board are directly related to the symbols printed on smart charts.
A twelve-sided roll dice is used by both teams in turn.
Each smart chart has a space at the top which takes into account the throwing of the pitcher, being the possibilities strike, ball and ball in play.
The different options related to the steal of bases are represented in smart charts.
The team that is in the field, throw the 12-sided roll dice by means of your pitcher to determine if the throwing becomes a strike, a ball or a hit the ball into the field.
The team that is at bat, throw the same 12-sided roll dice to determine whether steals bases, if makes a full strike, if produces a home run or if the runner is out.
The smart chart in use will indicate the different positions of the pieces of both teams on the board and also of the ball.

name: This Just In...!
description:
A party game where players use combinations of cards to create headlines along certain topics as demanded by The Editor. Each round sees a new Editor ask for a headline based on a certain subject which can be decided upon either at random or by flipping one of the included Topic cards. By using Actions, Descriptions and Things cards, players submit a headline to the editor and hope it will catch their interest. The Editor then chooses two headlines and asks the players to summarise the stories behind them. The Editor then chooses their favourite of the two and the headline is added to a Running Order.

The Running Order acts as a scoreboard of sorts. Players will recieve points for each card they use in their headlines but also get bonuses for the positions the stories end up in at the end of the game. Every time a new headline is added to the Running Order, the Editor for that turn decides where it will be placed, bumping all other stories lower than it further down the order. If there are more than ten stories, the lowest ranked one is removed from the game scoring that player no points. At the end of the game, the lead story recieves a bonus 10 points, the second 9, the third 8, etc., all the way down to 1.

name: The War in Cuba
description:
An action game based on the impending Spanish-American war.

Players shot wooden bullets at die-cut soldiers using hand-held spring-loaded cannons.

name: The Philippine War
description:
The last of four wargames introduced in 1898 by Parker Brothers themed around the Spanish-American War.

All four games were action based and involved the players shooting wooden bullets at die-cut soldiers using hand-held spring-loaded cannons.

Although not a commercial success, the series of four games contributed greatly to Parker Brothers image as a patriotic American company.

The first three games in the series were The War in Cuba, The Siege of Havana and The Battle of Manila.

name: Geographical Lotto
description:
Statler made a version of "Geographical Lotto" with USA map cards and cities. Playthings Limited made essentially the same game for Canadian cards and cities. It is not known if Playthings and Statler were somehow connected.

The game is basically a bingo game whereby the player have cards which they are trying to fill. The call are made by blindly drawing a city card which is then called out. Each card has twelve cities. The winner is the player who fills his card first.

Contents:

Geographic cards for each player with 15 cities
City cards which to draw & call

name: Cosmorama
description:
The board represents a corner of French with different routes: the path of Business, the sentimental route etc. The goal is to reach the Fortunate Isles across the entire plateau by road you choose. Different modes of transportation are available: car, rail, plane, boat.

Benefit cards are auctioned at the beginning of the game: transport, post office, restaurants, casinos, websites (one card per player). The auction amount is paid to the Fund for Tourism. The transfer takes place through the die roll for the car and paying for his trip by train or plane.

The round ends when one player reaches the lighthouse square, it gets the money up in the Bank of Tourism and each opponent receives 25 FF. Whoever wins two rounds (or one that remains after eliminating competitors by bankruptcy) wins.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tolle Tierwelt
description:
"Great wildlife" in English

There are 2 questions in each card with 3 answers for each questions. The winner is whoever can answer most questions correctly and thus can collect the most cards.
If the current player answers incorrectly the next player may risk with one of his collected card to answer it.

Contents:

32 large format cards with color photos

name: Tierspuren
description:
"Animal tracks" in English

There are 2 questions in each card with 3 answers for each questions. The winner is whoever can answer most questions correctly and thus can collect the most cards.
If the current player answers incorrectly the next player may risk with one of his collected card to answer it.

Contents:

32 large format cards with color photos

name: BabySmarts
description:
From the manufacturer:

Prove to your friends and family you know more about babies than they do with this fun and informative question and answer game, BabySmarts. Includes 60 questions, a BabySmarts Guide and a score pad in a sturdy flip top box.

name: SexSmarts
description:
From the manufacturer:

A fun and informative adult game designed to teach as you play. Includes 100 questions with answers, a 12 pages tip guide and scorepad in a sturdy flip top box. Designed by experts for everyone.

name: Dog Smarts: Unleash Your Knowledge
description:
From the manufacturer:

A great way to learn all there is to know about man's best friend. Contains 100 questions with answers and designed to teach as you play, it comes with a 12 pages tip guide and scorepad in a sturdy flip top box.

name: Red WineSmarts
description:
From the manufacturer:

A great way to learn all there is to know about one of life's guilty pleasures, Red Wine. Includes 100 questions and answes and designed to teach as you play. Comes with a 12 pages tip guide and scorepad in a sturdy flip top box.

name: CocktailSmarts
description:
From the manufacturer:

What's in a Cosmo? What about a Gimlet or a White Lady? CocktailSmarts has the answers, diving into different alcohols, history, lingo, and other intoxicating facts so you can feel as much like a pro in front of the bar as the guy or gal behind the bar. Play CocktailSmarts, enjoy the festive coasters enclosed, and add a twist to your next cocktail party.

A fabulous way to learn about a guilty pleasure and have fun doing it. Cocktail Smarts has 60 questions and comes with a set of coasters, a cocktail guide and scorepad in a sturdy and full colored tin.

name: NYCSmarts
description:
From the manufacturer:

Learn everything you need to know about the city that never sleeps in this question and answer game, NYC Smarts. Filled with tons of insider information and guarateed to teach while you play, it's a great item for the resident as well as the tourist. Includes 100 questions, a Guide and a Scorepad in a sturdy flip top box measuring.

name: ChocolateSmarts
description:
From the manufacturer:

Impress your friends and family with this fun and informative question and answer game about one of our favorite indulgences, Chocolate. Includes 60 questions, a ChocolateSmarts Guide and a score pad in a sturdy flip top box.

From cocoa tree to chocolate bars, ChocolateSmarts offers everything you ever wanted to know about this delightful treat and then some. Pick a card and explore cocao history and tips, chocolate trivia, and more. Do you know which cocoa beans are of the highest quality? The best way to melt chocolate? Or who made the first chocolate bar? You will after indulging in a box of ChocolateSmarts.

name: GolfSmarts
description:
From the manufacturer:

Think you know everything there is to know about Golf? Prove it while playing this fun and informative question and answer game, GolfSmarts. Includes 60 questions, a GolfSmarts Guide and a score pad in a sturdy flip top box.

name: CoffeeSmarts
description:
From the manufacturer:

How does your favorite cappuccino, espresso, or cup of joe get so delicious? Find out with CoffeeSmarts, the caffeinated question and answer game filled with answers for coffee lovers - from those who just crave their morning cup to expert baristas. This stylish box og question and answer cards reveals the history and mystery behind one of the world's most popular beverages. Sit down with a steaming cup of coffee, pick a card, and discover: What's the highest quality coffee bean? What's French roast? How can you make Cowboy coffee? And what's in Spanish Coffee?

Stay up all night with your pals sipping a cup o Joe and playing this this fun and informative question and answer game about the drink we can't live without, Coffee. Includes 60 questions, a CoffeeSmarts Guide and a score pad in a sturdy flip top box.

name: Realstat Ice Hockey
description: Statistical Ice Hockey game. Uses dice rolls compared to charts to make decisions and outcomes of strategy. Includes ratings for 1990/91 NHL teams and the 1991/92 Playoffs.

name: Ballistic!
description:
Fire up the cannons! Six enemy fleets are all competing to reign the high seas, and it’s up to you to maneuver your ships and cannons to sink as many key targets as possible. Will you be able to carry your fleet to victory?

The board consists of a grid of ship and submarine tokens, along with a command ship and cannon belonging to each player. In each round, players schedule actions on their player dashboards according to the amount of time required to carry them out. Then, each time slot is resolved simultaneously — actions include loading powder and cannonballs, maneuvering ships and cannons, and commanding the fleet of ships of a player's own color.

When a ship or submarine is hit by the appropriate size of cannonball, the token is retrieved. If a player hits another player's command ship, the player must give up a token to the player who fired the shot. The player with the most points at the end of the game is declared the winner.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Bibi & Tina: Wett-Rennen
description: Two friends are riding their horses to a tree and back, trying to collect berries on the way. Essentially, this is a roll and move game for young kids. However, the player first place a hidden bet on the winner, and they can move either of the two riders as far as their die roll commands. When a rider reaches the farm again, anyone who had placed the right bet receives points; additional points are gained through picking up berries. The player with most points is the winner.

name: I Love LucySmarts
description:
From the manufacturer:

Splain that if you can! The nostalgic question and answer game that makes learning about the most beloved TV series of all time easy and fun.

Think you know everything there is to know about I Love Lucy? Well prove it and have a great time doing it with this 100 question and answer game that's designed to teach as you play. Comes with a 12 pages tip booklet and scorepad in a sturdy flip top box.

name: ElvisSmarts
description:
From the manufacturer:

A fabulously fun way to learn about the King, Elvis Presley. Written by experts and designed to teach, this question and answer game covers 4 topics, Legend and Legacy, Music and Magic, On the Silver Screen and On The Road. Also comes with a 12 pages Elvis tip guide and scorepad in a sturdy flip top box.

name: CatSmarts
description:
From the manufacturer:

Uncover the mystery of your feline friend with this question and answer game created and written by experts for enthusiasts. Comes with 100 questions and answers, a 12 pages tip guide and scorepad in a sturdy flip top box.

name: Weights & Measures
description:
A game in the tradition of Happy Families but this has sets in varying numbers of cards. I expect parents saw an educational value in the game and they were right to do so.

There are 9 sets in all, each giving examples of a type of measure. The sets range from 3 cards to 7 cards. In your turn, you may ask any other player for a card in one set but you must have at least one card from that set in your hand. If you complete a set, lay it in front of you. When all the sets have been collected, the player who has most in front of him, wins.

The nine sets are:
Cubic Measure
Troy Weight
Apothecaries' Weight
Dry Measure
Measure of Time
Long Measure
Square Measure
Avoirdupois Weight
Money Table

name: Mysterix nr. 004
description:
111 questions and answers to mysterious, hair-rising, spooky or horrific subjects can be found in each of the four packets, shaped like a fan and based upon the Quiz & Co series.
Each card is divided into a yellow and a black part, in the yellow part one finds numbered questions, on the next card the corresponding answers, equally numbered, can be found in the black part.
The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

name: Mysterix nr. 003
description:
111 questions and answers to mysterious, hair-rising, spooky or horrific subjects can be found in each of the four packets, shaped like a fan and based upon the Quiz & Co series.
Each card is divided into a yellow and a black part, in the yellow part one finds numbered questions, on the next card the corresponding answers, equally numbered, can be found in the black part.

name: Mysterix nr. 001
description:
111 questions and answers to mysterious, hair-rising, spooky or horrific subjects can be found in each of the four packets, shaped like a fan and based upon the Quiz & Co series.
Each card is divided into a yellow and a black part, in the yellow part one finds numbered questions, on the next card the corresponding answers, equally numbered, can be found in the black part.
The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

name: Kino-Quiz
description:
In which film, Ingrid Bergman and Gary Cooper look deep into your eyes? And what the homesickness takes place Scarlett O'Hara back again and again?

71 entertaining and educational riddles about movies. Three answers to each question. Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Circus Fun
description:
A novel target game. The target ,so-to-speak,is a clown holding up 5 hoops. Each hoop is worth points, the amount of points depends on the size of the hoops. The two smallest are worth 50 points each, the middle-sized hoop is worth 25 points and the two largest hoops are worth 10 points each.

To score these points you must launch the paper hat pieces one at a time. You place a hat on one end of a springboard in the shape of a clown. Hold down the end where the hat is and let go. The hat will be sprung forward, hopefully at the target. If it goes through a hoop you score the appropriate points.

The player with the most points when the game has to be finished, wins.

Klee made this game for the export market because they used their Clover logo on the rules (but the traditional Klee logo on the box. Klee is the German word for Clover).

name: Dam It!
description:
Players take the role of a beaver family trying to dam the river before any of their neighbors can do so. The first to dam the river wins!

In this fast paced, family friendly card game, players build their dam by using big log cards to build the base layer of their dam. Then they can add in some twig filler by playing twig filler cards. Finally it can be topped off with mud by playing the appropriate mud cards. When you use these building material cards, you then add cubes to you player mat, which represents your dam.

But watch out! Other players can attack your dam and damage it by playing stone, weeds, or felled tree cards! These attack cards cause you to lose cubes from your dam. But if you're lucky, you'll have some helpful beaver cards in your hand that can save the day. Using a Busy Beaver card you can add a few cubes to your dam, which gets you that much closer to winning!

This game is full of interaction and confrontation. Build your dam, damage your opponents. The first player to build their dam up and put all the necessary cubes on their player mat is the winner!

name: Fantasy Armies
description:
User Summary

Fantasy Armies is set of Generic Table Top Fantasy Wargames rules for 25/28mm fantasy miniatures.

The rules are to enable players to fight large battles or skirmish engagments with thier collections of fantasy miniatures. They was a set of core rules (game engine) which every set of miniatures rules needs which deals with elements like the characteristics of your troops, their weapons, their morale and how these affect their performance on the tabletop like how to resolve combat or will they run away.

Fantasy Armies was written by Nick Eyre for Harlequin/Icon Miniatures for their range of metal miniatures; "Fantasy Battles" and Lord of the Rings Miniatures ranges (probably written to replace thier earlier rules; Raven).

The rules was to be published in a series of articles in Harlequin/Icon Miniatures own house magazine; The One Ring. The core rules was to be published in three parts and the Army Lists would follow. The magazine only lasted 6 issues before the company change hands and the magazine was cancelled, so only the first two parts of the rules was published in issues 5 & 6.

name: Bier-Quiz
description:
Trivia game about beer.
66 questions with 3 answering variants for each question.
Answer correctly and get the card as a point.
If the deck is exhausted the player with the most points wins.

name: Das München-Quiz
description:
Trivia game about Munich, a capital and the largest city of the German state of Bavaria
71 questions with 3 variant to answer.
Answer correctly and get the card as a point.
If the deck is exhausted the player with the most points wins.

description:

71 questions with 3 variant to answer.
Answer correctly and get the card as a point.
If the deck is exhausted the player with the most points wins.

71 questions with 3 variant to answer.
Answer correctly and get the card as a point.

If the deck is exhausted the player with the most points wins.

71 questions with 3 variant to answer.
Answer correctly and get the card as a point.
If the deck is exhausted the player with the most points wins.

name: Sesame Street Mother Goose Audio Card Game
description:
This is a simple card game for preschool children with a cute gimmick... the package includes a cassette tape of the Sesame Street characters reading classic nursery rhymes.

Cards representing these nursery rhymes are distributed among the players. When the matching fairy tale (Humpty Dumpty, Jack Sprat, Old Mother Hubbard, etc.) is read by a character the kid holding that card tosses it away.

The children gain and lose cards during a session because the spinner is twirled when the stories appear on the tape. The player holding the Mother Goose card at the end of the game is declared the winner.

There are no decisions to be made and there is no strategy. This is a basic introduction to card games for three year old kids.

Includes 12 cards, spinner, cassette tape, plastic card holder,
and the rules.

Designed for 2-4 players.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Richtig wild
description:
Where does the Matter of the vulture? With these and many other questions on the topics of animals, plants and their habitats are engaged in this exciting trivia game.

There are 2 questions in each card with 3 answers for each questions. The winner is whoever can answer most questions correctly and thus can collect the most cards.
If the current player answers incorrectly the next player may risk with one of his collected card to answer it.

Contents:

32 large format cards with color photos

name: Natur macht erfinderisch
description:
Very often spectacular scientific inventions are based upon nature - the aeroplane, roof tiles, or the newest thing, the "lotus effect" - a dirt-rejecting ability that now is used for sinks. With the simple means of a dice/movement game those connection between nature and science are explored and explained. Players try to find as many logical connections between nature and science as possible, the board parcours has 5 kinds of spaces, which require different forms of problem solving to find a solution. Players roll the die, advance their pawn and solve the problem of the space they land on. For a correct solution players receive a bionic-chip, who has collected five of them, wins the game.

Would you know what a fly and a bicycle have in common? The gear shift in a bicycle was devised from the fly's shoulder joint.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Guerra aereo-navale
description:
The title of this wargame for kids, published in Italy in 1940, means "Air-Naval War".

The game board has identical red and blue territories on each end. The players follow a numbered line across the ocean to attack the other player based on a roll of the dice. Units can end up in the space which leads to combat. Each turn, each player must move one of their planes, submarines and ships (they have two of each in their starting armies), alternating until one of each unit type has moved. Players try to destroy each others units and bombard the enemy territory. This occurs when a unit ends its movement in an enemy occupied space. An airplane can bombard the wooden representations of the Fuel Dump, Ammo Dump, Rail Station, Bridge, Office, etc. and remove them as "booty". The units must always move in one direction (toward the enemy) until they reach the end of the path, at that point each unit is treated differently (planes fly backward to the first square and ships are immediately returned to the 1st square and start moving toward the enemy again).

The Mas (torpedo boat) is an exception, it can move in both directions and sink any ship or plane that enters its space (it is only available to a player after that player has lost 3 units).

The island in the middle can be captured and fortified. Victory occurs with one player destroys both enemy planes and half their ships. There are no land based units except for an anti-air cannon which is placed in any empty, friendly land space at the beginning of the game. It automatically destroys an airplane that ends it move in the same space. Strategy comes from the choice of units to move each turn and becomes more involved with the activation of the Mas units. It was released on June 10th, 1940, the day Italy enters World War 2.

name: Under Siege
description:
Under Siege is an abstract game played on a circular board by 2 players. One player attempts to move his King piece from the center and completely off the board. The other player attempts to capture the King piece.

Turn based play where pieces move one space per move and capture opposing pieces by moving onto the space occupied by the piece being attacked.

Special moves apply to the larger pieces, namely being able to 'Vault' other pieces of the same team effectively allowing movement of two spaces under specific circumstances.

The King piece cannot capture opposing pieces.

The numbers on each side are uneven, the 'Peasants' have 16 pieces (8 smaller, 8 Larger) while the 'Royalty' have the King and 12 pieces (8 smaller, 4 Larger). This is to balance the fact that the 'Peasant' pieces start the game spread completely around the board, while the 'Royal' pieces are grouped together in the center.

name: ParisSmarts
description:
From the manufacturer:

Become the Parisan expert with this question and answer game about one of the most romantice cities in the world, Paris. Filled with tons of information and guarateed to teach while you play, it's a great item for the traveler in all of us. Includes 60 questions, a Guide and a Scorepad in a sturdy flip top box.

name: Pinch It!
description:
Pinch It! is a simple dice game based primarily on luck. The game was intriguing since it was played using a 4x4 grid of pegs. The board is divided into four quadrants each having a different color. Within each quadrant is a 2x2 grid of pegs.

There is no significance to the grids. The gist is that every player has four pegs. You could just as easily play the game with each player having four rocks.

The die used is a six sided die with special markings which control the action of the player.


Either of the 2 "Blank" faces – The player’s turn is over and the die is passed to the next player.



"Hollow Square" face – The player discards one of his own pegs.



"Hollow Triangle" face – The player may take a peg from any player of his choice and discard it.



"Solid Square" face – The player may replace one of his empty peg holes with a discarded peg. If he doesn’t have any empty hole, then his turn is finished.



"Solid Square and Hollow Triangle" face - The player may replace one of his empty peg holes with a peg from any player of his choice. If he doesn’t have any empty hole, then his turn is finished.


The objective is to have the last peg on the board.

name: Bridge Building & Cross Over
description:
A pair of abstract games, made cheaply and aimed at children. Cross Over is a proper game, even adults will like it, but the rules for the Bridge Building game are completely indecipherable. So, I will only describe the Cross Over game.

Each player starts at opposite corners on the board. The object is to get one piece on to the opponents back corner (marked with an X on the board).

A die dictates distance of movement and you can only move a piece either horizontally or vertically. It would appear that you cannot change direction within the move. If you land on an opponent's piece, that piece is removed from the board. If a person has lost pieces and rolls a 6, he can bring on one of the lost pieces but only within his start field.

The game is magnetic with the two boards forming the top and bottom of a case and the pieces can be stored within that case.

name: HorseSmarts
description:
From the manufacturer:

Challenge your friends and family with this question and answer game made especially for horse enthusiasts everywhere. Complete with 100 questions covering breeds, health, history and work and play, this game will teach as you play by yourself, with multiple players or even in teams.

name: YogaSmarts
description:
From the manufacturer:

Challenge your friends, family and other yoga enthusiasts with this question and answer game made especially for the zen at heart. Complete with 100 questions covering styles, poses, stretches and the language of yogs, this game will teach as you play by yourself, with multiple players or even in teams.

name: Classic RockSmarts
description:
From the manufacturer:

Challenge your friends, family, band members, anyone with this question and answer game made especially for classic rockers everywhere. Complete with 100 questions covering rock stars, concerts, movies and groups, this game will teach as you play by yourself, with multiple players or even in teams.

name: Connexo
description:
This is the 4x4 version of the game Connex'Oh which uses a grid of 6x6 tiles and was also released by EdiGames.

2 players face each other across a large plastic board that contains a grid of 4x4 square plastic tiles. All tiles are divided into a black and white triangular half, with a landing space on each side for the playing piece of that color. Tiles have a handle stuck in the middle that enables them to be lifted up, twisted round and replaced without the risk of having pieces slip off. Both the black and white player have 4 stones of their respective colors that start on opposite sides of the board. All tiles initially face the same direction, so that no two touching sides have the same color and hence no "connections" exist on the board at the start of play.

By twisting tiles, players can create "connections" of identically colored halves, creating a corridor along which pieces of that color can progress. Each turn players either twist one tile in the aim to improve the available route, or move a stone along one of those routes. Players try to remove all stones in their color from the other side of the board. The first to do so is the winner. A tile that has just been lifted gets a red marker on it. It prevents that tile from being turned by the player who is next. Additionally, it also prevents 1 or 2 neighboring tiles from being turned, as long as a connection in that player's color was created to the neighboring tile(s) by the newly placed one. An elegant rule that prevents stalemates and adds another tactic to employ.

name: Literarisches Quiz 2
description:
Trivia about literature.

71 entertaining and educational riddles about movies. Three answers to each question. Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Literarisches Quiz
description:
Trivia about literature.

71 entertaining and educational riddles about movies. Three answers to each question. Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Literarisches Quiz Kinder- und Jugendbuch
description:
Trivia about literature for younger audience.

71 entertaining and educational riddles about movies. Three answers to each question. Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Krimi-Quiz 2
description:
Trivia game about crimes.

71 entertaining and educational riddles about movies. Three answers to each question. Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Oh Blondie!
description:
This game is based on the comic strip Blondie.

Contents:

Spinner with positions for Blondie, Dagwood, Alvin, Baby Dumpling, Mr. Dithers and Daisy.
Playing board for each of Blondie, Dagwood, Alvin, Baby Dumpling, Mr. Dithers and Daisy.
Paper chips used to mark positions on player's boards


The obect of the game is to score points based on play.

Each player's playing board has 12 positions on which he can mark a point. Imagine 4 corners of a square. Now on each side of the square there are two positions between the corners.

You can mark one of the positions on the card whose picture you spin. If you get 4 positions along a side you must say "Oh Blondie" to score points.

There are there are other ways to score points.

name: Boxing
description:
This game attempts to simulate a boxing match. Like a real boxing match the winner of each round is based on the number of points scored in that round. The winner of the game is determined by who wins the most rounds.

There are three spinners. The first spinner is used as a timer keeper to break each round into 6 parts (minutes:seconds) at 3:00, 2:30, 2, 1:30, 1 and 0:30.

The second spinner is used as such and indicates what happens with the punch. The third spinner is used as such too, and indicates the referee's decision when one is needed.

name: Fairyland
description:
Fairland is sort of a "Chutes and Ladders" type game played on a board of 100 spaces. However there is a significant twist. If you land on the bottom of a chute then you get some token to play to get by the top of the chute. For example:


At 9, you get meat to feed the lion
At 19 you get blinding powder to throw at the tiger
At 29 you must feed the pig a cabbage, but if you don't have a cabbage then you are sent back to space 4 to get one.


The requirement to have the token on some of the spaces generates a lot more "churn" than in a regular "Chutes and Ladders" game.

name: Dictionary, Please!
description:
This is a similar game to the well known Scrabble in that letters tiles are blind drawn and used to form words, and that the objective is to score points. However there are significant differences.

(1) The words are placed on table in a pool area rather than being in a crossword grid. So word two does not need to have a letter in common with word one.

(2) There are not points on the letters, but points are scored primarily based on the number of letters in the word.

(3) 350 letter tiles

(4) After each turn unused letters are put in a discard pool which subsequent players can used to make words.

name: Krimi-Quiz
description:
Trivia game about crimes.

71 entertaining and educational riddles about movies. Three answers to each question. Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Shakespeare-Quiz
description:

71 entertaining and educational riddles about movies. Three answers to each question. Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Pocket Quiz: Englisch Wortschatz
description: This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game for learning English. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Trivia, Word Game

71 entertaining and educational riddles about movies. Three answers to each question. Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Pop The Question: The 70s & 80s
description: A trivia game with a music theme. Players have to guess the identity of the solo artist or band described by the clues on a cards. Each card has 6 clues, which are revealed one by one, starting with the most obscure, and leading to the more obvious. The first player to correctly guess the artist or band described by the clues receives the card. The player with the most cards wins.

name: Pop The Question: The 70s & 80s Extra
description:
Add some extra cards for Pop The Question: The 70s & 80s.

Players have to guess the identity of the solo artist or band described by the clues on a cards. Each card has 6 clues, which are revealed one by one, starting with the most obscure, and leading to the more obvious. The first player to correctly guess the artist or band described by the clues receives the card. The player with the most cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Music, Trivia
