description: A trivia game with a music theme. Players have to guess the identity of the solo artist or band described by the clues on a cards. Each card has 6 clues, which are revealed one by one, starting with the most obscure, and leading to the more obvious. The first player to correctly guess the artist or band described by the clues receives the card. The player with the most cards wins.

name: Pop The Question Extra
description:
Add some extra card to Pop The Question Trivia game.

Players have to guess the identity of the solo artist or band described by the clues on a cards. Each card has 6 clues, which are revealed one by one, starting with the most obscure, and leading to the more obvious. The first player to correctly guess the artist or band described by the clues receives the card. The player with the most cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Music, Trivia

name: Pop The Question: The 50s & 60s
description: A trivia game with a music theme. Players have to guess the identity of the solo artist or band described by the clues on a cards. Each card has 6 clues, which are revealed one by one, starting with the most obscure, and leading to the more obvious. The first player to correctly guess the artist or band described by the clues receives the card. The player with the most cards wins.

name: Laivynas
description:
It's trading card game in which players are building their own fleets and then , using different captains, weapons and maneuvers, trying to beat each other.

At the start of game each player build their own fleets. Your fleet value could not be higher than 8.Each ship has different abilities, attack, defense and value. So you can build big fleet with a lot of weaker ships, small fleet with powerful ships or medium fleet with medium ships.

At the player turn he do these steps:

1. Draw 1 card
2. Choose flagship ( one ship which will be participating in battle)
3. Attack ( at this step, player must put captain card on the ship ( if that ship doesn't have captain yet). Each captain has different abilities and attack, defense values. After that players can use spacial cards to change their own attack and defense values. Attacker can use weapons and maneuvers, defender can use just maneuvers. When player don't want to use anymore cards, attacker attack value and defender defense value is compered. Player who has bigger value destroys opponent flagship)
4.End of the turn ( if attacker lost, he must assign new flagship and all destroyed ships,killed captains, used maneuvers and weapons are discarded)

First player to destroy all opponent's ships is the winner

name: Stak
description:
There are a number of methods of play, but basically your are stacking wooden sticks with a square cross section for points. Different colored sticks score different number of points.

There is a certain twist in that the stack of sticks is made on top of a cone with a flat top. The cone is high enough to guarantee that a falling stack of sticks will create a spectacular collapse!

The game came packaged in a can with metal ends and the sides made of paper.

name: Who's Afraid of the Big Bad Wolf
description:
Basically the game is very similar to the much better known game Pachisi. Each player is trying to move his pigs from his starting position around a race track and get them to the brick yard, which is "home" for the game.

There are some differences to the regular Pachisi game. There are only four safe spaces marked on the board. Also there are special spaces which tell a player to advance or to go back a certain number of spaces. Also there are only three pigs, not four.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture

name: New Game of Snake
description:
The game is a simple race game somewhat similar to the better known Chutes and Ladders game. To play you'd need two dice (or a tee totem according to the rules...), a distinct marker for each player, and the game sheet. Presumably only the game sheet was sold and the player would have to supply the other components.

The 122 spaces on the game board are marked out along a snake. The start is "through" the snakes mouth which requires a 2 to pass. Space 122 is at the tail.

The game board directs forwards and backwards movements as in Chutes and ladders. However there are many differences to the standard Chutes and ladders game. The winner must get past 122 to win. Landing on some squares entitles the player to two throws, or causes him to lose a turn. A player unlucky enough to land on space 119 loses the whole game!

name: Wohnopoly
description:
Promotional game for a house improvements company.

The board looks interesting, with a track around the edge of a house which has a wall taken away so that you can see workmen in every room.

The game itself is not so interesting, being a close relative of games like Ludo, Pachisi and Mensch. To spice it up, if you land on a brown square you get to draw a card and must follow the instructions.

The first player to get all four of their men home is the winner.

Football related card game. 56 cards featuring 21 different footballing terms.

Each player is dealt a hand of cards. The 'match' kicks off by the first player to have an Anstoß (Kick-Off) card. If no-one has such a card, each player in turn draws another card from the stack. This goes on until an Anstoß is drawn and played. Next player must play a card that is the logical action after the kick-off. A check list is provided so you can see which action card is acceptable. The game continues like this until one player runs out of cards. That player wins the round and the other players get a minus score depending on which cards they still have in their hand.

The player with the most points after an agreed number of rounds, wins.

name: Panzer World Galient: Simulation Game
description:
A tactical level wargame based on the Japanese robotech animation "Panzer World Galient".
Two editions of the game were published, in Dual Magazine #11 and 12. Each edition uses the same basic rules, but with different map and units.

Players control one or more Panzer Soldiers (the mecha name in this universe).
Each turn, players secretly fill out the log for their action pattern and movement plan. Then, they simultaneously resolve movement and combat. The combat includes fire and close combat.

This game does not contain any scenarios. In the basic game, each player use one Panzer Soldier and battles to destroy the opponent. A skilled player can handle more units for large-scale battles.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Willi wills Wissen: Tiere
description:
Topic: Animals, nature

The object is to be the first reaching target zone on the little game board by answering most questions correctly.
There are 2 question and 3 variants for each question on one side of the card. Currect player draws a card and hide the answers. Other players show answers simultaneously;
Players who answer correctly scores 1 point and move their pawns one point further on little game board.
If leading player moves upon a 'specail' space on the board: Last and second last Player run a 'Rock,Paper,Scissors' competition to make a step ahead.
Who finishes first on the game board is the winner.

name: The Warlord Games
description:
Warlord is a small set of rules and 5 different piece types that are used in a series of scenarios. Each scenario is a structured multi-move abstract strategy game of battle using a unique board and setup.

Armies of 30 - 35 pieces are commanded by half a dozen leaders, any 4 of which may be active in a turn. Active leaders may move themselves or any friendly piece within 2 squares that has not already moved.

Each of the 5 pieces has a different simple short range move, and each captures an enemy piece by legally moving onto the enemy square, stopping, then removing the enemy piece.

Win by capturing half of your enemy's leaders before half of yours are taken.

name: Steel Stars
description:
The Earth is a dead husk. Having mined all of its resources, facing a population many times that which could be possibly sustained and slowly mutating it into a massive, cloying, choking city, we had no choice but to set our greedy eyes on the planets around us and conquer new lands.

After the Information War of the 21st century, the Corporations dissolved national borders and began a new war of their own: the Resource War. Like their European ancestors, who conquered and fought over new land, the corporations started to clash for control of the stars around Earth, as if they had claims to them from the moment of their conception.

Thus began the new arms race, but this time the lessons learned from past wars would be embraced and used to leverage as much advantage as possible. Research into more advanced abilities to control not only the battles, but the hearts and minds of the people who fight them would become key to victory.

Steel Stars is a game of intergalactic warfare amongst rival corporations in Earth's dark future with a near endless number of system configurations and multiple paths to victory – through the council, through research of technologies and advanced abilities, via the creation of popular utopian worlds, or by the might of your powerful fleets.

Each player steps into the powerful and all encompassing shoes of the head of one of the five corporations fighting for the control of the universe. You will need to use cunning, guile, diplomacy, deception, and tactical thinking to make the decisions that will hopefully bring victory, control, renown, and respect to your corporation.

In each round of the game, players select four actions to perform. Players in turn perform one of these. Whenever an action is performed, all other players may also perform that action. The available actions are: Fleet (move ships), Research (develop tech), Council (Create votes on new rules), Planetary (develop your civilization), Energy (generate resources) and Logistics (build new ships). Players score points for colonising worlds, developing tech, building colonies, passing votes and developing their civilisation. The game ends when one player has accumulated 15 points, but that player does not necesarily win, as there are bonus points scored for being the best player in each of several categories.

description:

name: My Toy Shelf
description:
This is a sorting and matching game for young children.

The board is a 3-D toy shelf. Players are required to draw random tiles illustrated with pictures of toys. The tiles are crafted in geometric shapes, and certain cards require the placement of a triangle, a square, etc. The child must match the tile to the appropriate spot on one of the shelves. A squirrel named "Rascal" can appear on one of the cards to mess up the display. The first kid to complete a set is declared the winner.

Includes the 3-D shelf assembly, 12 shape cards, 13 toy cards, and the rules.

name: Pocket Quiz: Kopftraining
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with confusing and challenging puzzles to think and thinking around the corner. The backside of each card contains the answers.

Solve the puzzle first and get the card as a point. Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Tycoon 2: Industry!
description:
Welcome to Tycoon 2. Happy Industrializing!
This is the classic reiteration of the Monopoly so that it adds depth and fun to the game.. Happy Industrializing! Though it is a lot different than monopoly, but it is simple and elegant enough to understand the rules soon enough.

The goal of the game is to hold the maximum asset values at the end of specific rounds of the game. (a round is actually a month in the game, and so usually 6 - 12 rounds/ half -yearly or annual game)
Players will take the role of tycoons trying to maximize their growth potential by acquiring membership of cities of the world, purchasing ownership of industries, advanced industries and various services, playing the casino and making black money to aid their fundings, and finally, dominating the board to become the greatest tycoon of all times.

It has been named Tycoon 2 since this is the reinvention of the beta one named: Tycoon - The game, which had fewer elements.

This board game is not publicly available, it is hand made at home, using paper money and other stuffs from other board games. The cards were printed and pasted on standard playing cards, and everything else was printed and published manually. =

name: Schweine Schwarte Fliiiiiiiiiieg!
description: A kind of "Musical pig" game. It consists of a fluffy pig. When you press the belly, music will start to play. The players stand or sit in a circle and someone presses the pig's belly, then tosses the pig to another player who has to catch it and throw it to the next player as fast as possible. The player who holds the pig when the music stops is out. Continue play until only one player remains. That player is the winner.

name: CityProGame Nürnberg
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Nürnberg each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.

name: CityProGame Karlsruhe
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Karlsruhe each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

name: Orc Raiders
description:
Prosper the best way orcs know how ... RAID!

Each player controls a village of orcs led by a Shaman, Chieftain and Warlord. Each round, players take turns playing a secret number of orc grunts with one or more leaders in various regions. Raiding the human mines, forest camps, farms and port city provide resources and honor points. Attacking other orc villages provides honor points and mucks with the opponents' plans. Placing in one's own village allows the building of defenses, increasing population or training your leaders.

The game ends when the resource decks run out. The player with the most honor points wins.

name: Pocket Quiz: Denkolympiade
description:

High performance sport for your brain: Clever puzzles, lateral thinking, concentration exercises, puzzles, logical thinking.

description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with puzzles to solve. The backside of each card contains the answers.

Give your mind a couple of workouts! Logic puzzles, 3D functions, word games, memory training and quizzes will prepare the mind and improve your memory and concentration skills! The ultimate fitness workout for the mind!

Solve the puzzle first and get the card as a point.
Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Puzzle, Trivia, Word Game

name: Pocket Quiz: Impressionismus
description:

Test your knowledge on the subject of Impressionism! Everything to know about the most famous painters of this period and your world-famous works.

Answer the question correctly first and get the card.
Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Die Mix-Max-Piraten
description:
There are 20 illustrated cards with body parts of a pirates and 20 text cards. Now we have to roll the dice, take a word card, properly read and look closely: Should it be the pirate with a mustache or beard with? With sabers or with the saw? With this fun card game to practice first-graders to read and understand exactly what has been read correctly.
Be the quickest the recognize the illustrated card.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Pirates, Word Game

name: Undead Jungle
description:
This game is a turn-based multiplayer adventure game featuring all the excitement of an adventure through the jungle with the added intensity of bloodthirsty zombies! A humerus board games that is simple and appropriate enough for the whole family to play, and strategic enough for any gamer to enjoy. In undead jungle players must battle their way through Dr. Manvils treacherous jungle watching out for zombies, bees, hippos, a tiger, and much more.
In Undead jungle players will be taking turns fighting their way through the jungle, during a players turn they will spend one of their four action points to do a number of things including attacking other players or jungle terrors, climbing trees for safety, scouring the land for item cards, and racing toward Dr. Manvil's sword. Once every player has used their actions the first player *Which alternates* draws a jungle event card. On the jungle event cards are both good and bad events. Animals and zombies move, items are found and lost, and much more. Once the jungle event card has been done, pass the first player token and repeat. The object of the game is to arrive back to Dr. Manvil's laboratory with his sword.

name: Take Off
description:
The object of the game is to collect a set of route cards between New York City and San Francisco. So going from east to west the set would be New York, Cleveland, Omaha, Salt Lake City, and San Fransisco. A player can play a "Motor Trouble" or a "Land For Gas" card on his opponent's stack to force the other player to play a "Take Off" before he can resume his route.

The 32 cards are New York (4), Cleveland (4), Omaha (4), Salt Lake City (4), and San Francisco (4). In addition there are 6 "Take Off" cards, 2 "Motor Trouble" cards, and 4 "Land for Gas" cards.

name: Mucki Maulwurf gräbt sich durch!
description:
Objective: be the first reaching the target

- acting/moving by turn -
roll the die and use points to move your meeple and/or dig
- one point per movement/digging;
digging means => put slides on the board or move/turn them;
players may start with a certain no. of obstacles (danger cards - max. 6) which are going to spoil movement.

name: Mensch pass auf
description:
Objective: be the first to reach the target (field 48)

- moving by turn -
roll the die, move your meeple & follow instructions of the field you land on..
Equipment: board, 6 (hard working) meeples, 2 dice
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Industry / Manufacturing, Racing
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Game (1990)
description:
Checkers meets blackjack.

The goal is to get a game piece to the other side of the board, and score as close to 21 as possible without busting. Pieces can only with forward, with the exception of the Ace, which can also move backwards. If you have the opportunity to jump a piece, you are required to jump it.

name: Das Wissensduell: Rekorde
description:
This is a trivia game with questions about records.
The game includes 100 cards with 100 Questions and answers (on the back side) and four clips in four colours used as player markers.

Players have to estimate facts for questions. There are always 10 different possible answers. There is a clip for each player to mark their answers on the card. Each spot with an answer can only be taken by one player. When all players made their estimations the card is flipped to the backside with the answer. The player with the correct answer or is closest to it gets the card. If theres a tie the next question/card is worth two cards (the old tied card and the next new card).
The first player with 7 cards is the winner.

name: Crossing Pawns
description:
In this abstract board game, players alternate placing white and black pawns on a 4x4 grid. After each player has placed 7 pawns, a red pawn is placed on one of the two remaining spaces. The players then move their pawns, trying to get four pawns in a row across the board. The first person to get four pawns in a row wins.

This game is one of two original board games published as part of a "Free Printable Board Games" article by the Love2Know website in July 2012.

description:

Each spot with an answer can only be taken by one player. When all players made their estimations the card is flipped to the backside with the answer. categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Prehistoric, Trivia

name: Olympic Rowing
description:
Statistical sport replay game on the sport of rowing, covering all rowing events in the Olympic games from 1972 to 2008. Hundreds of rowers are rated.
The game system, strictly for solitaire replay kind of play, left only a limited space to randomness: each event has an average time and player roll dice for each competitors to see how he/she/they fare against the others and the average final time. Each competitors sum up the modifiers obtained through four different dice roll to see the final result.

name: Das Wissensduell: Der Menschliche Körper
description:

Players have to estimate facts for questions. There are always 10 different possible answers. There is a clip for each player to mark their answers on the card. Each spot with an answer can only be taken by one player. When all players made their estimations the card is flipped to the backside with the answer. name: The Last Slice
description:
This pizza-themed educational board game teaches fractions. There are seven pizzas on the table, with each pizza divided into a different number of slice pieces. Each player has a hand of four cards numbered between 1 and 8. Players use the cards to construct fractions and claim slices of pizza.

If player takes the last slice of a pizza, that player receives a "Yum!" counter. When all the pizza slices are taken, the player with the most "Yum!" counters wins.

This is one of two original board games published in July 2012 by the Love2Know Website as part of a "Printable Board Games" article.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Math, Print & Play

name: Suffragettes In and Out of Prison
description:
Rules from game itself:

Directions for playing the Great Suffragette game:
"HOW TO GET OUT OF GAOL"

The suffragettes (i.e. the card disks) are first placed on the inner circle. (Holloway Goal).

The players alternately throw the dice, and at each throw the player moves his Suffragette round the spiral course, the same number of spaces as the number thrown.

Should a number be thrown which would bring a suffragette on to a space marked with either of the undermentioned words, she must be move as directed, viz. :-

"OPEN DOOR" The suffragette must be placed on the adjoining space in the next circle further away from the goal.

"POLICEMAN" or "WALL" The suffragette must be placed on the adjoining space in the next circle nearer to the goal.

"WARDRESS" The suffragette must be put back in Holloway Gaol and recommence her journey.

The player whose Suffragette first reaches the end of the spiral course wins the game. As a puzzle, the problem is to see what is the fewest number of throws you can get your Suffratette out of goal, following the same rules as for the game.

name: Pocket Quiz: Optische Illusionen II
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

Try to solve the puzzle first and find out what is hiding behind the optical illusions to get the card.
Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Pocket Quiz: IQ-Training
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. Pocket IQ quiz contains 50 training exercises and solutions to puzzles, Dice, rates, lateral thinking and After. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

Solve the task first and get the card.
Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Panic! card game
description: From the box. A wild and frantic speed game that everyone plays at once. The game is described and a great party and family fun game based on the fast style of play. It is a race to get rid of all cards by playing onto a center stack. Teams or individuals play provides hours of exciting family & party fun. 3 decks of 168 cards numbered 1-12 in 3 colors. Game can be played in teams or individually. All 3 decks are shuffled individually then passed, 5 cards dealt up and 12 cards dealt down. Then panic begins. As each card face up is played, it is replaced by one of the 12 down card. This continues until all 17 cards are played and the first player out of cards yells panic. But remember it takes a #1 card to start a stack. Then the cards are separated by team color and scored as per the instructions. The first team to reach 200 is the winner.

name: Plumage
description:
From the rules
"A domino type game, consisting of 49 card depicting seven species of birds, in which the Males (M) and Females (F) differ in their plumage. The game is played by identifying and matching the correct males and females. There is also one card for each species depicting the Young (Y)."

The game is played in a traditional domino manner except you are matching male and female pairs, and you are able to add a young below a 'paired' male and female (in which case you are able to take an extra turn). The winner is the first player to get rid of all the cards in his hand, or if the pack becomes exhausted and no one can 'go' the player with the least cards wins.

The cards have realistic artwork depicting the birds in a style similar to a bird reference book.

There is also another game variant included in the rules, called 'Bridges' which is for two players, and involves players creating columns of matching pairs of the same species or families of the same species, and bridges between the two players columns. Points are awarded for creating 12 card columns, and for creating bridges between columns. Games continue until one player has scored 30 points.

name: Segelfliegen
description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line (field 50)
learn more about flying a glider
- moving by turns/simple 'Roll and Move' game -

meeples are moved according the die roll;
ending on a marked space follow instructions..

remarks:
published between 1939 - 45 (see logo)
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Sports

name: Pointzy
description:
Roll 5 dices and try to achieve the highest score. The rolls are entered in a 5x5 sheet, and the score is the points on the dice. Later in the game the rolls have to match the numbers already in the protcol. After 10 turns (5 horisontal lines and 5 vertical lines)
the highest score wins

name: Chess-kers
description:
A Checkers variant played with red/white reversible pieces, five to each player, on a 6 x 7 grid of red, white, and blue squares. The rules on the back of the box include three variants of the game.

Each player starts on either narrow side of the board; the objective is to capture all the opponent's pieces to win. Movement of the pieces is dictated by the color of the square which each piece is on. Pieces are captured by landing on them, turning them over, and placing them on the capturing player's side of the board. The three variants have slightly different rules to increase difficulty of winning.
publishers: The Game Crafter, LLC, Van Elk Enterprises

name: Happy Digits Creativity
description:
Promotional board game as an award for "Happy Digits" premium customers of T-D1.

Communicative game with many notions about telecommunications and mobile communications and also on general topics. The terms are either paraphrased, pantomime presented or drawn. In the category of "Creativity" creative brainstorms are exchanged.

6 game figures, 4 x 33 cards, one die, 1 set of instructions

The first print run was limited to 5,000 copies.

name: Biene Maja Spiel
description:
Promotional board game for children of the Nuremberg insurance policyholders. Illustrations and game pieces are in the design of "Biene Maja".

The game features two games in one:   A classic "Ludo", which is named "Biene Majas Wiesenrennen" ("Bee Maja meadow race") here, and a running game about the company's junior breakdown cover, where the children have to safeguard themselves against hazards   and at the end of the game to have as much money as possible.

Includes: double-sided game plan at 360 x 360mm,   16 pieces (4 pieces per style), 1 dice, 33 green event cards, 33 red hazard maps, 85 insurance policies, 150 play money bills

The print run was limited to 5,000 copies.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Backtivity
description:
Two to six players must illustrate a lot of baking-specific terms through pantomime, drawing or describing them. The other players have to guess the words. It is not quite as easy to define Donauwelle, mime yeast, or draw rye bread, so this can become quite adventurous and funny.

Game Contents: 1 game board, which illustrates the genesis of a bread from the wheat fields to the bakery, 99 action cards, 6 pawns, 1 game instructions

name: Pocket Quiz: Englisch Grammatik
description:

name: DungeonRaid
description:
DungeonRaid is a new fantasy deck-building game designed to capture the charm and atmosphere of the console RPGs of days long gone.

The game begins with a small card draft to determine starting equipment. Then, in a classic Deck-building fashion, players purchase weapons, armor, and spells in turn and use them to fight monsters and bosses; all of which come into the supply randomly. Used equipment cycles back through the deck as it needs to be repaired and the player's goal is to collect the most wealth from the Dungeon while at the same time trying not to be the first to get killed.

"Staged" levels of difficulty increase the challenge at regular intervals and also introduce improved Treasure to the supply. This aspect also makes the game highly expandable, and gives it immense replay value.

(Tentatively) Recommended for 2-5 players, but solitaire play will be an option.

[This game is still in development, and development is currently on hold. Release date is yet unknown.]

name: The Web
description: The board is a web with holes in the intersections. The pieces are pegs that have numbers printed on them. Each peg can move the number of spaces printed on it. Some pieces can land on other pieces and remove them from the game. Each player moves their pieces along the web aiming to get their pieces to the opposing player's start space. the piece is then put into the player's safe zone. The winner of the game is the player that gets the most pieces into the safe zone.

name: Pocket Quiz: Teekesselchen für Fortgeschrittene
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 100 word puzzles. The backside of each card contains meanigs of the words and additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

In this game there are words to solve what have multiple meanings.

name: Pocket Quiz: Gehirnakrobatik
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with ultimate knowledge-check! Test your skills when it comes to mental gymnastics. The backside of each card contains the answers.

Solve the puzzle first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

"Brain acrobatic" in English

name: Pocket Quiz: Bilderrätsel
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with creative thinking puzzles. The backside of each card contains the answers.

Solve the puzzle first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

"Picture-puzzle" in English

name: Pocket Quiz: Rebus-Rätsel
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with creative thinking puzzles. The backside of each card contains the answers.

Solve the puzzle first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

name: Pocket Quiz: Geh-Hirn-Training
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with confusing and challenging puzzles to think and thinking around the corner. The backside of each card contains the answers.

Solve the puzzle first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

"Brain-training" in English

name: Pocket Quiz: Mehr Gehirnjogging
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with mental exercises. The backside of each card contains the solutions.

Solve the exercises first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

Test your skills on the subject of more brain training! Confusing and challenging puzzles to think and thinking around the corner.

name: Das Energie Quiz
description:
62 exciting issues from politics, history, geography and science.

In player's turn his left neighbor reads aloud a question.
If he answer corretly he receives one point and must answer another question. Otherwise, the next player has a turn. The winner is whoever has accumulated the most points at the end.

name: Grandma's Game of Knots and Whys of Science
description:
Question and answer game where each player is trying to answer the most questions correctly. Similar to McLoughlin's Gandmama series of games.

This game had 199 question cards, an answer book, and a set of instructions in the box.

name: Grandmama's Old Testament Questions & Answers
description:
In the 1860's the McLoughlin Brothers introduced a successful series of educational card games under the name "Grandmama's XXX Game." The first series included card games on Arithmetic, Geography, Riddles. and Useful Knowledge.

One player was designated the "preceptor" and the other players were "scholars." The preceptor would ask questions and go around the players until someone got the question right. Most right answers wins.

"Grandmama's Old Testament Questions & Answers" card game had 100 question cards, an instruction sheet, and an answer booklet which were packaged in a paper covered cardboard box.

name: Johnny on the Pony
description:
The game is basically a children's race game with no decisions. In this regard it is like Chutes and Ladders. The theme is riding your pony from start to the finish line.

There is a twist on the Chutes and Ladders type game. There are two card decks from which a player may get a move card on his turn. However the player must flip a supplied "coin" to see if he gets a card from the Johnny stack or the pony stack. having each player flip a coin would thus make "individual" luck come into play as opposed to both players just playing against a randomized deck.

The game had 4 riders and horses. It cam in a cardboard box that was somewhat like a pizza box.

name: Giant Wheel Old Maid Game
description: Basically this is a children's game which is a combination of Bingo and Old Maid. Instead of doing a blind draw, each player spins a wheel on his move to determine which picture to cover up on his 'bingo" card. If he spins the Old Maid, then he takes possession of the Old Maid token. When the first player completes his card, then whoever is holding the old Maid marker loses.

name: Giant Wheel Picture Bingo
description: Basically a Bingo game with a "spin." The six 4x4 playing boards are printed onto a large roll-up mat. Rather than a blind draw, on his turn each player spins a wheel to find the picture he can cover up. First person to complete a line of 4 wins. on his board wins.

name: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang  Movie Quiz
description:
This was a licensed game with a tie to the movie of the same name. It had Dick Van Dyke on the box top. It is essentially a movie trivia game.

Sheets of questions are supplied, and the player gives an answer then completes the circuit to show the correct answer for that question by turning on a light.

name: Rat Patrol Spin-To-Win
description:
Each player has a top to spin on the board which has holes. When a player's top lands in a hole he scores points. The player gets four spins per turn.

Two ways to win. First on total points. the first player to reach 400 points wins.

Second way to win is score points in each turn for one of the four weapons ( anti-aircraft gun - 25 pts, gun truck - 10 pts, plane - 50 pts, and tank - 75 pts) to capture. First player to capture all four weapons wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, World War II

name: Our Defenders
description: Rules state - "Our Defenders Game can be player by two, three, and four players. Each players selects a different cutup figure [ie 1 of 4] and separates same. The first player spins spinner. If it points to figure he selected, he takes one cutup part of figure. Next player spins and plays in same manner. If spinner points to a figure other than the one selected, player loses his turn. The game is continued in this manner until one player has completed his figure. The First player completing his figure is the winner."

name: Bonkan
description:
In Bonkan, players are explorers traveling through ruins and looking for anything they can find. Players will discover both artifacts and traps, then must decide to go on exploring or escape.

Every round, each player decides to continue or exit the expedition. If you choose to continue, you draw a card. Items found have weights, from heavy treasures to lighter artifacts (which are useful against traps). Each player that continues has to contend with this accumulating weight. Disasters and traps also come up in play, and a player can get stuck in the cave if they get too heavy or get stuck in a trap. Players who don't make it out score nothing for their treasures.

At the end of the game round, the player with the most points wins.

name: New York Quiz & Trivia
description:
New York Quiz is a game for anyone who has ever visited New York City, or dreams of doing so! With 170 tricky questions and fascinating facts about the Big Apple, everyone will find something to tickle their brain cells with. It's the perfect way to warm up to a coming New York trip, or remember it once you are back home.

There are 2 question in each card and answers on backside.
Player who answers correctly first gets the card as a point.

name: Electric Tipsy Towers
description: Dexterity game where the players are trying to build a tower out of wooden beams. The "twist" on the "normal" game is that the tower is built on a rotating turntable. Whoever knocks any part of the tower down loses.

name: Star Confrontations: Alliance War Host
description:
From the Introduction:

The Alliance War Host army book requires the Star Confrontation rules book in order to play. The Alliance War Host uses a few extremely powerful warriors in battlesuits to dominate the battlefield. Their advanced battlesuits make each troop incredibly deadly and tough as nails.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Siegreich voran!
description:
Victorious advance!

A new game from our Air Force by H. Kallenberger from the collection "Scholz's artistic games".

This game is adapted from real live and provides a fairly accurate picture of the use of air power. In it the combat units (bombers) are used to advance far into the enemy rear. These are heavy machines, suitable for carry large bomb loads over long distances.

The goal is to destroy the HQ of the opponent by hitting it with a bomber(only a bomber). Play also ends if the one of the player's HQ's has no place to move or if the player has lost all his bombers.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: Uprising
description:
From the game page on The Game Crafter

For too long the Meeples have lived under the boot of the mighty Regime. You have been pushed around and mistreated while the Regime grows rich off your toil. No longer! The day has come to rise up and take control of your fate. The day has come for Uprising!

Uprising is a semi-cooperative game for 2-4 players who take the role of rebel groups rising up against the vicious Regime. Will you be able to work together to overthrow your oppressors, or will you turn on the others to try to become number one?

Summary of Game Play

The board is a grid, where each cell ("sector") can be controlled by a player, by the regime, or by nobody. Each turn, players draw tiles indicating where they can take actions, such as attacking or reinforcing. After all the players have taken their turns, the regime takes 3 automated actions in random sectors. Each battle can be fought with military power, or with popularity.

The game ends when any player (or the regime) reaches a target score, based on popularity and sectors controlled. At that point, the force with the highest score wins, and if the regime is highest, all the players lose. In the standard rules, players can directly attack each other or temporarily align with the regime. There is a fully-cooperative variant, where players face a stronger regime.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chit-Pull System, Cooperative Game

name: Tele Test
description: Similar electroni game than Electro but instead of questions-answers there are pictures. The two plug are connected to each end of the battery and when the plugs are placed on the two points that are connected (i.e. the pair of pictures belonging together) the lamp will shine to indicate this.

name: Electro Comic
description:
Electronic battery operated matching game has 10 different pages to play. When you match one picture on one side of the page to a picture on the other side of the page with the electric wands, a red light lights up at the bottom of the game to show that you are correct.

Player with the most correct answers is the winner.

name: Exercises Snake Game
description:
Exercises Snake Game is a gambling game. Players would put up stakes (money) to play and then divide the stakes according to the outcome of the game.

The game notes that it is "to be played with a tee-totum, or with dice."

The game has a snakes with number 1 near head and number 54 near the tail. The snake is laid out in s curves along the vertical direction. he sections of the snake are in different colors to show Charles Magnus' printing ability. The page is also decorated with men exercising for the same purpose. They have no absolutely no function in the game.

The special positions on the snake are colored red and are have special instructions.

2 - Gives the player two throws more
9 - 1 more throw
20 - Go back to No. 4
27 - Advance to 32.
33 - 1 more throw
40 - Gives the player one-half of all the stakes
46 - Stop for the next turn
52 - The player has lost and must cease to play
52+ - Those who throw over 52 divide the balance
of the stakes


More to "More"

This particular image found on the web was a sheet of paper which had the game on one side and a handbill advertising Charles Magnus' wares on the other. The handbill side indicates that this is one of 12 such games printed on a paper sheet and available for purchase.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kopfball
description:
Abstract two player game with a soccer theme. The player that scores more goals than the other after an agreed time wins.

Each player has a team consisting of 11 figures. The playing field consists of 83 spaces with connections between them. On each space there can only be one figure or the ball.

On each turn a player can kick the ball in a straight line if he has a player next to the ball and move one of his 11 figures one space. If a player cannot kick the ball he can move two figures one space each (or one figure twice).

There are some more rules like fouls, passing or kicking the ball over an opposing figure.

name: Ein Tag auf dem Lande
description:
Objective: Be the first moving up to field 108
- moving by turn -
throw the die and move according rolled number; ending on a marked space follow instructions glued on cover inside.

name: X-It
description: A dice and card game for two to four players. In your turn, you roll the dice and if you roll a total on one of your cards, you can discard it. If a player is dealt an "X-IT" card, it may be used as a wild card, i.e., 1 to 6. First to discard all their cards, wins. X-IT cards held by the losers, count as 6 points, other cards as at face value.

name: Think Trunk
description:
Think Trunk is the perfect group and party game. Its unique game play allows for everyone to be involved on every turn.

There are 5 different categories on each card: Think It, Number It, Act It, Prefer It, and Wing It. All 5 categories encompass and expand on current games on the market but are adapted for multi-player input without teams.

The object of the game is to be the first player to get to the end and a single round takes 20-30 minutes.

name: Die Reise durchs Märchenland
description:
Objective: Be the first moving up to field 80
- moving by turns -
throw the die and move according rolled number; ending on a red marked space follow instructions.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Novel-based, Racing

name: Gänseliesel
description:
Objective: Be the first moving up to field 70
- moving by turn -
throw the die and move according rolled number; ending on a red marked space follow instructions.

name: Eine Fahrt durch den Spreewald
description: Objective: Be the first moving up to field 100- moving by turn - throw the die and move according rolled number; ending on a marked space follow instructions.

name: London Bridge
description:
London Brodge is a simple marble shooting game for points. "London Bridge" in this case is a pasteboard picture of the bridge with four arches. From left to right the arches score 1, 4, 3, and 2 points.

From the box top:

Directions
Place the Bridge on the floor with the supports behind.
The game is for each player to shoot the marbles in turn, those passing under the arches score the number thereon.
The player making the highest score wins.

name: ROLLA-STRIKE
description:
The world's first 14 sided bowling ball.

The fascinating Tetrakaideccahedronnocube... Just call me "TET."

There are 10 frames to each game and the player who has the highest score at the end wins. Each player has to complete frame 1 before the play moves on to frame 2 and so on. Maximum score per two rolls is 10. A spare is 10 points. A white dot on the first roll counts as a strike and no second roll is taken. It is pretty straight forward.

Equipment sold as a unit for playing a game simulating bowling by TET Leisuretime Concepts, Inc. in Arcadia, CA, 91006.

Similar games:

Bowling Dice
Bowl and Score
Bowl-A-Strike
Spare Time Bowling

name: Tierpark Spiel
description:
Objective: Be the first moving up to field 60
- moving by turn -
throw the die and move according rolled number; ending on a marked space (15x) follow instructions.

name: Von München durch Oberbayern nach Tirol
description:
Objective: Be the first moving up to field 43 (round trip)
- moving by turns -
throw the die and move according rolled number; ending on any image follow instructions glued on cover inside.
remarks: game belongs to the series: "Scholz' künstlerische Spiele" with very nice graphics/images;
as usual - cute pewter figures
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: BrainBox: Boston
description:
As with the other BrainBox games, the object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

This BrainBox, as the title suggests, is Boston-themed.

name: House Party
description:
Objective: be the first climbing up from a treehouse to a dream house
- acting by turn -
roll the die (1d6) and move forward on a circuit (containing 20 spaces); throwing a 'joker' (relaces a '6') ==> free choice (1-5); the field you may end on challenge you to:
1. 'house party': pantomine, acting... scoring within 1 min. max.
2. 'sudden inspiration': a given term forces you and the team putzing one word down in writing - scoring if you are matching..
3. 'have a guess': a given question ==> guess how many people will answer with a 'yes'
4. 'cheatery': a story is read aloud and you must jugde if true or not
5. 'big deal': you can score 2 x, but if you fail you loose 1 x
successful? ==> you gain one component; 3 components let you move forward from tree to dream...
remarks:
promotional 'Wüstenrot' (home loan bank) edition with elements out of 'Activity', 'Roller Coaster Hippo'...
categories: Card Game, Dice, Humor, Party Game, Racing, Word Game

name: Quiz mit Pfiff
description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line (100)
- acting by turn -
throw both dice (1d6 & 5-coloured+joker one):
colour defines the question card to draw
number determines the question to answer and - if correct - spaces to move forward;
starting from a pink space (luck) you may double allowed distance;
starting from a risk space you must move back if answer is wrong;
the very last (coloured) spaces must be taken step by step (no jump), card to be drawn determined by colour (no die).

name: Grips and Gaffers
description:
The film is over budget. The script is late. There are only three days left of filming. Your team of grips and electricians must scramble to film as many scenes as possible before production wraps! Don’t worry, though: “We’ll fix it in post.”

In Grips & Gaffers, you are responsible for a production unit filming footage for a movie. Your film set is a "puzzle" in which you attempt to slide the cameras, lights, and director around the board to match the needs of one of the scenes to be filmed. At the same time, every other player is racing to film the same scenes. If they get there first, you may be out of luck; you can only film a scene if the actors aren't busy on another set. Sometimes it might be necessary to film when the set is "close enough," rather than taking the time to earn a bonus for a perfect setup.

Time is of the essence! Every camera movement advances your Gaffer pawn on the time track, while lighting changes advance your Key Grip pawn. The player whose pawn is at the rear of the track moves next, so being efficient—and balancing the amount of work your grips and your electricians do—is key to your filmmaking success!
mechanics: Grid Movement, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Tabaluga: Die Eisperlen
description:
Objective: flip most of your pearls into opponents area
- acting by turn/2 players or 2 teams -
create 2 equal areas;
each player flips a pearl (of 10) into opponent's area (crossing own area);
move a pearl only once, but bumping (like curling) to optimize position is allowed; pearls outside the 2 areas are out of game.

remarks: Tabaluga is a cartoon character created by Peter Maffay, Rolf Zuckowski, Gregor Rottschalk, Helme Heine
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Wuselpicknick Das clevere Umweltspiel
description:
Objective: be the first distributing your invitations and solving your quests
- acting by turn -
draw your quest cards first;
throw the die - move fore- or backwards (if there isn't any obstacle like a garbage bin);
ending on a marked space perform required action in order to get rid of one of your quests/invitation card
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Racing

name: Hidden Rules
description:
A game for three or more secret-keeping rule enforcers.

Each player gets a secret rule at the start of the game. All rules are in play – including the ones you don’t know. It’s up to the person who has the rule to enforce it or not. Your goal is to be the first player to accumulate 3 points. The best way to do this is by learning the secret rules of the game faster than the other players and taking tricks.

You Need:
A standard Poker deck (Jokers removed)
A Hidden Rules trigger deck (available on the game's website)
A Hidden Rules action deck (available on the game's website)
Paper and pencil to track scores (optional, but recommended)

The basic game is played in tricks. The dealer begins the first trick of the game; after that, each trick begins when the last player to take a trick takes the top card of the deck, places it face-up on the table, and announces its value. Starting with the player to his or her left, and proceeding clockwise, each player must play a card from his or her hand on the trick, calculate the sum of all cards in the trick, and announce the sum.

Card Values: 2 through 10 are worth their face value. Aces are worth 1 or 11 (declared when played). Jacks are worth 0 points, Queens are worth -2 points, and Kings are worth -4 points.

If the sum is less than 21, play continues normally. If you bring the sum to exactly 21, you take the trick. If you push the sum over 21, the player to your right takes the trick, for forcing you to exceed 21. When you take a trick, add one to your score, and gather the cards from the trick into a pile face-down in front of you. Once taken, the cards from a trick may not be looked at.

All hidden rules are also in play. Each combination of a trigger and an action is a rule. It’s up to you to enforce (or not) a rule that you know about. When you enforce a rule, you must give the person information to indicate in what way their action violated the rule. The information you provide must be more specific than the violation. If you violate a rule, take back the card you played (if applicable), lose a point, and your turn ends (if it’s your turn).

For example, trigger #13 says, “When you play a card that makes the total exactly zero…” and action #5 says, “…Name a Peanuts character that hasn’t been named previously this game before you announce the sum of the trick.” If I make the total 0 and don’t say anything, you can make me take back my card and say, “You didn’t say a name.” The next time I make the total 0, If I say, “Neil Armstrong,” you can correct me again and say, “Neil Armstrong isn’t fictional.”

The first player to end a round with 3 or more points more wins.

This game owes a lot to the children’s “folk game” Mao.

name: Birthday Party, Cheesecake, Jelly Bean, Boom!
description:
A very, very lightweight trick-taking game for three to six R.E.M. fans.

Goal: End the game with the most points. Do this by being the last player to play on a trick. Look out for Boom! cards – they’ll make all the points go away!

You Need:


A Birthday Party, Cheesecake, Jellybean, Boom! (BPCCJBB) deck (available on the game's website)


If you’re starting a trick, you must play a Birthday Party. If you can not start with a Birthday Party, show your hand to the player on your right or left and let play pass to the next player, who must start the trick.

On your turn you may play a card or pass. If you pass on a trick you may still play later on the same trick.

If you want to play a card, look at the top card of the trick:


If the top card is a Birthday Party, you may play a Birthday Party or a Cheesecake.
If the top card is a Cheesecake, you may play a Cheesecake or a Jelly Bean.
If the top card is a Jelly Bean, you may play a Jelly Bean or you may play a Boom! and set all the cards in the trick aside, out of play.


If you run out of cards, immediately draw up to five cards. If the deck runs out of cards, it’s out of cards. No cards for you!

If you play on a trick and play comes all the way around to you and no one else has played on the trick, you take the trick. Put all of the cards in the trick in your score pile.

When you take a trick or Boom! a trick, you must start the next trick.

If it’s the end of a trick and the deck is out of cards, the game is over. Put any cards in your hand in the score pile of the player on your right.

Winning: Sum the points on the cards in your score pile. If you have the most points, you win!

name: Tabaluga: Das Drachenbergrennen
description:
Objective: score most winning points climbing up the hill (Drachenberg) with your team of 3 (coloured) meeples
- moving by turn -
roll the die & make up your mind who of your team should move forward; up to your choice: step out, jump or kick out on your way to the top - collecting winning points by adding the position of all your meeples;
game ends after one figure has reached the peak.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Tabaluga Die eisige Aufgabe
description:
Objective: be the first rendering ice maker machines harmless
- acting by turn -
use 2 coloured dice to block (evil) ice maker machines;
very similar (risky) concept like 'Can't Stop' moving your markers to the top; if you save your current position ==> new starting points during your next turn; if you fail you loose what you'd accomplished during your current turn.

remarks:
belongs to Schmidt series: 'Nimm-mich-mit-Spiele'

name: Tabaluga: Auf der Suche nach den Weltraumsteinen
description:
Objective: Find your (coloured) 2 (correspondent) slides (memory) and move your meeple upon to gather them; move further to your (coloured) target space ending the game.
- acting/moving by turn -
Each player throws the die moving forward & uncovering 2 slides:
wrong colour ==> flip them again; right: try (during your following turns) finding the correspondent one. If lucky move upon and grasp it/them (but avoid stepping upon an - additional - quest card, which spoils your further movement).

name: Tabaluga: Rettet Grünland
description:
objective: gather as few as possible of those 'snow-tiles';
- acting/moving by turn -
active player throws the die & moves forward;
if there is no land inside of the race track ==> uncover a slide: Green? ==> place it upon a snowy region; White? ==> keep it (penalty point)
if there is another player and/or green land you end on - nothing happens;
if there is another player with less penalty points: turn over a white (penalty) slide;
game ends if there is 'green' all over inside - player with less penalty slides wins

name: Schwein Gehabt?
description: A simple dice game where You must complete animals (rooster, dog, cow, pig). 5 dices are rolled, each die face shows one half of an animal - front or rear half. When two halves of the same animal are rolled the player is allowed to grab one of the 10 animal tiles from the middle of the table. If two matching halves are shown then 2 tiles, if none show then he cannot do anything. When no appropriate tiles are in stock a player can snatch one from another player. The game ends when only 1 animal tile is left in the stock. Player with most completed animals wins.

name: Buntes Blumen-Rennen
description:
The game consists of large flower tiles in which animals are also shown, and matching flower cards. Besides a memory game, other simple rule sets are also supplied. One is like musical chair: The number of flowers in each color is one less than there are players. The players run around the flowers, and when one player calls out a color, the players have to put their hands on the flowers in that color - the player who is last is out. Continue until only one player remains.
In another game, a card is flipped over and all players turn up flowers - a player who finds the matching one can keep it and flip over a new card. The first player who gets three flowers wins.

The components of the game are large and suitable for the outdoors.

name: War Echoes
description: War Echoes is a 32mm tabletop miniature game, set among a science fiction background. War Echoes uses squad level skirmish combat tactics on an individual character driven system. Five different factions and alien races populate the landscape each with its own unique weapons, abilities and game play style. War Echoes utilizes d10 dice for rolling, with character stamina ratings based on a modifier system for everything from movement to combat.

name: The New York Times Photo Trivia Game
description:
Info from the game box:

Images that shape our times. The most fascinating people. Compelling news stories from the twentieth century.

NEW YORK Photo Trivia is an exciting, challenging trivia game that will test your knowledge of people, places and events that help shape our lives.

Travel around the United States covering the most compelling stories of the last 150 years.

Roll the dice, answer trivia questions and collect the photos that have captured the world's imagination!

Includes:
300 NYT 3 x 5 Photograph Trivia Cards.
Cast Iron Transportation Game Pieces.
Full Color Game Board and 6 sided die.

name: Oink's Card Game
description:
Contents: 36 cards in 6 sets of six.
Object of the Game: To collect six identical cards.

Sort out one set of 6 identical characters per player. Place other cards out of the game. Shuffle and deal six cards face down to each player. The game consists of exchanging cards as quickly as possible. Each player looks at his cards, decides which one he wishes to exchange and places it face down in front of the player to his left. Each player then picks up the card placed in front of him and adds it to his hand before deciding which card to exchange next. To keep play running smoothly, the players should simultaneously say “Pass” and "Pick Up". The first player to get six identical cards and shout "OINK" is declared the winner.

name: Urlaubsländerquiz Deutschland
description:
Trivia game about Germany.
The game consists of 240 questions in the categories Town and Country, Art and Culture, History and Modern Times, Food and Drinks, Sports, Leisure and Holiday as well as Demands, 5 questions and 1 demand per cards, in varying sequences. Correct answers earn souvenirs, demands must be fulfilled when possible and change ownership of souvenirs. One can only hold a limited number of souvenirs of a kind, or must exchange them. Whoever has the most souvenirs at the end of the game wins.

name: The Realm of Agennul
description:
The Realm of Agennul is an ever evolving board game where you control the fate of the characters and the future of the realms. Our goal is to create a fantasy world and outlet for participants to collaborate and decide how characters, realms, and the lore develop within the game.

Players receive two characters, which must work together to earn the patronage of cities within Agennul. During the game players must protect those cities from invading players who are also competing for the control of the Realm.

Use characters to navigate through the Realm and conquer cities to gain coin and control of Agennul. With the coin upgrade, increase your city's defenses by paying coin for a fortification or purchase equipment for your characters to increase their abilities. Engage in epic battles between players as ego's grow while the limited towns and cities are fought over. Be conniving and pay off players to avoid conflict in order to secure your advancement in the Realm.

The Realm of Agennul is very simplistic at its core but can develop into a complicated strategic game as power shifts around the table between players.

The first player to have control of the most cities as well as the patronage of the Hero's City of Anos, is anointed as The Hero of Agennul and Protector of the Realms.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid

name: Pillow-Dex Tennis
description: Following the success of Pillow-Dex, Parker released a more sophisticated (and more expensive) version. With the balloons, this version also has a cord net which you could tie between two chairs, and rackets. Based on the indoor parlor scene on the box, Parker intended for this to be a game for indoors.

name: Knockout Andy
description: The game has 2 tops with spinners, and 10 small wooden pins that look sort of like bowling pins. The box bottom has four wooden pegs affixed in the pattern of a square in the center of the box. The eight pins are setup, and then each player in turn spins his top. 5 points for knocking a pin down, 10 points for throwing it out of the box. 500 points wins the game.
publishers: H. J. Phillips Co., Parker Brothers

name: Daze of Our Loans
description:
Daze of Our Loans is a game for anyone with a sense of humor. The players are "lenders" that move around the board making loans and, sometimes, recovering on them. With luck they may even obtain collateral. When circumstances warrant, loans can be sold or participated out to others. Meanwhile, the economy may quickly change from normal times to recession or boom, sharply changing your loan portfolio values and affecting your strategy. Players must also deal with unpredictable court judgments, costly regulatory inquiries, bankruptcies, and documentation errors, among other common celebrations in a lender's day.

The game lasts for one hour, then all players get 2 more turns. The player with the most money wins.

name: Thru the Clouds
description: Simple race game where each of fours players race to get their three pegs from start to home. Spinner will give values between 1 and 4 for each spin.

name: Scram
description:
This is a simple children's game. At the start of each game each player takes his color marker's and covers up all the positions on his fourth of the board. When a player spins a number then he has to lift a marker that has that number under the marker. If another number is exposed, then the marker is returned. The first player to remove all his markers wins.

Since there is a combination of memory and luck, this would be an interesting game for an adult to play with a child.

name: Tiger Tom
description:
The game has markers for each player and a spinner with the values 1-6. From the game board:

Directions for the game on "Tiger Tom" No 4660

Tiger tom is lost. Who will find him? Each player chooses the side he wishes to play on, and the one who spins the highest number starts the game. The spaces between the cross marks count one. The player has to follow the black line until he reaches the center where he will find Tiger Tom. The one who arrives there first finds Tiger Tom and wins the game. If a player lands on No. 1 by exact spin, he must go back and start again. If a player lands on any of the black spots by exact spin, he must go back five spaces. If he lands on a red spot, by exact spin, he may advance three spaces. A player may pass another but if he lands on the same space, he must go back to where he started and lose one turn. If four wish to play, two start from each side.

name: Traps
description:
Traps is a marble shooting game where each player tries to shoot marbles into specific locations on a board. When opened the game box creates a ramp, and a "backstop." One the backstop are seven position which have a hinged flap that shuts when a marble is shot through the opening. from left to right the positions are numbered 1 to 7. The positions also have point values of 5, 15, 10, 25, 10, 15, and 5. Three games can be played on the board, Traps, Golf and Tournament Play. From the directions:

HOW TO PLAY TRAPS

Any number of players may compete. Each player in turn will roll or shoot an inning of four balls, scoring the points as they are made, the one first reaching a total of five hundred points becoming the winner of the game.

HOW TO PLAY GOLF

TRAPS now becomes a seven hole links. Drive for No. 1 hole: after holeing, recover ball, return trap to closed position and shoot for No. 2; continue for the entire course. Player making seven holes in fewest shots is declared the winner.

Tournmment - Twenty-Five Bird Event

Player will specify by small number (not one or seven) the Pigeon he expects to break; if succesful, 1 is scored and player shoots again, first designating the intended shot (not one or seven); if again succesful, another point is credited and the third shot may be either 1 or seven, but in no case may one or seven be called, unless the shooter has previously broken two consecutive birds other than one or seven. failure to break the bird designated, loses the players turn, which goes to each entrant in rotation; winner is the one who first breaks 25 birds.

name: Jack and the Bean Stalk
description:
This is a simple chase and capture game in that the Giant is trying to catch Jack. The Giant is a large pawn shaped piece, and Jack is a small disc. There is a spinner with values of 1 to 5. There are interconnected paths with dots to mark positions along the paths. The game board is glued to the bottom of the two piece box.

Directions (from game board)

Jack the small piece starts from home, the Giant from Castle. Spin in turn, each player moving as many dots as spun over any route, either forward or backward. They cannot pass ecah other on the same path. If Giant lands on dot occupied by Jack, he wins. If Jack reaches Door of Giants Castle and gets home safely, he wins (having got the hen that lays the golden egg).

name: Jet Race Game
description:
A simple race game with 17 spaces on the board. The spinner has 8 different positions. So this is a very simple spin and move game. There are 4 markers that come with the game.

Spinner positions:

3 - Land
3 - Take off or Fly
1 - Fly
1 - Bad weather go back to last city (ie lose a space)
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Racing, Transportation
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Checkers 3
description:
Checkers played with 2 or 3 players on a six-sided hex board, with 61 black hexagons touching only at their points, not their sides, leaving small red spaces between, and forming a larger overall hexagon. Each player picks a side separate from other players. Complexity comes not as much from the board itself but from the addition of an extra player's pieces.

Other 3 player Checkers variants have instead stretched a Checkers board's squares into a "Y" or triangular shape.

The publisher's name suggests there may have been a Chess variant published with a similarly styled board.
publishers: Chess 3, Inc., The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Shotgun Jousting
description:
Two gangs of bikers meet in the desert and after drinking themselves silly decide that jousting on their motorbikes, using shotguns rather than lances, is a good idea.

A two player push your luck game. Each player has 11 cards, and each selects and plays one card from their hand simultaneously until one or both players plays the "BLAM" card, which ends the round. The player playing the "BLAM" card scores for the cards they have already played this round. The game is played over four rounds.

name: Star Confrontations: Space Fleet Patrol
description:
From the Rulebook:

The Space Fleet Patrol army book requires the Star Confrontation rules book in order to play. Space Fleet has highly trained Fleet officers that can deal with almost any situation and their ability to teleport around the battlefield means they will always be in the right place at the right time. Their advanced space shttles use their powerful pulsars to decimate the enemy.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Rush
description:
A simple timed game where players name items in categories such as "Things you don't want to step on barefoot".
In turn, players draw a card, then read the category on the card and the amount of time out loud (from 5 to 15 seconds). The player then names as many things that fit the category as possible in the allotted time. The player gets one point for each named item.

After each player has three turns, the highest score wins.

name: Counting Town
description:
From the rule book:
"Counting Town is an engaging, imaginative and colourful play set that invites the child to do something very special: learn while playing."

The rule book provides 12 games for children to play. Each game is provided as a learning excercise for the children playing. The games focus on the language and number concepts such as colours, distance, time, quantity, sequencing etc.

All 12 games follow the same sequence of play:
The teacher setups the board for play.
A background story is provided for the game.
The teacher poses questions to the children based on the board setup.
The children then take turns based on the directions of the teacher (i.e. the teacher directs the children to move the parts around the board - the teacher then asks additional question to the children).
categories: Children's Game, Math, Number, Word Game

name: Blister the Game
description:
From the rule-book:

The object of all blistergames is to win by being the last player or team, with one or more active blisterpieces on the board.

The game is played with dice. There are two styles of dice: the blisterpieces (which have a different symbol on each die face) and the blisterblockers

The rule book provides six variations of the game: blisterboxes, blisterangles, blistercrosses, blistertriangles, blisterpokes and blisterballs.

Depending on the variation in play the blisterpieces are oriented such that they all have the same symbol showing. The symbol in play determines the movement that is allowed for that particular die (i.e. Blisterangles must move horizontally and vertically, Blisterpokes can move either horizontally or vertically).

The sequence of gameplay is as follows:
Player 1 rolls the 8-side die.
Player 1 moves one piece (die) the number rolled ensuring they follow the movement rules determined by the symbol on the die.
If the die ends its move within 6 squares with direct line of sight a "Blistermatch" may be started. During a Blistermatch the two dice being disputed is fought over. If one player can form the take-out pattern (identified in the rules) the losing die is eliminated. If a Blistermatch reaches a stalemate it ends and the game resumes as normal.
Gameplay continues with alternating turns until one player eliminates the other players pieces or a stale mate occurs.

name: Tides Of War: Gettysburg
description:
In honor of the 150th anniversary of the Battle of Gettysburg, military professionals, historians, and game designers created this game to closely replicate the actual battlefield conditions and operations of Gettysburg in 1863. The game comes in both a standard and collector’s edition and is played on an oversized game board with 172 miniature commanders and 126 brigade counters. The collector’s edition comes with life-like pewter miniatures on a magnetized metal game board for stability, and a carved wood base with drawers for storing the miniatures.
In lieu of the game’s dice and chart system, attacking and defending units can enter their strength, location, and orientation into the Interactive Game App (IGA) which then simulates the battle conditions to determine results. A unit’s strength is represented by possible Combat Factors on a brigade counter encircling a rotating miniature. The miniature is turned toward lower numbers as casualties are taken or is increased up to full strength as depleted units are merged into it. Reinforcement, Supply, and Morale Cards also affect the Combat Factor and randomness of game play.

The game also uses a Double Turn Rule where after the initial attack, both the attacker and defender may move all of their units one hexagon, defenders first. This allows both sides to retreat, stand, or bring up reinforcements during the turn. Units still in contact fight each other one more time before the turn ends. Artillery has a range of four hexagons and is only required to engage in battle if the enemy’s artillery is in range.

Incremental casualties, merging and resupplying units, and double-turn combat combine to recreate actual conditions, while the IGA cuts playing time in half. Tactical skill, not luck prevails, and the winner may rewrite history.

name: Afrika
description:
Objective: be the first getting rid of all your puzzle pieces
- acting by turns -
form a pile with hidden puzzle pieces;
yongest player or loser starts uncovering a piece, placing it upon the table & drawing another one in order to hand it over to left neighbour('s supply);
left neighbour acts in the same way; but if no tile can be placed it must be stored in his/her supply; in this case no tile may be handed over to left neighbour, too.
After pile is empty each play may place 2 tiles out of own supply - by turns.


remarks:
belongs to series: Mosaik "Raum und Grenze"
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Hadak útja
description:
(English)

Hadak útja, or Crossroad of Peoples is a light wargame in the footsteps of the famous Britannia. The game covers the history of the Carpathian Basin from the Roman conquest (12 BC) to the arrival of the Hungarians (907 AD). Players control mighty invading armies - from the glorious Romans and the ferocius Germanic tribes to the dreaded Huns and the peaceful Slavs - that seek to carve a new home on the blood-soaked soil under the Carpathians.

The players move and fight battles with their units in order to occupy and keep given areas. Units include four types of combat units (normal and heavy infantry, normal and heavy cavalry), settlements (oppida and Roman cities) and leaders (e.g. Emperor Trajan, King Attila the Hun or Prince Svatopluk of Moravia). At the end of the turn each people on the map score VPs from their occupied areas.

The game includes a Simple and an Advanced Game. All files will be made available in English as well.

(magyar)

A Hadak útja egy történelmi társasjáték, amely a híres Britannia című játék nyomdokain a Kárpát-medence küzdelmes múltját mutatja be a római hódítástól (Kr. e. 12.) a magyar honfoglalásig (Kr. u. 907). A játékosok azokat a hódító népeket irányítják - a dicső rómaiaktól és a vad germánoktól a rettegett hunokig és a békés szlávokig -, akik új hazát kerestek a Kárpátok övezte véráztatta síkon.

A játékosok célja, hogy egységeikkel mozogva és csatázva bizonyos területeket foglaljanak el és tartsanak meg. A játékban négyféle harci egység (normál- és nehézgyalogos, normál- és nehézlovas), települések (oppidumok és római városok), illetve vezérek (pl. Traianus császár, Attila hun király vagy Szvatopluk morva fejedelem) kapott helyet. A térképen levő népek a fordulók végén pontokat kapnak az általuk elfoglalt területek után.

A játéknak egy Kezdő és egy Haladó változata is van. Minden szükséges kellék letölthető (lesz) innen.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Pinguin Rallye
description:
A simple die-based racing game for children.

A big walrus is trying to scare away penguins from their ice floes. Can your penguin still manage to reach the iceberg?

Each player has a penguin player's piece. Players move their penguin according to the roll of the die from one ice floe to the next. If a walrus symbol is rolled, the walrus comes down from the iceberg, pushes the closest penguin off the floe and makes it fall back a few spaces (penguins that have fallen off an ice floe are moved back to the next of the darker floes). The player who has rolled the walrus can choose where to place it.

The player whose penguin reaches the iceberg first wins the game.

name: Paradise
description:
The object of the game is to go on a journey round and round any of the four circular routes and collect five picture cards from each of the wildlife, people, flowers, places and birds symbols.
