Players roll the die and move, landing on a symbol and collecting a picture. Sometimes the picture has instructions to move ahead or back, so a player's turn isn't over until no more movements are directed. After five of one symbol have been collected, a player is penalized cowrie shells for every future landing on that same symbol.

The winner is the player who collects 25 cards and has the highest number of cowrie shells left (thus a player collecting 25 cards first is not necessarily the winner).
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Donkey Derby
description:
Donkey Derby uses something like a roulette wheel for players to win letters which they use to make words. There are four versions of the game based on the word list from which the players are trying to form the words. There is a "Beginers Game", a "Bird Game", an "Animal Game" and a "Capital City Game".

The color for each player is determined each game by lot. When 2 or 3 players are playinging each player gets 2 letter cards (or a special Donkey card) on each spin. If four players are playing there is a twist. The Yellow player gets one letter by spin and also gets to take any letter he wants from the bank. For five players the black player gets one letter plus he can "rob" any player of a letter not in a word.

The game is played for points. 400 points is recommended for 2-4 players, and 500 points for 5 players. The donkey cards are worth points or can be traded back to the bank for three letter cards.

name: You Wake Up To Marmageddon!
description:
Bill Johnson – You Wake Up To Marmageddon!

Set in the world of 'Bill Johnson - Zombie Issues Specialist' an e-book by Jon Brown, Marmageddon is a tile-placement game in which Players draw and place tiles, exploring a warehouse - trying to collect the most Marmite.

The tiles feature Marmite, Zombies and movement icons. They must be placed adjacent to tiles that have already been played, in such a way that a warehouse is formed. Having placed a tile, the Player moves his character around the warehouse (based on the movement icons on the tiles), collecting the precious Marmite and defeating the Zombies. Players must escape the warehouse with their collected Marmite before the tiles are exhausted or the warehouse is complete, else suffer the consequences!

name: Mr. Buckethead Adventure Game Series: Mr. Buckethead Goes To The Moon
description:
Mr. Buckethead gets to choose between visiting the candy store or the toy store; somehow, this eventually leads him to prehistoric jungles and the dangerous surface of the moon.

This is an interactive gamebook where the player constantly chooses options in an evolving comic-book-like story, collecting money, items, friends and Action Points (used to activate special powers). The book includes a scoresheet and many puzzles and mini-games throughout, as the player works to gain the challenging Victory Point (by defeating the Moon Monster). Like other books in the series, there is also a 2-player monster fight mini-game included.

ABOUT THE SERIES:
Based on the live action television and film character, this new series of interactive gamebooks is adventure-packed! 64 pages of intense gameplay action with an innovative story structure that allows continuous play across multiple issues. Each issue in this series contains a solo adventure plus a bonus multi-player monster fighting game! The appeal of an evolving RPG with the look and feel of a comic book, the Mr. Buckethead Adventure Game Series is challenging and entertaining fun for all ages!
categories: Adventure, Book, Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Puzzle

name: Quadline
description:
Another game by the company that specialised in making designs so that partially or totally colour blind people can play. They mainly made traditional games but this is an original game by the company owner.

The game is played on a 7 x 7 grid. Each player must try to get four pegs in a row, hence the name of the game. It is a refined version of Go-Moku or 5-in-a-Row. The limit on placing pegs is that each peg played must be adjacent to an opposition peg. First to get four in a row, wins.

name: Golden Questions
description:
Golden Questions is an LDS game. The players are Mormon Missionaries who encounter various people they must try to convert with the Golden Question, "Would you like to know more about the Mormon Church?"

Players move around the board by spinning for results on a "Golden Spinner". Each street is filled with houses where the missionaries can seek for potential investigators. The game also makes use of Mormon trivia questions which players much answer in order to earn investigator cards.

The player who converted the most investigators to Mormonism wins, but there is also a kid edition where everyone wins.

name: Share-A-Tiara
description:
The object of the game is to be the first to fill one's tiara with all five of the gems. There are four boards, one for each player. The player spins the spinner and if it lands on a space with a gem that she (it's mostly a little girls' game) doesn't have in her tiara, she gets it. There is a "lose a gem space" as well as a "spin again" space (although it has little effect on the game).

Components:
4 Game Boards
20 Gem pieces
Spinner
Instructions

name: Rancheros
description: Rancheros is a casual strategy game for 2-4 players in which players take on the role of Mexican Ranchers that are trying to raise various animals to meet the demands of their local meat market. The player will acquire varying amounts of pesos for how they raise their animals while balancing the demands of the meat market. The player with the most pesos when the game ends is the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Commodity Speculation, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Kegelschach
description:
This was published sometime between 1910 and 1930 in Germany.

On a 9 x 9 grid of black and white squares 2 players move their pawns diagonally from their own corner towards the centre of the board. Here, the central area of 9 squares is marked (the "black" squares are red).

Each player has 1 "main" and 8 "additional" pawns. Starting position is on the 9 spaces of one corner (creating another square), the main pawn in the middle of the 8 additional ones.

Before the game, players agree upon a goal to reach: One out of 7 ending positions to fulfill with their pawns. All of these positions are located in the central area, from 2 pawns sitting on two opposing corners of the area up to the full 9 spaces of the centre. If the goal includes the central space, the main piece has to be placed there to reach the goal.

On their turn, players move one of their pawns one space diagonally. You can "catch" an opposing pawn by having two of your own pawns on each side of it - again diagonally. You can then pick it up and place it on any unoccupied space of the same colour anywhere on the board.

The player who manages first to fulfill the goal wins the game.

name: Super Shooter Basketball
description:
This is one of the Patch Products Big Little Games series, designed to be travel games.

From the publisher:
Practice shooting hoops and gain mad skills! Just place the ball on the shooter, press down on the back lever, and your ball flies through the air! Simply aim the shooter where you think you will have a good chance to get the ball into the net, and press down. Includes rules for three games - Horse, Around the World and 3-Point Shootout - so you can challenge friends to different games.

Contents: Basketball hoop with fold-down backboard, attachable basketball shooter, 3 tiny basketballs, rules. The shooter attaches to the hoop for storage. The game takes a few minutes to assemble.

name: Banners of Betrayal
description:
Banners of Betrayal is a lightly structured card game about feudal warfare. The players can freely attack each other, and the losing side of a fight joins the winner as a vassal. The ultimate objective is to eliminate every other contender for the crown.

Combat is based on a modified rock-paper-scissors mechanic. As cards that are played in a combat are discarded, extended fights weaken both players. The focus is on knowing when a player should yield and accept a lower rank, or risking losing in the final round.

There are three game modes called Honor, Tournament of Honor and Betrayal. The first two game modes use the principle described above. The tournament takes several rounds and the players are scored by their end rank. In the Betrayal game mode the King will award points for himself and his allies at the end of each round. The other players can opt to be contenders, who can fight with the king, or lords who can't fight by themselves, but who can sell their services for points.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Frog Skins
description:
Frog Skins was created for a Game Design Challenge, which charged its competitors to create a game that improved humanity in 60 seconds or less. Its target: inflation. The game gives new meaning to a CCG being a license to print money, because in this CCG, the "cards" are money — various denominations of bills from $1 to $100, to be more precise.

Each player creates a deck of five bills. As in War, each player presents a bill, and the higher bill wins the round. Ties go into a tie pool. Whoever wins the most rounds wins the game and the money. The hook, and the mechanism that combats inflation is that you may choose to rip a full bill into halves, which in the game, counts as two copies of that "card", but in the real world, causes a smidgen of deflation (the rules state that you must throw away torn bills after the game).

name: Das Mittelalter
description:
In this game Lady Rowena was kidnapped by the Black Knights and the players as a knight of the lion, the bear, the eagle and the unicorn sends his mercenary troops looking for the magic key.
In his turn player rolls the dice, moves his character and follows the action event cards trying to get the key. Whoever gets to castle first with the key to open the door his mercenaries first is the winner.

name: Tom en Tamira's Taalspel
description:
Tom and Tamira's language game
Tamira and Tom are on the playground. They wait for their dog Robbie. But Robbie is lost.

The players can help Robbie to come to the playground. Tha question is drawn and Tom and Tamira give both answer that question. But who is right? Tom, Tamira or perhaps both.

Players who have given the correct answer may move Robbie to the next square. Choose the shortest route and watch out for all gates. Who is the first smart playing with Tom and Tamira is the winner of the game.

name: West Point Cadet
description:
The instructions/rules for the game are printed inside the lid. The game is for 2, 3 or 4 players. The required pieces are: one playing piece for each player, a spinning indicator and a package of checks. The checks are used for keeping account of the points won or lost, with white counting one, blue counting two and red counting three. Each player begins with a set number of scoring pieces

There are rewards and punishments for such things as falling from your horse, talking in ranks, smoking cigarettes, being proficient in study, having soldierly deportment, doing good recitations, etc.

Whoever has the highest score when all players have finished the game is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Quickflip Volleyball
description:
This vintage dexterity game features two foam rubber volleyball athletes inside a vertical playing surface. Each player controls a "flipper" dial that moves his athlete under a plaxiglass shield. The volleyball is a plastic disc that is tossed back-and-forth under the plexiglass.

The athletes are manipulated to catch or instantly return the white disc representing the ball. A dropped volleyball or a return that lands out of bounds scores a point for the other player. First player to five points is declared the winner.

Includes the plastic volleyball court assembly, two plastic legs, and two discs.

name: This Hallowed Ground
description:
"This Hallowed Ground" is a set of rules for American Civil War 15mm military figures. These rules are designed for grand tactical play. The scale is set at six turns per hour and one inch for twenty-five yards. Movement, fire, and morale are based upon the brigade (consisting of one to six regiments for infantry and cavalry.) Artillery is structured around a battery of four to six guns (represented by a single unit.) Included is a sample (and partial) Order of Battle for Gettysburg and a supplement for adapting the rules to fictious battles against forces loyal to the Emperor Maxmillian I of Mexico.


These rules are quite comprehensive, including command control, weather and other random events (such as pre-battle disease), artillery crew casualties, the effects of unit training/experience, close action procedures, morale, sighting and line-of-fire, and much more.
Three appendices are included: A graphic description of formations; a brief description for conversion to 25mm figures; and a glossary.

name: Zombie Survival: The Crash
description:
In a post-apocalyptic world, a few months ago a zombie outbreak took charge of the largest cities on the planet. Urban areas are infested and the military are planning some reconnaissance missions on the major affected areas.

You and your team of soldiers were in one of those missions, flying a town overrun by zombies. But suddenly the unexpected happened! A problem with the helicopter engine causes the loss of altitude and the aircraft is going down. Luckily, (or not), you and the other members survived the crash.

It looks like the survivors crashed over some abandoned and unknown building. The problem is that, just like the whole city, there are zombies everywhere!

With low ammo, the only way to survive is to cross the interior of the building and search for exit.

This is a survival game, where characters are lost in an environment full of zombies.

The map, zombie encounters, weapons and ammo are randomly created and each game is never the same.

It is a print and play game. The PDF includes:
-24 map tiles
-Zombies and soldiers miniatures (cut, fold and glue)
-Modern weapons & ammo counters
categories: Horror, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Magical Rainbow
description:
From the publisher's and Toy Directory websites:
The board is used on a slight incline and the game pieces are magnetic. The Magical Rainbow is a magnetized game that takes children on a special adventure through 7 magical lands. Players race to a pot of gold, watching out for Paddy the Leprechaun, who on every turn travels from land to land protecting his gold. Throughout the journey players will try to collect gold coins, avoid the Leprechaun and his lucky trinkets, and use strategy to win the game. The first player to reach the pot of gold at the end of the Rainbow wins, however the game encourages sharing with others in need. This game is designed to teach children color recognition, sequencing, patterns, counting, strategy and sharing.

"Using a rainbow game theme lets kids imagine what it would be like living on a Magical Rainbow, and helping Paddy the leprechaun give out his gold to people in need. The rainbow game combines colors and a magnetic 3d game set that keep kids entertained game after game. The other goal for Magical Rainbow was to create a board game that could be played with one child. There are a lot of one child families and what good is a board game if you don’t have anyone to play the game with? Magical Rainbow can be used as a standalone make believe play set." The game pieces double as flexible magnetic play pieces that have letters and numbers on the reverse side. They can be used on the front or back of the game board or on any metallic surface to assist children in developing recognition with the alphabet, numbers and words.

Awards: 2009 Family Choice Award, Creative Child Magazine's Game of the Year award, Dr Toy Best Picks, 2010

name: Neuroshima Tactics: The Outpost
description:
Form a gang and fight for dominance over the city. Seize the most valuable districts, search the ruins to gather the precious gambles, make use of your units' special abilities, which are straight from Neuroshima RPG.

Neuroshima Tactics is a miniature wargame in which the players - using 28mm figures - clash among the ruins of the Goddam United States. Each player commands a force comprising of 5 to 12 models in an attempt to achieve certain goals in the allotted amount of time. The game is set in the world of Neuroshima.

Outpost is the last regular army of humanity. Army that uses leftovers of pre-war equipment. This set contains 5 miniatures, tokens, cards and terrain elements.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Moloch
description:
Form a gang and fight for dominance over the city. Seize the most valuable districts, search the ruins to gather the precious gambles, make use of your units' special abilities, which are straight from Neuroshima RPG.

Neuroshima Tactics is a miniature wargame in which the players - using 28mm figures - clash among the ruins of the Goddam United States. Each player commands a force comprising of 5 to 12 models in an attempt to achieve certain goals in the allotted amount of time. The game is set in the world of Neuroshima.

Moloch. Machine empire. Mechano-electronic creation that takes area of several states. Uncountable cybernetic brains weave strategies and coordinate attacks. This set contains 5 miniatures, tokens, cards and terrain elements.

name: Star Confrontations: Space Dwarf Defenders
description:
From the Rulebook:

The Space Dwarf Defenders army book requires the Star Confrontations rules book in order to play. The Space Dwarves are brave warriors that are always looking for a good fight. These master engineers build powerful and deadly tanks, making them one of the most mechanized forces in the universe.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Henolfs Hasenhetzjagd-Würfelspiel
description:
Objective: being a dog: catch all hares: being a hare: escape to field no. 54
- moving by turns -
depending on no. of players: 1-3 hares & 1-3 dogs;
1 hares may roll the die twice getting a headstart
2 ending on a red (or marked blue space) hares & dogs must run an additional circuit
3 hares may jump (=shortcut) if they throw a '1' standing on a space with an adjacent black arrow
4 a hare is caught if a dog overtakes or ends on the same space

name: (Unnamed Wargame)
description:
This is an anonymous and untitled game based on World War I.

Rules of the game: Each ally starts from his own citadel.

You advance the number of squares indicated by the throw of a tee-to-tum.

Gains around the board are enhanced by reaching the Butt of the Rifle which allows one to proceed to the end of the bayonet.

Reaching the helmet allows one to advance 6 spaces.

You can be sent backwards by reaching the butt of the rifle which allows you to be moved back to the square indicated on the tip rifle.

Reaching the Fort moves you back 6 spaces.

Throwing double 6's allows you to play again

Reach the end of the board to win the game.

name: Aufregende Auto-Rallye
description:
There are 36 square cards, 4 cars and a special die.

Players form a road with the cards laying them on the board, look at these 2 minutes and then turn these face-down

The objective is to be the first to go through the complete course. The player rolls the dice in his turn. The value indicates how many fields he can "guess" to get ahead. For each card that he wants to drive, he must first indicate whether or not the asphalt after being uncovered. Is it true, then moved his car and continues. If He makes a mistake, the car remains last card and and the card is turned back face- down.

name: Plauz
description: A dexterity game for children. Players take turns trying to place little plastic pieces (snails, beetles, leaves) on top of a plastic toadstool. The toadstool wobbles, and if some of the figures fall down, the active player has to take them. The first player to get rid of all of his/her snails, beetles and leaves wins the game.

name: Plitsch, Platsch
description:
In this game children try to place their raindrops, consisting of three parts, on the board. The die decides which action a player has to take. The first player to have no raindrop pieces left wins the game.

At the beginning of the game, each player gets three wooden raindrop pieces - one small disk and two rings. The larger ring fits around the smaller one, which in turn fits around the small disk. Players take turns rolling the die. The die determines whether the player is allowed to put a piece of his/her raindrop on the board (rain symbol), loses a turn (cloud symbol), has to take back a drop (sun symbol) or is allowed to place the rainbow, thus locking a field on the board. The game ends when one player has placed all his/her raindrop parts on the board.

name: Piratenkreisel
description: The pirates have found out that huge golden orbs can be found on the large Caribbean island, and of course they are trying to get them. Each player has a pirate ship and tries to bring a golden orb to his/her home harbour. On their way, the pirates have to avoid other pirates because they will naturally try to steal their golden orb. But even the best pirate has to strike the sails when the weather is bad. A magnetic spinner in the center of the board rotates the golden orbs around and also causes the dreaded storms. This causes surprising twists of fate in the race for the golden orbs.

name: Animoes
description:
From Continuum Games website:
Animoes takes the classic game of dominos and makes it easy for children as young as three to play. Instead of dots, each piece contains cute animal characters. Children match animals as they play.

Animoes offers a unique twist at the end of the game. The player who has played all of their pieces first, becomes the “Spin Master”. The “Spin Master” spins the spinner board until an animal is identified. The player to the right of the “Spin Master” must act like the animal the spinner has identified. If the spinner lands on the Duck, the next player must act like a Duck – quack like a duck, walk like a Duck and do whatever he/she thinks a Duck would do. It is a great way to end the game laughing!

The pieces are oversized (4" x 2" - perfect for little hands) and dishwasher safe.

36 Game Safe Custom Plastic Tiles (8 Different Animals)
Spinner Board

name: Kreuz und quer über's Eis
description:
An action and memory game for children, with a magnetic mechanism.

On the way over the ice floes to the other side it's easy to slip. The Eskimos use their sledge to get from floe to floe. On some they are safe, on others they slip and fall into the water.
There are 30 hidden magnets in the board. Water hole chips serve as an aid to memory.

name: Fabolarix
description:
A children's game about colours, shapes, sizes, and recognizing the right way to the tile.

The game consists of a board, 48 magnetic wooden tiles in a linen bag, 4 player pieces and a die.

Tiles (with as many symbols as there are players in the game) are placed on the board and the race for the symbols begins. The player who collects the most tiles wins the game. The die determines how many spaces a player is allowed to move. It is important for the players to recognize which tile can be reached with the result of their die roll. This requires abstract and logical thinking.

name: Goldtaler
description:
A magnetic game for children with a die from 1 to 3.

The dwarfs are lucky! Gold can be found on the road. Huge golden coins are just waiting to be collected. If luck is on your side, you can even carry home a whole stack of coins...unless one of the other players takes them away first!

Gameplay: Players take turns rolling the die. They then move their dwarf pawn the corresponding number of spaces on the circular track. If they land on a gold coin (a wooden disc is placed on every third space during set-up), the dwarf is put on the coin, which sticks to the dwarf's base magnetically. On the next turn, the dwarf moves on with the coin attached. He tries to reach home (every dwarf has his home section in one corner of the board), continuing to collect more coins if possible. If one dwarf lands on a space occupied by another dwarf, the newcomer steals the other's gold and sends him home. The game ends when all coins have been brought home. The player who collected the most coins wins the game.

name: Zwergenkick
description:
A soccer-themed, magnetic dexterity game for children.

Players' pieces are put on a board. Playing sticks are put under the board and move the pieces over magnetic attack points from above. This way, a ball is kicked towards the opponent's goal.
The game exercises hand-eye-coordination. Players see the pieces on the board, but not the movements of the stick under the board.

name: Shakey's Libation
description:
From the rules:

The object of the game is to gain all the letters spelling LIBATION. The first one to do so (or last one under the table) is declared the winner.

Game-play

Players take turns rolling the die and moving around the game board. Players perform various actions when landing on a space (chug-a-lug-active player drinks, boomba-la-roomba-everyone drinks, chance-active player draws a card and performs *that* action). Players also collect a letter of the word "libation" corresponding to the space landed on. The corner squares are similar to monopoly (start, dungeon, throne room, go to dungeon). Gameplay continues until one player successfully completes the word libation or until all other players are 'under the table'.

name: Kurs Ost-Nordost
description:
Objective: be the first entering opposing port with your battleship or sink enemy battleship
- acting/moving by turns -
each player gets 1 d6 and an additional die as route indicator, 6 mines, 12 small & 1 battleship;
dice: 'a 4 combined with NO' = 4 transverse moves direction NO
- protect your battleship with your small ships, place mines and try to surprise your opponent; moving upon or across an enemy ship is going to sink it.
remarks:
published 1930's

name: Pumuckl's freches Mäuserennen
description:
A simple children's racing game themed around the story of the kobold Pumuckl (a character from a German radio play and TV series for children).

Master Eder (the carpenter with whom Pumuckl lives) has discovered mice in his workshop and is going to bring in the neighbour's cat to catch them. Pumuckl has one last night to play with his little friends before the cat gets there.

Each player has a player's piece symbolizing a mouse. The mouse is put on the mousehole of the same colour. The cards - which show either a picture of Master Eder (3x) or die spots from 1 to 6 - are placed face down in the middle of the board. The cheese tokens are placed on the corresponding spaces on the board. When a player rolls the die, he/she has to turn over one of the nine cards. If the number of spots on the die is the same as that on the card, the player gets to move his/her mouse that number of spaces. If a card showing Master Eder is turned over, the mouse is scared and hides inside the last mousehole it has passed. A player who has collected two cheese tokens gets to advance to the next mousehole. A player who lands on a Pumuckl space has to make a grimace and then rolls again. The game ends when the first mouse safely reaches its own mousehole.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Pocahontas: Das romantische Familienspiel
description:
The player who is first to find John Smith, Meeko and Flit and reaches Smith's ship with them wins the game.

Components: 1 board, 4 Pocahontas pawns, 1 Kocoum pawn, 12 chits showing either John Smith, Meeko or Flit, 24 cardboard trees, 1 die.

The active player rolls the die and moves their pawn up to that number of spaces on the board. If they land next to a tree, they check who hides behind that tree (i.e. which character is on the sticker hidden at the bottom of the tree). If it is John Smith, Meeko or Flit, they gain the corresponding chit. If it is a settler, the player's turn ends immediately. Some other characters force a player to give one of their chits to another player, return a chit to the pool, or exchange that tree with another one. When John Smith is discovered, Kocoum enters the game. Instead of moving their own pawn, players can now move Kocoum instead. If Kocoum reaches one of the player pawns, he steals the John Smith chit from that player. The chit is placed in the village area, and the player's Pocahontas has to return to the village to re-gain it. A player who has collected Smith, Meeko and Flit can go to the ship.

name: Derby Bingo
description:
Derby Bingo is a combination of Bingo with a betting dice game. There are red wooden discs to cover the spaces on the bingo card and square paper chits (yellow/plain) with which to bet.

The 4x4 Bingo Cards represent a player's horse. Betting on your horse is part of the game. You can bet to WIN, PLACE, or SHOW at the top of the card.

There are two die. One die is the conventional d6 die with 1 to 6 spots. The other die is a special one with letters R, A, C, E, P, and T.

One your turn, roll the two die. When rolled, the letter die gives the column (R, A, C or E) on the bingo card and the number die the space. If you have a match, then you cover up that spot on your card. You finish by filling a bingo line.

The "POT" is started by players paying chits for their Bingo card. Also if a player rolls a P the player must pay into the POT. Players rolling a T take money from the POT.

If more than three are playing then the game ends when first, second and third places have been decided and all bets are paid off. The "POT" is shared by the players owning the winning horses.

name: Over The Garden Wall
description:
This is a simple game where a wooden marble is "shot" for points. 300 points is suggested for a game, but any other score agreed upon by the players can be used.

The "marble" is placed on a "shooter" which is a disc with an indentation to hold the ball. The shooter is then flicked with a finger into the "garden wall" which causes the marble to jump the fence and roll around the other side of the board. There are holes in the board marked with various point values.

name: Potato de Cho!
description:
In this game, players attempt to collect potatoes of different sizes and types.

A number of cardboard potatoes are placed face-down on the table. The first player may now attempt to retrieve one or more potatoes using his index finger, following certain rules. After his turn ends, new potatoes are added to replace the ones he has taken away, and the next player takes his turn.

The game continues until no potatoes are left. Then, each players collection of potatoes are scored. Points are given for the majority of each type of potatoe, as well as for the number of potatoes.

name: Freu' dich nicht zu früh!
description:
Objective: Be the first moving up to field 132
- moving by turn -
throw the die and move according rolled number; ending on a red marked space follow instructions. Use 3 dice from out field '127';
remarks:
published ~ 1940's

name: "Kombiniere" Wer mich hat gewinnt
description:
Objective: play the game several times - each time you win you may wear the sticker 'Nick Knatterton'; player who was wearing this sticker most is the winner;
- moving by turns -
roll the die and move forward; each space (of 25) shows information to follow (see cover inside); player who reaches field 25 (precisely) wins this game...
remarks:
published during 1960's
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Note-O
description:
From the box:

"For the school room or home by Mrs. F. L. Crown"

"A game in which fifty-six music symbols are quickly and easily learned and the habit of concentration, alertness and fair play is encouraged among boys and girls.

Music supervisors and music teachers will find 'Note-O' invaluable in the teaching of the names and definitions of music symbols.

Rules for playing 'Note-O':

The game of 'Note-O' contains forty players' cards, fifty-six dealer's cards and pasteboard discs with which to cover the symbols on the players' cards.

As many players may participate in the game of 'Note-O' as there are players' cards. Each player is provided with a 'Note-O' card and enough discs to cover all the symbols on his card.

At the beginning of each game, a leader is chosen. This leader is provided with the deck of dealer's cards and from it calls the symbols, one by one. As a symbol is called, the player having that symbol covers it with a disc. The process is repeated until some player has covered all the symbols on his card at which time he calls out 'NOTE-O.' The first player calling 'NOTE-O', whose symbols have been covered correctly, wins the game.

The game may be varied by having any player announce 'Note-O' when he has covered three symbols in a row on his card.

At the end of each game, cards should be exchanged and the leader's cards shuffled before starting a new game.

The game is made much more difficult and more interesting when each player is provided with two or more 'Note-O' cards."
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Music

name: The Hi-Fi Game
description:
From the box:

"Experience the fun of buying, selling, and trading equipment. Invest into audio Industries to increase your earnings. Follow the latest trends, and exchange insider gossip while you compete to build the HI-FI System of your dreams."

User summary:

Very similar to Monopoly, but in place of real estate, players move around the board (rolling dice to do so) and choosing to invest or not in whatever aspect of the hi-fi audio industry (circa 1970's) they land on, and paying royalties or fees to those already owned by other players, until all players but one are bankrupt.

name: Code 3 Response!
description:
From the box:

"Code 3 Response! is the action oriented, strategy EMS trivia board game where you respond your ambulance along city streets to emergency scenes and transport your patients in a race to the hospital."

User Summary:

Game board is an overhead likeness of a city, with buildings, streets, hazards, and a hospital. Players take turns moving their pieces according to rolling of die, and movement depends on negotiating map, hazards, and answering emergency procedure questions correctly. Winner is the first to successfully negotiate all of this on the way to the hospital. The game is intended as an educational aid for emergency training.

name: Felix the Cat's Complete 3 Game Set for Boys & Girls
description:
User Summary:

Contains 3 games for children--Felix's Fishing Game, Felix's Road Race Game, Down on the Farm Game.

Each game is a race to reach the end of the board while overcoming obstacles. Player movements are determined by a spinner.

name: Hippodrome
description: This game from from Milton Bradley dates back to 1890 and features a lithograph map of an around the world race for two players. Each player in turn spins the spinner and moves the indicated number of spaces paying penalties for landing on an opponents playing piece. First player to circumnavigate the globe wins the game. There are safe areas where no penalty is called for if your opponent lands on your square.

name: Cracoviana
description:
Cracoviana takes you for the walk throgh Cracow old streets, where you find traces of historical events, rulers and artists. We learn about the city, its climate, history and tradition. Great way to make you children and grandchildren learn about the city, while having great time

Game goal is to gather as many "Wall Blanks" as possible in shortest time. Whoever achieves this and reaches Wawel, wins.
Players move through fields that symbolize streets of Old Town.

On street crossings there are questions from 10 sets - Legends, Artists, Tratition, Monuments, Events and so on, whic you must answer in order to get "City Blanks".

name: Babar und die Abenteuer von Badou: Das Kartenspiel
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Badou, the grandson of the elephant king Babar, loves to go on adventures with his friends – but it's time to leave on the next outing and he can't find them! In Babar und die Abenteuer von Badou: Das Kartenspiel, the players need to help Badou find his missing friends so that they can take off!

name: Babar und die Abenteuer von Badou: Das spannende Suchspiel
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Badou, Babar, and their friends want to use colored chalk to bring children into their jungle school – but alas, their friends have taken off running down the wrong roads. Can the players go after this motley army of youngsters and help them find the right path?

name: Clacto Snakes
description: Game based on the use of magnetic marbles (clickets). The object is to place all the clickets on the games board (in the shape of a snake), without moving them as a result of magnetic attraction.The player who succeeds in placing his last clicket without disturbing the other marbles on the board wins the game.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Hegemony – Punks
description:
Punks believe in motto "Leave and let die". They like to party, their lives are intense but short. They act in large groups, so their machine pistols can spit out rain of bullets

Punks set contains 2 punks, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Hegemony – Cokes
description:
Cokes look like a bear. To get to that point you need a lot of bulls cojones and a lot of coke. He is hard as rock and just as stupid. Andrenaline makes him even more dangerous - when injured he can send whole squads to the grave.

Cokes set contains 1 miniature, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Mutanci Borgo – Mesmeryta
description:
Mesmerite is made for special tasks. As he approaches his enemies he attacks their brainwaves with mental noise, making them see invisible flame walls and feel pain which is not there. In the meantime other Borgo units can safely accomplish their tasks.

Mesmerite set contains 1 miniature, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: At Home in Sunderland
description:
A mathematical card game. The cards feature somewhere interesting in Sunderland, which is in the northeast of England.

Each card has a number between 0 and 9, except for the Double cards. Each player gets 6 cards and must look to see if a pair can be formed. A pair is made up of two numbers that, when multiplied together, make a total that is also on one of the two cards. For instance, you play a 5 and an 8 which makes 40. Thus the number 40 must also be on one of the two cards played. If successful, a pair is formed and can be laid face-up in front of the player. The first player to lay three pairs (6 cards) wins the round.

When a round is one, the other players add up the value of the cards in their hand and that is their score. After 12 rounds, the lowest score is the winner.

There are special rules for the Double Cards which you need to play because if you are caught with them in your hand when a player goes out, you get a nasty negative score.

This is an expanded game (but more subtle and a better design of the cards) that first appeared as Multitu in the 1960's.

name: Multitu
description:
A mathematical card game which first appeared in 1964. The cards feature numbers and you must form pairs. A pair consist of a total on one of the two cards that is equalled when the two cards played are multiplied together.

If you use all your cards first, the round ends and the player going out scores nothing but the other players take a negative score based on the cards still in their hands.

To spice up play, there are Problem Cards which are nasty if you get caught with them in your hand when another player goues out. One of them is Mr Whacker, a school teacher who seems to like caning his pupils.

name: Diet Without Tears
description:
Educational card game published by the British Diabetic Association. It is an attempt to make people think about what they eat, especially for them to know the calorie count of their meals.

In it's basic form, players can just ask each other about a card, for instance: " Find me another card with the same calorie count as X".
But two more interactive games are possible. In 'Shop Shut' (for which you need two copies of the game) each player gets a hand of cards. One player is nominated as the Caller. Everyone plays their cards face up in front of them. The Caller draws a card and if a player has the same card, he shouts "Sold" and turns the card over. This continues until one player turns over his last card and then shouts "Shop Shut". That player scores nothing but the other players score their cards still 'open' by totalling the Carbohydrates on the card (or the Calorie count if decided before the game begins). After a pre-agrred time limit expires, the player with the lowest score wins.

In 'Happy Food Families, it plays exactly the same as a Happy Families/Quartet/Authors game. A set of four cards must all be the same food value as indicated on the card. The player who has the most sets when the cards run out, wins.

name: Upgrade Wars
description:
Far in the future, war has been relegated to a spectator sport. As humanity has spread throughout the solar system, advances in material sciences have left us wanting for nothing yet craving new forms of entertainment.

3D printers ranging in size from minuscule to mammoth process material known as Nano-Goo (or just “Goo”) into virtually anything a person could need, from food and clothing to massive, space-faring ships. Using these technologies, a few enterprising individuals capitalized on humanity’s need for entertainment and have brought back to life the ancient custom of gladiatorial combat -- done safely by remotely operating (teleoperating) vastly powerful machines of war known as War Bots.

Large 3D printing structures are dropped onto remote asteroids and other small, celestial bodies. These come with a small complement of devices which begin to process the raw materials of these asteroids into Goo, which these massive printers can use to create War Bots. Printers use a series of programs called .WAR Files, which give them the specifics of War Bots which they can then use Goo to print.

War Bots are printed out of Goo, which is programmed to take a specific form with specific functions. Because they are made of self organizing nanomaterials, War Bots can be modified by simple programs called .UPGrade Files – or upgrades. These upgrades can be applied to War Bots while they are in the field.

Governed by a strict set of rules, and limited by the programs made available to them, contestants manufacture and then fight with these giant machines, for the delight of audiences throughout the Solar System.

Upgrade Wars is a deck building, tactical combat game. Players begin the game with a starter deck of 10 resources and two War Bots (the giant robots that do the actual fighting).

Through the course of the game, they may purchase new programs to deploy as War Bots or to Upgrade existing War Bots that have already been deployed.

The battle field is divided into three zones - the Printer zone (where the magic happens), the Defensive Ring and the Front Line - a zone shared by all players.

Your bots traverse the battlefield under your command in an attempt to reach other player's printers and destroy them.

Complete Victory: The last player with a Printer still capable of creating War Bots wins the game!
Tactical Victory: Each enemy War Bot you destroy is worth 1 Victory Point. Each enemy Printer is worth 5 Victory Points. Once three card piles are depleted, the player with the most Victory Points wins!

Featuring strategic and tactical play - players must decide where and when to spend their resources, which can go to either purchasing new program files or deploying War Bots into the field of battle. At the same time, you must manage your existing War Bots to defend your Printer and attack the enemy.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Bump N Run the Stock Car Racing Board Game
description:
Bump N Run is a roll and move style game played on an oval race track/game board with 3 racing lanes. each player rolls the dice to determine the starting order. Highest roller is 1st, next highest 2nd, and so on up to 8 players. Each player starts the game with 10 fuel tokens, 4 tire tokens,and 4 Bump n Run cards. Then you decided on how many laps to run(5,10,20,etc).

Each player, in turn rolls the dice and moves there car/pawn around the board space by space, lane to lane wherever they choose. Every time you roll the dice it cost you 1 fuel token, every time you change lanes it cost you 1 tire token. when you come up on another car/player you have the choice to race around him, or race to through him by playing a Bump R Run card, which knocks him back to where your turn started.

When you get low on fuel or tires you race in to the pits to spin the pit wheel to earn money to buy more fuel, tires, and Bump N Run cards. You spin the wheel once per turn and stay as many turns as you need to.

Every time you complete a lap of the track/board you collect a lap counter card to keep score. The first player to complete a pre-determined number of laps is the winner.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Hegemony – Scar
description:
Hegemony is made of tough guys. And Scar is most tough of them all. His presence motivates other gangers to act as if they were even tough.

This set contains 1 miniature, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Hegemony – Bun
description:
Beer keg on his back, chainsaw in his hands - lets go slaughter some enemies!
This set contains 1 miniature, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Hegemony – Machete
description:
Machete everywhere brings his... ehm... machetes. No one can match him in hand to hand combat. He is also so tough, he ignores some wounds he gets.
This set contains 1 miniature, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Hegemony – Gangers
description:
Gang members that wander on the wastelands. Demoralized, they attack settlements and gas stations. They rob and kidnap. Brave only in a group.

This set contains 2 miniatures, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Hegemony – Black Angels
description:
Black Angels. Machine roar always means trouble. When you see Black Angels, you're in trouble. They are tough, merciless and cruel.
This set contains 2 miniatures, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Moloch – Brain
description:
Brain - without him machines are just pile of junk with some basic, ineffective algorithms. They need him to think for them, analize, create strategies.

This set contains 1 miniature, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Moloch – Spiders
description:
Spiders are the nightmare dream of Outpost soldiers. Invisible enemy, mindless force controlled by a Brain walking far behind. They can cross any obstacle, walk through walls with great speed. And when they catch you they will drown you in rain of lead.
This set contains 2 miniatures, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Dés magiques
description:
There are two special dice and thirty-six cards in this game.
In his turn player rolls the dice:
The first die shows six topics: boat, house, sun, apple snail, butterfly. The second die shows six colors.

Player who first grabs the card with the correct topic and color get that card as a point.
Player with the most points after all cards are taken is the winner.

name: Ordino train
description:
Players must lead their locomotive to ten destinations. The gratings are formed of sequences of 1 or 0. The special dice contain only 1 and 0. Player rolls the dice and if they show by example 1-1-0, you may follow paths that meet the combinations 0-1-1, 1-0-1 or 1-1-0.

One of the three dice additionally carries a red face and a green face, for placement of traffic lights to prevent enemy movement with red or to clear the way with green light.

Who go through all of his destinations first is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Conquest Tactics: Inferno
description:
Conquest Tactics: Inferno includes forty new cards, encompassing all of the different card types in the Conquest Tactics base game, with five copies of every Troop, three of every Spell and Skill, two of every Base, and so on.

These cards give certain factions access to spell and skill types that they've never been able to use before, gives other factions new mechanisms that reinforce their existing strategies, and expands on each factions' existing upgrade trees for troops, in addition to including victory conditions and bases that allow for new strategies and new cross-faction deck combinations.

The Kickstarter for this expansion ended unsuccessfully on September 1, 2012, and it was not released. The developers stated a continued interest in releasing this expansion in June 2013, but there has been no further news.

name: Holy Runes
description:
Fantastic and addictive game. 1-4 players. Normal game mode, map mode, and challenge mode.

Objective: Defeat gold dragon and conquer the magic land with holy runes.

Challenge mode: No map needed. Each player is level 4, and equips 6 runes and 6 scrolls randomly.

Brief Game Rules:
Beginning: each player chooses role card and its side (light or dark), and takes 1 rune and 1 scroll randomly. Next, put the pawn on the battle map (Wasteland-Start Cell) and is Level 1

Process: the active player rolls a dice and moves on the battle map from start cell to Boss cell to fight the boss. When passing Boss cell, the player may choose to challenge the boss or return to the Start cell. When winning the challenge, the player goes to the next map and upgrade one Level.

Battle with monster: player starts first. The player may choose to use ability, rune or scroll in each turn. Ability can only be used once each battle and may be played anytime; only 1 rune can be played in each turn, and tap the rune after its effect (taped rune cannot be used in the same battle unless returned to hand); only 1 scroll can be played in each turn, and remove the scroll from game after its effect. The monster attacks secondly. Choose a monster attack card each turn to activate monster action.

Battle with player: opposing side players can attack each other when their pawns placed in the same cell. Any player can challenge another player when the pawn placed in the Battle Field Cell. The attacker plays first. Each player may use ability, rune and scroll to attack the opponent.

Team with player: same side players can make team when their pawns placed in the same cell. When they attack monster as a team, monster uses the different monster attack card to each team member. When they are attacked by opposing side player, their team status is broken, and the opponent may choose to attack each team member separately.

Cool Factors:

Normal game mode, map mode, and challenge mode
Strategic battle with abilities, runes, and scrolls
Dark and Light camp, Team mode, and Battle Arena
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Wiz Poker
description:
Cool Factors:

-Handy and addictive game
-2 colors, wiz point and power cards
-Easy to start and highly strategic

Description:
Fantastic, fast and addictive game with your family and friends. 3-6 players. 54 wiz cards and 6 power cards.

Play all your cards as soon as possible to get points or chips!

Brief rules:
Each round, the first player plays first, and other players follow in order. The “Point Rules” can be applied whatever 1 card or more cards are played. When a player wins a round and takes the lead in a new round, the player may get the wiz points on the cards he just played and use the wiz points to play power card...

name: Business Empire
description:
Description:
Business Empire is designed based on economic, financial and management concept in real business world. It demonstrates how to accumulate wealth and develop wealth quotient.

Brief rules:

There are 3 phases in a player’s turn: the beginning phase, the operation phase and the ending phase.
1) The beginning phase: The active player can draw 1 card from top of the library. Then the player generates revenue and pays interest.
2) The operation phase: The active player can build assets; sell assets; borrow liability; refund liability; place deposit; use deposit, operation card and disaster card.
3) The ending phase: If the player has more than 8 cards in hand, the player should choose to discard extra cards.

Cool Factors:

Simulation to real business world
Disclose the secret to accumulate wealth
Easy to start and highly strategic

name: Casual Friday of the Dead
description:
CFOTD is a light and humorous board game where you play an office worker during the zombie apocalypse. Maneuver your token through an office building besieged by the armies of the undead to be the first to rescue the CEO and lead him safely to the exit.

Players also control their own zombie that they use to hamper and hinder other players and event cards can help you, hinder you, or give you helpful items to help you win.

Based on zombie B-movie cliches CFOTD brings the campiness of low budget movies into the office.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Borgo Mutants – Claws
description:
Claws. Strong and fast mutants fighting with implanted knives. Deadly in close combat. And their speed lets them to get to close combat before you say "Grenaade!"
This set contains 2 minis, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Borgo Mutants – Spider
description:
My hands are full. In case of Spider this sentence gets a new meaning. He has 4 hands - and each with something to hurt you. He is fast and can climb everywhere.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Schweine Schwarte das Rennen
description: The eternally hungry pig has gulped up the die – when the little piglets on the hunt for burgers race towards the finishing line, you must press the belly of the pig to learn how far you can move it. Three piglets per player participate in the race along the burger spots. In your turn you press the belly of the big pig, the die tumbles and rolls and when it stops you know how far you can move one of your piglets. When your piglet ends its move on a spot with another piglet already there, you send this piglet back to the start. If you are the first to have three piglets in your personal burger finish, you win.

name: Know Trouble
description:
Card game made as a promotional item for Dettol, a very popular disinfectand in Britain. The game is endorsed by the Child Accident Protection Trust.

The cards consists of pairs of cards. One of the pair warns of a danger and the other gives advice on how to avoid that danger.

Three games are described in the rules. Keeping Me Safe is the main game. The first player places a danger card face up. The next player checks her hand and plays the advice card on top of it (if she holds it). If not the next player looks, and so on. Once a pair has been completed, the next player lays a danger card and the game proceeds until one player has used all their cards. He/she is the winner.

The other two games are more traditional, Snap and Pairs, but both are a little more difficult because the two cards that match are not mirror images which would be more usual in games of Snap or Pairs.

name: Das Fussball Quiz
description:
Who scored the Wembley goal? How big is a playing field? How many times Germany was the world champion? Which famous singer was formerly goalkeeper for Real Madrid? Which player has been hindered by the collision with a moose on his international duty?
48 question cards offer interesting facts and curiosities about the most wonderful thing in the world:
Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most cards after the deck is exhausted is the winner.

name: Memo Quarto 4 Albrecht Dürer
description: A playful encounter with the painter Albrecht Durer, this memory version. 18 masterpieces of the famous Renaissance artist must be collected after the memory testing, but not in pairs, but in quartets. Each image was divided into four parts, the players will now add back together. First you need to find two matching parts, they are designed to be found later in the game a fitting part, this may be set to. The displayed works are presented in detail in the accompanying booklet.

name: Das Prestel Kinder Kunstspiel 2
description:
A second simpler version of Prestel's Art Game. Players learn the most beautiful masterpieces of art history in an entertaining way.

Turn the spinner, move on the game board. Each field represents a range of art and is associated with a task: do pantomime, describe paintings, answer the questions.
A sharp eye and a good memory is needed.
The winner is the first who has puzzled together all the parts of his painting.

name: Das tolle Spiel für Kinder
description:
Simple rules - similar to Trivial Pursuit and some party games - roll the die, move Your game-piece and answer question. If Your answer is correct get the pie of that category. Categories are: Pantomix, What is wanted, Forbidden Words, True or false etc.

Collect piece of pie from each available category to win the game.
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Electronic Wissens-Duell
description:
Electronically assisted knowledge and reaction game. There are 24 panels on both sides of the display and variety of topics, from animals to ABC and sports equipment.
One player enters the code number of the card nad the question is answered. Both players simultaneously search for the perfect image and enter its number. Whoever answers correctly gets faster, the point. The display also shows the final score. Who won after an agreed number of tables the most games is the overall winner.

name: Profilius
description:
Quiz game with cards, 110 question and answer cards, and the areas of travel, transport, technology, nostalgia and motor sports. Dice is rolled and it shows the category from the card.
Player who answer correctly first gets the card.
If there are no more cards left, player who has collected the most cards is the winner.

Promotional game for Pirelli

name: Rund Um's Rote Kreuz
description:
Game with similar mechanism with Trivial Pursuit, the questions relate to the work and training with the Red Cross. 200 question cards with questions in 5 areas of knowledge, including general education.
Object of the game is to collect card from each category to win the game.

name: Captain Midnight's Treasure
description:
In Captain Midnight’s Treasure, you take on the role of a pirate on a crew that has just returned from a very successful raid and now it’s time to divide the loot in typical pirate fashion, with dice!

Captain Midnight’s Treasure is a family friendly, easy to learn, fast paced dice game that provides for challenging strategic game decisions in a fun environment. This game will test your knowledge of odds and probabilities, as well as help you teach them to younger upcoming gamers, as you decide when to push your luck and roll again, or stay with what you have.

Game Play:
You have 5 dice and 3 rolls to get as much treasure as you can from the pot before everyone else does. The game starts off by rolling the dice to determine the Swabbie. After that each person rolls the dice, with the Swabbie going last, trying to get a Ship, Captain, and Crew, with the last two dice determining how much treasure you get.

But since you are pirates, it’s not going to be that easy! First, you have to make sure you get enough treasure to beat the Swabbie or else you have to pay him his dues. Then, certain rolls will cause you to lose your treasure or allow you to take treasure from other players, or even become Captain Midnight himself!

And of course the one with the most gold at the end wins!

name: Hind Commander: Urban Creatures
description:
Hind Commander: Urban Creatures (HCUC) is a Solitaire- or up to 4-Player cooperative game from Robert J. FRITZ inspired by the miniature game "Hind Commander" by Marcin Gerkowics (Assault Publishing). The Player/s fly combat helicopters and have to eliminate a creature (according to the given scenario) before more than 50 % of the concerned town has been destroyed by the creature.
The game is basically designed for a miniature tournament game at the Game Festival 2012 in Vienna which will be played there on the 18th of November for the first time publicly. After that event the rules will be published via Assault Publishing.
The game itself is limited on a set of rules and combines different materials which have to be obtained separately. To play it you need the following components:
- One set of rules and the necessary dice (1xD6 and 1xD10 or custom made die with arrows)
- 2 to 4 1/600 combat helicopters from the "Hind Commander" game system
- at least one 4D-Cityscape-Puzzle - more info on http://4dcityscape.com/ - (each scenario uses a different town and creature)
- different kinds of mini creatures (mini dinos and movie monsters) without any bases (you find product proposals in the rules)
categories: Aviation / Flight, City Building, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rover
description:
The board contains 61 hexes of which 5 are black, 6 red (R) and 6 blue (B). The group of hexes is called the red player's base and contains the red player’s counters at the start of the game, similarly for the blue hexes. The black hexes are impassable. They can neither be stopped on nor passed through.

The game is won when the opponent’s base is completely occupied. This may be at any time after each player has had his first turn. Although the 6 occupying pieces are normally all of your own colour this does not have to be the case. If your opponent is foolish enough to leave a piece in his base then take advantage of it!

Players take it in turn to move any one of their pieces which is not in the opponent’s base. This piece is moved in any direction of the player’s choice until blocked by a black hex, the edge of the board or a piece of either colour. A piece must be moved as far as possible in the chosen direction—it cannot stop ‘en route’. At no time can a piece occupy the same hex as, or pass over, any other piece of either colour. A player must make a move on his turn. If he is unable to do so then he has lost the game. Once a piece has stopped on the opponent's base it may not be moved later but must stay where it is for the rest of the game. There is no penalty for moving through the opponent’s base, provided you do not stop there.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Chemist
description:
Chemist. World Champion in creating grenades on the go. If you need smoke cover take him with you.
Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Cowboy
description:
Cowboy. Texas toughest. Can shoot two guns with closed eyes. Two really big guns...

Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Bodyguard
description:
Bodyguard. Nice guy when you want to feel safe. He protects one chosen character in your team and gives him bonuses to rolls. Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Gladiator
description:
Gladiator. Battle-hardened with countless arena fights. Unmatched in close combat. Knows every trick and technique. In his hands everything becomes a deadly weapon. Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Fixer
description:
Fixer - jack of all trades. When he is around you don't have to worry about weapon jam. He can also make holes in walls so that you'll never get into a trap you can't get out of. Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Thief
description:
Thief - agile as a cat. No obstacle can stop him. He moves without noise. Can surprise enemy and sell them bullet in their back. Can also get cash from wherever your opponent has hidden it. Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Schafköpfchen
description:
Schafköpfchen is an easy variation of Schafkopf, a trick-taking game popular in Austria and Bavaria. In each of the four colors of cards in the deck are six cards numbered 1-6; the deck also contains gray cards numbered 7-15, which are always trump. An additional trump color is determined each round by die roll.

Each round, a player starts with eight cards in hand. The starting player plays a card, and the others have to follow the suit, if possible. The player with the higest card of the played color or a trump gets the trick. After eight tricks, players look at the cards they collected. Some of the cards show flowers, and the player with the most flowers scores 1 point.

The first player to collect 3 points wins.

name: Die Vogelhochzeit
description:
Objective: Be the first moving up to field 50
- moving by turns -
throw the die and move according rolled number; ending on a marked space follow instructions glued on cover inside.
remarks:
published before WWII
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: ABC Nürnberg, Noris Spiele, Tietz und Pinthus

name: Die tolle Drehscheibe
description:
Objective: be the first moving your 3 meeples into target zone
- moving by turns -
throw the die and move according rolled number;
you need a '6' to step out and a '6' for an additional move;
target zone can be reached passing the turntable only;
if a meeple blocks/sits on a 'D' space turntable may be moved;
you may jump over other meeples, but your own one blocks you.
remarks:
published before/during WWII
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Double Duel
description: Get Ready for a fast funny sound-alike word game. This game is for 3-4 players and is a word game. The clues are given that have the same sounding answer but spelled differently. Each player is given a buzzer to ring in to answer. There are over 400 Clues and the game ranges from 7 and older.

name: Traitor Race
description:
This is Game #31 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series.

It is a 2 player traitor game. In the game, players don't know if they are on the same side, or opposing sides. They try to figure this out and either help the human side win the race, or undermine it so the neutral player wins by either losing the race or failing in too many attempts during the race to exceed the current number.

During turn, players will play cards from their hand, trying to exceed the prior turn's target number, in a mechanic like 2-5 Skidoo.

name: Beeline
description:
From the box front: A New Classic Game of Beauty and Skill As Interesting as Chess, Easy as Checkers. A Two Player Game Enjoyed by All Ages.

Players take turns adding tiles to the board, extending a line from a starting space marked on the board. The winner is the first player to reach the opponent's starting space.

name: Bonne Pêche!
description:
Card game featuring 32 Sardine cards in eight sets of four. It is not related to the hobby of Fishing, but there is a set of four fishes going fishing! Rather cannibalistic I think.

Each player gets 5 cards. Players must ask each other for certain cards and if four from one set are completed, that set is considered 'caught'. When asked, if you do not hold such a card, then you can say "Ira à la Pêche" and the asking player takes a card from the deck and the turn passes to the next player. Play continues like this until all eight sets are complete and the winner is the player with the most sets.

name: Verkopft und zugepflastert
description:
Quiz game with motion/dice mechanism on the basis of Trivial Pursuit, general knowledge questions plus questions on first aid and Red Cross matters.

Roll the dice, move You pawn and draw a card. Answer the question from the category You are standing and if it is correct take the card.
Collect cards from each category for win the game.

name: Le Trésor du Gritimis
description:
A children's card game, similar in principle to the standard French game of Mistigri, which itself is of the same family of games as Old Maid or Schwarzer Peter. However this game is significantly different as the odd card held at the end of the game means you are the winner (so it is a sort of Old Maid in reverse).

Each player gets a hand of cards and your turn exists of drawing a card from another player's hand. If a matching pair is formed, it is laid to one side. When all the pairs are matched, the winner is the one holding the treasure card.

name: WWF Naturquiz Unglaublich, aber wahr
description:
Objective: be the first getting a card of each catagory/biosphere (5):
amphibians and reptils, spiders and insects, birds, mammalians, plants
- acting by turn -
active player asks another player for a card from a defined biosphere; you win the card if you answer question about it correctly - and may ask a player again...
remarks:
seems to be an enlarged remake of Unglaublich, aber wahr!

name: Pippi Langstrumpf und ihre Freunde
description:
Objective: be the first getting 7 golden coins
- acting by turn -
there are 28 slides upside down (6 different images) + 6 round tasks slides (visible images);
if you put the 'Pippi' pawn upon one of these task slides and aks 'how often' => next player may open the bet; the following one may increase or pass until no one increases anymore.
if the player turns over appropiate number: + 2 coins
wrong: other players get 1 coin each.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: The Devil's Wind
description:
These rules for refighting battles from the Indian Mutiny of 1857 - 58 follow on from previous sets in this series ~ A Good Dusting and Washing the Spears ~ which have received a very positive reception from gamers. They are designed not for competition play but with enjoyment between like-minded friends firmly to the fore and focus very much on throwing loads of dice and feeling the brush of the Devil's Wind across your cheek in the process! Games should play out satisfactorily in two to three hours on a table about 7' x 4' or so. There is no figure, time or ground scale to worry about, just cut straight to the action on the road to Lucknow.

The game mechanisms allow all players in the game to take on commands within an Honourable East India Company or Regular British force, with the Mutineers controlled by all of the players in accordance with the auto generation and action rules. It is equally possible for two or more players to take on opposing Mutineer and HEIC/HM forces and play the game out conventionally. The rules aim to give you an enjoyable game where, if correctly wisely and blessed by the dice gods, the Mutineer forces may win.

The full colour rules include numerous illustrations of action on the tabletop here in GHQ, units and individual character figures; scenic items to enhance your tabletop battlefield; a sample scenario to get you started straight away; a play sheet which can be photocopied; a short reading list; and a suggested list of figure manufacturers, in 28mm at least.

name: Savez-vous compter les Choux?
description:
Children's card game. 36 cards comprising of 30 Cabbage cards (with 1 to 3 cabbages on them), 2 Snail cards and 4 Hedgehog picture cards.

All the cards are shuffled and the first player takes the top card. If it is a Cabbage card, he lays it in front of him. If it is a part of the hedgehog picture, it is placed in the centre of the table. If it is a Snail, the player must return it to the deck of unused cards together with all his Cabbage cards. The pack is then shuffled again. Then the next player draws a card and follows the same instructions.

The game ends when all four parts of the Hedgehog picture have been revealed and the winner is the one with the most cabbages in their possession at that time. (Note: the rules say the most Cabbage cards wins but this must be wrong or, otherwise, having 1, 2 or 3 Cabbages on the cards would be meaningless).

The box is one which extends, that is, the inner sleeve slides down to reveal the character up a tall ladder and watering her cabbages.

name: ABC-Karussell
description:
This educational game leads the children on the basis of a motivating theme in the world of letters and sounds. To put a carousel, letters and the corresponding picture cards that match only if they were set correctly. The manual includes an educational commentary and educational content are compliant with the current curriculum.

In his turn kid may place letter-tile touching the inner cirle with the same color or picture-tile touching the correct letter.

name: Super Kosto
description:
Simple trick-taking game for the young (maybe intended to be their first experience of taking tricks). The four Trophy cards are set aside and shuffled and one drawn at random. This nominates the trump suit, be it Crocodiles, Apes, Lions or Elephants.

Thereafter it follows all the normal rules for taking tricks; Must follow suit if you can, may trump if you can't or you may play any card you wish to get rid of.

The winner is the player with the most cards after all the tricks have been played.

name: Star Confrontations: Hive Devourers
description:
From the Rulebook:

The Hive Devourers army book requires the Star Confrontations rulebook in order to play. The Hive Devourers are a race of bio-mechanical horrors that want to consume everything living in the universe. They charge their hordes of deadly warriors into the heart of the enemy and use their massive war beasts to crush vehicles and heavy troops.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Border Bed
description:
With Border Bed, instead of having the bed completely stolen by your partner during night, you will play bed space through series of questions and actions. The most successful player will enjoy more bed space - to the detriment of the other - for the following night.

At the beginning, the bed is equally split on the “bed space” tracker. Then, each player moves one after the other on a simple board using a D6. Depending on where the player ends up, he or she will need to either answer a question or perform an action - on a successful answer, he/she will gain 5 cm on the bed (the other losing an equal amount) and will be allow to play again.
A few squares on the board have extra bonuses/maluses beside the basic question or action.

Questions are taken from a trivial pursuit style deck, with 5 categories: sport/entertainement/musik, general knowledge, day-to-day life, erotism/sexuality, and “personal”. The last one typically consist of question asking you to know something about your partner - favorite dish, name of first pet and more personal things. Actions come from an action card deck. They usually involves some personal things - kissing your partner for more than 10s, doing a massage and so on.

The game ends when one of the player arrives at the last position on the board. The loser - player who is going to have less space on the bed - can still decide to perform a few extra actions to regain a bit of space.

name: Wissens-Spektrum Offizielle Österreich Ausgabe
description:
6600 Questions in six fields of knowledge are waiting for you to be answered in this special Austrian Edition.
The categories are: general knowledge, Austria, natural sciences, geography, art and history.
The first, who has answered three questions of each category and an additional question of one category chosen by the opponents, wins.

name: Dîner à la carte!
description:
Build up a full meal using recipes from all French Regions by answering trivia questions about French gastronomy. The game comes with a full cookbook of the 264 dishes mentioned in the game.

Questions are the main part of the game - they come from a deck of cards, each card corresponding to one region local dish and containing 4 different questions - e.g., what composes a traditional dish, where the name of specialty comes from and so on.

Each player is randomly assigned a french region at the beginning of the game and tries to build a full menu - first course, main dish, cheese, desert, drink and a speciality - preferably with recipes from the region. First player to have a complete menu win the game.

Every time a player answers correctly a question, he/she will be able to either add it to his/her own menu if the dish (written on the question card) was from the same region and that the menu slot is still empty. Otherwise, a token mechanism still allows the player to eventually fill in its menu slots.

name: Close Quarters: The Prometheus Incident
description:
Close Quarters is a fast-paced print 'n play boardgame of futuristic man-to-man combat, played on maps created from multiple room tiles. Using easy-to-learn game mechanics, The Prometheus Incident places players in the roles of the defending crewmembers of the Earth Protectorate Ship Prometheus or the troopers of an assaulting rebel faction intent on capturing the vessel for their own purposes, with battles fought within the confines of the key areas of the ship.

Close Quarters: The Prometheus Incident includes:


Complete game rules for playing Close Quarters, including rules that will be used in future combat modules;
