Over 30 unique room and corridor map tiles, rendered at 300dpi for best printing results. Use them in the provided scenarios, those of your own design, or to spice up the combat layouts of your favorite SciFi RPG.
Five highly replayable scenarios that allow players to re-create the more intense segments of the action aboard the Prometheus.
Background fiction describing the basis of the overall conflict and each of the scenarios.
All of the counters, markers, and reference sheets necessary to play - everything but dice!


Close Quarters can also be played on any RPG-compatible map overprinted with 1" squares, allowing players to use self-created or commercially available maps or deck plans from their collection when playing this game.
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Die Olchis werden Fußballmeister
description:
Objective: gain 3 victory chips
- acting by turn -
place meeples on starting position; try to 'climb' goalwards
using 3 dice in the beginning; choose a target - if your dice show a matching colour => move upon; if you want to do a second/third move, use 2 dice or 1 die respectively.
If you fail you are going to loose all your moves during that turn. Scoring a goal => gain 1 chip

name: Wissens-Spektrum: Märchen
description:
More than 1000 questions for Wissens-Spektrum about fairy tales.

The first, who has answered three questions of each category and an additional question of one category chosen by the opponents, wins.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Trivia

name: Wissens-Spektrum: Motorwelt
description:
More than 1000 questions for Wissens-Spektrum about Motor World.

The first, who has answered three questions of each category and an additional question of one category chosen by the opponents, wins.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: Wissens-Spektrum: Bibel
description:
More than 1000 questions for Wissens-Spektrum about Bible.

The first, who has answered three questions of each category and an additional question of one category chosen by the opponents, wins.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Religious, Trivia

name: Wissens-Spektrum: Olympia
description:
More than 1000 questions for Wissens-Spektrum about Olympics.

The first, who has answered three questions of each category and an additional question of one category chosen by the opponents, wins.

name: Wissens-Spektrum: Reisen
description:
More than 1000 questions for Wissens-Spektrum about Traveling.

The first, who has answered three questions of each category and an additional question of one category chosen by the opponents, wins.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: Wissens-Spektrum: Rock & Pop
description:
More than 1000 questions for Wissens-Spektrum about Rock and Pop Music.

The first, who has answered three questions of each category and an additional question of one category chosen by the opponents, wins.

name: Wissens-Spektrum: Deutsche Geschichte
description:
More than 1000 questions for Wissens-Spektrum about Germany.

The first, who has answered three questions of each category and an additional question of one category chosen by the opponents, wins.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Magic Maelstrom
description:
Updated August 2013 after more playtesting and streamlining.

On another Earth, in another Universe, the Magic Maelstrom sits, surrounded by the frozen northlands warped by the gravity-like pull of the mana. When the Magic Maelstrom spins, it can destroy all within its reach; only those with inherent immunity can resist its power.
Fire, ice and darkness dominate the northland seasons; brief glimpses of light intervene to lift the doom and gloom.

Mana is power; mana is all; those who control the mana can control the northlands...

Standard Game: 4 rounds.
Playing Time: 2-3 hours for experienced players, longer for newer players
Number of Players: 2-4, best with 4
Winning: At the end of the agreed number of rounds, the player with the most mana points on the victory track wins.

KEY FEATURES
Alternate actions to limit player downtime - rounds are highly interactive.
Potential use of card colour and/or function to give a player both options and a dilemma.

See the Two-page Rules and Introduction documents below for more details.

Each round consists of two communal actions, then alternate actions until all available options are either used or turn declared complete by all players.

Players use units on a board to control their home region and to take over new areas. Areas can generate resource cards.

Resource cards are used to purchase units, activate areas of their card colour to take actions in or are traded in for mana. Resource cards are generated by a dice roll once per round. At the end of the round, you must trade in any unused resource cards for mana points.

Fate cards have a variety of effects, such as creatures, devastating events and strange occurrences that may help or hinder your cause. They may also be used to activate areas of their card colour to take actions in. Fate cards are drawn at the start of each round and can be retained in your hand until used or, perhaps, stolen by your enemies.

All discarded Fate cards are placed face up and some discarded Fate cards may be affected by those held by other players.

At the end of the game, the winner is decided by adding up a combination of mana points for areas, units and special places, then adding these to the victory track to see has the most mana in total.
categories: Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Phase Order

name: St. George's Gauntlet
description:
St. George's Gauntlet is a "push your luck" dice game. As a knight of the Order of St. George, you must collect gems from a cavern guarded by a gauntlet of dragons. The roll of the dice determines whether you collect gems or get killed by the dragons. Certain rolls will allow you to kill the dragons, if you are willing to take the risk of rolling a special "Dragon Slayer Die". Collecting the last gem in a level of the cavern results in a big bonus, but failure gives your opponents an easier shot! Do you leave the cavern to earn glory, or push forward for greater rewards?

The game can be played two ways: In the Basic Game, all players compete until the sixth level of the cavern is explored. In the challenging "Video Game" variant, each player begins with a set number of lives and is eliminated when all lives are lost.

name: Pettersson und Findus  Wie Findus zu Pettersson kam
description:
Objective: be the first one gaining 6 cards in front of you
- acting by turns/drawing simultaneously -
2 x 15 cards (with 6 different images)forming a circle upon the table, visible are only 15; in the centre of the circle 6 cards (numbered 0 - 5) are placed, too.
Active player throws the die; the symbol shown on the die must be combined with a matching no. card (if 3 cards of with that kind of image are visible 00> take no. 3);
the first successful player gets 1 card; wrong => an already achieved card must be dropped.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Memory, Novel-based

name: The Game of Flight
description:
A World War II era card game where each player tries to be the first to complete a "Flight" and win the game by playing a Terminal card on his/her turn. A completed Flight consists of an Aeroplane card, A Pilot card, Map cards and a Terminal card all of the same color. The Air Hostess card (acting as a wild card) may substitute for any Flight card to assist in completing a Flight. Players first draw a terminal card to determine which Flight they need to complete. These are kept face down. Six cards from the deck are then drawn for each player and play continues with each player attempting to complete the Flight color that matches their Terminal card. All flight cards played are placed face up and used communally.

A point variation for this game my be played where players not completing a Flight total the points from the cards remaining in their hands and the lowest cumulative score over four completed games is declared the winner. In this version all cards except the Air Hostess (50 points) have an assigned value of 10 points. In this version penalty points (100) for poor play may be assessed.

The game consists of 60 cards divided as follows: 4 Aeroplane cards. 4 Pilot cards, 36 Map cards (9 for each of 4 flights numbered 2 through 10), 4 Storm cards, 4 Storm Buster cards, 1 Air Hostess (wild) card, 7 Terminal cards. Cards are colored white, yellow, blue and pink for each of the 4 flights. The Air Hostess (wild) card is green.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: uSpy
description: uSpy is a WWII espionage deck-building game for two to five players. In the game, each player acts as the Director of Espionage of a WWII major power and the goal is to infiltrate enemy Headquarters, place moles inside enemy spy Networks, and steal money/technologies. The game ends after seven rounds or when one player has three or more enemy moles in place. Players tally their victory points are tallied, and whoever has the most points wins!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Spies/Secret Agents, World War II
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Rainbow Spinning Game
description:
This is a game played with 6 tops. The 6 tops are different colors corresponding to 6 colors on the game board. You get all 6 tops spinning and wait for them to stop. A top with its tip resting on its color scores 1 point. Any other color scores nothing. The game is to 50 points.

The board is a square divided into 4 quadrants. In each quadrant the board is broken up into circular arcs that look like 6 concentric circles that were cut horizontally and vertically through the center, then randomized.

For some odd reason the box top has the name "Rainbow Spinning Game" but the rules have the name "The Game of Rainbow Tops".

name: The Lincoln Highway Road Game
description:
The historic Lincoln Highway, the first coast-to-coast highway in 1913, stretched from New York City to San Francisco. So children can learn more about the highway in a fun way, the nonprofit organization Lincoln Highway Heritage Corridor created a board game. The Lincoln Highway Road Trip comes with game pieces of a vintage gas pump, antique autos, compass, tourist cabin, postcard and suitcase as well as 200 trivia cards and fortune cards.

The game board reflects the regional part of the highway -- known as Route 30 -- in the six-county area from North Huntingdon at the Allegheny and Westmoreland County border to beyond Gettysburg. A grant from the Sprout Fund in Pittsburgh enabled the organization to develop the game and distribute it to upper elementary and middle schools along the region's 200-mile corridor. It was created by Alex Grab of Ligoni

Using pewter-like game pieces (vintage gas tank, suitcase, compass, tourist cabin, postcard and antique auto), players move along the highway beginning in Irwin. The goal is to be the first to travel the historic route through Westmoreland, Somerset, Bedford, Fulton, Franklin and Adams counties to Abbottstown in eastern Pa.

One of the 200 question cards reads: “A volunteer highway crew is picking up debris along the side of the road near Buckstown. How long does it take for a Styrofoam cup to decompose?” A. 20 years; B. 90 years; C. 150 years; or D. 400 years?” The correct answer is 400 years.

Another is: “The Mountain Playhouse and Green Gables Restaurant originally started as a sandwich stand. What was the dessert that became such a hit with Lincoln Highway travelers?” A. Ice Cream Sandwich; B. Custard; C. Angel Food Cake; or D. Torte? C is the correct answer.

name: Ratz Fatz Geburtstag
description:
A birthday-themed educational children's game in the Ratz Fatz series.

The game consists of 20 wooden figures (a rabbit, a pirate, a candle, a cake, a present,...), 10 wooden tokens and a booklet with several game ideas for kids of various ages.
The basic game idea is that an adult reads or tells a story or a poem from the booklet, and the children have to grab the figures representing items/persons from the text. For each correct item, they gain a token, and the player with the most tokens wins the game.

Other ideas presented in the booklet include a memory game and finding figures that fit a certain description (all animals, everything that is edible, things you can play with etc.).
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: World Builder Type II
description:
Theme:
Play one of four deities attempting to build a new world. Score the most points to become the chief of the pantheon.

Game Play:
Each World Card has 12 symbols in 4 shapes. The symbols are colored in or black. Each player is trying to accumulate 1 of the 4 shapes. Colored in shapes count for points unless the Polarity special action card is played, then black shapes count for points. Each player gets to play 1 card per turn unless a special action card is used to change this.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Math, Mythology, Prehistoric
publishers: Melancholy Media, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Deutschland-Quiz: Baden-Württemberg
description:
Objective: gain most question cards finding correct answers
- acting by turns -
draw a card and give the correct answer;
if you are right keep card as bonus point

64 question and answer cards, informative and curious about geography, politics, celebrities, recreational activities and history of Baden-Württemberg, state of Germany.

name: Dice Dale
description:
Dice Dale is a resource management, worker placement euro style dice game with heavy strategy and serious gameplay in a small dice bag. Players compete for victory points as they build up the thriving fictional city of Dice Dale.

Players roll six-sided dice for resources each round, collect workers in inverse proportion to the number of resources they gained, and then spend those resources and workers to build new buildings and gain victory points. A large collection of buildings with differing effects provides deep strategy and interesting decisions as the game unfolds.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Willi wills wissen: Fußball
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target zone
- acting by turns/simultaneously -
Active player draws a card & decides, which question (1 out of 2) should be answered (multiple choice A-C);
all players switch simultaneously chosen letter & red foil is used to make the correct answer visible:
correct? Move one space ahead.
At the time leading player steps on a marked (tossing) space last players have to use their letters in a 'rock-paper-scissors'
game... winner - or tied - may step ahead.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia

name: Un de Plus: Les Véhicules
description: Young children's game. Each child has a hand of four cards and the top card of the stack is revealed. If the player has an identical type of vehicle and the number of such vehicles are the same plus 1, then he can discard the card. If not, another card is revealed and the next player tries, and so on. The first child to use all their cards, wins.

name: Jeu des Clowns
description: Young childrens game. Each card features a clown in different costumes. Each player gets a hand of cards and the top card is revealed. In your turn, if you can match one feature on the exposed card you can play your card on top of it. If you don't or cannot spot it, the turn passes to the next player. The first player to use all their cards, wins.

name: DOR
description: The DOR is you’re only way out!

name: Planit: The Omni Evolution Game
description:
The Planit game was included with Omni Magazine Volume 14 #1, October 1991 edition. From the publisher's site:
"The Omni Evolution Game Life’s not one big crapshoot. Instead it’s a board game that lets each player be Gaia."

"In the first phase, players must fill the atmosphere up with oxygen. In the second phase, they must evolve higher animals in sequence. The first to evolve 'Evolutionary Humans" wins."

Players play cards from their hand to affect the environment and evolution of life on their individual planets, which are represented on the game map.

name: Kreuz und Quer durch Europa
description:
Each player is dealt 6 cards. — The card following next will be placed on the table face up, being the “starting-card” for the journey. The remaining cards will be left in the pile, face down.

The first player takes the top card of the pile and must consider how to lay out as many cards as possible on to the starting card, according to the following rules:
The player may continue laying out only cards showing countries with common borders (a map of Europe is provided). He is also allowed to lay out two cards of the same country at the same time;

Any country may be reached by aeroplane, i.e. including any country not adjoining the country shown on the card laid out last. However, the rule is that a plane may be used only once in each turn. Flying will be indicated by leaving the previously laid out card uncovered in such a way that the aeroplane will remain visible. (With neighbouring countries the cards will be placed partly on top of each other in the form of scales, the aeroplane remaining covered.) It is left to the discretion of the player himself whether or not and when he wishes to make use of a card as air ticket.

The first player having finished laying out as many cards as possible next to the starting card and in conformity with the above rules, each additional player will follow his turn in corresponding manner, by laying out his cards next to the card laid out by the previous player.

The winner of a round will be the player who first succeeds in laying out all his cards. The game should be played to a pre-agreed number of rounds.

Scoring the points: the figure in the left hand corner of each card shows the number of neighbouring countries. The figures shown on the cards remaining with the players will be counted minus points for those players.
Special instructions: in addition to countries with common borders those countries connected with each other by ferry boat (railway ferries) will be considered neighbouring countries too. (See the map of Europe with the game).
In this game Turkey is considered a neighbouring country also of the Soviet Union, although that frontier is in Asia. There is no neighbouring country to Iceland.

name: Thomas & Friends: Windy Day Rescue Game
description:
This is a children's game in which each player moves around the board collecting items as they land on them. Movement is decided by rolling a dice which has three different colours on its sides, and moving to the next available space of the colour shown. The object is to collect four items and return to the start/finish space.

Publisher's Description:

Join Thomas & his friends in a race around Sodor collecting stranded cargo before delivering them safely to the station!

It's a very windy day in Sodor and all the cargo has been blown around the village. Help Thomas and his friends collect the stranded cargo and deliver it safely back to the station. A colour recognition and collection game for children from 3+ years.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Trains
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: HiT entertainment, Paul Lamond Games Ltd

name: Deutschland-Quiz: Thüringen
description:
Objective: gain most question cards finding correct answers
- acting by turns -
draw a card and give the correct answer;
if you are right keep card as bonus point

64 question and answer cards, informative and curious about geography, politics, celebrities, recreational activities and history of Thüringen, state of Germany.

description:

64 question and answer cards, informative and curious about geography, politics, celebrities, recreational activities and history of Bayern, state of Germany.

64 question and answer cards, informative and curious about geography, politics, celebrities, recreational activities and history of Hamburg, state of Germany.

64 question and answer cards, informative and curious about geography, politics, celebrities, recreational activities and history of Hessen, a federal state of Germany.

64 question and answer cards, informative and curious about geography, politics, celebrities, recreational activities and history of Mecklenburg-Vorpommern, state of Germany.

name: Deutschland-Quiz: Sachsen-Anhalt
description:
Objective: gain most question cards finding correct answers
- acting by turns -
draw a card and give the correct answer;
if you are right keep card as bonus point

64 question and answer cards, informative and curious about geography, politics, celebrities, recreational activities and history of Saxony-Anhalt, state of Germany.

name: Was ist Was Schweiz Quiz
description:
Objective:
get most question cards finding correct answers
- acting by turns -
draw a card and give the correct answer;
if you are right keep card as bonus point
content:
64 question- & answer cards (backside), wide range (geography, people, politics, history of Switzerland

name: Blokkerende Botsauto's
description:
Blokkerende Botsauto's (Blocking Dodgems) is a print and play game for two players.

Each player is the driver of a car. The cars drive on a 4 by 4 grid of streets. Each player in turn passes one intersection. Each intersection is a double sided tile. One side has an intersection where no right turn is allowed. The other side shows an intersection where no left turn allowed. Driving straight ahead is always allowed. Each time a car has passed an intersection, its tile is flipped. The first player to pass all 16 intersections wins. The cars cannot be both on the same tile at the same time. A player who has nowhere to go (his car can only drive off the grid, or on a blocked tile) loses the game. During the setup phase of the game, each player determines the initial state of half of the grid.

This game was published as a prize question in the Dutch magazine Pythagoras (issue 51/3, Jun 2012). It's a magazine about mathematics for high school students. Readers had to find a winning strategy (no answer was found).
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Dragonfly
description:
Some people don't realize that the Dragonfly is a friend. It eats up a lot of Mosquitoes and in the summer when I see armies of dragonflies arriving, I give a cheer. Go, Team Dragonfly, get those nasty mosquitoes before they get us and our pets. The object of the game is to capture the mosquitoes with the dragonflies so people and pets don't get bitten. The game is over when all the mosquitoes are accounted for, either all caught or some caught and some (ouch) biting people and pets.

Adults enjoy the strategies as well, especially in a family setting. Play solo or with as many as 4.

name: Die drei ???: Im Bann des Voodoo
description:
Objective: get 5 victory points forming a continuous line on a
number line from 1 - 10
- acting by turns -
active player rolls the die and moves; ending on a question mark a card may be drawn from another player - one out of 3 questions is read - 3 possible answers, too. Correct? Take top (hidden) numbered chip from that place and drop it upon your number line. Wrong or space already occupied? Place chip at lowest position.
Special space (!!!) in the centre: May be entered by one player only => search and use a chip of your choice;

name: Tack
description:
Described on the box as "The Card Game for Pony Lovers".

Each player is dealt 7 cards and the game-play is similar to Rummy. You can draw a card of the deck or take the top card in the discard pile. The aim is to be the first to complete a 'set'. A set must contain a pony, a bridle, a saddle, a pair of stirrups and 3 other cards that a rider might need or desire (a rosette is good and is worth 9 points whereas a grooming kit is not so nice and only scores 3 points).

Each card in the set has a points value. The winning player scores those points and a new hand is played. The one with the most points after an agreed number of hands, wins.

name: Knusperhäuschen-Spiel
description:
Objective: be the first collecting 6 cookies
- acting by turns -
the board is prepared - 6x6 grid - covered by small slides;
active player rolls 2 dice (1D6 + coloured);
the slide with these 'coordinates' tells ypu what to do:
take cookies, get one mouse (or even 2 mice) => leads to cookoies consumption, witch...

name: StarSpeed 17: Rocket Racers of Galaxy 5000
description:
Thousands of years ago, this galaxy was in turmoil. Many civilizations discovered the power of Grotons as an energy source, and used it to master interplanetary travel. Unfortunately, they found their neighbors very difficult to relate to. The one thing they all seemed to have in common was their pride in their ability to travel through space, and they all liked to show off. Before long they began having periodical competitions to see who had the better spaceships, and this eventually grew into this regular race.

Players choose an alien race to represent in the race, and they determine the shape of the course. Planets along the course can be chosen at random, and each racer is assigned a Home world and a Rival world, which provide benefits and disadvantages during the race. Who will demonstrate their superior technology and racing skills by crossing the finish line first and win the Groton Cup?

Play Speed cards to move your Rocket along the track and to break orbit from the planets along the way. Status cards played against you by other players will slow you down, but can be repaired using matching Remedy cards. Equipping your ship will protect you from Status cards, but if the status is powerful enough it could destroy your equipment!

The game also features a unique 'Last Place' rule, where the player at the back of the pack gets an extra turn each round to try and catch up to the rest, or blow past them if the circumstances permit. Last Place can change hands multiple times each race, and it's really not a bad place to be!
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: The Stargrunt Weapons Manual
description:
From the back of the rules book;

This Manual is a supplement for the "Stargrunt" 25mm Squard-Level Combat System from Ground Zero Games.

This booklet Contains:


Over eighty different weapons and systems, with full game stats and details!
Additional and optional rules for "Stargrunt"!
Games stats for many of the vehicles available from GZG!

name: Exchange Square
description:
Exchange Square is a stock market simulation board game where players compete to become the first to reach Master Trader.

Buy and sell assets and ride on the economic highs to make the most money. Beware of the bubble bursting as other players back-stab you to get ahead in the rat race!

This turn based roll and move game involves both team work and individual insight. Players can buy four assets (Gold, Oil, Technology and Property) and then manipulate the prices of their assets by using Insider Knowledge cards. Fortune may smile on some lucky traders with the Tax & Benefits cards, however beware of the Event cards which can change everything in one move for all the players!

name: Passionnelle-Mans
description:
This is a strategy game for 2-8 racers. The game aims to tell the "story" of Le Mans in 4 sets of races (rounds). There are 246 cards that tell the store of the race and allow the players to move their cars along the track. Each racer also has an endurance and various penalties can show up that will reduce their endurance.

You collect cards on your turn (6 cards max in your hand) and try to collect 3-5 cards from the same family; this will give you a bonus in your move or give you additional endurance to last longer.

You can also play on teams, with drivers on the same team, taking a team counter.

Rules are in both French and English.

The games was published in conjunction with the Automobile Club de l'Ouest (ACO).

name: Predator
description:
Two player trumps game. Divide the cards evenly and stack them face-down in front of you. Both players draw a card and reveal it.
There are a number of possible results:

Predator card (P) On the bottom of the card are silhouettes of creatures it will eat. If the card revealed by your opponent features that silhouette, the card is 'eaten'. Both cards are taken by the Predator and put on the bottom of his stack.

Food card is a creature that could be eaten so it is vulnerable. A Food card cannot beat anything.

Wildlife Rescue Card will beat a Predator.

Man Hunter card beats all cards except Wildlife Rescue cards.

Neutral (N) cards are just that. They cannot eat any card and they cannot be eaten.

If a situation arises where the exposed cards cannot beat each other then reveal two more cards and check again. This is repeated until one card takes the other and the winner of that duel takes all the revealed cards.

The main cards are in four colours but the colours only link to a region of the world. The colour itself has no other relevance.

The game is endorsed by the World Wildlife Fund (WWF).
First player to capture all the cards, wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: Onkey Bonkey!
description:
An Onkey is something that gets whacked by a Bonkey. For example, a Bonkey (Hammer) whacks an Onkey (Nail).

Shuffle all the Onkey cards and place them in a face-down stack. The first player turns up the top card. The other players look at their hand of nine cards and if they have the correct Bonkey, they should try to be first to place it on top of the Onkey and shout out "Onkey Bonkey". If first, that player takes the Onkey Bonkey (a matching pair is called an Onkey Bonkey). If you have a Blank Bonkey card you can also try to be first and cover the Onkey card. If you do, you don't get an Onkey Bonkey but you do stop another player from doing so.

The game is played over two rounds and the one with the most Onkey Bonkey's, wins.

There are a couple of errors on the box. It says it is for two to four players but clearly two players cannot play it (the player turning over the Onkey card cannot compete, only the other players, so in a two player game this would be pointless). And the publisher claims it is an educational game! That is stretching the game description to say the least.

name: Das große Fußball-Quiz
description:
Over 1,000 tricky questions and answers about the German Bundesliga and the 2nd Bundesliga.

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points or by time. Who is the first to score predetermined points or has the most points after a certain time is the winner..

name: Fanny
description:
Fanny is a nice and helpful instructor. She tells you all about riding and horse care, how you have to hold the reins, and how you scrape the horse's hoof etc.
Players choose their horse and starts racing. In his turn player rolls the dice and draws a card collecting various stuff he needs. If he must jump over the hurdles he needs horseshoes etc. or continues his ride until he collects things he needs

Who finish the race first is the winner.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Racing, Sports

name: Firestorm Invasion: Conquest
description:
Once you've smashed your enemy with a lightning strike, it's time to take, and then hold, those vital enemy hotspots. This could be fighting over a military base, entering the ruins of a devastated city, or some other strategic objective. This is where your highly trained infantry, with armoured support, come into their own. We call this CONQUEST and it will be presented using 15mm scale miniatures.

Source: Publisher Blurb

Conquest is second tabletop wargame in Firestorm Invasion family. This game uses 15mm and dice to recreate fights during planet invasion in Firestorm Armada universe.

Each player controls his forces made of 15mm infantry and vehicles and tries to decimate opponent or fulfil scenario objective.

name: Firestorm Invasion: Special Ops
description:
Lastly, but by no means least, comes the gritty art of daring special operations. Small teams of highly trained troops going man-to-man against the best your enemy can throw at you. Capture a bunker, rescue hostages, eliminate a target or destroy a shield generator - this is what your elite troops trained for. We call this SPECIAL OPS and it will be presented using 28mm scale miniatures.

Source: Publisher blurb

Special Ops is third, and final tabletop wargame in Firestorm Invasion family. It uses dice and 28mm to recreate small scale special operations during final phase of planet invasion in Firestorm Armada universe.

Each player control small force made from 28mm miniatures and tries to fulfil scenario objective or smash his opponent.

name: Teddy's Party
description:
Childrens card game. There are eight full sets of different Teddy cards. A set consists of five cards, a full-size Teddy and four other cards, each a quarter of the related Teddy.

Deal 7 cards to each player. The first player must play a full size Teddy card if he has one. If he doesn't, he draws a card. Once a full size Teddy card is on the table, the next player can play either another full size Teddy card or can add a quarter card to any matching Teddy currently on the table. You must play a card if you can but you may only ever play one card per turn.

When a set is finished, the player playing the last quarter card on it, scores 1 point. The first player to use all their cards scores 5 points. The winner is the first player to score 11 points.
publishers: AG Müller (AGMüller), Rhino Games, U.S. Games Systems, Inc.

name: Une poule sur un mur…
description:
A single pawn travels on a wall the number of spaces indicated by the dice, but in the direction chosen by the player. The space where the hen stops indicates what action is possible to do - draw, give, receive or exchange card etc.
The goal is to collect five cards that make up the rhyme.

name: Silent Hill: Defeated
description:
This is an unofficial fan-made game, and is not affiliated with nor endorsed by Konami or Great Eastern Entertainment.

From the publisher:
Silent Hill: Defeated is a free, unofficial, print-and-play card game designed for use with Silent Hill-themed playing cards (not included) to play a game more thematically linked to the popular survival-horror videogame. The card deck is a "poker" deck with 2 Jokers, but the splitting of the deck's artwork between Monsters (Black suits) and Heroes (Red suits) led to the design of Silent Hill: Defeated. The game could conceivably be played with any "poker"-style deck, but the Silent Hill deck from Great Eastern Entertainment is highly recommended.

The gameplay is like Silent Hill meets Uno. You start the game by drawing 7 cards and your goal is to get rid of all the cards in your hand. You do this by "challenging" the top card of the discard pile. Sometimes that card is a Monster and you will need a Hero to fight it. Sometimes, it's the other way around. The Heroes (red-suited cards) and Monsters (black-suited cards) have different rules and play a little differently, but in the end you have to combine both strategies in order to empty your hand of cards, which allows you to finally escape the twisted place called... Silent Hill.
(please check the Files section for the rules pdf.)

name: Sound Domino
description:
Children's picture dominoes game but with a real twist - with sound! Besides the 28 domino cards, you have Marvin the Electronic Mouse.

There are seven types of images, Ship, Bicycle, Motorbike, Tractor, Car, Train and Aeroplane. Marvin has sound effects to go with each image.

Each player gets a number of dominoes depending on the number of players. These are laid out in front of you picture-side up. One domino is also placed in the centre of the table. Marvin must be in easy reach of all the players.

In your turn you must press Marvin's button and he will play a sound (example - ring-a-ding). Now, everyone looks at their dominoes at the same time, looking for a bicycle domino that will fit to the array of dominoes in the centre (of course, normal domino rules apply). If you have a domino that will fit at either end of the array, you must quickly press the blue button on Marvin. Play continues until someone uses all their dominoes and that person is the winner.

name: Baa Baa Black Sheep
description:
Children's card game based on the nursery rhyme:

Baa Baa Black Sheep, have you any wool?
Yes sir, yes sir, three bags full
One for my master, one for my dame
and one for the little boy who lives down the lane

The rules:
Object To collect a set of 4 cards comprising of a Little Boy, a Dame, a Master and a Black Sheep.
Deal each player four cards and place the rest of the pile face downwards on the table. Turn the top card over and place face upwards beside the pile. All the players look at the 4 cards in their hand to see if they already have a Dame, A Black Sheep, Little Boy or Master card amongst them.The youngest player begins by taking a card from the top of the pile. If this card is a Dame, Master or Little Boy card he can keep it to add or start his collection. He will then place an unwanted card from his hand on the pile which is face upwards beside the main pile. If he has picked up a Black Sheep card, or if he has a Black Sheep card already in his hand, he may place the Black Sheep card face upwards on the pile and turn to any player saying ‘Have you any wool?’ If the person questioned has a Dame, Master or Little Boy card in his hand he must hand this card over in return for whatever card the original player chooses to give him. The player who has asked ‘Have you any wool?' then takes another card from the main pile to keep a total of four cards in his hand.
Play then continues with the next player taking another card from the pile. If he picks up a Dame, Master or Little Boy card he can add or start his collection and must throw away any unwanted card from his hand on to the pile face upwards. A Black Sheep card may not be picked up from the face up pile, but any other card can be taken. Play continues with each player taking a turn in the same manner.
The winner is the first player to have a Master, a Dame, a Little Boy and a Black Sheep card in his hand.

name: The Old Woman Who Lived in a Shoe
description:
Childrens card game based on the nursery rhyme.

Object is to collect 10 cards comprising of The Old Woman and her nine children.

To play, spread all the cards face downwards on the floor or table. The youngest player begins by turning over one card face upwards. If the card is the Old Woman the player may place this card in front of him. He may then turn over another card to try to get the next card in sequence. When he fails he must leave the card face upwards on the table. The next player turns one card upwards and must also have the Old Woman card to start. The player may choose any of the cards on the table or floor whether these are face up or face down.
When a player has his Old Woman card in front of him, on his next turn he must try to look for a card showing a picture of a little baby. Next time he must find a picture of a child card that is slightly larger in size. To do this he can turn over another card or choose from the cards already on show. He must start with his Old Woman Card, then the little baby and then a slightly larger child until he has 10 cards in front of him. Each card will match up if chosen correctly as part of the picture overlaps from one card to another.

To finish, the winner is the first player to have the Old Woman and all her children in the correct sequence {A total of 10 cards). With two players, two sets of Old Woman and her children may be collected by each player to decide the winner {a total of 20 cards).

name: Memo Extra Kiekeboe
description:
Can you guess what lies under the colored cards? Roll the dice and take a peek under the card of the color indicated by the
dice.

There are 24 cards in six colors and six cards with little hole in the center. In his turn player rolls the dice and try to guess the top cards of that color. If it is correct he takes that card and continues his turn. If it is wrong he must say what he saw.

If there are no more cards left, the player with the most cards wins.

name: Memo Extra Picturebook Boys
description: Each player chooses a story. Shuffle the 32 cards and place them face down on the table. The oldest player begins the game by looking one of the cards. If the card is part of his story player takes it and puts it in his book of images. The player may continue his turn until he looks the card not belonging to his story. He shows the card to other and ends his turn. The first player who completed his picture with 8 cards is the winner.

name: Memo Extra: Treasure Hunt
description:
The object of the game is to be the first pirate who reached the island.

In his turn player flips 2 cards on the table. If they are not identical his turn is over. If they are identical the player:
1) moves his pawn the number of spaces indicated on the cards.
2) turns the cards face-down and places one card on any free ghost-ship.
If all 4 ghost-ships are blocked then player may add a card if he remember the last cards on this ghost-ship. If not he places the card back on the table and ends his turn.

Player who places the last card on the ghost-ship reaches first to the treasure island and is the winner

name: Memo Extra Trio
description:
In this memory variant, players must find 3 cards that form the combination (f.e: Pirate, Pirate Ship, Treasure)
In his turn player turns around 3 tiles and if he finds a trio, he takes the tiles and continues his turn.
Game ends if all tiles are taken.
The player with the most trios is the winner.

name: Digest-o-rama The Game
description:
Digest-o-rama is a fun, fast paced board game that takes students on an educational journey through the Digestive System in the human body. Be the player to collect the most Digest-o-Bucks as you travel from the esophagus to the rectum. Great for 2-5 players.

Educational roll and move game with questions (similar to Trivial Pursuits) but firmly focused on the Digestive System. For 2-5 players.

name: Have a Go!
description:
British card game from the 1950's. The cards all feature famous people and are extremely weird. Then you realise they are photographs taken at Madame Tussauds of some of their waxwork figures.

Rules
1. Each player contributes one unit into a kitty.
2.The dealer deals the players seven cards each, then places the remainder of the pack face down in the middle.
3.Each player in turn takes a card from the top of the pack and discards one unwanted card from his hand, laying it down face up by the pack.

The first player who collects either
(a) two runs,
(b) a run and three or four of a kind,
(c) two sets of three and four of a kind,
(d) a complete run,
and lays them face up on the table, wins, and receives one unit from each player.
The first player who collects the cards “HAVE A GO” and lays them face up on the table takes the kitty and collects two units from each player.
4. A run can only consist of cards of the same colour, e.g. brown CDE or brown CDEF.
5. If a player wins by completing a run of all cards in his hand, as in rule 3 (d), then each player pays him two units.
6. The card which has been discarded by the last player can only be picked up by the next player if it enables him to finish, otherwise he must take one from the top of the pack.
7. When all cards in the pack have been picked by the players and no player has yet won, the pack of discarded cards are shuffled and stacked face down, play proceeding as before.

name: Tiro Finale
description:
Translated from the manual

Tiro Finale is a card game based on Mami's and the Cake Witch's battle in Puella Magi Madoka Magica

The game consists of 2 types of cards, Mami cards representing Mami's power and Witch cards representing the Cake Witch. All cards have a power of 1 to 6.

The game is about being the first to claim that the total of Mami's power (both the open information on the table and the hidden information in each player's hand) is bigger than that of the Witch.

name: Time Traveler's Method
description:
Translated from the manual

All players have spent six depressing years in junior high and high school. The only somewhat colourful memories from those years are the memories together with their childhood friend and the class' top student, Shizuka Miyamoto.

On the graduation day, Shizuka left with the words "I'd liked to have really fallen in love with someone", and a couple of months later, the players are devastated as they hear she has married some guy her parents introduced.

Soon thereafter, the players see an advert recruiting people wanting to participate in a "time-space jump experiment. Only for people with strong minds."

The players participate in the experiment, and use the time machine to try to improve their past. The time machine is powered by strength of mind. The unhappier past, the stronger mind, so at the start, players are able to go back all six years. But as they change the past and get happier, their mind weakens.

Who of the players will be able to catch the heart of Shizuka Miyamoto?

name: The Produce M@ster
description:
Translated from the manual

This is a party card game where the players become 765 producers, trying to send out their idols to different jobs, getting as many jobs as possibel done.

There is no real difference between the different idols, but you can have fun appointing the jobs you wish for your favourite idols.

Based on the video game The Idol m@ster.

name: Cat Kick
description:
User summary

Players represent teams of cats trying to get ahold of the treats being delivered. Treat cards are lined up, with numbers on them, showing which cat(s), in queue order, will get the treat. Players play cat cards with different numbers of cats on them, face down, onto the treat cards. Once all cat cards have been played, the cat cards for each treat are turned face up and points are dealt to the player(s) who have "their" cat in the right position. "Cat Kick" cards will kick away the cat card in front of them.

A half quick game of bluffing and guessing.

name: Territories
description:
User summary

Game consists of 60 cards numbered –3 to +5; all are dealt to the players. Each round, players choose 1–3 cards to put forward face down. They're revealed simultaneously, and the player who have played highest gets the trick. However, the trick is worth the total of all cards, and since there are certain cards that multiply or reverse the value (turn + into -), it's a matter of reading your opponents.

name: Carnage: Herptar & Brigandish Mages
description:
Herptar & Brigandish Mages is an extension box for the Carnage basic game.
Adds two metal miniatures (the magician Brigandish and reptile Herptar), 40 spell stones in two colors and two books of spells.

CARNAGE is a fast, fun, beer-and-pretzels miniature game of fantasy battles between human tribesmen and amphibian Herptar swamp-dwellers. Charge in to battle riding roaring bulls or honking pangolins! Shoot a swarm of arrows with your human or chameleon archers! Hack your foes with human or alligator soldiers!

name: Carnage: Orb of Power & Benny the Bouncer
description:
Carnage - Orb of Power & Benny the Bouncer is an extension box for the Carnage basic game.
Adds two very nice metal miniatures: Benny the Bouncer (almost 7 cm high) and Orb of Power, a pair pulled by two ostrich-like creatures and a card with Orb effects (which take effect after the dice).

CARNAGE is a fast, fun, beer-and-pretzels miniature game of fantasy battles between human tribesmen and amphibian Herptar swamp-dwellers. Charge in to battle riding roaring bulls or honking pangolins! Shoot a swarm of arrows with your human or chameleon archers! Hack your foes with human or alligator soldiers!

name: Klossgubbe
description:
(English "block man") Swedish children's game. Wooden blocks lay face down on the table. In a Memory like fashion players take turns finding the right blocks to build a complete figure. Starting with shoes, then legs and so forth. Several leg or torso pieces can be stacked creating a funny looking final figure.

Supposed to train memory and hand/eye coordination

name: Gut gefragt ist halb gewonnen
description:
Objective: score most winning points by guessing the requested
term (out of creatures, plants, minerals)
- acting by turns -
determine time or no. of winning points game ends with;
one player acts as game master: a card is drawn (randomly);
player is challenged to guess the term =>
A the faster the better the score &
B the lesser questions the better the score
remarks:
published mid/late 1960's

name: Flip: Plus und Minus
description:
The cards are evenly distributed. Each child puts his cards face down in front of him. Now, in turn, clockwise, the top card of the pile is turned face-down. As soon as two matching cards are on the table: who calls the first flip, wins the pile of his opponent. But beware cards not indetical may look same at first sight.
Last player in game is the winner.

name: Flip: Zahlen, Ziffern, Mengen
description:
Shuffle the deck and each player places his cards face down on a pile. The player with the shortest name begins and open his top card. Then the next player open his top card etc.
Different things may happen by opening cards:
1) Someone turns a card already opened by any opponent.
Player who calls "Flip" first gets both card and places them bottom of his deck.
If "Flip" is called wrongly, the penalty is discarding one of his card to flip-pot deck.
2) Card shows dice. Player rolls it and the dice shows action to player must do:
Change the direction, take the flip-pot, take all open cards from table, exchange Your discard pile with chosen opponent's discard pile etc.

Game lasts to pre-agreed time-limit. Winner is the player with the most cards.

name: Fresh Biz
description:
FreshBiz is a game that fundamentally changes the way its participants play their business and life by simulating and then practicing new, creative methods of entrepreneurial thinking, and problem solving to achieve their most vital goals.

Through its game-based learning, participants travel through the game on a mission to win, while gaining skills, understandings and strategies that not only help them to achieve the goals in the game, but also to excel in their lives.

Utilizing common business practices, and years of insight from entrepreneurs, FreshBiz uses tools such as the buying & selling of businesses, leveraging, negotiations, loans, business opportunities and more to simulate a business environment. Simultaneously, relationships are being forged and the atmosphere of the room buzzes as participants engage with themselves and others in entrepreneurial, multi-dimensional thinking.

Insights gained during a 60 to 90-minute game last far into the future, as our participants claim that the game impacts them for the rest of their lives. There is a distinction between change and transformation. Working harder, doing something less, spending more time else, etc are change, while transformation through FreshBiz is what shifts your paradigm completely and offers you the opportunity to play business, relationships, and life in a whole new way.

As you play FreshBiz, your goal is to reach the "Winner" lot in 90 minutes. In order to achieve your objective, as you pass from section to section (paying tolls to pass), you will have to handle different business dimensions and practice entrepreneurial skills.

The Businesses
In order to pay tolls as you cross through the board on the way to the Island, you will need to earn money. One of the many ways to do that is by starting businesses. Each player gets different businesses cards and each business card has an establishment cost and a profit. You will have to be creative and smart in handling your budget, cash flow, and strategy in order to turn your original capital into the profits you need to move ahead in the game.

Action Cards

Just as in life, each player starts the game with their own unique set of Action Cards. Essentially, these are your gifts, talents and special abilities in the game. It's up to you to use them in the best way possible, and they can be played during any turn. So, be creative and you will make money and friends The Stock Market, Loans, & Partnerships As you go through the game, there will be many business dimensions that you can leverage to help you win, such as the Stock Market, Loans, Partnerships and more...
The more dimensions you master the better results you will get and the more fun you will have...in FreshBiz and in life! So go win!
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Ellsworth Elephant
description:
Contents: 1 playing board, 4 Wood Pawns, 13 Question Cards (Ellsworth's letters), 1 spinner

Number of Players: 2, 3 or 4

Before the game starts:
1. The card portion of the platform should be broken up into 13 individual cards which are called the "LETTERS". The LETTERS are then placed, FACE UP, in a POOL next to the playing board, in easy reach of all players.
2. Each player then selects a wood pawn and places it on the space marked "START" in the center of playing board
3. Each player now spins the arrow of the spinner - the one with the highest number starts. In case of tie, player spins again.
4. Play passes to the left

Object of the game:
The player who is FIRST to enter Ellsworth's House with the most LETTERS, is the WINNER.

Special Feature of the Game:
This game consists of two parts - the first from START to the GATE - the second from the GATE to ELLSWORTH's HOUSE, including the HOME PATH and BONUS SPACE

The Play:
1. In the first part of the game (area from START to GATE) the first player spins and moves his pawn the number of spaces in any direction he chooses (either forward of backward). Player can never split his move and must always move on his turn according to the number he spins.
2. Any number of players may rest on the same space at the same time.
3. Whenever a player, in the first part of the game, lands on a color space by EXACT COUNT, he picks up the LETTER with the matching color stamp from the POOL. He must read aloud the question on that letter and the three different answers given below it. He then must state aloud which ANSWER he thinks is right, A, B or C. Each question on the LETTERS is numbered and the ANSWER CHART here in the box cover lists these numbers with their correct answers - A, B or C. If he has answered correctly, he gets a bonus move of 10 additional spaces. If his answer is incorrect, he remains on that color space until his next turn. In either case, he keeps the LETTER.
4. Each player has to place the LETTERS he picks, FACE UP in front of him, so that all players around the board can see them.
5. As long as there are LETTERS left in the POOL, NO player can enter the second part of the game. After the last LETTER has been picked up from the POOL, all players place their respective pawns on the space marked GATE and all start from there equally on the second part of the game.
6. From the GATE to the Beginning of the HOME PATH, players move only in a forward direction.
7. Whenever a player in the second part of the game lands by EXACT COUNT on a color space, he has this choice - he may take the matching color LETTER from the player who has it, or, he may advance 10 spaces.
8. The section of the pathway from the last color space to Ellsworth's House, is the HOME PATH. Once a player advances into the HOME PATH, he moves within it, forward or backward as he chooses. When a player lands by EXACT COUNT on the BONUS SPACE, he may take from any other player any LETTER he desires, regardless of the color stamp.
9. Since a plyer cannot win, unless he enters ELLSWORTH'S HOUSE with the most LETTERS, he will move back and forth within the HOME PATH until hes has more letters than the other players. As LETTERS can be taken away in the HOME PATH, there is great excitement and suspense. Until the last moment of the game, nobody knows who will safely enter ELLSWORTH'S HOUSE.
10. To enter ELLSWORTH's HOUSE, a player does not need an exact count on the spinner.

FAMILY RULES
When more advanced children or grown-ups join the the game, the regular rules are followed, except that in the first part of the game, all questions and answers are omitted when players pick up LETTERS, but the bonus move of 10 spaces is still given.

name: Bowl, Spell and Score
description:
Wacky family word bowling game that features a unique wooden character dice ball that determines the amount and location of bowling pin tiles to flip over in attempt to spell words in each bowling frame to score big points. The ball comes in endless color combinations and features letter, numbers and symbols to challenge players word skills.

Player roll the dice, open indicated number of ball-tiles in indicated locations and try to form a word to score points.
After multiple rounds player adds up their points and the player with the most points is the winner.

name: Rickety Rackety Roo
description:
In essence a roll/spin and move game, advertised in the 1950s as "fun for all the family".

Game board, 2 dice, 4 pawns and 4 sets of coloured counters.

No image of the board is available but it is apparently a board with an outside track and an inner grid of "Roo" squares. According to the rules the object of the game is to monopolise as many 'Roo blocks' as possible by forming more 3-counter rows - horizontally, vertically or diagonally - than opponents. 10 points are scored each time a row of 3 is formed. A player rolls the dice to move around the track, and the track block on which he lands indicates the Roo block on which he is allowed to place one of his counters. When a particular Roo block means there is no chance for a player to start a row of 3 or block an opponent that block is considered dead and from then on no player moves to it. When all Roo blocks have been played out players compute their scores and highest score wins.

Publication details from The Game Catalog: US Games Through 1950, 8th edition, 1998. Rules from gamearchives.org.

name: Gran Attack
description:
Tactical level wargame based on Japanese robotech animation "Aura Battler Dunbine". This game is one of the First Step series games for beginner.

Each unit represent one aura machine, include aura ship and aura battleship.

The turn sequence is simple, Repeat of movement and simultaneous attacking. The rule is only five pages, but some important elements is included. For example the aura power requirement level or difference of fire combat and close combat.

Victory condition is stated for each scenario.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Basketball
description:
Objective: score most hits
Table version of basketball. Players direct the metal ball on the play field in such way to score the goal (2 points). Players figures are placed on small springs.
If active player scores ball possession changes; if basketball hoop is missed player proceeds where ball ended. If ball ends outside other player proceeds. Game ends after aggreed time or result.

name: Little Kingdom Royal Picnic Game
description:
Magical electronic board game where players have to help Ben and Holly using Holly’s magic and transform the animals back into their fairy and elf characters. Roll the dice and race around the board collecting the correct animal cards, if you land on a picnic basket space you can attempt one of Holly’s spells – the basket will either playa sound to transform the animals back or make a ‘bang’ which means the spell didn’t work.

If all the animals are transformed the player with the most animals transformed is the winner.

name: Quirinalopoli. Corsa alla Presidenza
description:
“Quirinalopoli. Rush for the Presidency” is a political version of a roll-and-move gamey styled like the Game of Goose enclosed to “Il Borghese” magazine in the summer 1997: it consisted of a board and the miniatures of eight Italian politicians of the day to be used as playing pieces. Players roll the dice and move their figures and respond to spaces on the board.


“Quirinalopoli” è un Gioco dell’Oca a tema politico allegato alla rivista “Il Borghese” nell’estate 1997: oltre alla plancia di gioco sono state realizzate anche le miniature di otto “protagonisti della Seconda Repubblica” da utilizzarsi come pedine.

name: Tr3cento. Una giornata nella Bolzano del 1300
description:
“Tr3cento. A day in Bolzano, 1300 A.D.” is a historically-themed didactic game made on the occasion of a gothic painters exhibition that took place in the Italian town of Bolzano in the year 2000.

The aim of the game is experiencing everyday’s life in the XIV century’s Bolzano.

Before starting, every player draws a card showing a different character and, by rolling a die and answering questions (each character has an own set), needs to make a whole round on the map in order to win the game.


“Tr3cento. Una giornata nella Bolzano del 1300” è un gioco didattico a tema storico realizzato per un’esposizione di pittori gotici allestita a Bolzano nel 2000.

Scopo del gioco è sperimentare la vita quotidiana nella Bolzano del Trecento.

All’inizio ogni giocatore pesca un personaggio da un mazzo di carte e - ora lanciando un dado, ora rispondendo a diverse domande (cambiano da personaggio a personaggio) - deve completare un giro della mappa per vincere.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Memory-Extra Picturebook Girls
description:
Each player chooses a story. Shuffle the 32 cards and place them face down on the table. The oldest player begins the game by looking one of the cards. If the card is part of his story player takes it and puts it in his book of images. The player may continue his turn until he looks the card not belonging to his story. He shows the card to other and ends his turn. The first player who completed his picture with 8 cards is the winner.
remarks:
pretty same game approach like Memo Extra Picturebook Boys, but different box, materials & target group

name: Bobcat of Futureville
description:
Monopoly with a Bobcat construction equipment theme.

From the box: With Bobcat of Futureville, you too can live the life of a Bobcat dealer. Purchase Bobcat of Futureville and other dealerships for your chnace to lead the market. Achieve Brand Orange facility status and dig your way to Bobcat of Dealertown. Add another sales specialist and increase your market share and win money! But gamble wisely--if you land in the wrong neighborhood, you could be buying trucks and trailers from the dealer next door. Worse, if you don't take care of the customer, it'll cost you.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Shattered Peace: The War for Terra Nova Book 1
description:
"Three days have passed since Marabou, home of the Southern MILICIA, was obliterated by the CEF. Today, Earth forces descend on Terra Nova, blackening the skies, as thousands upon thousands of drop pods block the rays of Helios from reaching our planet.

People of Terra Nova, we stand on the precipice of destruction. They have come, uncaring, inhumane, and relentless. But they will be stopped.

For those who have died, for those who will die and those who will be opposed, we must fight back. We will prevail!"

- Field Commander Miranda Petite in an address to Black Talon Forces, TN 27 Summer 1950

The next few days will decide the fate of the planet, and although few know it, the fate of the galaxy and of humankind rests on Terra Nova.

This Full-Color, 54-page book is a campaign supplement for the Heavy Gear Blitz! Locked & Loaded Rulebook, and requires it as well as Black Talon: Return to Cat’s Eye for play. It also requires the use of six-sided dice and Dream Pod 9 Heavy Gear miniatures. For two or more players, ages 8 and up.

name: Terra Nova Gambit: The War for Terra Nova Book 2
description:
Terra Nova Gambit - The War for Terra Nova Book 2 includes:


Background Information on the CEF's Utopian Colonial Corp allies.
Utopian uniforms, ranks, insignia, and equipment.
Technical data on the Armiger Auto Control Suit and the Neural Kinetic Interceptor Drone Unit (N-KIDU) autos.
Technical data on the refitted HC-3 Command & Reconnaissance vehicle.
Rules for fielding Utopian Colonial Corp armies and the new CEF HC-3 combat group.
New Regiments of Note for the CEF, Utopia, and Black Talon.
Advanced League and campaign rules.
Campaign scenarios for the Barrington Basin, TN orbit, and the new PAK front.
Discover the fate of Col. Arthur and the PAK.
League Advancement Rules and Survivor Upgrade guidelines.
Timeline Narratives set during the War for Terra Nova.
Datacards for all vehicles presented in the book.

name: Black Talon: Return to Cat's Eye
description:
Aftershocks and political fallout from the Interpolar War and the destruction of Peace River have left Terra Nova reeling. With Earth identified as the culprit, Terra Nova's governments have resolved to never to be caught off guard again and the Black Talon program was formed for the purpose of being sent off planet to recon Earth’s former colony worlds. Their first mission is the gate world Caprice, with its orbital fleet yards that were the staging grounds for the first attack on Terra Nova. They have the training and equipment with which to observe and sabotage Earth's Colonial Expeditionary Force (CEF) wherever opportunities arise and gain new allies whenever possible.

But it was not enough. The CEF is hell-bent on recapturing control of the colonies and has the largest fighting force in human history. War is coming, a war beyond anything that we've seen before. The fate of Terra Nova is held by an elite few, and they shall determine the fate of mankind.

Black Talon, Return to Cat’s Eye includes full army lists for Earth's Colonial Expeditionary Force, Caprician Forces and Terra Nova's own Black Talons. Also included within this book:

- Full backgrounds on all three armies presented in the book.
- Options for Terra Novan Armies post TN1940.
- Additional terrain and table effect rules for battlefields across the galaxy.
- A continued timeline covering from where Locked & Loaded left off to the beginning of the Battle for Terra Nova.
- An overview of the opening stages of the Battle for Terra Nova.
- Newly re-organized Datacards for all variants to date, for easier play.
- Rules and Guidelines for uneven Threat Value games and story-driven engagements.

This is a 124 page supplement for Heavy Gear Blitz! Locked & Loaded, and requires it for use. Also requires a few six-sided dice and Dream Pod 9 miniatures. For two or more players, ages 8 and up.

Soft Cover, ISBN: 978-1-897460-18-4

name: Moral x Mold
description:
Translated box black blurb

School Order Rep has come to investigate any personal items student have brought to school. As a student, you must treat the Order rep correctly so as to avoid punishment.

How?

Well, by seeing to that your BL fanzines aren't "unnecessary" items, of course!

User summary
A simple card game consisting of different types of attractive boys, guys and men (anime style). Players take turns being the Order rep, who decides what preferences are OK, and the remaining players (students) try to play their cards so that they match them as much as possible. A game of deduction and creative guessing. And laughs.

The game also comes with identical rules called "Model Men", where the players try to guess what combination of model will sell the next fashion mag.

name: Zotch
description:
A push your luck dice rolling game.

Object: "All players try to accumulate the highest number of points per turn, which uhen added to their score, gives them the necessary 10,000 points to win."

Equipment: box, instructions, scoresheets, dice cup and six dice (marked blank, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5).

Scoring: blank = 50, 1=100, 3 of a kind = varies (2-5 = die x 100, blank = 500, 1 = 1000), straight (blank, 1-5) = 1000, and 6 of a kind = 3 of a kind x 3.

name: Mad Dash
description:
A turn-based roll-and-move car racing game based on the zany videogame kart racing mania (Mario Kart, Crash Team Racing, etc.) Each player tries to be first to cross the finish line, but not before equipping weapons cards or playing sneaky tricks and trying to blow the competition out of their way!

The core mechanic of this game is a trade-off between going fast and equipping weapons (which reduces the speed and sturdiness of your vehicle.) Eventually, a player's car will be destroyed, at which point the player will return to the nearest checkpoint and continue racing (or just blowing up their enemies for the fun of it!)
categories: Fighting, Humor, Racing, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: SPT: Blue Comet SPT Layzner
description:
Tactical space combat game based on Japanese robotech animation series "Blue Comet SPT Layzner".

Each unit represent a SPT(Super Powered Tracer, robotech name in this universe). Unit ability is written on the data cards.

Each player control one or few SPT and aims at the destruction of the opponent SPT.

Players writes down the plan of the movement and the battle in the log. Then, that is disclose and resolve at simultaneous. The law of the inertia acts on the movement in the outer space. Feature of this game is a rule of search operation using the dual map.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Gobbler Game
description: From the objective in the rule book: "The object of the game is to depart from home, arrive at the hunting camp, go on a gobbler hunt and be the first to "Bag" your gobbler." Players roll a die to move along the paths in the woods. Spaces include such activities as "Gas Stop", "Forgot Flashlight", and "Stuck in Swamp", all of which result in losing a turn. There are also 3 decks of cards: Road Chance, Hunt Chance, and Phone Chance. Also from the rule book, to win the game, "A player must roll the EXACT NUMBER ON THE DIE to get his gobbler or be lucky enough to draw the 'WINNER CARD' from the green chance pile."

name: Monster Match
description:
Monster Match is a fast and fun card game where you are trying to reassemble body parts from different monsters. The game suits between 2 to 7 players, for ages 8 and up.

The game consists of one deck that contains all the monster parts. Players are dealt out cards and take turn trying to improve upon there monster(s).

Taking its mechanical roots in games like gin rummy but with a new theme and abilities for cards makes this anything but what your grandmother use to play.

name: HomeVesting
description:
The HomeVesting playing board has two six-sided playing courses: the outer, purple “Rehabilitation” course, and the inner, orange “Selling” course. Each course represents a different stage of the investing process.

The outer “Rehabilitation” course is where we initially buy, carry, and fix up our properties. The game always starts on this outer course.

The inner “Selling” course is where we seek deals to sell our investments and cash out. Players individually move onto the inner Selling path as they complete their Rehabilitation process.

Summary of the Game

Players select investment properties, begin on their individual colored Start spot, and take turns moving their pawn around the outer Rehabilitation path to develop their properties.

Eventually, each player will complete their Rehabilitation phase, progress to their colored Start spot on the inner Selling course, then proceed around the Selling course to seek a deal for cashing out and selling their investments.

Play continues until only one player remains which has not settled all debts and cashed out of the game. All players have the option of short-selling and cashing out of the game at any time before completing their full rehabilitation and selling process, which establishes their final cash position. But a final remaining player is always forced into a short-sell to end the game. All players then evaluate their final cash position. The player finishing with the most money wins.

name: Война 1812 Года: Кутузовские Шахматы
description: Game by S. Zdorovtsov depicts Napoleon's invasion of Russia on a strategic level. Players command Corps and their goal is to destroy their opponent. This could be done by reducing enemy to 3 or below Corps. French start with 14 Corps and the Russians with 13, but one French Corps leaves play on Turn 9, to simulate Reynier's help to the Austrians. Game mechanic also includes reinforcements, partisans, morale, and generals.

name: Match: Wereldtopo
description:
Matching card game with topic "World"

There are info or picture on the middle of the card and multiple patterns on the edges. Two or more cards match if at least one pattern fits on all cards.

In the beginning of round multiple cards are drawn from the table. Players who first declare the matching cards (based by their knowlidge or seeing the matching pattern) get the cards.
If there are no matched cards found the new cards are drawn.

Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Match: Geschiedenis
description:
Matching card game with topic "History"

There are info or picture on the middle of the card and multiple patterns on the edges. Two or more cards match if at least one pattern fits on all cards.

In the beginning of round multiple cards are drawn from the table. Players who first declare the matching cards (based by their knowlidge or seeing the matching pattern) get the cards.
If there are no matched cards found the new cards are drawn.

Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Match: Natuur
description:
Matching card game with topic "Nature"

There are info or picture on the middle of the card and multiple patterns on the edges. Two or more cards match if at least one pattern fits on all cards.

In the beginning of round multiple cards are drawn from the table. Players who first declare the matching cards (based by their knowlidge or seeing the matching pattern) get the cards.
If there are no matched cards found the new cards are drawn.

Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Match: Menselijk Lichaam
description:
Matching card game with topic "Human Body"

There are info or picture on the middle of the card and multiple patterns on the edges. Two or more cards match if at least one pattern fits on all cards.

In the beginning of round multiple cards are drawn from the table. Players who first declare the matching cards (based by their knowlidge or seeing the matching pattern) get the cards.
If there are no matched cards found the new cards are drawn.

Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: The Epishell Wars
description:
THE EPISHELL WARS Squads of humanoid mecha face off in varying terrains over ever changing goals,commonly resulting in the destruction of the other team. The game uses a system of 3d12 rolls, with modifiers to the minimum and maximum that may be rolled. Each roll will have a modifier of +X/-Y (EG. +1/-1, +4/-2, +0/-3). The +X portion determines the minimum result of each of the d12, and the -Y determines the maximum. A modifier of +2/-2 would mean that each die can result in the range of 3-10 (1+2, 12-2), the total roll being anywhere between 9 and 30.

The game setup involves a map with 1" hexes of a size predetermined by either a provided scenario or popular decision. Terrain involves transparent overlays called terrain Plates that have visual cues as to which form(s) of terrain are included (Obscure, Hostile , Hostile , Resistant). Terrain Plates can overlap, and each terrain type present in a given hex applies in a "yes/no" fashion.

Players agree on the number of units and of which types that each will bring into play. Given a default game of 1v1 death match, each player will have four Epishell (humanoid mech) units. For each unit they will decide the variety from Scout, Assault, Marksman, and Escort and apply modular designed equipment based on the carrying capacity of that unit. Pilots are also assigned to the units with a zero sum trait set. Typically, each player will have a side of the map to treat as their starting area. Time and objectives will be determined by popular decision before the terrain is placed and the units outfitted.

During game play, each player has a set number of "MOVE" and "FIRE" actions equal to half of their total unit count, rounded up and may only allot one to each unit at the start of the "Circuit". A countdown procedure occurs using the traits of the units, giving priority to "FIRE" actions. Every action is given a small amount of Movement points, with an extra bonus from a "MOVE" action. Movements points can be used to change facing or location.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: De Basisschool Quiz: Groep 3
description:
Test yourself. Do you know everything you need to know? With this super fun quiz you will practice all the courses you get in your group. 600 questions alternating questions and answers. With explanations and illustrations. For each group - from 3 to 8 - has its own quiz.

Topics: language - count - History - Society - Geography - Earth, space and environment - physics and technology - nature - traffic - English

The questions are on the left flaps, the answers on the right flaps. Turn the right flap to the answer.

Who answers correctly get a point. Winner is the player with the most point.

name: De Basisschool Quiz: Groep 4
description:
Test yourself. Do you know everything you need to know? With this super fun quiz you will practice all the courses you get in your group. 600 questions alternating questions and answers. With explanations and illustrations. For each group - from 3 to 8 - has its own quiz.

Topics: language - count - History - Society - Geography - Earth, space and environment - physics and technology - nature - traffic - English

The questions are on the left flaps, the answers on the right flaps. Turn the right flap to the answer.

Who answers correctly get a point. Winner is the player with the most point.

Topics: language - count - History - Society - Geography - Earth, space and environment - physics and technology - nature - traffic - English

The questions are on the left flaps, the answers on the right flaps. Turn the right flap to the answer.

Who answers correctly get a point. Winner is the player with the most point.

description:

The questions are on the left flaps, the answers on the right flaps. Turn the right flap to the answer.

Who answers correctly get a point. Winner is the player with the most point.

description:

Who answers correctly get a point. Winner is the player with the most point.

name: De Basisschool Quiz Groep 8
description:
