Then the match results are found, not by subtle, clever play. No, you draw a card and the result will be ticked in the card, either a Home Win (1 point scored), an Away Win (2 points scored) or a Draw (3 points scored). And that's it!

Three variations are provided but still the same game except for the solitaire patience-type game, but that is also dreary. The last rules relate to no game at all. The publishers suggest that you might like to fill in your Football Pools entry form by drawing cards randomly and applying the result to match 1 on the coupon, then match 2, and so on. I would imagine that this use of the cards was the main intention of the publisher.

name: Mickey Mouse & Friends
description:
A CCG of Disney released for the super market companies Louis Delhaize, Match and Smatch in Belgium. Each package includes 4 cards with the entire collection existing out of 216 cards.

The rules for the game are simple: Every player takes at least 5 cards face down. Now the first player takes the first card from his deck and chooses one of the 5 characteristics (cheerful, romantic, clumsy, playful or relaxed) which all have a specific score. After choosing the category the player places the card on the table so that everybody can see it. Now the other players take the first card from their own deck and compare the score of the choosen characteristic. Each card only has three characteristics, so only players who have a card with the choosen characteristic can play along that round. The player with the highest score on that characteristic wins the round. The game goes on until one person has won all the cards in the game.

For collecting purposes people have made their own interpretation of the game or let the winner choose a card from one of the losers decks.
categories: Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Flieger und Flak
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target zone with all your meeples (planes)
- moving by turns -
each player rolls the die moving forward; if die shows a '4' a new plane (totally 4) must be taken out of supply; if move ends on a space with an own plane: not allowed; if move ends upon a space with an opponent's plane: remove opponent's plane back to start;

if your plane enters opponent's circle: if a red plane image is met ==> enter opponent's region and eleminate an anti-aircraft gun.

remark:
published early 1940's
categories: Children's Game, Dice, World War II

name: Die Biene Maja
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target zone
- moving by turns -
simple 'roll & move' game; instructions on cover inside/partly on images of the board

remarks:
first edition should had been published during 1920's
second edition with limited copies due to 75-year-old anniversary of Vedes

name: Die lustige Autofahrt
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (76)
- moving by turns -
each player rolls the die and moves forward according number; follow instructings ending on a red marked (image) space.
Remarks:
should be published during 1930's
very cute ceramic meeples

name: PIO
description:
In this game embody little birds that perch on the wires that cross the fields, is aimed at children 4 years maores and the idea is to become familiar with the music, both in intonation and in the language itself by sticking the idea of the pentagram . also performed memory exercises remembering the position of the cards. ppueden play of 2-6 kids and heading time escede 30 minutes.

This game will have to sing "chirp" according to the position of the bird in the cables.

- Top cable, a "chirp" sharp.
- Central cable, a "chirp" means.
- Lower cable, a "chirp" grave.

Starting with advancing rolling the dice and go up finding one bird cards face-down to seek agreement with the dice and singing according to the letter says, if you play well it keeps pulling antler horn fail to find a "chirp" or steal the letter of flock , also won three letters till flock which is then placed in a row and will have to sing all the principles (9 notes) to win the game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Music, Print & Play

name: Farm Yard Fib
description:
Card game featuring farm animals.

The first player draws a card and makes sure no-one else can see it. It will be one of ten possible animals. The other player or players can ask seven specific questions which will be answered with a "Yes" or "No".
A couple of question examples:
Good Household Pet?
Meat we eat?

Every question asked scores the card-holder 1 point. If the animal is not guessed after the 7 questions or is guessed incorrectly, the card-holder scores a bonus of ten points.

One nice little tweek - the cardholder must always be honest except he can tell his "Farm Yard Fib" and answer one question incorrectly. He can only do this once throughout the seven questions.

The points are totalled after an agreed number of turns and the winner is the one with the most points.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction

name: You Can't Fire the Customer
description:
Customer Service has become a major element in the strategic plans of all successful companies today. Companies expect employees to give excellent (not just good) service to all customers, as well as to successfully handle difficult customers who can be hard-to-please, uncertain, angry, insulting, or even threatening. It is often the failure to deal successfully with these difficult customers that leads to reprimands and termination for employees.

You Can't Fire the Customer gives students the knowledge and confidence that they need in order to handle the average customer and the difficult customer. The game focuses on ten important skills and how to use them in realistic situations.

Policy Skills (what to do) Personal Skills (how to do it)
1. Fulfill company promises 1. Focus on the customer
2. Stay within your authority 2. Always show respect
3. Get help when needed 3. Keep your word
4. Fix problems 4. Be a good listener
5. Address customer needs 5. Show empathy

In the game, players earn play money by giving good advice to Linda, a new employee at Office Giant, an office supplies superstore. In the course of the game, Linda deals with customers on the phone, at the Service Desk, and on the sales floor. She encounters some cooperative customers and a range of difficult customers. Players enhance their advice with appropriate tone of voice and body language.

SCANS Skills Addressed:

Foundation Skills: Thinking Skills, Personal Qualities, Basic Skills
Workplace Competencies: Interpersonal Skills, Information, Systems

Learning Objectives:

Learn essential customer service skills.
Learn the special relationship between the customer and the employee.
Learn when to handle a tough situation and when to seek help from a supervisor.
Understand the concept of authority and the importance of not exceeding it.
Learn the importance of knowing company policy and applying it to problems.
Learn the importance of appropriate tone of voice and body language.
Learn critical thinking skills by evaluating alternative ways of responding to customers.

name: Cakambi
description:
Game comes with a folding board, 47 black wood balls, 3 red wood balls and 1 die.
The balls are either + (positive) or - (negative). The balls are placed randomly on the board-roll the die and if the number on the ball you pick can be divided evenly by the number on the die, you keep the ball and add it to your score. The first player to get a total of -7 or +17 wins. For 2-4 players.

Published by Quiggs & Co. Keene, NH

name: Fliegerstaffel auf Feindflug
description:
Objective: be the first receiving 24 victory points
- acting by turns -
each player moves a plane - blowing on it;
after three trials reaching start position you have to bring the top of your plane into one of these red circles printed on the board to fulfill a quest - scoring as described.
remarks:
published early 1940's
categories: Action / Dexterity, Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, World War II

name: Das kleine Bankett und andere Abenteuer
description:
The playing area for Das kleine Bankett und andere Abenteuer ("The Little Banquet and Other Adventures") in most of the game's scenarios is a tad unusual: a circle of chairs, with players starting each round by standing behind a chair. The players represent kids from different countries, specifically brothers and sisters who are accompanied by a pet, and they want to solve puzzles, quests and tasks while meeting and playing with one another. More specifically, some scenarios involve cooperative tasks, while another might have you compete against everyone in a race. Each scenario has been designed to be replayable numerous times.

Once a scenario begins, a golden "ball" will be put into play from the starting point, moving either clockwise or anticlockwise. As soon as the golden ball reaches the first standing player, this player is in charge and can choose to act. Every player has a character card, which depicts his available moves on its backside. Once the player chooses an action, it will likely require other players to move, so the succession of players will change in the circle of chairs.

After his action, the player sits and hands the golden ball to the next player adjacent to him. The next standing player who receives the golden ball takes his turn, and play continues until all players are seated. At this point you check whether you've met any of the winning conditions of the scenario, such as placing members of your faction near goals or hidden treasures, or handing someone a gift. If you manage to exchange places at the right time with your partners, you can achieve different goals; since each character has different abilities to move others around or place themselves near a goal, players often have multiple solutions on their fingertips – assuming they can find them in time.

Each character also has a loyal pet shown on its card. The pets can be one of two classes – Growler or Kuddler – and each class has its own specific move. If needed, a pet's owner can decide to use the action of his pet instead of his own.

Integrates with


The Last Banquet
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Cowboykort
description: A short childrens/party game of speed and memory. Each player is dealt six cards and puts them down next to each other in memorized order. Then each player turns over one card, looks at the other players cards, and the first to turn over a second card identical to one already turned over wins the duel. This person loses the card. The game is over when one person has no cards left.

name: Puzzle Playing Cards
description:
Puzzle Playing Cards® brings puzzle building and card games together. With a variety of different learning styles, you and others work competitively to collect and complete 13 animal puzzles.

Players will collect 4 cards and build hands of each Animal Puzzle. With 13 Puzzles in the game, each puzzle is broken into 4 corner pieces. Each card will have Animal facts, unique colors, and partial images to help guide you to completing your puzzle.

During the game players will pick up a random card from the deck or previously discarded face up card. At the end of a turn you will always discard down to 4 cards at the end of a turn.

Players will all aim to collect all four parts to a puzzle. The first player to do so announces this and all players will collect points, depending on the completion of their targeted puzzle.

The game is designed with many different learning styles in mind and it is encouraged that younger players read their completed puzzle facts out.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Puzzle

name: Chekker Math
description: Each player has a set of chips numbered 2-9 which start in the circles bordering the edge of the grid. Each grid square has a pair of numbers, each shown twice so as to be easily read by all players. Played most like Chinese Checkers, the twist in Chekker Math is that a playing piece must be a factor of at least one number on each square on which it lands. Thus, only a player's 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 8 chips may be played on the square showing "30" and "64". The 7 and 9 chips may not be played on that square.

name: Black Hills War
description: Little Big Horn wasn't the only battle. Two other major battles (Rosebud Creek and Slim Buttes) and eight further battles were needed to suppress the Sioux and other tribal peoples who defended their homelands with both consummate skill and enduring courage. A block styled war game that takes fog of war to another level through the use of command blocks and scouts on the board rather than full units as in most war games.

name: Gibs: The Advanced Pack
description:
This is an expansion to the fast paced card game Gibs.

New additions:

4 new gib types with more advanced abilities
more action cards to keep the deck balanced
6 new white gem condition cards
Cards to add a 5th player to the game


It's as simple as adding all the cards into the deck no messy choosing certain cards to remove.

You can buy Gibs: The Advanced Pack at this site https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/gibs-the-advanced-pack
publishers: (Self-Published), NB Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Ninja Chess
description:
Your goal in Ninja Chess is the same as in regular Chess: Capture the opponent's king in order to win. The differences between the games include a smaller playing area, fewer pieces, and the inability to castle. The game has a historical Japanese theme, and players start with a Tonosama (King), an Okugata (Queen), a Samurai (Rook), a Ninja (Knight), and some Ashigaru (pawns), with the pieces being pretty detailed plastic pawns mounted on small bases.

Reimplements


Chess

name: Game Night Fight
description:
Taken from the designer's game description...

This game arises out of many long nights of playing other games that took way too long and started way to many fights. Playing a board game involves multiple players, each looking to win. The resulting competition can devolve into incredible displays of lunacy. Nit-picking over the rules, collusion against specific players because of grudges carried over from other games, and even fights over bending or missing pieces.

This game harnesses all of this angst into a game in and of itself!

In this game, you move on a board that's only 10-spaces long, trying to be the first person to get to the end. You do this by playing specific cards on your turn, each representing things that might happen during a typical board game. Watch out though, because your opponents will be trying to get there first as well. Cards like "Analysis Paralysis", "Bathroom Break", "Blame-Shifter", and good old-fashioned "Cheating" will no-doubt bring back memories of past board-game fights. Who knows, maybe you'll all get along next time!

name: The Game of Alice in Wonderland
description:
This is the first game ever published based on the book Alice's Adventures in Wonderland.

From the Rules Card:

The Game of Alice in Wonderland

This game contains 52 cards divided into three sets.

SET. I. 16 Picture Cards numbered from 1 to 16 with a star in the corner.

SET. II. 16 Picture Cards without star, numbered 1 to 16.

SET. III. 20 number cards numbered from 1 to 20.

The two sets of picture cards form pairs by matching their numbers.

Each set takes by its number. The higher cards taking the lower ones. Star cards take each other according to their numbers, and both the other sets, whether their numbers are high or low. Plain Picture Cards take each other according to their numbers, and all number cards. Number cards take each other according to their numbers.

name: Willi wills Wissen: Autos
description:
Topic: Cars

The object is to be the first reaching target zone on the little game board by answering most questions correctly.
There are 2 question and 3 variants for each question on one side of the card. Currect player draws a card and hide the answers. Other players show answers simultaneously;
Players who answer correctly scores 1 point and move their pawns one point further on little game board.
If leading player moves upon a 'specail' space on the board: Last and second last Player run a 'Rock,Paper,Scissors' competition to make a step ahead.
Who finishes first on the game board is the winner.

name: Si la tendance se maintient
description:
Are you ready for an exciting electoral campaign? In Si la tendance se maintient simulates, in 2-5 hours, a full electoral campaign, day by day. Players represent political party leaders in a generic Western parliamentary democracy using pure proportional representation.

During the course of the game, players will manage a hand of cards that they, over 28 campaign days, use to attack each other, as they try to increase their voting intentions at the expense of other players. Taking into account their voting intentions and the strength of their partisans, players elect a certain number of MPs. A majority player will automatically win, but a minority situation will allow players to form a coalition.

Designed by a well-known member and executive of the New Democratic Party of Canada, Si la tendance se maintient, a French-only game, includes several appendix aiming at generating a discussion about the nature of politics, and of its institutions.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Negotiation, Political, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game

name: Die verrückte Tierparty
description: The game consists of cards showing different animals doing actions (turning around, jumping on one leg, clap hands etc.). Players take turns flipping over two cards from the draw pile and placing them in a row. As soon as a player spots that there are three of the same animal in the row, she has to make the respective animal sound. If three of the same action can be seen, the player must perform the action. The first player to do that wins the three cards (or shares them with others who were as fast). When all cards are used up, whoever won most cards is the winner.

name: World in Four
description:
In World in Four, players try to assemble sets of nation cards by grabbing them from both the table and opponents. Each player starts with twelve cards in hand (or ten, depending on the number of players) and fourteen cards are arranged in a grid on the table.

On a turn, the active player reveals one card from the table to all players; if she thinks she can make a set of four cards (including the revealed one), she attempts to do so, claiming them as a set if she does so and adding one card from her hand to the face-down array if she fails. (She also turns the revealed card face down again.) The player then identifies an opponent and names a country or number. If that opponent has such a card, he must hand it over to her and she takes another turn; otherwise her turn ends and the player she attempted to steal from takes the next turn.

Once all cards have been played as sets, the game ends. Sets numbered 6-13 are worth that many points, the South Korea set is worth 10 points, and all other sets are worth 5 points each. The player with the highest score wins.

name: A-Mart
description:
A-Mart – subtitled Arithmetic Mart – has you shopping for food in the supermarket, but your goal is not to grab all the food that you can, but rather to remember how much food you actually bought. Oh, and you're a porcupine.

All players start at the entrance of the supermarket. On a turn, you roll the die, move that many spaces on the track, then take 1-2 food items from the shelves next to you on the movement track. Supermarket employees help you take more goods (so helpful!), while porcupine bullies force you to toss an item previously placed in your cart. Land on another player and you take something from them, potentially messing up both your counts. Some food cards – being coupons, I suppose – subtract from your total; others double the total.

Whoever reaches the end of the track first collects five bonus points, and the game ends. Players then announce the total amount of goods they've collected. If correct, they add 20 points to their score; if they're off, they lose 10-50 points depending on how far they're off the mark. Whoever then has the highest score wins.

name: Proxy Wars: Oath Bound Expansion Set
description:
Proxy Wars is an expandable two-player game in a contemporary but slightly fictional setting. Players represent a battle-ready faction and use their agents to fight for control of a customizable board, which is set up individually each game. To win, agents must occupy valuable tiles worth victory points (VPs) or wipe out enemy agents or do both.

Proxy Wars is a full-fledged strategy card-based board game, and the game mechanisms include tile-placing (the cards form the board) and deck-building elements. You are to decide how to best deploy your faction's power and agents to outwit your opponent with ingenious cutting, positioning and attacking strategies.

Proxy Wars: Oath Bound Expansion Set contains six GreenEngage and five MegaCorp cards as well as scenario cards and a scenario booklet.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Political

name: Fairytale Pyramideto
description:
Fairytale Pyramideto is the second expansion of Pyramideto game.

Fairytale Pyramideto includes 12 cards of a dozen of czech fairytale characters - like the Little Mole, fairy Amalka, Ferda the Ant or Rumcajs the Robber.

Cards have a typical six-color frame, name, pyramid form and the sign - fairytale crown.

Children/players are invated to add their own pictures on the card. (This is not necessary for the game.)
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: France Ecologie
description:
The goal of the game is to create a natural legacy free from pollution. Game board is a like in Monopoly. Each player has a player board with 6 boxes: park, monument, beach, river, animal and plant. Player try to bring the corresponding 6 cards in correct places.

In his turn, the player rolls the dice and moves his pawn accordingly. In certain boxes, the player draws cards with pollution, cleanup, events etc.

The winner is the one who completes his six cards by being rid of all chips "pollution".

name: Kes? Kus? Mis?
description:
Who? Where? What?
Trivia game of Olympics 1896-2012.
There are 400 cards in this game. There is question and 4 variants in one side of the card and answer in another side.
Players gives their answer and if this correct player scores a point.
Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Zenigata Royal
description:
User summary
A 2-player assymetrical card game, where one player is a band of thieves trying to steal treasures, and the other player is the police force trying to protect them. The Thief has a deck of cards numbered 1–6 of different colours, and the Police has a couple of trap cards, and a large number of duds (incompetent police officers).

Seven treasures are lined up in a row, and the players take turns placing one card each. The thief plays his cards face up, and the Police face down. If the thief plays cards that apply to one of the traps the police has played, the trap is played face up and the polices trap and all of the thief's cards for that treasure are discarded.

If the Thief managed to steal 4 treasures, he wins. If the Police manages to protect 4 treasure, he wins.

The art is of several famous master thieves from Japanese TV animations.
categories: Bluffing, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Submarine Chaser
description:
This is vintage game of abstract naval strategy.

Four warships are attempting to destroy an enemy submarine. The board includes spaces with submarine nets and the warships attempt to force the sub into the entanglements. The sub can fire a torpedo at a warship by maneuvering into special "fire" spaces that permit the U-boat captain to launch.

The game can be played by more than two players... each additional player commands an individual warship or a squadron of ships in team play.

Includes the board and five metal ship tokens.

name: Rainbowz
description:
It's a family game containing 90 cards, 1 die and a few tokens.

A central board is built with one type of cards (table-cards). Each player receives 7 cards from the pile (game-cards).

Players have to collect the 7 colors of the Rainbow as soon as possible in order to score more points. The mechanic is quite simple: 1. draw a card and reveal it (use the bonus action if a bonus card was drawn); 2. Exchange a card of your hand with another one on the board (carefull: some cards are blocked and cannot be exchanged unless you use the die). After a player turn the others may struggle to exchange for free (no turn action) the card left by the previous player.

The 1st player collecting the 7 different colors wins the maximum points (depending on the number of players). Then, by finishing order, others gain less 1 point than the previous one. Scoring: each color card and each pot-o-gold worth 1 point. Add the scoring tokens and know your scoring.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection

name: Marisoba
description:
User summary

A hand-management card game where players try to woo Marisa Kirisame of Shrine Maiden fame. Using the cards in hand (numbered 1–5), players try to get ahold of one of the three "date with Marisa" cards on the table. They can also be stolen from other players. Some cards have special abilities, and players also have a special character ability.

The winner gets the right to marry Marisa.

name: Marisoba Betsumori
description:
User summary

An expansion to "Marisoba". This expansion includes 4 new characters, 3 new Spell cards, 23 new playcards and 4 new Marisa Date cards.

name: Attrition
description:
Attrition is designed to be played by two people. Players follow directions provided on the game board to form completed boxes and capture the most amount space.

The board is 13x13 one inch squares (totaling 169 spaces)each with its own arrows allowing for movement of a specific direction up, down, left or right, or a combination of those movements.

At the beginning of the game each player rolls a die to determine who will place their game piece first (lower number places first higher number places second but moves first). As players exit a tile they place a marker turned to their color on the board. Players must follow the directional arrows in the spaces trying to form a completed box (2x2 or greater). Once you have formed a completed box you are allowed to move freely in that space assuming you can get to the box using directional arrows on the board. If a completed box is fully encircled by the opponents color markers the box is turned to that players markers. You may not move through an opponents completed box. If you move through an opponents marker that is not in a completed box turn it to your color (you must follow the directions of the arrows under the marker). If at any time you find that you have no legal moves you move your game piece to another location on the board and your remaining moves are forfeit.

Each round players roll a single die and the combined roll is the movement allotment for the turn. Players alternate first position each round eliminating the "first-player advantage".

The game ends when neither player has a valid move that they can take.

The aesthetics of the game are meant to give you that old-timey feel. From the scroll for a game mat to the stained wooden game pieces and markers, Attrition is meant to feel like a game that has been played for hundreds of years.

name: Magica
description:
User summary

A memory-styled yet complex card game based on the Japanese TV animation series Puella Magi Madoka Magica. The game consists of 6 witch cards, 16 Puella Magi cards, 10 emotion cards, and some fate (point) cards.

The 16 puella magi cards are placed face down in a grid, and the goal of the game is to – like Memory – on your turn, reveal the correct puella magi in order to defeat the current witch. Defeating the witches gains the player a fate card and an emotion cards. Emotion cards can be used for special effects. Also, each player has a secret identity that gets certain bonus points at the end, but it's dangerous if the other players discover who you are.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Memory, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Medallions
description:
A long, long time ago, after a loot of a cursed treasure, a pirate ship was devastated by an intense storm and pushed into the lowlands of a distant archipelago. The enigmatic medallions recovered by the natives over the years and the strange events that have taken place ever since, make the population on the islands fear that the curse is upon them. In Medallions, players embrace the characters of the natives charged with exorcising the curse and seeking to recover the medallions to launch them into a giant furnace. The purpose is to transform them into pure metal ingots. But beware: not all members on the mission are well-intentioned...

In Medallions players have to collect medallions of 3 colors within the islands to transform them into gold ingots (VP's). In their turn players move their disc on the track up to 3 cases. Then, their pawn inside the board repeats the move selected. To continue the movement and go further a player may use cards from a common stack. At the beginning of the game each player receives a secret role (there may be a traitor or not in the team). If you are a good charater you will try to transform the highest number of medallions you can, trying to identify and accuse an eventual traitor (there are risks doing so). The traitor will have another goal: collect secretly the highest number of black medallions (traitor VP's). A traitor only can be accused until 3/4 of the game track.

The game has a simple but important economic gestion. To have money to buy new medallions arriving in a island, players will need to sell medallions and special ability cards that may be played in your turn. As they are sold, the pile will increase and someone can buy them all! Note that sold medallions are put face down, and only buyers can have access to the information about who sold what.
mechanics: Area Movement, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Terre des Betes
description:
French dice game

"Le jeu de la chasse photographique"

Theme: Photo safari

Each player is a reporter sent out by "Terre des Betes" (Animal World) to take photos of animals in the forest. You try to collect photos of certain animals by moving your playing piece on the board. You have to memorize the photos you have already discovered. The first player to have collected a certain number of photos wins.

Simple dice game for children,

name: First Emperor
description: An area control game set in ancient China and Mongolia. A combat game featuring miniatures which includes various elements such as troop types, facing, and cavalry charges. Dice are used for combat results,cards are used for activation. Opponents capitols are the usual objectives and variable quality/purpose troop types allows for extensive tactical studies.

name: Major Bowes Amateur Hour Game
description:
A simple, roll and move game with the object being to be the first player to acquire 5000 votes. Like the Bowes radio show, where if he did not like your act he rang a loud GONG signifying the end of your radio audition, the game has a couple of GONG spaces, where landing on them returns you to the beginning of the game (unlike the radio show where being gonged meant the end of your performance). Other spaces can make you go back some number of spaces. or move ahead some number of spaces.

The game (Popular Edition 1) is based on the MAJOR BOWES' Original Amateur hour on radio (the predecessor to the Ted Mack Amateur hour on TV in the early 1950's). Major Bowes who never was in the military insisted on being addressed by his self-proclaimed title of "MAJOR" also had a saying that he was famous for. He always said "ALL RIGHT! ALL RIGHT!" after each performer had either finished his/her act or been gonged off the show.

Famous words associated with the show and printed on the game board:

"THE WHEEL OF FORTUNE SPINS AND WHERE SHE STOPS NOBODY KNOWS"


PUBLISHER: WARNER MFG CO, BENNINGTON, VT

name: Rainbow Fish Look Out For the Shark!
description:
The Rainbow Fish Look Out For the Shark game is ideal for 3-5 players. The object of the game is to get rid of all of you card-and avoid ending up with the shark card.

The dealer shuffles the cards and deals them all, face down to all the players. Players shoudl be careful not to show the faces of their cards to the other players. Any player who holds a pair of card with the same symbols (green leaf, red starfish, yellow snail, etc) in the top left corners should immediately lay them face up on the table. Player to the left of the dealer goes first. He or she picks a card from the player to their left. If the card matches, the player lays them down face up on the table. If the card does not match, or gets the dreaded shark card, their turn ends and it is the next players turn. Play continues until all pairs have been matched up and one player is left holding the shark card. The player with the shark is the looser. This game features the art of Marcus Pfister's award winning book series The Rainbow Fish.

name: Great Art Close up: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
description:
Great Art Close Up...

Discover art of the great museums of the world as you play 5 fun card games, including "Memory," "Old Maid," and 2 new matching games for children of different ages. Turn your next visit to the art museum into a treasure hunt with each Close Up deck.

Paintings from this game are from Museum of Fine Arts, Boston

Look closely to match close up details to the paintings they come from with this deck of 48 playing cards. Ages 5 to adult.

name: Wild Cards: North American Birds
description: Bird watching is America’s most popular pastime. This card game + book set features some of North America’s most fascinating birds, from owls and raptors to waders and woodland birds. Learn about birds as you play three favorite card games: Memory, Old Maid, and Go Fish. Created in association with the Cornell Lab of Ornithology, and filled with wonderful images from leading wildlife photographers.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: Wagons West
description:
It is the 1800’s and the promise of a new future lies in the Pacific Northwest. In between lies hardships, harsh terrain and the unknown. Gathering up family and friends, you load up your wagon and head west, hoping to beat the winter weather to your new home.
Wagons West is a game of time and resource management. Each player starts with $200 which they use to purchase a wagon and supplies for the journey west. Once loaded, players start down the trail, following others or pushing ahead in an effort to save time. But the road is not without its dangers and unexpected turns. Cholera, rough terrain, accidents, shortage of food and water and treacherous river crossings all threaten to slow the party down or stop it all together.
Manage your time and resources well and with a little luck you will make it to your new home in the west.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Petrograd 1917
description:
Soviet historians tended to see the Great October Socialist Revolution as irrefutable proof of the inevitable scientific laws of economics as pronounced by Marx and interpreted by Lenin. Liberal historians tend to focus on the political and ideological background of the revolution and ignore the social and economic issues. Left wing historians, particularly Anarchist writers, tend to view the revolution as the expression of the mass will to reject authoritarian intervention in their liberty and freedom. Revisionist historians consider the revolution as arising primarily from below, that is, from the peasants and the workers. And most historians tend to take an obligatory swipe at the Tsar, Tsarina and Rasputin, and then ignore the bureaucracy, the armed forces high command (Stavka) and the bourgeois reactionaries forever after.

Rather than attempt to justify one or the other of these dogmas, perhaps it would be easier to realize that Russia in 1917 was an enormous paradox. She was one of the largest countries in the world in terms of both area and population, yet her economy was primitive and underdeveloped, and 85% of her population consisted of illiterate and superstitious peasants with no interests in anything much beyond the limits of their own villages, least of all politics. Russia was about a century behind the development of the other Great Powers, and although she was finally trying to catch up, she was handicapped by a political system and an absolute monarch that were simply unequal to the 20th Century. When the revolution finally came, it was solely Russian, which is to say, a national phenomenon with a traditional outlook; and it adhered to the Standard Operating Procedures for revolutions, which is to say, that it was initiated by the moderates and then ultimately taken over by the extremists. But to Lenin and his Bolshevik organization, the revolution was going to have a global outlook with the intent of imposing Lenin’s vision of socialism on the entire world.

Regardless of the name given to the events in Petrograd in 1917, the facts are that there was a popular revolution followed by a Bolshevik coup d’état. Petrograd 1917 starts with the popular revolution that had been initiated by the moderates, was taken over by the extremists, and then succumbed to the inevitable coup d’état. Players will find that staging a successful coup will not be as easy as it was for Lenin, who was blessed with the unwitting but invaluable assistance of Kerensky.

This is a card-based simulation for 2 to 6 players, each of whom will try to create a political organization and help it to gain influence, so that it becomes the predominant political party in Russia, either by votes or by force. The game board represents Petrograd, the capital of Russia, which was the site of most of what happened at the time. Markers and counters on the board indicate where army units, factories, bridges, railroad stations and other important buildings are located.
mechanics: Action Points, Open Drafting, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Casemate & Cannon: Fleet Action Rules for the Age of Steam 1820-1890
description:
Casemate & Cannon brings the Age of Steam to the fingertips of the Armchair Admiral. The rules were designed for maneuver and engaging large fleets and squadrons into Close Action. A complete and comprehensive Fleet system designed for detail and fast play.

- allows for a 20 ship game to be completed in 2-3 hours
- can be used with any scale and no rebasing needed
- all major and minor nations Army lists
- allows for naval warfare all over the world
- features HRG's Naval Terrain Generation system
- complete navale lists and ship capabilities
- admiral and player aid tools
- includes complete campaign integration for Eagle's Prey
- can be used from 1820-1900
- integrates with HRG's Eagle's Prey 19th century rules

(from the back of the book)
categories: American Civil War, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame

name: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: Lord Zedd's Last Stand Game
description:
Power Rangers, the evil Lord Zedd has taken control of your Dinozords. In order to stop Lord Zedd from destroying Angel Grove and the world, the rangers must defeat Lord Zedd!

Lord Zedd has sent all of his Evil Space Aliens and Putty Patrol Warriors to stop you. Do you have what it takes to defeat them all in order to take back your Zords from the evil Lord Zedd?

Game Objective: Players need to have their Power Ranger reach the Lord Zedd Battle Space. The first player to have their Power Ranger successfully defeat the evil Lord Zedd is the winner!

Game Play: Players choose their favorite Power Ranger and decide player rank by playing rock, paper and scissors. Game movement involves rolling the die and moving your Power Ranger the number indicated along the board.

Players will battle over 20 various Evil Space Aliens from the Power Ranger series (season 1 & 2) and the Putty Patrol Warriors, as well as answering Finister Trivia questions along there way to battling the evil Lord Zedd.
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Sonix Family Musik
description:
80 cards with 40 musical instruments and one Audio CD.
The games of Sonix series are specifically designed to promote the following skills in your child: perception, discernment, acoustic memory, logic, observation and language skills.

Before the game must be activated the random play function on the CD player to listen to each round a new track.
Some games are old familiar games like Memory and Lotto game.
Some games are new. Players listen to CD and must be the first to find the pair with the correct instruments.
Player with the most pairs at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Sonix Family Tiere
description:
80 cards with 40 animals and one Audio CD.
The games of Sonix series are specifically designed to promote the following skills in your child: perception, discernment, acoustic memory, logic, observation and language skills.

Before the game must be activated the random play function on the CD player to listen to each round a new track.
Some games are old familiar games like Memory and Lotto game.
Some games are new. Players listen to CD and must be the first to find the pair with the correct animals.
Player with the most pairs at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Avec Gullia sauvonsla Terre!
description:
Saving the Earth with Gullia
The little girl Gullia go around the planet Earth and try to remove all the 12 pollution that covers it.
Players are team to answer correctly questions about nature and environment or making mimes.
If the Earth is released from the pollution if the whole round is over, all players have won!
If there is at least one polluted place everyone has lost the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Environmental, Real-time, Trivia

name: Баттелі
description:
Баттелі, or Illomi Chess, is a two-player strategy game played on a 20 square isometric board.

During the game each player's swordmen battles it out with each other in an abstract chain reaction battle, until there is a victor. Each of these battles bring the player's closer to the goal of capturing the king.

Rules are available in the conlang Delang (both Delang script and Latin script), English and Norwegian. All game components are language neutral. No game components are supplied from publisher.

Rules:

Each pawn can move to an adjacent square, but only one pawn may move backwards. Use a way to mark such a pawn.
If a pawn has moved backward, no pawn can move backwards until a pawn has moved forward.
The pawn that has moved backwards cannot move until a pawn has moved forward.
If you do not have two swordmen more than your opponent, you may use your move to breed a new swordman.
Only the king can breed new swordmen.
The new swordman must be placed in an adjacing square to the king, and there has to be a swordman on the square already.
You have to move a newly breed swordman.
You have to kill an opponent's swordman that's in front of your's.
If an opponent's swordman is in front of a newly breed swordman, you have to kill that swordman with your newly breed swordman.

name: Vivat Rex
description:
A turn based, card driven, strategic game system, epic in scope, which focuses on the period between 1660 and 1789 (and will, at one point, will include an expansion for the age of Napoleon). Games will include (with emphasis on possible order of release): 1) The Great Northern War, 2) The Great Turkish War of 1683-1789, 3) The Seven Years War, 4) The War of Austrian Succession, 5) The War of Spanish Succession, 6) The War of Polish Succession. The Williamite War in Ireland is also planned for release as a teaching game due to its small and contained scope.

When combined, the maps for these separate, self contained modules will sprawl from Portugal to Britain to the plains and forests of Peter the Great's snow blasted Russia and the Barbary Coast and slave markets of Northern Africa. As well as colonies around the world.

A future module will tie these together with international events, diplomacy, technologies and more. Players will be challenged to build a powerful nation-state, levy taxes, develop their military advancements, build and dismantle fortresses, stay ahead of their enemies, and manage over 300 cards and events to survive the era. As the monarchs of Europe develop their nations armies and military, the rules used for campaigning will actually change to simulate the stunning advancements in theory, logistics, and capabilities of the era.

CURRENTLY IN DEVELOPMENT. MAY BE A FIVE YEAR PROJECT. It has taken several years to collect the 5000 records for fortifications of Europe in this time frame. A massively time consuming project in and of itself as multiple sources (known and unknown) had to be combined as well as endless combing through the internet to locate fortresses seemingly unknown to all of the key sources. We feel, however, it has been worth it. Eastern Europe was particularly daunting.
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Simulation

name: Chesseract
description:
Chess taken to the 4th dimension. Played on a 4x4x4x4 board, it includes all the traditional chess pieces, with a slightly different number. Each player has 1 king, 1 queen, 2 rooks, 4 bishops, 4 knights and 21 pawns. Players also have 3 types of fairy pieces: 2 unicorns (moving like a knight with an additional single cell right angle move), 2 wizards (moving like a bishop, but only to other levels in the 3rd & 4th dimensions) and 1 minstrel (a non-capturing piece, that moves like a rook and prevents orthogonally adjacent pieces from making a capturing move). Players take turns moving pieces one at a time, but a variant allows players 2 moves a turn to speed up the game. The goal is to checkmate the king.

Some of the traditional pieces have altered moves, beyond the 4 dimensional aspect. The king only moves and captures orthogonally one space. Pawns move orthogonally one space and captures diagonally one space. Rooks move and capture orthogonally, but also changes direction at a right angle once it meets a wall. Bishops move on 2D diagonals and on 3D or 4D diagonals (but not on the 2D diagonals of other levels). Knights move as chess knights. The Queen moves as a Chesseract rook or bishop.

One huge challenge in Chesseract is to try and envision moves in 4 dimensions. While each 2 dimensional level is only 4x4, learning to extend the moves beyond is a little brain-burning.

Chesseract was created by Jim Aikin

name: Trivial Pursuit: Lifestyle Reise edition
description:
This is a standalone, travel-sized German Trivial Pursuit, based on the theme of 'Lifestyle'.

This is a two-player (or two teams) game, with simplified Trivial Pursuit rules.
By rolling the dice and picking up a colour, each person can answer the relevant question and win (or not) the coloured section to be inserted in a slot.

The winner is the person (or team) who completes all colours in the slots.

name: Hidden Fires
description:
Party game. 14 attractive cards are placed around the room and up to 14 guests are invited to guess the answers to the 14 clue cards. All answers must include the word or phrase that include the word Fire or Fires in it. The clues range from easy to downright impossible (Example: Clue - Unsportsmanlike Incendiarism? Answer - Backfire). See what I mean?

At the host's call, the competition stops and the guest with the most correct answers, wins.

name: Millennium Gravitas TCG
description:
Millennium Gravitas is a tactical science-fiction cardgame of eXploration, eXpansion, eXploitation, and eXtermination (4X). The game features Invasion and Colonization of Planets, Technology Research, Tactical Space-combat, Ship Construction and Customization, Anomalies and Resource Management.

Gameplay consists of building structures (ex. energy collectors) to gather resources, colonize planets to man your spaceships and research technology to equip your fleet, planets and shipyard.

This is accomplished by drawing cards from your deck and playing them according to various rules and time-based mechanics (building ships takes time for example).

The goal of the game is to defeat the opposing player according to three different victory-conditions:

Extinction - The opposing player loses all Population (by invasion or destruction of planets or structures)

Starvation - The opposing player loses all Energy (by stealing energy or destroying collectors)

Burnout - The opposing player loses the ability to play Units (by losing all cards in his main deck and hand)

Millennium Gravitas relies less on luck-of-the-draw than other comparable games and gives the player more control over their strategy. The core mechanics are focused on flexibility and tactics rather than deck-building or owning the most powerful cards to overpower your opponent.

The game supports different game-modes, like 1vs1, 2vs2 or +4vs (the mechanics theoretically do not limit the amount of players that are able to play together or against each other). All complex play styles are supported, from team-matches to last-man-standing. This creates many interesting games with temporary alliances and even politics as emergent game-play. Additionally Millennium does not require a game-board or sophisticated game-pieces and miniatures, all you need to play is knowledge of the rules, your own deck, and something to be used as tokens.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: The Cobbler and the Elves
description: The object of this game is to move around the playing board according to the numbers scored on the spinner and to accumulate as many game cards as possible. The first player to accumulate 30 game cards is the winner.

name: Ni Oui Ni Non: edition Premium
description:
An expansion of the classic Nicht Ja, Nicht Nein with a case of 55 additional cards included in the box.

Object of the game is during the questions try other players
to answer forbidden words YES or NO. If somebody answer so
others must then quickly ring the bell to move their pawn on the gameboard if they are the quickest.

The winner is who gets there first with his character in the middle of the board.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Real-time

name: The Banking Game
description:
This is a financial game about saving money and becoming a millionaire. The object of the game is to own a $200K home, a $50K auto, a $300 business, 100K in stocks, $200K in bonds, 100K in gold or collectibles, and $100K in savings.

Players move along a pathway after twirling a special spinner that results in percentage increases in a designated form of investment or requires the player to draw an event card. There is score card that spells R-E-T-I-R-E-D as the player reaches each financial goal. Event cards reward a player who follows up on a hot "tip" and puts his or her cash into that form of investment on the following turn.

The first player to spell RETIRE on the score card is declared the winner.

Includes the colorful board with a built-in spinner, tokens, play money, cards, score sheets, rules, storage insert, booklet about banking, and a cassette tape with a seminar about the banking industry.

name: Satellites
description: Each player starts with 16 numbered tiles (two each of numbers 1 through 8) and take turns playing one of them. The number on the tile dictates how many spaces the player moves around the board, and an arrow on the space where the player ends his turn indicates the row or column where that tile must be placed. This row or column is then scored based on the tiles present in it. Red and blue tiles belong to each player; yellow tiles placed in the center can be scored by either player provided the row or column including them contains more points in his color than his opponent. Once a row or column is scored, it cannot be scored again for the rest of the game. Highest score after all possible tiles have been played wins.

name: High Command
description:
Military strategy game was published in 1942 during the middle of WWII.

The red army and the blue army face each other on a terrain grid which features rivers, mountains, forests, and cities. Each army includes 1 headquarters unit, 8 infantry units, and 6 tank units. The illustrated playing pieces are stand-up tokens similar to the kind used in Stratego.

Includes a colorful board, tokens, rules, and a storage insert.

name: Torpedo Attack
description:
Naval combat dexterity game was published in 1940.

Two plastic and metal ships are involved with the battle. A submarine fires an aluminum torpedo at a battleship. If the torpedo strikes the proper target zone on the battleship the vessel "explodes" and falls apart... the game mechanic is similar to the 1980s Milton Bradley classic Torpedo Run.

Includes the ships, the torpedo, and the rules. More experienced captains can take longer shots or otherwise embellish the game, but the concept was quite simple.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Jolies Sirènes
description:
You hold in your hands a magic mirror which reflects the girl will turn into a beautiful mermaid!
Just turn the arrow on the wheel to win one at a piece of the puzzle that make up the body of your siren (hair,
face, chest, tail ...) and put them on the mirror in the correct order.
But beware of the evil sea witch: she may resume at any time parts of the mirror!
The first player who has transformed the girl to mermaid in her mirror win the game!

name: Mon Premier Cochon Qui Rit
description:
My First The Laughing Pig for the littles ones. Recognize shapes. 2 levels of play for two years and olders.

Roll the dice and construct the pig. First player who gets his pig ready is the winner.

name: Superkvíz
description: Are you too scared to go to the TV show quiz game? Than try it at home first! Quiz type of party game for up to four players. The game comes with buzzer which indicates who is on turn, game board, four players pieces, 56 cards and four pencils and notebooks. Superkvíz is also four variants in one package.

name: Newcastle to London Cycle Race
description:
Game in the inside covers to the Boy's Own Paper Annual, 1964.

The rules:
Here is a brand new idea! A thrilling cycle race game to liven up the long winter evenings. Any number of players can take part, and all you need is one die (two dice will speed up the game) and a few small coloured counters. The rules common to all dice games are too familiar to repeat - just remember that each space is one mile. Jump on your cycles. Right then, all set? You’re off to a flying start!

It is a game in the grand tradition of 'Game of Goose' race games.The winner is the first player to reach Big Ben in London.

name: Umakartové
description:
Umakartové is experimental take of Aleš Pilgr on mixing indie music CD and family co-op board game for 2 to 6 players. The game plays exactly 41 minutes; so as long as music CD which comes with game (or it´s other way around?). The players are Umakartové (something like home elf) and after the human family goes on holiday, they take over the house and tries solving problems in 12 rooms; like hot iron left on table, milk on stove etc. If they save the house, all players win.

What you need to do to save the house? Prepare twelve playing fields that correspond to individual rooms. Then shuffle the word cards and give them out among the players. Everyone holds their cards hidden. When you insert a CD into the player and turn on the shuffle mode. The game begins. Youngest player chooses a card and pantomime the word shown. Other players have one attempt to guess words, anyone can guess. Correct guess is the first successful step to avert danger in the room (you put the card in the appropriate room). If guessing is not successful, then take a card in your hand and performs a new word. Words are selected from the songs, so playing song can serve as a hint. You have to guess 5 words for each room. Compositions have a length of about three minutes, that means to guess each word have approximately 20 to 50 seconds. Guessing must be quick, otherwise fail. The entire game fits into a box with music CD.
---
Po zběsilém balení odjíždí rodina na dovolenou a nevědomky za sebou zanechává v domě celou řadu malérů, v každém z dvanácti pokojů jeden: tu zapnutou žehličku, tu mléko pálící se na plotně… Je na vás – tajemných UMAKARTECH, skrytých obyvatelích lidského stavení – abyste zažehnali všechny problémy a zabránili nejhoršímu. Váš čas je ale omezen – než dohraje CD! Originální hra spojená s poslechem CD skupiny Biorchestr. Zcela nové prožití poslechu hraní hry a poslechu CD.

name: So-Soo-Yoo 素数遊
description:
Board game. Roll dice and move one of six pieces around the board to collect rings which are randomly placed on the board. Object is to be the first to collect 6 rings (one of each color or all one color) with no extras.

Roll of die give 1-6 moves per turn. Use colored dots (or "bubbles") on each space to jump to other spaces that have same combinations of bubbles. Board spaces go from 1 to 199.

Can attack and slow down other players by beating them to rings, leaving rings in "bad" places for others to get, "swapping" rings at end of turn, or "bumping" (landing on another player's space) and knocking their rings off.

Whenever a ring is picked up, another of the same color is immediately placed using dice which generate 0-199 (0 = "whammy" = lose a ring), so there are always six rings somewhere on the board, one of each color.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Dirty Politics: The Board Game
description:
Two to four players campaign against each other to capture the presidency. As the players move their tokens (elephant, donkey, bull, bear) around the board through the states they use dirty tricks and smear tactics to gain the 270 electoral votes needed to be elected.

The game is somewhat similar to Monopoly with a square board made up of state squares. In the middle of the board are stacks of Media cards and Power cards as well as a stack of Bribery Checks. Players are given money to "buy" the votes of states as they land on them.

Each turn the candidate rolls the dice and whatever state square the player lands on he can win that state by paying the required fee or draw a Power card to give the player a further advantage. If the player lands on a state owned by another candidate, that player draws a Media card and suffering the consequences. Various cards drawn require the candidate to either gain or lose influence and votes.

Play continues until one candidate accumulates the required 270 electoral votes or all other players run out of money.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding

description:
1660 is a strategic game in which the players take the roles of European powers (Spain, France, the United Provinces, and the English Commonwealth) and try to extract wealth from their colonies and conquer those of other players.

The game is played over three years, at the beginning of each of which the players collect taxes and can build ships and armies. There are then fourteen movement and combat turns each year. Ships are moved via dice roll (reflecting the unpredictability of the winds), but players can choose how to allocate each die. There are also prevailing winds and currents which can affect movement.

Players can attack other players' colonies, but can also send merchant ships to obtain trade goods and carry them back to home ports (where they add to the treasury) or send warships to attack other players' treasure fleets. There are occasional random events.

At the end of three years victory points are awarded for gold in the treasury, ships, and captured colonies. Each nation subtracts a different amount from their final score to reflect imbalance in the positions; each nation starts with different amounts of money and units, and also collects a different amount of taxes each year.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jetzt mal ehrlich
description:
A German card-based game intended for teaching teenagers about society/ethics/sociopolitical issues. The cards can also be used as a starting point for discussion.

The game centers around questions like "What would you do if you wanted to get home from a party at night and the driver is drunk?" or "What would you do if a friend tells you he is homosexual?"

The game confronts you with 60 tricky situations from the area of politics, ethics and society. There is one card for each situation. The front side introduces the situation and the back describes three possible reactions to the situation. Players decide how they would react and try to guess what others would do. If you know the other players well, you earn points.

There are three variants for playing the game:

1) In the most basic variant, one player reads one of the reactions from the back of a card. The other players try to guess what the situation is by asking yes/no questions. The player who first guesses the situation wins the card. The game ends when each player has been the "reader" once or twice. The player with the most cards wins the game.
Suggested minimum number of players: 3

2) One player reads a situation and the three reactions from the back of the card. All players (including the reader, R) guess how R would most likely react. They write down the letter assigned to this reaction on a slip of paper. Before the players hand in their guesses, R chooses three players of which he/she thinks that they've guessed correctly. The chosen players show their guesses and R shows his/her answer. For each matching answer R gets one point, the chosen players get 2 points if they've guessed correctly. Now all the other guesses are collected and counted. All other players (i.e. everyone except R and the 3 chosen players) get one point if the majority has guessed correctly. Then the next player becomes R. The game ends when each player has been R once. The player with the most points wins the game.
Suggested minimum number of players: 8

3) A situation and the three reactions are read. Each player decides how he/she would react and writes down the corresponding letter on a slip of paper. The answers are handed in. Now each player guesses how many people have chosen answers A, B and C. They right the numbers down in a table. Then the answers are counted. Players get 3 points for a correct guess, one points if their guess is off by one.
The game ends after 14 situations. The player with the most points wins the game.
Suggested minimum number of players: 4

Example situation:
Situation: "The party is over. We've all been drinking. This is particularly obvious in the person who was intended to be the driver. He gets behind the wheel. It's a 20-minutes' drive. There is no bus that late at night and we want to get home fast.
Possible reactions: "A: I ask the driver if he's confident he can do it. If he says yes, I'll go with him this one time. After all, it isn't far and we can take back roads."
"B: We judge who's most likely to be capable of driving and decide on a driver that way."
"C: Under no circumstances am I going to drive or take a ride with a drunken driver. We'll have to call a taxi and collect the car later."

name: Terathan
description:
WHAT IS TERATHAN?

Terathan is a new Fantasy card game that combines the fun of Player vs player combat with the ability for dungeon crawl and co-op game play. Terathan is a collectible card game where players can build custom decks and choose from a large number of Race choices, each with its own special abilities and spell books. Each race comes with its own custom Miniatures used in the dungeon crawl game aspect.

Game Play Description:


Player vs Player competition play



Player vs Dungeon, where the player can participate in a 1 player Dungeon crawl card game, attempting to take down the Dungeon overlord.



Player Co-Op game play, where up to 4 players work together to take down the dungeon overlord in multiplayer dungeon crawl card game play.


Terathan give its players a unique ability to play MMO in the version of a card game. Terathan will feature all great aspects of today's card games including expansions, custom dungeon crawl scenarios, unique races, co-op player, and the ability for a player to play a single player game. Terathan players will have the ability to build unique decks, custom to their liking. All expansions, dungeon scenarios, and add on's to the game will be compatible with the base deck included in the core set.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Trading
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Panda Game Manufacturing (PandaGM)

name: Mythic Palace
description:
From the developer's Web page: "An Arabic language collectible card game in which players construct decks and summon all the forces at their command, including mythic creatures of ancient lore to heroes wielding jeweled swords and magical powers as they build temples, baths and living quarters for their people. If successful, players become legendary architects by building the most powerful fortress to stand the test of time."

Known in Arabic as: قصر الأساطير

Mythic Palace/Palace Legends is a strategy game set in the mythical Middle Eastern kingdom of mysterious, and inspired the game its legendary characters and stories of the heritage of the Middle East. A two player game with 150 original card games representing mythological figures, magical powers, and supernatural abilities. In Mythic Palace, players assume the role of architects who must bring to bear all the resources their kingdoms can muster to create a mighty fortress and defend it with heroes and creatures inspired by Sir Richard Burton’s One Thousand and One Nights, and Middle Eastern mythology. Build a deck and call all the forces to them to exploit several strategies to win.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Aldarok Games
description:
A tactical character-based board game where gladiators fight for immortality before Aldarok: the end of all things. Characters move around on hex-grid battle maps, use unique abilities, and roll dice for combat.

Fight against an opponent with a squad of 3 unique characters. Build up a resource pool (Destiny) and unleash it on your opponent with a wide variety of unique abilities. The primary objective is to eliminate the opposing enemy team. Alternate victory conditions depend on the map being played.

There are 26 characters in the Aldarok Games Core Set, adding endless dimensions of strategy to the game. Characters can be drafted and banned for a unique gaming experience. No game is ever the same!

name: Honba za pokladem
description:
A fun game on travels (home, forest or garden) for children from four years.

VARIATION IN THE FOREST
You need: ribbons cut from the roll of paper, treasure (according to your imagination) and 4, 8, 12 or 16 cards each in a combination of all elements (optimal is to find 8 cards).
The landscape in the woods or someone from adults or older children - Treasurer - Traces the route from streamers up to the hidden treasure.
After the route hides the card so that the visible part, and instead indicate a different color ribbons. The card should be hidden up to 1.5 m from the streamers.
Hunt can begin. Always perform only one task from the card. At the beginning, decide if you will do a, b, c or d.

QUICK game FOR A FLAT
Conceal secretly cards less clearly defined area of about 20-30 square meters. Do not mark the streamers. Send kids look for cards in the same time. The winner is the one who finds most cards with highest value.

OPTION FOR GARDEN
Treasurer hides cards in the garden and mark places streamers. Treasure well take refuge. After completing all the tasks children tells where to look for treasure. You can hint if player are close or not.

Variants may combine and invent your own rules!

---
Zábavná hra do lesa, na zahradu i do bytu pro děti od 4 let.

Set obsahuje: 16 laminovaných kartiček se 64 dovednostními a vzdělávacími úkoly v plátěném pytlíčku, krepák na fáborky (3 minirole vel. 25x200 cm - 2 oranžové pro trasu a 1 žluté na označení úkolů)


PRAVIDLA:
VARIANTA DO LESA
potřebujete: fáborky nastříhané z role krepáku, poklad (dle vaší fantazie) a 4, 8, 12 nebo 16 karet vždy v kombinaci všech živlů (optimální je hledat 8 karet)
V krajině nebo v lese někdo z dospělích nebo starších dětí - strážce pokladu - vytýčí trasu z fáborků až k ukrytému pokladu.
Po trase schová dané karty tak, aby byly částečně vidět a místo označí fáborkem jiné barvy. Karta by měla být ukrytá max. do 1,5 m od fáborku.
Honba může začít. Vždy se plní pouze 1 úkol z karty. Na začátku se rozhodněte, jestli budete plnit a, b, c nebo d. Vyjmenovávací otázky plní děti společně a ostatní ůkoly jednotlivě nebo podle rozhodnutí strážce pokladu. Ten kontroluje nebo může hádankou napovědět správnou odpověď.


VARIANTA NA ZAHRADU
Strážce pokladu ukryje karty na zahradě a místa označí fáborky. Poklad dobře ukryjte, ale neoznačujte. Po splnění všech úkolů dětem prozraďte, kde mají poklad hledat. Napovídat můžete slovy zima, přihořívá, hoří...

RYCHLÁ HONBA DO LESA, NA ZAHRADU A DO BYTU
Ukryjte tajně karty na menším jasně vymezeném prostoru cca 20-30m2. Neoznačujte je fáborky. Pošlete děti hledat karty ve stejnou chvíli. Vyhrává ten kdo najde tolik karet, jejichž součetová hodnota je nejvyšší. Úkoly tentokrát neplníme.

VARIANTY MŮŽETE KOMBINOVAT A VYMÝŠLET SI VLASTNÍ PRAVIDLA:)
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Environmental, Number, Trivia

name: Schnick Schnack Schnuck
description:
A simple card game that uses the rock-paper-scissors mechanisms.

The game consists of 55 cards. Each card shows one of x symbols. In addition to rock, paper and scissor symbols, there are fire (burns paper), well (extinguishes fire etc.), and joker pictures. Each player receives one joker card and puts it face-up in front of him/herself. The other cards are shuffled and each player gets six cards. Players take turns choosing one other player for a duel. The duel partners each play one card of their choice simultaneously. The winner of the duel gets the card that the loser played. Then the next player chooses his/her partner for this turn's duel.

If both players play the same symbol, both cards stay in the pool and the next symbols decide who wins. If a player has lost all his/her cards, he/she uses the joker card. This means that the joker player uses a hand gesture while his/her duel partner plays a card as usual. If the joker player wins, he/she gets to draw two new cards. If the joker player loses, he/she is eliminated from the game. The first player to double their hand cards to 12 wins the game.

name: Wanderland
description:
A trivia game produced by "Deutsche Wanderjugend", a German hiking organisation for young people.

The game consists of 360 cards, a frog clicker and 50 chits. The cards are used to build a one-meter long path. The card backs have path segments, bridges and turns printed on them. In order to be allowed to add a card to the path, one has to complete a task or answer a question from the card. The cards come in 4 different categories, but they are all related to hiking, conservation, youth politics and youth culture, and knowledge about the "Deutsche Wanderjugend".
Questions come in different levels of difficulty and players earn different numbers of chits ("Wandertaler") accordingly.
The game ends when the path has been completed. The team with the most chits wins the game.

name: The Day After Tomorrow
description:
The first 4x strategy game fully integrated into an immersive storytelling/choose-your-own-adventure system.

60 years after the most powerful nations on Earth obliterated the planet, small tribes emerge to transition from mere survivors into a functioning society. You play as the leader of one of these tribes, each with a unique method of governing their people, a specific moral alignment, and explicit spiritual beliefs. You are leading a small group of lieutenants and followers. Your objective, specific to your unique character and motivations, is to mold this emerging world in the way you best see fit.

Explore the wasteland to find essential materials, find and recruit other small pockets of survivors, and discover the competing tribes. You must conquer hearts, minds and bodies if you want to emerge as your region's guiding force in forging the world to come The Day After Tomorrow.

In the early game, players explore and expand by revealing hidden tiles, hoping to find modest food sources that will allow them to add tribe members, find groups of other survivors who may be interested in joining forces, fighting for their autonomy, or simply keeping an arms-length relationship. Most importantly players are hoping to find precious rare materials such as ammunition, horses and power sources to assist their growth and expansion.

Through exploration players discover one another on our unique modular hex map system. Then the main phase of the game begins, where culture and religion pass between connected tribes, where the leaders fight for the best people, and each tribe's rare and valuable resources are being plundered during daring raids and defended by courageous sacrifices. Tribes will need to work together in order to achieve shared ends, but ultimately the most important thing is: will your particular vision for the world to come end up proving dominant?

The characters in The Day After Tomorrow are brought to life with voluminous text in a choose-your-own-adventure style. You will need to carefully roleplay your leader as adhering to his or her particular moral, spiritual and governmental predilections is required to achieve success. There will be numerous character choices for players to make and, for those who want The Day After Tomorrow to do so, the design is intended to support deep RPG-style character play.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Exploration, Modern Warfare, Negotiation, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Role Playing, Secret Unit Deployment, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: I.Q. Games: Wonders of the World
description:
From the back of the box:

Learn about fascinating places in the world as you play this fast-paced quiz game! Each card contains five clues. Answer on the first clue, and you earn five points. If you answer after all five clues (including a picture clue), you still earn a point! The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

A "NOW YOU KNOW" section on each card contains fascinating facts to learn and tell.

name: 3 Gnus und 7 Kakadus
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Welcome to the number zoo! There's always a lot going on because a wild diversity of animals can be found in these enclosures: rhinos, parrots, wildebeest, cockatoos, and many more.

Keeper Fred naturally knows all the animals personally and taking care of the rascals requires a lot of work as he needs to count them, send them to the proper enclosures, and maintain order in the zoo. But who can help Fred count carefully so that no animal is lost?

With the three games in 3 Gnus und 7 Kakadus, children learn to deal with the numbers to 20, count, sort, organize and develop an understanding for varying amounts.

name: Entdeckerquiz Deutschland
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Entdeckerquiz Deutschland, Robby the Robot and his brilliant team of kids are going to quiz players over ten rounds on all they know about Germany.

A different question is asked each round, then all players place one of their chips into one of the four response areas on the "Quizzomat". Players then turn the wheel in the window of the Quizzomat to reveal the solution code and see who guessed correctly. Whether the subject is history, culture, or unusual features, the Quizzomat always knows the right answer. Whoever scores the most points after ten rounds wins.

name: Dominion of the Gods
description:
Dominion of the Gods is a tactical miniatures game played on a board created by the players. The players buy, assemble and paint miniatures for use with the game. The miniatures come with stat cards, these stats will also be available in a rulebook. The stat card tells the player how far the model can move, how many dice it uses to attack, how many dice it gets while defending, how far its combat reach is how many hits the model can sustain before being removed from gameplay as dead and the level of faith it has in its God.

Monsters, heroes, and gods of different pantheons battle in a miniatures skirmish game. Intuitive dice-based combat. Cards list what models can accomplish, and dice rolls determine hits and blocks. Rolling the power die in special situations can prevent un-blockable hits.

Players start off by choosing a God from a pantheon to play as their main character. Players then decide on a point total for the game they want to play. Once the point total is decided, each player puts together an army with models (using the models point cost) that equal up to the point total decided by the players. Players can only use models from their chosen pantheon at this time. There is the possibility that some pantheons may be able to benefit from rogue legends in the future. Players are allowed to select one coin that they possess to use during the game. Different coins will be manufactured with different abilities. Some coins will be standard while others will be collectible items sold only during certain times of the year or at specific locations.

If a God is killed during the game, the faith scores of all the models on that team are reduced making them more likely to fail psychology checks. If a God is the only model left on the board, the God loses the ability to use any influence. Influence is a score that tells a God how much magic he can use every round. When a God is left without followers, he loses his magic ability.

name: Les Fugitifs
description:
Les Fugitifs is a strategic game for 2 or 4 people.
The theme of the game is the escape of four men from a city. The men need to find their way to the center of the city and then out of the city as quickly as possible. Each of the players tries to find their way and also obstructing the other players in their progress.

It is a tile placing and moving a character game.

Each turn a player can move his character on the board, place tiles or turn a tile on the board.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Concurrent
description:
